title: River Gambia National Park Tour
text:
We choose Janeya tours to go for River Gambia National Park. Everything was perfect and we enjoyed the tour a lot!

In the beginning we payed deposit before we arrived to Gambia. Ibrahim, who was our guide took us from hotel in the morning and during the road to River Gambia National Park we stopped in several places. He showed these places and in every place we had local person who told us about that place. It was very interesting to see almost all Gambia during this road trip. Main attraction was to see chimpanzees and hippos from the boat tour around Baboon Island. We slept in hotel in Janjanbureh island where is Gambia slave history written.

Our guide Ibrahim and his driver was very professional and they helped us with everything even it was not included in the main trip to River Gambia National Park. I appreciate their time which spends with us. I highly recommend Janeya tours, for the money which we payed it was great experience and nice moments in Gambia.

title: Professionele tours onder leiding van een ervaren gids
text:
We hebben hele goede ervaringen met Janeya Tours. Op de Strip vind je ze links, tegenover African Queen. We deden 4 excursies onder leiding van de gids Lamin.
Allereerst een (vroege) ochtend bird watching, met een hele goede lunch daarbij.

Een andere excursie betrof een bezoek aan de vismarkt in Tangi en de markt in Serekunda. Erg interessant en zo anders. De vismarkt op het strand moet je zeker bezoeken.

Een derde trip was een bezoek aan een Gambiaans gezin om te kijken hoe zij wonen en leven. De mensen zijn allemaal heel erg vriendelijk. Daarna ook nog even naar de koeien-, geiten- en schapenmarkt geweest. Veel dieren en handelaren daar.

Zeer indrukwekkend was de trip naar het slaveneiland. Je bent even onderweg, maar alleen de ferry is al een belevenis op zich. Op Kunta Kinteh eiland zijn de resten van het fort. In 200 jaar tijd werden via het eiland 15 miljoen slaven naar Amerika verscheept. Details over de verscheping en de gruwelijkheden lees en zie je in het museum aan de oever.

Lamin was een goede en vriendelijke gids, de auto's waren goed en de drivers ervaren. Lamin weet veel en was altijd op tijd.

We waren blij met Janeya Tours en ook dat we een lokaal bureau hebben kunnen steunen i.p.v. de grote reisorganisatie. Janeya steunt op zijn beurt educatieve initiatieven.
Dank en succes!

title: Boottocht in Gambia
text: Fantastische tocht gehad met de boot. Ontzettend gastvrij, heerlijk eten en een prachtig uitzicht. Dikke vette aanrader!

title: A look back into history
text:
I have arranged several trips
Organised by Lamin and the team at Janeya tours and the feedback has always been excellent. 
Last week I joined the Kunti kinteh excursion and our guides were Ibrahama and Mariama, they organised the trip very well with plenty of refreshments, food ordered in advance so no waiting around. The guide at the island was very knowledgeable and explained everything really clearly.

title: SUPERB FAULTLESS SERVICE
text:
We stumbled across Janeya Tours on our first trip to The Gambia.

 From start to finish the service that they provide is professional and faultless. 

We had originally planned to take only one tour but with such impeccable service from the whole team and our tour guide Ebrima Sannen we could not resist taking two! 

We have every intention of revisiting The Gambia again and have already discussed further adventures with Janeya Tours. 

We cannot wait for our next adventure. X

title: Trip across West Africa
text: Intensive experience in West Africa! We hire a car and driver Buba Tourey and traveled Senegal, The Gambia and Guinea-Bissau. Endless experience and superb service thanks mainly to Buba! Ask for him if considering a trip, you will not regret! It was perceft!

title: Memorable trips!!
text:
Very nice and helpful people. 
The owner speaks Dutch! He will try to find a way suitable to your needs to get the most joy out of your trips.
We booked a few fishing trips on the river Gambia. They did everything. Nothing was to much. Very nice team Abraham was very nice and helpfull. The lady cooked a lot of nice and tasty dishes. The captain was very skillful and had a lot of knowledge where to catch the fish. 
And Noah was really funny!! 
They were all very entertaining and also showed us a good time. They will do anything to accommodate you the best. We caught more then 50 fish each time. I think it was because of the good team. 
We did not just get a nice trip we got a few friends with it as well.
With our next visit we will book with them for sure!!

title: Fantastisch!
text: Met een groep van 38 studenten zijn wij tien dagen op avontuur gegaan door Gambia. De gidsen van Janeya Tours hebben ons fantastisch geholpen! Het contact vanuit Nederland was top, de gidsen zijn erg aardig en vriendelijk en denken met je mee gedurende je vakantie! Ik kan Janeya Tours aan iedereen aanbevelen!

title: Fantastische gidsen!
text: Met een grote groep  verschillende Tours gedaan. Kwamen elke keer ruim op tijd en wisten veel te vertellen. Alles verliep erg voorspoedig. Van te voren contact gehad via mail en whatsapp, dit verliep ook erg goed. Zeker een aanrader!!

title: two day trip with Boba en Lami
text:
OK the trip was very bad. over 4 hours on a  boat lokking at two hippo's far away en some chimpansees in the trees far away, but hé we took the wrong trip our mistake.
So we don't recomand the two days trip to george island!!
Boba and lami are great, the trip to George Island was fun experience, good lunch saw many nice people. A good taste of the life in Gambia.

Next time we take the trip we wanted to take with Janeya tours.

title: Trips with Janeya Tours
text: We had three trips with Janeya. One to Fathala in Senegal (walking with lions), one bird trip and one to Kuntha Kinthe Island by car on the nort side of Gambia river. Greate guides with greate humor and good knowledge of The Gambia and life in general. Janeya use additional guides at each site. Very serious owner. Recomended company.

title: Tours
text:
We hebben nu 3 tours achter de rug , kunta kinte , roudtrip , nature trip , we hadden 3 dagen Abraham als gids en baboe als driver , zijn 2 super mensen en heel vriendelijk , wij waren alleen dus was privé , de tours kunnen altijd persoonlijk wat aangepast worden , zo zijn we naar de local familie gegaan van onze driver in de middel of nowhere en had wat spullen voor school bij en daar uitgedeeld , wat een dankbaarheid ja kunnen ze thuis niet aan tippen , dus bij deze zeer zeker aangeraden .
We hebben hier ook voor savonds een heel betrouwbare taxi , is zo een goed man 7886608 zijn naam is Seedy , als je zegt Dominique van belgie ga je een goede prijs krijgen

title: fathala and lazy day trip
text:
Good organized trips.
We had a very nice and friendly guide, Ebrima.
The rest of the crew was also nice and helpfull.
Good food on the trips
we loved it !!!

title: Janjanbureh
text:
I arranged this trip by emailing Lamin, he is a top man. He helpfully answered my questions then confirmed booking. Picked up on time, reliable. I paid when I was picked up, a good price. Only me and another traveller on this trip.
Buba and Mariama were excellent guides who know a lot and fun to be with.
On Jananbureh trip seen hippos and chimps upriver. We stopped at 2 busy markets, Soma and Farafenni also visited  a small rural mud hut compound.
Many thanks to Lamin, Buba and Mariama for a great trip. Highly recommended.

title: Roots Tour
text:
Excellent service - we don`t live in the normal tourist area but despite this we were promptly picked up / dropped of at our accomodation.  The trip was very well organised and even when something did not go 100% to plan they adjusted so smoothly that we didn`t even notice until afterwards.  
I highly recommnend this company for your Gambia tours.

title: vier uitstappen gedaan , allen zeer goed georganiseerd .
text:
Round trip  ( rondrit 4x4 )  , Roots  James Island (Kunta Kinti) , safari Fathala Senegal , citytrip Banjul  , vismarkt .
Allen top georganiseerd  door Kit .

title: First class service
text: We were like others a little sceptical about tour operators in the Gambia, rest assured the service provided by Janeya tours is second to none, its a bespoke service tailored to meet the needs of their customers, they willingly go above and beyond to provide an amazing and memorable event for all interest, each tour has a detailed and informative descriptive to enable visitors to the Gambia an opportunity to enjoy and absorb the qualities that are avaliable - massive thank you to Ibrahim who is a mine of information, highly knowledgeable and a highly dedicated ambassador for all Gambians. Many thanks to all at Janeya tours.

title: Senagal Safari and Roots Tour
text:
I contacted Lamin before our trip to The Gambia and he was extremely helpful.
We booked the Roots tour and the Senegal Safari.
They arranged to pick us up and return us to the airport for our holiday and this was all included as we booked 2 trips.
Both days we had Kit as our local guide. Kit was a pleasure to be with and very knowledgeable of the local area. He told us everything about the whole History of The Gambia not just related to the particular tour.
If you are taking the Roots our I would recommend to buy and watch the DVD before going. It puts everything into perspective. The tour is actually almost a little dark when you think about the African Slave Trade. We met also the relatives of Kunta Kinte. Originated from his Brother and Sister.
Our second tour was to the Fathala Safari park in Senegal. This was an early start. Left from the hotel at 6:00am. This was the best though as we got an early Ferry and not so long Queue at the Senegal border. We arrived at the safari park before the real heat of the day kicked in we saw all the animals in the park. Including the Wildebeest who soon after we saw them at a watering hole disappeared not to be seen by persons who arrived later. We did not do the walking with Lions. And actually even though we were at the park early the Lions were very sleepy when we arrived back.
The additional benefit of using private companies like Jenaya Tours is that your money goes directly into the local economy not lining the pockets of the big Travel agents.

title: Janeya tours
text:
Today we had a wunderfull boat trip in the Creeks near Banjul with Janeya tours. Everything they promised, they made true. The guide was Ebrima Tamba, who loves to give information and tell about huis country. They picked is up at excactly 9am. About 10 AM the comfortabel boat left the harbour. At nearly 4 pm we went back, after having swimmed, fished, andere spending a lazy day watching wild life. We saw lots of birds.  Not strange that the tour is called, Lazy Day Tour, the food on board was very well and plenty. Also the drinks were free. Dont forget your swim suit and sun cream.

We higly recommend it!

Walther & Jolanda

title: Smooth and well organized day trip to Fathala
text: I booked our day trip from home, before coming to Gambia. We were picked at time and guided perfectly during the day and everything went smoothly and nicely. I can highly recommend this company.

title: Dissapointing
text: We went on a 4x4 trip to to Halahin River which included a school and rural village visit. We were supprised by the huge amount of passengers that gave candy to children. We were told that some children could not pay the 50 dalasi monthly school fee. Since these people do not have money for toothpaste, let alone for a visit to the dendist, it is just silly to give them candy. Durable /lasting gifts such as a ball, a skipping rope are better options and items like soap, washing powder or school supplies meet the needs better for poor people. Guides and tourleaders should educate tourists and also tell them about dress codes (the don't because the are afraid of not getting a tip). Some young female passengers on the trip wore very short pants and tank tops that would be fine in the Costa del Sol, but not in a country where 90% is Muslim.

title: Goede reisorganisatie, vriendelijk en kundige medewerkers. Aanrader!
text:
2 Days Gambia Adventure gedaan. Aanrader! De bus had een defect, maar een andere bus stond al klaar. Fijne, vriendelijke gids (Kit) die veel wist te vertellen en alles goed regelde. Chauffeur Omar heeft ons veilig overal naartoe gereden.

De busrit is lang over een niet al te boeiende weg. Er werd regelmatig gestopt en halverwege dag 1 werd het programma leuk. Boottocht langs de eilanden, nijlpaarden en chimpansees gezien en de overnachting in de hutjes aan de rivier was een belevenis. Reken op steenharde kussens, koude douches en beperkt elektriciteit, dan kan het alleen maar meevallen.

Dag 2 erg leuk met het bezoek aan Georgetown en een school. Ontbijt, lunches en avondeten eenvoudig, maar gewoon prima. 

Dit was onze derde tour met African Adventures en het is voor de derde keer uitstekend bevallen.

title: Was een geweldige ervaring.
text: We werden keurig op de afgesproken tijd opgehaald en via 3-4 andere hotels naar het Tanji Bird reserve gebracht. Daar konden we kiezen tussen zelf per kano varen of geroeid worden. Wij kozen het laatste. De gids zat ook bij ons in de boot en wees ons de vogels aan, heel fijn anders zouden we er veel gemist hebben, maar hij kende ze allemaal. Hij had een Nederlandse vogelgids bij zich en gaf dan ook de namen in het Nederlands, wat we zeer gewaardeerd hebben. En we zagen geweldig veel prachtige vogels, heel bijzonder. De omgeving zelf, varen door kreken en mangroves, was ook spectaculair mooi. We stopten bij een eilandje waar we ontbeten, koffie of thee en gesmeerde boterhammen met ei of tonijn, alles keurig in orde. Terugvaren en weer andere vogels zien en teruggebracht worden naar het hotel. Alles was goed geregeld en in orde, zeker een aanrader. Neem zeker een goed fototoestel mee.

title: Door fout van de organisatie werd het hollen tegen de klok
text: Gister een 4WD Adventure tour gedaan. ‘S morgens bij de pickup ging het al mis. Er waren 3 gasten van ons hotel die van de organisatie een verkeerde pickup tijd hadden gekregen 8.15 i.p.v. 8.00 foutje dus. Dit had makkelijk hersteld kunnen worden als de tourguide even naar de kamer had gelopen om te verifiëren waar deze mensen bleven. Deed hij helaas niet. 8.09 vertrokken we dan maar. Volgens zeggen waren de 3 andere gasten 1 min. later bij de receptie. Na de eerste stop heeft de hele groep bijna een uur moeten wachten op deze drie gasten die nagebracht werden. Het vervolg van de adventure trip heeft de tourguide alleen geprobeerd de verloren tijd in te lopen. Boottochtje werd een speedboot naar de lunchlocatie en ook daar geen tijd genomen om even bij het strand te zwemmen. Ik denk dat toen de verloren tijd was ingelopen want daarna ging alles ineens een stuk relaxeter. Kortom fouten kunnen gemaakt Worden maar ook heel simpel worden opgelost.

title: Super!
text:
Ik heb meerdere trips gedaan met African Tours. Ik vond het zo leuk dat ik een nog een keer heb gedaan 2 jaar later, zodat mijn vader het ook kon zien. De eerste keer was ik alleen naar Gambia en bij hun voelde ik mij gelijk op mijn gemak. 
Er worden helaas leugens vertelt dat dit bedrijf onder corendon valt. Dit is niet waar. Deze jongens en meiden werken hard om hun geld te verdienen en de enige connectie die zij hebben is dat corendon gasten aan hun toe vertrouwd. 
Ik ben in ieder geval erg enthousiast over de trips en het personeel is erg aardig.

title: Fanta was a great guide!
text:
We booked the 4 wheel drive day tour from Kotu. Our guide was Fanta and she was great! Perfect English, great information and a lot of humor! We were with about 10 other people so small group.

The tour consisted of visiting a school, a meat market, a village (incl. dance performance), a river boat tour and the fish market. Before the last activity we stopped for lunch on a beach. We lunched at 4pm but we did not that prior to that day so everyone had snacks. 

Fanta was accompagnied by a driver and 'papparrazzi'. They offered us a complementary drink just before the river boat cruise and stopped the 4 wheel drive in case anyone needed a bio-break ('bush bush stop' = toilet).
The 4 wheel was in good shape and comfortable for the whole day. The roof was great because it kept the heat away. 

We could leave our bag with non important stuff in the car while getting out for the markets. The driver did keep an eye on it and everything went well. We felt safe and welcome the whole day.

Price wise it's okay. It's a great tour for your first visit of Gambia. I had the feeling I've really seen the country after this tour!

title: Excursie naar zuid Senegal was heel veel reizen en heel weinig zien!
text:
zo goed en prachtig de twee daagse excursie two dat Gambia adventure was zo belabberd was de excursie naar zuid Senegal☹️ Het ophalen van alle 21 medereizigers duurde al 2 uur, daarna moest er nog brood gehaald daarna weer stoppen voor ijs, nogmaals voor nog meer brood, sigaretjes voor de chauffeur en nog een gsm kaartje waren we anderhalf uur later eindelijk onderweg naar de grens van zuid Senegal en Gambia.
De truck was eigenlijk defect maar er werd toch door gereden, langs de doorgaande weg ontbijt, terwijl we dat meehadden van het hotel, midden in de zon zonder schaduw pff... de truck kon niet hard en rammelde heel erg hard zodat er niet gepraat kon worden. We zouden door Birkama rijden en daar konden we leuke foto’s van de vele kleurrijke mensen schieten, werd ons verteld door de gidsen. Dat hebben we geweten want we werden bekogeld met fruit en stenen, niet doen dus want de mensen vinden dit (terecht) erg onplezierig. Aan de grens kwam er een monteur bij en die constateerde dat er een bout in het differentieel gebroken was. toch langzaam door gereden naar de grootste boom en daarna snel een lunch, alles moest snel anders misten we het hoge getij om met de boot naar de wietplantage te gaan bij een voodoo stam. Birdisland kon niet meer  vanwege tijd gebrek. In de boot kon niet gestopt worden om de mooie vogels beter te bekijken. Snel de stam bezocht want het water ging weer af en we moesten snel weer terug bij de opstapplaats zijn. We hadden twee gidsen 1 Engels en de ander Duits. Die laatste vond het wel genoeg want die was gestopt met vertalen voor alle Duitsers aan boord, die konden geen Engels dus bij het bespreken om de smokkelroutes wel of niet te nemen kregen de Duitsers dit niet mee.
Het was al 18:30 uur en de smokkelroutes zou drie kwartier langer duren dan direct naar de grens, wat denk je gaan ze toch de smokkelroute nemen. Na overleg met de Duitsers toch besloten om de korte route te nemen want iedereen was het zat en wilde zo snel mogelijk naar het hotel.
Ongelooflijk dat ze dan kiezen om in het donker, met een kapotte truck deze slecht route willen nemen??? Om kwart voor zeven weg gegaan en om kwart over tien terug in het hotel👎🏿 Ons advies deze excursie vooral niet te doen want ook met een goede truck was je 4 uur kwijt geweest met het ophalen en terugbrengen van alle deelnemers.

title: the best !
text:
2 excursies gedaan met deze gidsen gedaan
de 4 wheel drive was top, moet je gedaan hebben !
zeker top begeleiding, zeer veilig

de safari was de 2e, ook top
alle dieren kunnen vinden, wauuuwww

2 x met Lamin als gids,( Lamin 1 en Lamin 2, beide top)

100% betrouwbaar , stipt en veilig

ownerResponse.text:
Hahaha Double Lamin op de tours. We zijn blij dat je een geweldige tijd hebt gehad en ervan genoten hebt. Bedankt voor de beoordeling en iedereen op African Adventure Tours waardeert je en wenst je het hele jaar door liefde, zegeningen en geluk.

We hopen u snel te zien.

title: 4wheel drive dag excursie naar het zuiden
text:
We hebben een leuke dag beleefd. Via Corendon hebben we deze tour bij African Adventure geboekt. Het was een leuke en leerrijke dag! We zijn op plaatsen gekomen waar we anders nooit terecht zouden komen, en steeds onder de goede begeleiding van de gidsen!
Een echte aanrader!

ownerResponse.text:
We zijn blij met uw aanbeveling en wij allemaal op African Adventure Tours wensen u liefde en zegeningen gedurende de rest van het jaar. We hopen je binnenkort te hebben om onze andere spannende en mindblowing uit te proberen.

We zijn blij dat het een educatieve ervaring was.

title: Excellent!
text:
We were in The Gambia for only 1 week and so we only took part in 3 of AAT's tours - would have gladly sampled the rest of their program if we'd had the time.

The first tour we took was the City Orientation tour (Serrekunda Market - Albert Market Banjul - National Museum - Kachikally Crocodile Pool Bakau and some other stops I don't remember the name of). The benign chaos of Serrekunda market is something to behold - every bit as colorful (and olfactorily stimulating) as the soukhs of North Africa. The Albert market is very tranquil and civilized by comparison. The National Museum is rather small but quaint. A lot of focus on colonization and Independence, which is understandable, but the eras of the great West African empires barely feature at all.
Our lead guide on this trip was Lamin (Sr.): a very smart and amiable dude who seems genuinely committed to lifting tourism (and therefore the economy) in The Gambia to a higher plane. Kudos to him.

The second tour we took was to Abuko Nature Reserve and Lamin Lodge. Abuko is very small - didn't see much wildlife apart from tons of birds. Guess we were unlucky. There's a nursery of sorts in the park where they take in baboons collected from private ownership and prep them for re-enrry into the wild. There was also a pen with hyenas, but I doubt they were rescued from private ownership (cause... they're hyenas), so I must say I found their presence somewhat questionable. A bit of a sorry lot, the poor things. Lamin Lodge is very picturesquely located in the mangroves. There's a little boat ride included in the tour from there. The guide on this tour was Kanteh. Now Kanteh is a character. Sardonic, world-weary and quite possibly perpetually inebriated. All the same, he knows a lot and is good fun to be around.

The third and last tour we took was the one to Fathala Park in Senegal. Fathala is a sort of mini safari park - the predators are separated from the herbivores, and the animals are manually fed extra during the dry season, so it's not all that wild, and don't go comparing it to the big safari parks in the south and east of the continent. But nevertheless, we enjoyed ourselves being driven around its bumpy roads on a big truck, and we were lucky to spot almost all the animals they had - giraffes, buffalo, warthogs, various types of antelope and the park's sole rhinoceros.
For this trip however, the journey was certainly as much fun (if not more) than the destination. The border crossing into Senegal could warrant a tour destination in and of itself, and the ferry crossing from Banjul to Barra was absolutely mental. It was all civilized enough at dawn for the way there, but coming back we got perhaps a bit more than we bargained for. I don't know how many people the ferry holds but whatever the number is, at least four times that many were trying to board it, getting us caught up in a good ol' near-stampede. Never any actual danger, mind, but enervating enough to get the blood flowing a bit quicker. Having missed the ferry (and in The Gambia that may mean waiting a half day for the next one), our guide - shout out to Lamin Jr. - after some heated and colorful negotiation managed to charter a fishing boat to take us across instead. Lamin Jr and his two colleagues (can't remember their names unfortunately) really deserve a raise for the lengths they went to to get us all back to the hotel safely.
African Adventures indeed! 

So in summary, we enjoyed ourselves immensely under their very capable care

ownerResponse.text:
"So in summary, we enjoyed ourselves immensely under their very capable care"

This means so much to us and we are glad we took great care of you and your family. We are looking forward to having you over to try the rest of the excursions.

All of us at the African Adventure Tours wishing you love and happiness. We hope to see you soon.

title: Wow wat een belevenis!
text:
In januari 2019 voor de eerste maal naar Gambia! Wat een bijzonder land met  vriendelijke mensen. We hebben de dagexcursie met de 4wheel drive gemaakt. Wat een gevarieerde tour, deze tour zou door elke toerist gemaakt moeten worden. Je krijgt een aardige indruk van het land. Je rijdt via de Serrrekunda markt naar een plaatselijk schooltje (dus neem als je kunt wat mee aan pennen, potloden of wat andere spulletjes). Bij elke tour nemen ze een ander schooltje. Veel kinderen kunnen niet naar school omdat de ouders de schoolkleding en schoolgeld niet kunnen betalen van ongeveer 5 euro per jaar. Vervolgens naar de veemarkt waren koeien, geiten en schapen verhandeld worden. Dan dansen met de plaatselijke bevolking, een riviertocht een goede lunch en als afsluiting een bezoek aan de vismarkt. Al met al een superleuke en leerzame dag. De tweede excursie was een dag naar Fathala in Senegal. Onze gidsen Lamin jr en Ramou hebben ons een fantastische dag bezorgd. Eerst met de ferry bij Banjul over wat een belevenis, een kleurrijk geheel, zeker de terugweg met mensen die allerlei waar mee nemen tot aan geiten aan toe. Met een jeep of 4 wheel drive het park in, hier is een neushoorn en een paar giraffes, zebra s en ander wild te spotten. Ook de grensovergang is leuk om mee te maken. Dank Lamin en Ramou voor deze leuke dag!
Daar we gelijk verliefd zijn geworden op Gambia besloten we terug te gaan in maart en hebben de 2 daagse tour genomen. Wat een bof we hadden Lamin jr weer als gids, deze jongeman heeft ons 2 dagen bezorgd om nooit te vergeten, ook spreekt hij een aardig woordje nederlands, wat een indrukken hebben we opgedaan en wat heeft hij ons veel verteld over het leven in Gambia. Een dorpje bezocht met weeskinderen, dit kwam wel aan.... ook een mooie boottocht op de rivier met het spotten van nijlpaarden , chimpansees, bavianen, krokodillen en allerlei andere mooie vogels. Ook werd er op de boot ons een lekkere lunch geserveerd. Wat leuk de hutjes waar we sliepen zonder elektriciteit. Terug naar basic. Je gaat dan toch wel weer eens denken aan onze luxe, zeker als je ziet dat in het binnenland iedereen het slechter heeft dan wij in de hutjes. Volgende dag met de ferry naar het slaveneiland Georgetown. Indrukwekkend. Er is daar nog een gevangenis in gebruik waar niemand van weet hoeveel mensen er zitten. Een dorpje bezocht en rijst afgegeven (dit kan onderweg met elkaar gekocht worden). Ook is het erg leuk om speelgoed en een paar voetballen mee te nemen, verkrijgbaar in supermarkt of Serrekunda market. Wat zijn ze daar blij mee!!!!
Ook een compliment voor  onze chauffeur Buba, wat een aardige man en goede chauffeur.
Er is ons heel wat meegegeven om over na te denken.
Bijna zeker weten... wij komen terug Gambia! African Adventure Tours... THANX...specially Lamin jr. and Buba.

ownerResponse.text:
Dit is een wow-verhaal !! Wauw! Gewoon wow!! We zijn blij dat je een geweldige tijd hebt gehad en een aanbeveling hebt gedaan. Dit is geweldig en we zijn blij dat we onze gasten niet teleurstellen.

Lamin Jnr en Buba sturen hun liefde naar jou en je familie. We hopen dat je binnenkort andere trips met ons zult proberen.

Veel liefde van ons allemaal.

title: Well organized, wide range of tours on offer
text:
We got into contact with them through our tour operator. They are a gambian company, trying to provide proper jobs for locals as well as good service to tourists. We did 34 tours with them and can say they mostly reach their objectives.
Though you must be aware they do have the Gambian method of time kepping. Which means that a half day trip for which you are picked up at eigtht in the morning will not see you back before three at the earliest!
But they have comfortable transport, complementary drinks, helpful and knowledgeable guides and good drivers.
Reasonably priced. Recommended.

ownerResponse.text: We really appreciate your recommendation. Hearing this from you makes us very proud as Gambians and we are looking forward to growing and giving back to The Gambia as We are Fir The Gambia and Her Children.

title: De Gambia voelen en beleven in 2 dagen met “African Adventure Tours” dat kan!
text:
Zeer leuke, veilige, vriendelijke 2 daagse excursie onder een prima begeleiding.
Gids Bunja heeft ons op een fantastische leuke manier een stukje van zijn land laten zien, voelen en beleven. Zijn enthousiasme kent eigenlijk geen grenzen en met veel kennis van zaken heeft hij ons begeleid, langs en over de Gambia rivier. Veel over de flora en fauna gehoord, bezoek aan dorpjes, boeren, bezienswaardigheden en schooltjes waren een mooie beleving. Chauffeur Buba heeft ons op een zeer veilige manier rond gereden, altijd alert op mensen en dieren die onverwachts capriolen uithalen die niets met veilig verkeer te maken hebben, dat gaf ons een zeer goed gevoel en bedankt daarvoor😀. De overnachting was ook erg gezellig, simpel maar schoon en een zeer vriendelijke staf. Een erg leuke trip met veel aangename verassingen!

ownerResponse.text:
Hello Hanneke, We are glad you had a great time with us. I'm sure Bunja did great to keep you safe and happy. He's a wonderful and hard working guide, one of a kind tbh. Buba is also one safe driver in the field and a very trusted one for that matter. Hearing your feedback regarding this excursion means a lot to the whole team.
All of us at African Adventure Tours are sending you and your family much love and wishoing you a Happy New Year filled with love blessings, luck and happiness. 

We Hope to have you agin soon.

Much Love.

title: Je kunt beter met de locals meegaan
text:
Ze bieden te dure excursies aan met te grote groepen. 
Bovendien geven ze de indruk dat je locale mensen helpt door met hen mee te gaan. Dat is niet waar. Corendon heeft een connectie met african adventure tours. Je geld gaat naar een rijke baas. Je kunt veel beter met de locals meegaan want zij bieden met meer passie en tijd dezelfde excursies aan en voor minder dan de helft van het geld.

ownerResponse.text:
We find it very sad to read that you put all of us down so badly. Corendon is not owning us. We are proud Gambians who want to show the world that we are very capable to organise our business in such way that we can work together with tour operators from all over the world who hire our busses for airport transfers as they are not allowed to set up their own tour companies here in The Gambia. We, locals, are putting our act together to build up the country the right way by paying our operational licences and taxes to the government so we can hopefully finally have good roads, hospitals and schools, better lives. 
We understand after translating your comment that you have not been on a tour with us, (this is fine as you are free to choose whoever you want to spend your day with) because we know if you would have, you would not have written this negative comment. We are a team of nice local people, all taking care of our families this way and working hard on a better future for all Gambians. Please don't always listen to the people on the street. They are also trying to survive, but they are not helping to build up this country this way by not paying the tax money that this country so badly needs in its build up. We wish you a very nice day and when you come again to the Gambia. All of us at African Adventure Tours wish you a very nice day and hopefully a different mindset on who we are and what we do. 
Happy New Year to you and your loved ones.

title: 2 Day Gambia Adventure
text:
Hi! My girlfriend and I went on the 2 Day Gambia tour and it was really great. Really recommend this tour for those who want to most of Gambia! We also did a tour with Gambia Tours, and it was far far away from the experience with African Adventures.

We had Ebrahim as our guide and we couldn’t have had a better one than him. Caring, never in a hurry and taught us a lot during the two days. 

5/5

/Eric, Sweden

title: Three Days Through The Gambia
text:
Three great days we had with the driver and our guide. Lamin is an excellent guide organizing a perfect trip through the country. We have had two boat-trips on the rivers Halahin and Gambia watching birds, monkeys, chimpanzees and hippopotamus living in their nature.

Of course Georgetown and the King-tombs in Wassu as important historical sites we have not missed. Visiting different villages and markets has given a impression of the life in The Gambia.

Our guide Lamin is able to explain seriously and with humor much about history, society, ecology and spirituality. So we can take a lot of knowledge and insight... and great photos.

Hi, 

Thank you for your remarks. We are so glad you had fun during this trip and also happy that you had a wonderful sight seeing while on the trip as well and also the service we render.

title: Probably the best bird tour guide in Gambia
text: Just back from an intensive, target focused, 7 day birding tour with Foday from Fatou Bird Tours. I very strongly recommend him and the wider company. Communications and planning before the trip were excellent, logistics were smoothly dealt with throughout (importantly rapidly switching vehicles via Foday's extensive local network when we had a leaking radiator to ensure the birding schedule was uninterrupted), and he is simply an amazing birder who (unlike many guides in Gambia) is genuinely passionate about birding as a hobby rather than just a job. As more and more of our targets were seen he was very willing to change the sites we were visiting in the last few days to ensure we could maximise the chances of seeing our final few targets. Whilst Foday loves targeted birding trips across Gambia and/or Senegal, he and Fatou Bird Tours are also great at organising more relaxed birding trips - I strongly recommend Foday and Fatou bird tours.

title: 12 Days Birding Tour
text: It was my first time in Gambia and I had chosen Fatou Tours for my 12 day individual birding tour and at the end my expectations were completely fulfilled. I found Fatou Tours via internet search and communication was very easy and friendly. All my questions were answered quickly. Everything was organized very well, from the pick-up at the airport, lodges/accommodations, food and birding spots until my return. My main focus was photographing birds and I need to say a big thank you to my guide Foday. He has a big knowledge about the birds and where to find them. He was always struggled in my needs as photographer and he did an excellent job. All visited lodges had good fixture and were wonderful for birding. My favorites were Riverside Lodge and Tendaba Camp. The food was in each accommodation very tasty and my favorite was chicken domoda with onion sauce. For lunch we had often this lovely sandwiches, where I cannot remember the name. At the end I had seen more than 230 different bird species and photographed almost 200. I recommend Fatou Tours to all birders, bird interests and bird photographers. The next time I will do a combined birding tour Senegal/Gambia and I definitely select Fatour Tours and Foday again. Gambia is wonderful country with a lovely landscape and friendly people. Even if you are not interested in birds, go and visit it :-)

text: We had 2 great tours organized by Foday. We went with Mohammed and Mustafa to the inlands of Gambia and on Safari to Senegal.  Thanks on behave of our family.

title: The perfect team to go birding with in the Gambia and beyond!
text:
We were looking for a bird guiding company to see the best birds in the Gambia and we found Fatou Tours via Birding Direct. The organisation and planning went very smoothly online and we were really pleased that they were flexible in customising their 10 day tour to let us split it into 2 sets of 5 days so we could have a break for Christmas.
We were met at the airport (very late at night due to the flight) by our guide Foday and it turned out that with him and our driver Gibrel, we had been given the dream team. Foday's knowledge when it came to birding was fabulous and the general customer service was second to none. They could not be more helpful and accommodating. We saw over 230 species of bird just staying in the Gambia and we were overjoyed to see our target bird of Egyptian Plover. 
We would heartily recommend the team of Foday and Gibrel and also Fatou Tours for bird watching and more in the Gambia.

title: reliable top experience!
text:
I found Fatou tours on the internet when considering a holiday in the Gambia. I had email contact in advance and after some quick correspondence we agreed on a program to our wishes: a mix of birdwatching, enjoying nature and some culture. My wife and I bought a relatively cheap 3 weeks package deal in a Kololi hotel with a travel agency with: a small week relaxing in the beach/hotel with every other day a day trip with Fatou tours, a 9 days trip short into Senegal and deep into Gambia with them and then another small week like the first week (so not using our hotel part of the time, but this was still the cheapest solution for us). 
With only 5 stars reviews the expectations were high, but even then they were surpassed! Although we met Fatou, we had her business partner Foday Bojang as our guide all the time and he did perfect. The trip was organised very well, he was always on time and solved any problem that occurred on the way. As a bird guide he can not be surpassed. He knows all the 600 bird species in Gambia and can distinct them at glance: female, male or juvenile with their calls. He can imitate many bird sounds and often get answers from birds that come closer and closer. He sees birds when driving the car where we (not unexperienced) had to look twice after knowing where they were. As he is using a camera himself, he takes care of good positioning for pictures, always giving priority to his clients. He keeps on searching untill the last minute. Except for birds he also knows all monkeys, many butterflies, dragonflies, reptiles etc. Apart from already bookes accomodation he is flexible in the program and open for wishes or feedback. On top of that he is pleasant and polite company. We had a fantastic time and if we come back to Gambia will surely book trips with Fatou tours again.

title: amazing trip
text: We had a very nice experience with Fatou Tours Gambia. We saw her office at Senegambia and in one day they manage to arrange a very complete tour to the Baboon Island. We saw a lot of animals; red and green monkey, chimpanzees and hippopotamus. The hotel were we stay was also nice and the food was delicious. On top of that our guide Yankuba was very professional, friendly and reliable. We even saw the prehistoric Wassu rocks. I would always recommend Fatou Tours Gambia and thank you very much for the experience.

title: 240 vogelsoorten binnen een week
text: Samen met een vriend zijn wij een week lang (eind april-begin mei) met Foday, van Fatou Tours door Gambia getrokken op zoek naar alle prachtige vogels van Gambia. Hij ziet echt alles en kent alle (contact)geluidjes van de vogels. Foday is bijna net zo fanatiek als wij, maar zorgt ook voor genoeg relax momenten zodat we het de hele dag vol konden houden. Het vervoer was perfect, en de basic accomodaties die geregeld zijn door Foday pasten ook goed bij de reis! Hij heeft veel rekening gehouden met onze wensen en behoeften en checkte dit ook vaak genoeg. Binnen een week hebben we 240 vogelsoorten gevonden! Echt een topervaring!

title: Super, professional.
text:
One of the most professional we dealt during our trip to gambia.
Postives:
1. Car rental price was reaonable in compare to other car rentals.
2. Punctual with time regarding their work.
4. The car was in great condition and really fulfilled our expectations during our three days fun trip in Gambia.
5. Receiving and returning car was super easy, they even let us drove to our hotel and afterwards collected the car.
6. Paper work was simple and received deposit super fast.

Can only recommend.

Best regards

title: Birdwatching with Fatou Tours
text:
Just returned from The Gambia. Found Fatou Tours after being approached by their guide, Foday Bojang, on our first night out near to our hotel (Senegambia). No hard sell just wanted to give us information about their birdwatching tours. Really nice with a professional manner. Eventually booked three tours at their office, which was air conditioned, near Sarge’s hotel. 
First tour was with Fatou herself who is the owner - Lamin Lodge followed by Abuko National Park. At Lamin we had coffee and biscuits at the start, then breakfast, after the boat ride, which was great. We saw Goliath heron, pied &malachite kingfishers, numerous  other birds. At Abuko we had a walk followed by birdwatching from the hide to watch the crocodiles. Plenty of birds with coffee and Oreo’s. Brilliant. 
The second tour was to Farasutu forest then Pirang forest with Foday, who like Fatou really new his birds. Plenty to see including various owls and Guinea baboons. Whilst watching, numerous small birds at a water hole we had breakfast. Very relaxing.  We had lunch later at Pirang. We were out from really early morning until teatime, so both long days but really good for birdwatching. 110 different birds seen on these two tours. 
The third tour was to Kotu Creek followed by a walk. Fatou then took us to Calypso Bar to watch the crocodile pool which has numerous birds coming in for a drink. All the tours were professionally organised and really enjoyable. I even bought a mug with their name on.  I would recommend Fatou Tours for birdwatching.

title: LAZY DAY CRUISE 🛳
text: 30th/01/2022 was a day to be remembered. As my first time,I join the team of experts on a lazy day boat trip on the mouth of river Gambia on Banjul. I have the opportunity to explore the river and my passion of nature force me to do some birding as well where I was able to spot birds like kingfishers, and the likes. The fascinating part was I have the opportunity to do fishing as well. Not forgotten the food dishes where exceptional likewise the team of FATOU TOURS GAMBIA is a group of experts to be honest. I urge you all to book your trip with FATOU TOURS GAMBIA. I bet you will not regret the trip

title: 15 days fun birding
text:
15 days fun birding

My first birding trip to Gambia was a fun experience. Fatou Tours Gambia organized everything except the flight and the personal insurance, and organized it perfectly. The first 5 days we stayed in our hotel at Senegambia ( the Metzy)  - for birding around Banjul. Kotu Creek, Brufut, Tanji, Kartong, Farasutu, Pirang : we visited all the wellknown birding places, and during the driving we stopped very often for more birding. Then we did drive inland : first 2 nights at Tendaba Camp, then 2 nights at Georgetown. Really great were the boat trips in each place. Then we did go to Senegal : campement Wassadou - again great boat trip - and the national park Niokola Koba. After another stay in Georgetown we did take the small ferry to the north bank, with losing at Morgan Kunda. Driving back to the south bank did bring us a second time in Tendaba Camp, our last night was at the magnificent Bintang Bolong lodge. During the last day we could keep on birding till noon, then it was time to drive back to the airport.Great trip, more than 300 different birds, 4 amazing boat trips, great lodges , and with fatou senghore and Foddy Bojang also great and experienced guides who arranged 24/7 everything. Thanks Fatou Tours Gambia

title: Fantastic experience!!!
text:
5 day trip to Georgetown

Did do a 5 days trip with fatou tours gambia and that was a great experience. Picked up at our hotel in Senegambia, on the first day we did drive to Bintang Bolong, stopping a lot of times for birding. At noon we did do a picnic, you can say ,,between the birds”. After a great drive we arrived at Bintang Bolong Lodge and that was another great surprise : with rooms above the water, we had a fantastic view, while the kingfishers all the time were flying close to our rooms. Early breakfast and early start on day 2, direction Tendaba. Again hours of birding, and along the road constantly the typical compounds and enthousiastic children. Close to Tendaba another great birding spot, called the airfield. For dinner , we could choose between a buffet or the menu-card.Day 3 started with a magnificent boat trip into the mangroves, with off course a lot of birds : fantastic. Waterbirds before noon, forest birds in the afternoon, also from in the hide close to our room. Day 4 : direction Georgetown, the city with the 3 names : Georgetown, Janjanbureh and Maccarthy Island. In the afternoon did do boat trip to see the chimpansees, a unique experience. Day 5 , another  fun boat trip and then drive back to Senegambia, again all the time birding. With Foday Bojang and Fatou Senghore we had 2 experienced birding guides, so we did see a lot of birds , much more than we expected. Also all the others things - car, lodges, food - were perfect, so next time when we are in The Gambia we certainly will do a new trip with this company again.

title: Gambia birding
text:
A day full of birds

After some relaxing days at the pool I decided to do some birding and choose Fatou Tours Gambia and that was obviously the right choice. Fatou herself did pick me up at  08.00 am at my hotel Seaview, the drive to Kotu Creek did take only some minutes. During the boat trip of one hour I did take nearly 500 pictures !!!!!! With the malachite, the pied, the giant, woodland and the blue breasted I did see 5 from the 9 kingfishers , fantastic !! Fatou told me even all kingfishers have been seen in this creek. Also lots of egrets, herons, cormorants, kites, and other birds like the sacred ibis and the bee-eaters. After the boat trip we did do a short walk to see the pearl spotted owlet, and yes : he was waiting for us , so that I could take great pics !!!! After Kotu we did drive to Brufut Woods, about 35 minutes. We had the luck to meet there the forest guide and during the walk with him we did see the black shouldered kite, the red necked falcon and the nightjar and this last one was a real surprise !!!!!! Picnic at Brufut Woods, and then again birding in Brufut until it was time to drive back to Senegambia. A great day with lots of birds and lots of stories about birds, Fatou Senghore is indeed a great guide. When corona is less I certainly go back to The Gambia and his birds and his sun and will do probably a longer tour ( inland) with fatou tours gambia.

title: Extremely bad experience
text: Avoid this company by all means . We booked a tour and they said everything inclusive only for them to ask us to pay for border crossing even though we asked if it covered all that and they accepted. The tour guide was unprofessional, they couldn’t even give as little as water and when we came back to complain to Mr Timothy, he became extremely rude and hostile . Avoid them by all means and use other tour guides to get value for your money

title: Great day at Makasutu Forest
text:
We did the Makasutu Forest tour with Ebrima as our guide.  It was an excellent day.  When we arrived at the forest we were met by our local guide, I believe his name was Modi.  Modi was knowledgeable, friendly and a joy to be around.  We learned about the many health remedies that the trees and plants of the forest offer.  We took a small boat along the river and saw the oyster beds & locals that harvested and sorted them.  We tasted a wine made from the fruits of the palm tree and watched as forest man climbed the palm tree to harvest its bounty. We met and spoke with the local ‘Boost Doctor’ and bought some health remedies from the forest.
The forest tour was completed with a delicious lunch that is included in the tour price.

All in all a fabulous day, Ebrima was lovely and kept us entertained throughout the day was his local knowledge. He spoke about the culture of The Gambia and kept us informed.

I’d also like to thank our driver.

title: No hassle, listen to your interests before recommending tours
text:
I didn't end up booking a tour with this company but what I liked about them was the lack of hassle.

I was walking past and I stopped to take a look at the tours.  As my luggage hadn't arrived and I had an upset stomach I didn't book because I wasn't sure when I'd get clothes or feel better.

They said no problem.  Let me give you something for your stomach (Baobab) and told me how to use it.  (I also googled it, and It worked.)

I later went back and told them what I was interested in and they would have done me a personalised tour to suit me.  Unfortunately I'd run out of days and had to fly home.  But next time I wouldn't hesitate to book with them so I thought I'd review to say that they were good people

title: Fathala and Makasutu forest - unforgettable experince
text:
My fiancé and I visited Gambia in December 2022. On our first day, we found the TimoTours office. After talking with a beautiful lady we decided to go the next day with this company at Senegal Safari trip! It was the best decision during our holiday!
On Safari we traveled in a small, only 6-person tourist group! Our guide was Ebrima – a nice guy with huge knowledge about the country and very good spoken English. We felt free to ask him about everything. The Safari trip was perfectly organized, and everything was on time. We smoothly across the border with Senegal, which was itself a very interesting experience. On Safari, a guide from Fathala Reserve joined us. We saw many wild animals living in this place (zebras, giraffes, etc., even spiders!) and acquire knowledge about them. During the trip, we were endowed with water and before returning to Gambia we ate local food in a friendly, clean restaurant. We could choose what we want to eat, we decided to try a local meal - chicken with fried rice – a delicious, huge portion of food with a spicy accent. At the end of the trip, we were lifted to our hotel.
We enjoyed the Safari trip so much, that the next day we booked the next trip with Timo – Makasutu forest.
To our surprise – this was individually organized for us! We got to Makasutu forest (2 tourists – my fiancé and I) with a guide – Aisha, and the driver. It was a lovely time. During the road, Aisha told us about the country, people, jobs in Gambia, etc. In Makasutu we have another guide from the place, we were boating and walking in this beautiful place. We had the opportunity to visit a local fortune-teller and know our future :D In the end, we ate local food and on the way back we visited a local craft market, where we bought some wooden souvenirs.
Summarising, trips with TimoTours are pure pleasure. Guides are very professional, nice, young people with a passion for what they do and respect for the clients. Ebrima, Aisha – it was a pleasure to meet you! Trips are much cheaper than trips organized by Polish travel agencies – and during the trip with TimoTours tourists are supplied with unlimited water (it is very important during hot sunny days in the Gambia) and had the opportunity to eat local meals (all included in trip price). However, the biggest advantage for us – was small tourist groups, which allowed us to individually ask questions, see everything on our own, and smoothly get things done as toilets or shopping, without wasting time.
After five months after our trip to the Gambia, we are planning another visit to this beautiful Country – then we will book a TimoTour trip to George Town!
All the best to Timo Team!
Ewelina& Wiktor from Poland.
