title: Leuke en betrouwbare gids
text: Deze gids is echt een aanrader! We hebben drie tours samen met Omar gedaan. De tour naar fathala in senegal, de tour naar George Town en een lazy fishing day. Alle drie de tours waren goed geregeld en erg leuk om te ervaren. Omar was erg aardig en wist veel te vertellen, daarnaast konden we ook alles vragen. Een voordeel van een tour met Omar tegenover een tour met bijvoorbeeld tui is dat je tour een stuk authentieker wordt en er is meer mogelijk als je nog meer wilt zien. Wij wouden bijvoorbeeld nog snoepjes halen onderweg en dit was zo geregeld. De prijzen die op de website staan vermeld komen overeen met wat we hebben betaald zonder dat hij nog om een tip ging zeuren zoals de meesten. Andere gids lamin was met ons mee op de lazy fishing trip. Dit was ook perfect.

title: One day trip to Gambia
text: Omar organized a one-day trip to Gambia for me and my friends, and I can confidently recommend his services. Everything was handled with professionalism, from the planning to the execution. He made sure we were comfortable, well-informed and able to make the most out of our short time. A reliable and knowledgeable guide who truly cares about delivering a quality experience.

title: Tour to the Kunta Kinteh island
text: We went on a tour with Omar to the Kunta Kinteh island. The entire experience from pick up to dropping us off was absolutely amazing. Omar is such a jolly and easy-going person, and gave us a really good insight into the history and life in The Gambia. And not only that, we had a chance to have so many amazing conversations with him, which made it feel less like a tour and more like a friend showing you his beautiful country. The tour in itself lets you explore a different side of the country, away from the touristy beaches. So if you want to just get away from the maddening Serrekunda, go ahead and book this tour.

title: Tolles Gambia Erlebnis
text: Ich habe mit Omi eine zweitägige Tour nach Georgetown unternommen. Aufgrund eines Missverständnisses war ich die einzige Reisende, aber das Angebot stand und ich hatte zwei aufregende und ereignisreichen Tage, an denen ich mich immer sehr gut betreut und informiert gefühlt habe. Da ich in der Nebensaison gereist bin, gab es nicht alle Angebote, so wie ich sie erwartet hätte. Neben der wirklich tollen Betreuung hätte die Vorbereitung der Reise etwas gründlicher sein können. Sehr langes Warten an den Fähren.Aber Omi sagt, that’s African System. Also auch Teil des Abenteuers und das war großartig. No Risk, No Story. Und nach diesem tollen Erlebnis hat man viel zu erzählen: Cashewnutfarm, Wassu Stones, Chimpanzee Island, Hippos, Janjanbureh, …. Alles einfach sehr beeindruckend.

title: Good option for exploring The Gambia...but not for a longer tour including Senegal and beyond
text:
I think that specifically for short tours of The Gambia with a small group (or a day tour with a larger group), this would be a great company to go with. Omi is a responsive communicator, we felt physically safe with our guide, Kumuna (who was cheerful and did his best), the vehicle they put us in never broke down, the driver was responsible, and all were very knowledgable about The Gambia. We had fun and enjoyed all we saw.
That said...Omi and his crew seriously overstretched their expertise in agreeing to create an itinerary for and lead a group of 8 of us for 12 days in The Gambia, Senegal, and Guinea-Bissau. Though we sent half of our tour money four months in advance so Omi could reserve the hotels he specified and we agreed to, those reservations didn't happen and we did not stay at a single one of them. Kumuna did not seem to have much experience in navigating (nor any fondness for) Senegal, struggled with time and money management, and made major changes to the itinerary without our advance permission (we never even made it to Guinea-Bissau and missed several things we were supposed to do in Senegal). I don't think any of it was calculated deceit--more an inability to deliver much of what was promised and a very, very strong preference for just keeping us in The Gambia as entirely as possible. I still think Omi and Kumuna fundamentally good, caring guys. But it would be misleading to give a very positive review when a maximum of 50% of trip we took was recognizable as what we agreed to and paid for.

title: Guinea-Bissau Day Trip
text:
My 13 year old daughter and I booked Omar's day trip to G-B. We knew it would be a long day but didn't have time to do a longer trip. 

Omar's reliability and time management were excellent. He arrived at our accommodation at 6am, with his driver, Lamine, who was very funny. At the Senegalese border, we switched from car to a less comfortable shared taxi. The road wasn't great but we got to the G-B embassy no problem. Omar had phoned ahead and the visas were easily organised. We took a taxi to the G-B border, then did a wee tour about on motorbikes and on foot. This was a quick, but fun, tour of Sao Domingo (90 mins. to 2 hours). Then a taxi back to Ziguinchor, a nice dinner, an uncomfy bus back to the Gambian border, another uncomfy taxi, then Lamine's car and we were back at our accommodation for 6pm. It was a lot of transport but also one of the most fun days of our holiday, as we saw places we knew very little about. 

Omar is a great problem-solver. He's also organised, reliable, easy company and a good communicator. Visas, food and transport costs aside, you're mainly paying for his knowledge and language skills which take the stress out of a journey which would take the uninitiated far more than 12 hours to complete and could be quite a hassle. It'd be possible to do the trip yourself on public transport but, for us, travelling with Omar was a great decision, as we felt safe and confident in his skills. Would recommend for anyone looking to go off-the-beaten track while on holiday in The Gambia and would also recommend Omar for other tours (we used his services again when switching accommodation). Thanks Omar and Lamine!

title: Great day trip to Senegal for my daughter and I
text:
Omar took my daughter and I to Senegal for the day to visit Fathala wildlife reserve. He managed to bypass the queues onto the ferry and ushered us through the busy market in Barra to find our waiting Driver and Jeep.
We felt well looked after, and he was flexible this timings. At the border crossing he just pointed us where to go and waited for us and straight back in the jeep so everything was quick and easy Most importantly, we felt safe as long as he was in sight.

title: The three boss men of the Gambia
text: Everybody that visits the Gambia must take a tour with Omar, Lamin, and the number 1 driver in the Gambia because these guys are going to be the top tour guides in the whole of the Gambia. These 3 men are the nicest people you could wish to have as tour guides. My brother and I had so many laughs and fun times during the two tours we took. Personally, I highly recommend the Guinea Bissau trip! Everyone should do this! We had a brilliant adventure, met some interesting characters along the journey, tried some local food, and got to experience things we never would have back home in England. Omar has the best prices for his tours and I genuinely believe you cannot find a better deal than what he offers. Thank you for some of the best adventures of my life! I will definitely be returning to Omi tours to discover Mali, Mauritania and Guinea! What are you guys waiting for? Get out there and explore with Omi tours now!

title: Perfect tour guide to visit The Gambia and parts of Senegal. Relax and enjoy the local flavor.
text: We took 3 trips with Omi Tours visiting different parts of The Gambia and Senegal. Every trip was a fantastic experience where Omar was a perfect guide and took care of our every need: pick-up at hotel, all ways of transport, food, drinks… Highly recommended.

title: Trip to Fathala Wildlife Reserve - Senegal
text: We are an English family of 5 (2 adults and 3 teenagers) who spent the day with Omi during our recent holiday in The Gambia. Omi took us to Fathala Game Reserve in Senegal and nothing was too much trouble for him. He organised everything - picking us up from our hotel in Kotu, helping us navigate the river crossing by wooden boat (as the ferry was out of action), providing drinks and delicious omelettes for breakfast and helping us through the border crossings quickly and efficiently. The game drive was lots of fun with our entertaining guide, Lamin and Omi also allowed us to experience a delicious lunch of local Gambian food, as well as enabling us to greet many local children to the sounds of 'Hello toubab'!! Omi was kind, friendly, interesting, helpful, reliable and honest. We felt very safe with him and I would highly recommend allowing him to be part of your holiday. A very enjoyable and memorable day. Thank you Omi! Kind regards, Alicia and family

title: The perfect guide for trips in The Gambia
text: We used Omi for three trips during our stay in The Gambia. He was very attentive to make sure we were happy at all times, and, most importantly, whist we were with him we felt safe and secure. Any small issue he was able to deal with all situations with the minimum of fuss. He was also happy to tweak the itinerary to suit anything extra we wanted to do or see. He was also not overpowering and left us to ourselves whenever the situation allowed. He is also very good company with a broad interest.

title: Guinea Bissau  day trip
text:
Omi tours  are fantastic 
We took a day tour to Guinea Bissau  me and my friend  .
and although it is a long day what fun we had , omi and his driver where great company we had such a great time and laughed and joked all the way . We went  through gambia to check point  then Senegal where we ate breakfast with the locals and washed down with a tea made from roots . Then on to the Guinea Bissau visa application in Senegal. Where omi sorted out are visas .
Once at Guinea Bissau we made are way through customs leaving the driver behind  at the other side we were met by are new drivers on motorbikes to take us  to are destination a short 10 minutes drive .
Once at are town to vist are first point of call was a drink of palm wine at a local cafe ,then we took a good look around talking in all the points of interest including the village where the buildings are made from mud .
Then it was lunch time we had red snapper fish and boiled rice with a pepper sauce absolutely amazing. Then it was time for the journey home.
Omi tours are so good because they are personal tours and omi and his driver really looked after us  and we always felt safe I can thoroughly recommend them and this trip ten out of ten.

title: Waanzinnige leuke gasten
text: De meest fantastische trips met Omi en zijn chauffeur Lamin gemaakt!  Omi is een rustige zelfverzekerde jongeman die erg zijn best doet om een mooie tour te verzorgen. Lamin is de vrolijk rasta die je rond rijdt. Omi weet veel en Lamin zit al heel lang in de business dus die kan nog aanvullen. De mannen worden gerespecteerd in de omgeving en dat is handig als er veel pushi anderen op je af komen. Ze zorgen bijzonder goed voor je. Mijn zoon, dochter en hun vriend voelden zich veilig bij hen. Ik ook!  En vooral heel veel gelachen.  Als je een trip wilt doen in Gambia, geef deze jongens een kans. Ze maken het meer dan waar.

title: Day trip to Guinea Bissau
text: 6 am start from hotel . Due to paperwork issues  with the car  we didn't get across Senegalese border untill 9.30 am . This trip is mainly a long car trip with stops at border crossings and various checkpoints as well as a consulate on the way. This trip is not for the faint hearted or those that suffer car sickness but if you like to collect countries , watch the world go by as you drive past and don't mind stepping out of your comfort zone this trip should be on your list of to do's when visiting Gambia. Our driver and guide was Lams .Thoroughly knowledgeable and wonderful guide. He got us through all the relative checkpoints ( of which there are many) and looked after us the whole day. We finally arrived in Guinea Bissau at about 1  pm to the town of Sao Domingo . To be honest a one horse town with not much going for it but I'm probably one of the few people that can say I've been there and I've a lovely full page visa and a multitude of stamps in my passport . On the way back we stopped in a Senegalese town to have a late lunch . After lunch all the women working in the back of the compound came round with their mobile phones  and asked to take pictures of themselves sitting with  the "exotic " creatures that came for lunch. We had a very pleasant conversation with them using our school days French  ( a very long time ago for me ) .Nice and tasty and although the surroundings were nowhere near European or resort standards we were not ill at all . Lams  said he knew that the woman cooked " clean " food . Although only in Gambia for a week this tour provided a great insight into West African life  and how things work there as well as the beautiful scenery .

title: Fathala Reserve
text: My dad and I did a Fathala reserve trip with Omi and had a lovely day. He made the border crossing into Senegal easy and had lots of knowledge to share with us on the day. Overall a very good trip and I would suggest to anyone to reach out before their trip to the Gambia to organise a trip with him!

title: Never again! Nice name, but no knowledge.
text: It was horrible. Nothing works. The boss arrived 1 h later than the time. The busdriver and the guide waited with us. We know - africa! But 1 hour at 5am is a lot. He promised us that we would achieve this and that agreed goal - and nothing worked. The coach fell apart - unfortunately we had to go back earlier because the bus wouldn't have made the journey. There was no hotel prepared in Bissau - we walked through the streets and looked for accommodation with Grandma. The boy is nice, but he can't do his job at all. The time frames were never right, he promised us goals every day that we never achieved. We actually spent 3 days just in the vehicle and didn't see anything of the agreed locations. The worst thing: he demanded more and more money from us - he no longer had the money that had been paid in advance and in order to achieve this we now had to pay more. Super dubious. We are still waiting for a refund for a ferry trip that was not carried out. Definitely: don’t book here! This is 100% wrong!

title: Fathala Safari with Omi.
text: We did the Fathala safari trip with Omi, which I arranged with him by email before our trip to The Gambia. Omi was very accommodating and looked after us so well. He helped us with the yellow fever certificates at the border crossing into Senegal and arranged the jeep driver and all the meals in advance so that we didn't have too much waiting on the day. It was a pleasure spending the day with him and I would recommend him to anyone wishing to do trips in The Gambia.

title: Great experience - very friendly and informative!
text: Omi took us on a tour along the River Gambia inland to Georgetown with many stops along the way last year (apologies for the delay!). He and his driver were very friendly and put a lot of effort into making sure we had a good time. He managed to fit a lot of places and activities into a short space of time, including a river tour to see crocodiles and chimpanzees, and I would definitely recommend to anyone going to visit the same area.

title: Costumized private trip around gambia
text:
Did two trips around Gambia with Omi and the driver Lamin.

They are the best. They will try to give you the best experience possible and try to show the best there is to experience in the places you visit.

They know the region very well. They will also take you to great local restaurants.

We did the Georgetown/Janjanbureh (2 day) tour. We enjoyed the river boat trip (where we got to see chimps and hippos) and all the other attractions. The only negative point was that the room didn’t have A/C, so the room was very hot during the night, but we are in West Africa after all, so you just have to deal with it.

The other day tour we did was all costumized. We did the Banjul tour; went to Bakau crocodile pool; to a local oyster farm; did the Makasutu forest boat trip; went to the monkey park in Bijilo and ended the day in Tanji fishing village (where you get to see the fishermen’s colorful boats)

I recommend Omi for the people that really want to experience West Africa!

title: The best guide in The Gambia -- Omi Tours!
text:
Omar is a knowledgeable, kind, and fun guide. He will instantly make you feel at home in The Gambia. I spent many fun days with Omar and Lamin on the road throughout West Africa, especially in The Gambia and Guinea-Bissau. I can't imagine doing it with two finer people. They are up for fun, adventure, and sensitive tourism, all while considering the individual needs of the traveler. 

One thing I really appreciated was how Omar listened to all of the things I love, and tailored our adventures to match those things. We had some amazing times on the River Gambia, encountering dozens of chimpanzees and pods of hippopotamuses. We visited villages and cities throughout the Gambia, Casamance/Senegal, and Guinea-Bissau. It was simply a wonderful, memorable journey.

Omar and Lamin are resourceful, too, with a wide range of skills that are very useful for the tough conditions of travel through the remote areas of the region. Although I hired Omar as my guide, he has become a good friend. Don't hesitate to visit the warm, kindhearted people of The Gambia and Guinea-Bissau--and do it with Omi Tours!

title: Fantastisk tur 💪😎
text:
Fantastisk tur Amadou havde arrangeret. 
Spændende tur med overnatning, sejltur mm. Planlægning i fællesskab
Godt selskab med datter, fælles bekendt og Amadou
Kan helt klart anbefales

title: Für Touristen gefangene, eingesperrte und gequälte Tiere. Bitte gebt kein Geld dafür aus!!
text: Bereits 1 Punkt für diese Bewertung ist zu viel. Uns wurde von Ecotours in Serekunda, neben dem LemonCreek Hotel, eine Mangroven- und Forestwalktour angeboten. Ohne Info ging es zuerst auf den größten Tiermarkt. Ziegen/Kühe waren am Knöchel mit einem 30 cm langen Seil angebunden, auf dem Boden lagen leere Tablettenhüllen. Es gab ein Schlachthaus. Im Forest gab es eingesperrte Affen, es stank, es war unsauber. Ein Minikrokodil in einem 1 x 1 Meter Betonbecken mit 2 Schildkröten wurde uns gezeigt. Am schlimmsten waren die Hyänen/Präriehunde. 2 Betongehege ohne Bepflanzung. Trennung beider Gehege war kaput. Die Tiere zwangen sich unter dem Zaun durch. Alle hatten durch den Metallzaun Wunden am Nacken bis aufs Fleisch hinunter. Ein Neugeborenes war auch dort eingesperrt. Das ist kein Tierwohl. Ich wollte freilebende Tiere beobachten. Zu sehen waren nur gequälte und extra für Touristen eingesperrte Tiere.

title: Sehr informativ
text:
Wir haben eine Tour bei Amadou gebucht, den makasutu Forest. Demba und Abdulai haben mir und meinem
Partner alles gut erklär und alles gezeigt. Wir waren nur zu zweit auf der Tour sodass wir wirklich alles miterlebt haben. Die baboons und Krokodile haben wir auch gesehen. Das Essen war sehr gut und Durchführung durch den Wald inklusive Erklärungen aller Wurzeln, rinde, bluten etc die von den afrikanischen Bombern als Naturheilmittel genutzt werden. Ich kann ecotours nur weiter empfehlen, vor allem
Weil Mit dem Profit ca. 50 Kindern ermöglicht wird zur Schule zu gehen inkl. Uniformen, Frühstück und Lernmaterial. Wer mehr darüber erfahren möchte, kann sich gerne bei Amadou darüber informieren. Die Spenden dort gehen direkt an die Kinder und nicht an eine Organisation.

title: Janjanbureh 2 days trip
text: We went for private 2 days trip from Serekunda - Faraffeni - Wassau stone circles - Gambia river - Janjanbureh - Brikamaba - Brikama market. Our guide Demba was just amazing, gave us a lot of information about history and living style of Gambia. He took care about us all the time, giving us fresh drinks and making us smile :) we had a great opportunity to see the chimpanzees and baboons on the river Gambia, to meet and spend some time with the local people, take knowledge about the great Gambian history of slavery. We would definitely recommend Ecotours to everyone.

title: Safari und banjul Tour!
text:
Wir haben zwei Touren mit ecotours gemacht. Beides Mal war es super! Amadou hat uns Gambia gezeigt, wir waren am Crocodile Pool, auf dem Markt und haben die Sehenswürdigkeiten von banjul gesehen, es war toll.
Die Safari Tour haben wir mit Emra (Name richtig?) durchgeführt, es war klasse. Wir sind vorbei an den Touristen Bussen und haben viel mehr von der Tour gesehen, da sie mit dem Auto durch den Safari Park an Orten waren, wo kein Bus herkommt!
Ecotours können wir wirklich empfehlen.
- pünktlich 
- gut organisiert 
- Hilfsbereit
- freundlich...

title: 4 day, 3 night bespoke trip
text:
We went on a bespoke 3 night 4 day tour with Amadou from Ecotours. We were 2 people with Amadou as guide. 

We contacted a few tour guides with good reviews from the UK which included Ecotours. We then had a few days after arriving in The Gambia to ask around and contact other operators. Apart from quoting the most competative price Amadou was the only person who actually seemed to have understood what we were asking for, rather than either giving a generic tour itinerary or a  vague response with no real itinerary.

The tour overall was fantastic and we thank Amadou for making it so.

A brief itinerary: 
Day 1 - picked up from hotel (early!), ferry crossing from Banjul to north of the River Gambia, stop for breakfast, drive to Wassu Stone Circle, lunch, drive to Kantaur, boat trip to Baboon Island (we saw hippos, chimps and other wildlife), drive to Jangjanbureh for dinner and overnight stay.

Day 2 - breakfast, walking city tour of Jangjanbureh, drive to rice fields for a walk and tour, visit local family in remote village, lunch, drive to Tendaba camp for a few hours relaxation (they have lovely accommodation and swimming pool), dinner and overnight stay.

Day 3 - breakfast, long boat trip to mangroves to see lots of birds (we loved this trip!). Drive to have lunch then to Bintang. Village tour with local guide. Dinner and overnight stay.

Day 4 - drive to Makasutu forest. Boat trip and forest walk with guide. Drive back to our accommodation early afternoon 

At each stage of the trip Amadou had arranged local guides to show us around. They were, without exception, knowledgeable and engaging and could answer any questions we had. We also got the opportunity to see places others may not have done with a generic guide. Amadou has many contacts throughout the Gambia which made this possible 

Best points
Excellent and prompt communication both before and after arriving in The Gambia.
Professional approach. Polite.
Always on time to meetings and pick ups.
Actually listening to what we wanted.
Competative price.
Excellent local tour guides.
Ecotours sponsors a school in Serrekunda with a percentage of profits.

Other
No bad points but just to note, if you have dietary requirements make this very clear from the start. The lunch and overnight places cannot always source ingredients so you may need to be flexible or plan ahead.

Would definitely recommend Ecotours. I think we had an excellent  experience of the real Gambia. Amadou is professional, personable,  knowledgeable and this, along with his local knowledge and contacts really made this the experience we wanted. Thank you.

title: Demba is the Best tourguide
text:
We had a trip together with Demba WHO worked at Ecoutours, he was a very good storyteller and knew many interessant places.
I just found it strange, that lunch was included for US, but NOT for him, Ecotours should take better care of their personel. We of course paid his lunch.

title: Ein toller Urlaub
text: Wir haben den Urlaub im Hotel lemon creek sehr genossen.  Ecotours war direkt vor Ort und hat mit seinem Angebot und wunderbaren Menschen überzeugt. Danke besonders  an Seedou.

title: Three great trips with two excellent guides
text:
My girlfriend and I spent two weeks at the Lemon Creek Hotel so Ecotours were very convenient but they were also great quality. 
Demba was our guide for the 'roots' tour and the safari park in Senegal. Despite the difficult nature of the roots tour (learning how the Gambia and its people were impacted by the slave trade) we felt it was a very important part to visiting Gambia and Demba's local knowledge and charm made both trips enjoyable. We were lucky enough to see a rhino, giraffes, zebra, Eland and much more in the safari park.
We also went on the two day tour to Georgetown and back with Amadou, who looked after us extremely well and his passion for his country and his support of local communities made us proud to be supporting his tour company. 
Particular highlights were the very warm welcome at the village community we visited, seeing a family of wild hippos on the boat trip and experiencing good local food for every meal.
Highly recommend!

title: En af de bedste og mest lærerige ture, jeg har været på
text: Mor og hendes kæreste havde besluttet, at vi alle skulle til Gambia, for at besøge nogle bekendte, der ejer et hotel dernede. Jeg havde regnet med en dejlig badeferie, og det havde vi også. Men jeg havde ikke regnet med at lære så meget, som jeg efterfølgende må erkende, at jeg har. Amadou og hans selskab Eco tours havde et kontor på hotellet, Lemon Creek, hvor vi boede. Vi besluttede os for at tage en af de store ture. Vi skulle have en på opleveren. Meeeeget tidligt om morgenen tog vi afsted mod færgen til nordbredden. Resten af dagen kørte vi langs floden ind i landet. Vi så gamle slaveøer, hvor lokale guides fortalte om de forfærdelige ting, der var hændt i sin tid. Vi så chimpanser hænge fra grenene på chimpanseøen, da de skulle fodres. Vi mødte glade mennesker overalt, hvor vi kom. Vi overnattede på Janjanbureh - en gammel slaveø - og tog mod Senegambia den dagen efter. På vejen mødte vi en ældre herre, der fortalte om den astrologiske betydning af en stemsamling, vi besøgte en familie, der boede i lerhuse. Min søster tog et billede af hele familien med sit polaroid-kamera og gav det til dem. Under hele rejsen fortalte Amadou om alt - menneskerne, kulturen, politikken i landet og naturen. Jeg følte mig helt mæt, da vi kom tilbage til hotellet, men det er en oplevelse, jeg aldrig vil glemme. Jeg var lige ved at skrive, at det er en oplevelse, man ikke kan sætte en pris på, men det kan man ;) Og det var alle pengene værd - det er helt sikkert!!

title: Ein toller Tag
text: Wir, eine Gruppe von 7 Personen, buchten eine Tagestour zu den historischen Stätten des Sklavenhandels: Alfreda, Juffure, und Fort James Island. Es war ein tolles Erlebnis mit nachhaltigen Eindrücken. Amadou und Demba, die Jungs von Ecotours, organisierten alles perfekt: die Fahrten mit Autos, Fähre und Boot; die Besuche des Slavereimuseums und des Forts auf James Island; Lunch und die immer vorhandenen kühlen Getränke! Sie sprachen ein sehr gutes Englisch und wir erfuhren viel über das Land und die Menschen. Ihnen gilt ein großes Dankeschön! Wir sind sicher, wir werden beim nächsten Mal wieder einen Ausflug bei Ecotours Gambia buchen.

title: Fathala
text: Visite des mangroves. D'un village et une île isolée pour nous seuls. Merci Djere!!! Super visite et ton poisson était extra sur le bbq.

title: An excellent weekend with excellent people
text: I was on a work trip in The Gambia and took the opportunity during the weekend to do some tourism. The people from Ecotours were extremely friendly and even though it was ramadan and they were fasting, their smiles and energy were way greater than mine! My guide, Demba, and our smiling driver, William, are real jewels!!!! Looking forward to going back and continue exploring the country!!

title: Roots Tour
text:
I've recently got back from a two week holiday in The Gambia during which my wife and I also got married. Along with us we also had 10 other family members and friends, most of which were in The Gambia for the first time. We decided organise a trip for after the wedding so we could see some of the history associated with the west African country. 

Amadou and Demba picked us all up at 8.20 from our hotel, two minibuses meant we had some space to relax in as we journeyed up to Banjul. As we made our way to the ferry port, Demba and Amadou explained the day ahead. Taking time to point out landmarks and discuss the kind of things we might see. Which if we were lucky could include dolphins. 

We traveled to Banjul, boarded a two deck boat and set sail down The Gambia river. We were given some sangria and sandwiches and there's a fully stocked bar on board too. 

An hour in and a couple of Julbrews later two dolphins made an appearance next to the boat, soon after another school joined them leaping from the water to our delight.

First stop was Juffereh, where we were greeted by the children. Our Ecotours guides then handed over to a local UNICEF guide who then took us into the village to see the museum. The many artefacts that depicted the history of the slave trade, brought a tear to the eye. It was very real and really hit home how horrific the slave trade was. 

We continued into the village to meet the chief, a wonderful lady over 80 years old that keeps the villagers in check. We also met Kunta Kinte's  last living relatives and enjoyed a talk on the family and Alex Haley's personal journey to seek his heritage. 

From here we rejoined the boat for a wonderful buffet meal. So much quality food! Then on to James Island, where we learnt about the conditions the slaves were kept in before their deadly journey across the Atlantic. An estimated 6 million slaves lost their lives on their way. An astonishing fact that is hard to comprehend.

After leaving the island we sailed back to Banjul before driving back to our hotel via a guided tour of the city. We arrived back around 6pm, having had an amazing day. Every member of our group took something away from the experience. 

Hats off to Demba and Amadou, they delivered a great trip for a reasonable price.

title: Very good! Really great trip to get to know the Gambia
text:
We took a three day tour through a large part of the Gambia, including a short visit to Fathala National Park in Senegal. Two very good and nice guides took us for a great trip. The guides spoke very good English. We visited several ecologically ran sites, JanJanBureh, a chimpansee Island and the presidential rice fields. We had a bird safari, went to see hippo's, slept in two really nice places, had great food along the way, etc. It was just great! 

We were out only for three days, but we saw and did so many things that we felt like being on the road for a week or more. These three days really took our holidays to the next level!

Keep in mind that it might be very hot when not at the coast!

The tour is well prepared and all in consultation with us.

The van we used (we were with 7, including 3 kids) was very good, although the airco could not handle the heat (it did work though, but it was 38+ degrees outside).

title: dagtrip naar Fathala Wildpark Senegal
text: Vanuit Bijilo met ecotours naar Senegal gegaan. Vervoer was uitstekend goede gids die de hele dag mee ging, persoonlijke aandacht en veel kennis van zaken maakte deze dag tot een succes. Daar zijn hun zeker onderscheidend in en geeft je naast deze mooie dag ook het gevoel dat hun het uiterste willen doen om deze dagtrip tot een succes te maken

title: To see a lot of The Gambia
text:

Stoneman at Wassu and the griot at Janjanbureh were especially entertaining and informative.  Guides on our boat trips for birding and chimpanzees were knowledgeable and easy to talk to.  The timetable was kept to and the the whole trip was an amzing experience with cold drinks on board and stops to take photos or admire the view or meet some kids in a school, so many things to see and remember.
I'd do a longer trip with Amadou at the drop of a hat.

title: Wonderfull holidays with Simon Tours in The Gambia
text:
Before we left for The Gambia, we already had extensive mail/app contact with Saidou Jallow (Simon Tours) and talked about various excursions. 
On the day of arrival, we agreed with Saidou at our hotel to go through the excursions and finalize the agreed dates. All excursions are paid for in advance on the spot so you don't have to worry about anything else. Saidou took care of all the transport, local guides, crossings etc...
We booked four excursions (including Fathala Wildlife tour Senegal and Hidden Gambia) and he showed us the real Gambia, including nomad markets and communities of tribes that still live in huts and where no tourists come. Two excursions were tailor-made, which is all possible at Saidou. Unfortunately, only a birdwatching excursion in the wet season is not recommended. But that was more than made up for by a visit to the fish auction in Tanji, a must for every Gambia visitor. We really enjoyed The Gambia and the wonderful excursions we made with Saidou.

Lizanne and Bert

ownerResponse.text: Thanks so much for your review! It’s great to hear you had such a fantastic time in The Gambia and that Saidou could help make it all happen. We’re so glad you got to experience the real Gambia, from the vibrant markets to the tribal communities—you can’t find those moments on the usual tourist trail. And thanks for the feedback on the birdwatching in the wet season; we’re happy the visit to the Tanji fish auction made up for it.

title: Great Guide for local visits !!!
text:
During our first visit to Gambia, we met Simon on the first day and agreed with him that he would be our guide for 4 days on various excursions.

The first went to Serrekunda market (2 people) and mangroves and because Simon has been doing this for a long time, he knows his way around and you come to places where you would never go with a large group.

The second excursion was a two-day trip to the interior of Gambia (Hidden Gambia, 4 people) where we visited the nomads and had a lot of contact with the locals, really fantastic.

Finally, we went with him to the Fathala wildlife park (2 people). Very beautiful and they took plenty of time to show us almost all the wildlife in the park. Simon always stayed with us and showed us the way through the hustle and bustle (where other providers put you on the boat and you are picked up by a taxi driver on the other side)

Simon is an experienced guide who keeps his appointments promptly, speaks perfect English, is friendly, knows his way around the local area very well and always remains calm. His drivers are also reliable and safety comes first.

We highly recommend Simon tours, everything is possible as long as you indicate what you want (extra).

You can always contact us if you have additional questions

Thanks Simon and drivers!

Review for Simon Tours in The Gambia:

text: We did  a search of local companies in Gambia who could do excursions Bushwacker Tours was the company we chose. Their prices were competitive & better than TUI prices. Our guide Alieu was knowledgeable, well informed & had a diverse of networks everywhere we went. We as a family felt very safe & was considerably taken care of by Alieu & driver Baba. Both Alieu & Baba were organised, prompt with timings & very professional in everything they did. Alieu went over and above to ensure we as a family got the best experience from our excursions. We did Banjul City Tour; Roots Tour; Fathala Wildlife Reserve incl walking with lions and we did Monkey Park where we fed the monkeys.  I highly recommend Bushwacker Tours to anyone who is going to Gambia and requires a honest, safe and knowledgeable company for their excursions. Alieu made mine & my family holiday memorable with a smile & I will never forget our experiences in The Gambia.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you so much the McKenzie family. We hope to see you again 😁

title: A privilege to see into a different world
text: We went on the Fathala & Roots tour with Bushwacker tours. Alieu is an excellent guide . Who is knowledgeable, an intelligent nice person. At all times we felt completely safe, whilst able to experience a bit of real Gambian life. We learnt a lot from  Alieu about what life is really like for everyday Gambians. I would encourage all tourists to venture out of their hotel . The ferry trip in itself is an eye opener.

title: Wonderful and interesting tours throughout Gambia
text:
We had an amazing time with Bushwacker Tours. In total, we did 3 tours with them: 1x No Roots, 1x Janjanbureh 2-day tour and 1x the South Gambia tour. All three of them were interesting and different to each other, but the clear highlight and a must is the Janjanbureh tour - we saw chimpanzees, hippos and the "real Gambia". I can absolutely recommend doing a tour with them.

We had Malcolm as a guide and he was brilliant. He was funny, very attentive to our needs and safety, organised and very knowledgable. In fact, we really enjoyed just having a chat with him about the life in Gambia and he was always able to share an interesting perspective and fact. He was a great part that we enjoyed our stay in Gambia.

title: One of the best visit ever, bushwhackers makes us had the best and memorable holiday in our lives.
text: One of the best tour guide company in the Gambia. Well capable and competent staffs who gives first class information in everything you need to know as a guess. With bushwhackers tour i recommend them as the perfect company to book your excursion or trips with.

title: The Best in Gambia! You can stop reading reviews now and just book it!
text:
Amazing trip to Baboon Island, Chimps and Janjanbureh! Alieu is an incredible guide and Baba a great driver! Saw ALL the animals - Chimps and Hippos galore.  Couldn’t have asked for a better, more organized trip. Environmentally conscious, cares about the animals, always hires local guides. The stay at Kairoh Gardens was pleasantly surprising and the food was good throughout. No question, just book it! 

P.s. for an especially good time you can count all the roadblocks along the way :)

title: A lovely day
text: Back on board ship after a lovely day with Bushwhacker Tours.  We did the Roots tour.  Our guides were waiting for us as we got off the ship.  We were 16 with several guides and drivers.  I've just gotten several emails from others in the group saying how pleased they were.  Mr Bayo, the office manager, and I had emailed back and forth setting everything up.   A really fun day.

title: Do not hesitate, take a trip with Bushwackers Tours!
text: We really had a phantastic excursion in South Gambia, got really all the information tonlearn more about the country and felt very confident with Alieu and his driver. Personal suggestions and changes tonthe trip could be made.

title: Travelling around in the Gambia
text: Have used Bushwacker Tours many years in a road. Are very satisfied with the guides we are using. We feel safe, taken good care of and all the knowledge are appreciated.

title: The best of gambia
text:
Abbiamo fatto 4 escursioni con questa agenzia (gambia river cruise,roots  tour,janjanbureh  tour, abuko national  park) in tutto abbiamo fatto 5 giorni in compagnia di due guide molto preparate.Abbiamo visto coccodrilli,ippopotami,scimpanzé,babbuini,uccelli.Inoltre abbiamo visto un museo sulle maschere del gambia e l'isola degli schiavi (james island).
Esperienza  stupenda,cibo ottimo.
Personale preparato,disponibile  e puntuale!
Silvia e massimo (como) italy

title: Top organisierter Ausflug nach Fathala
text:
Wir haben die Tour nach Fathala gebucht und wurden dorthin vom Guide Solomon begleitet. Er war sehr freundlich und hat uns auch während der gesamten Tour viel über die heimische Kultur und das Leben in Gambia erzählt. 
Die Tour an sich war top organisiert und auf dem Weg dorthin (Fähre, Grenzübertritt) hat alles gut geklappt! Im Park haben wir die wichtigsten Tiere gesehen (Zebras, Giraffen und Wasserbüffel). Der Lunch auf dem Rückweg war auch sehr lecker. Alles in allem immer wieder gerne.

title: Well organised and professional with lovely Malcolm.
text:
A great trip out with Bushwhacker tours! We had a wonderful guide, Malcolm, who took us to Kunta Kinteh Island as part of the Roots tour. 
It was a really well organised trip- communication was prompt and we were picked up on time..a great, safe driver both sides of the river! I was so impressed at Malcolm's knowledge. We have wanted to do this trip to Jufureh for years and bombarded Malcolm with questions which he took in his stride. I really enjoyed the trip, albeit a bittersweet one that made me feel really emotional but I am so glad I finally got to go. The tour included a visit to descendents of Kunta Kinteh which was surreal and humbling. I would recommend the trip to anyone!

title: Fatala safari tour
text:
Excellent trip. After  looking at other tour providers and prices this looked the best option and we weren't disappointed. Well organized and professional. An informed guide accompanied us throughout the day. With some apprehension we took the walk with lions additional option and this will be a lasting memory.

All in all a thoroughly great day out.

title: Tour Senegal
text:
A well organiseren tour by Aji Tours. She is very friendly and everything was included, even drinks. So the drinks at any time cold in your hands.  
Aji is a guide who knows everything about the tour and Gambia!

title: Skip deze excursie als je moet kiezen
text:
Geboekt via TUI. 
Wij vonden dit niets. Hele dag varen tussen de mangrove, amper vogels gezien. 
Ik zou het niemand aanraden.

title: Queen aji
text:
What a absolutely brilliant lady
Walking history book she is
I can't thank her enough 
For taking us to kunta kinta island

title: Amazing experience with Aji
text:
With Aji I experienced the trip of a lifetime in the Lion walk- 
Aji is a knowledgeable tour guide and goes out of her way to make sure you have the best experience.
I cannot recommend her highly enough. 

Shukran Aji, Ibrahim Suliman Maria. And the beautiful people of The Gambia

title: Meeting Aji is a must when in The Gambia.
text: Aji was such an amazing guide. Not only taking care of us through the whole journey but also sharing her experience and large knowledge. She is such a hard worker, a strong women caring for her coumunity. We had amazing conversations while we were amazed by the views during the day. Can't thank her enough for everything she shared with us! Would recomend her with no doubt and would love to see her again in future adventures around Gambia!

title: Impresiona ver in situ esta barbaridad. Con Aji tuvimos explicaciones de un local, de la isla y alrededores
text: Visita a la isla Kunta Kinteh interesante. Aji puntual y con buenas explicaciones. Mujer fuerte e inteligente que merece ser apoyada

title: Don't be fooled by appearances. She is a small woman but a Big Person in Gambia.
text: Aji is a very good guide. She has a lot of knowledge about her country, she is very organized, caring and communicative. But above all, she is a fantastic woman and friend. If you want to visit Gambia in an intimate, nice and cheerful company, choose Aji Tours and you will definitely not regret it.

title: Aji as a best Tour guide and friend!
text: We are 3 friends who spend two weeks in Gambia discovered its beauty with Aji Tours.She is amazing person with great knowledge about her countyside, history and local usages.She is full of empathy, joyfull and attension of People.We were spending with her and friends unforgetable moments.Makhasutu ,Fatala and others was amazing experiences.We love You Aji .Margaret, Magda ,Dorota.

title: Geweldig
text:
Deze tour met Ali een lokale man geboekt. Ali_tours_gambia (insta)
Ali heeft een goede uitleg gegeven over de rivier. De oesters die groeien aan de wortels zijn indrukwekkend. Als je geluk hebt, zie je apen aan de kant van de rivier. Het eten was zeer lekker en traditioneel klaar gemaakt. 
Fijne luie dag

title: Een geweldige ervaring in Gambia.
text: Vanuit ons hotel Senegambia hebben we Aji ontmoet op de strip. Een kordate, sympathieke en positieve Gambiaanse. Via een aantal locals kregen we te horen dat ze betrouwbaar is en dat we gerust bij haar een boeking kunnen doen. Wij waren voor de 1e keer in Gambia en we kozen voor het wildpark in Fathala. En het was in 1 woord geweldig, in alle vroegte gingen we op de veerboot naar Senegal. Alles was in de puntjes geregeld,  het ontbijt op de boot, de formaliteiten bij de grensovergang en de safari in Fathala. We waren met een klein groepje van 4 en dat was heel fijn, we hebben veel informatie gekregen over Gambia en de dieren in Fathala.Op de terugweg hebben we ook nog heerlijk geluncht. De liefde voor haar land heeft ze op ons over kunnen dragen! . De safari was een hoogtepunt van onze vakantie en we kijken er met veel plezier op terug.

title: wonderful, smiling and trustworthy girl. Trips with her are beautiful moments full of good emotions. I recommend 100%
text: Beautiful views, lots of photos, positive energy, full relaxation. A unique opportunity to get to know the local friendliness and culture ❤️💚

title: The BEST guide ever
text: We have been on 2 trips with this amazing, warm, smiling and loving little guide 🇬🇲 Aji has made our trip to Gambia a PERFECT experience 🇬🇲 In addition to the fact that she knows so much about her country, and she is very happy to share it with us, she helped us in many other situations. What this little woman can't do, it's not worth being able to do 😍 After our trips, she sent the most beautiful pictures that she took of us on the trip - so at the same time as being our guide, she was also our photographer 🙏 She has our warmest recommendations - and she will be the first person we will contact when we (soon) go to Gambia again. All our trips must be booked through her, because then we KNOW that there is a guarantee of success and a great experience. Thank you so much, Aji - you loving and wise little person 🥰❤️

title: Fathala resevre Senegal
text:
Went to Fathala in Senegal...
Aji is a local female tour operator , very professional and made the trip fun , competitive rates....

title: Number 10
text: Just amazing trip to Senegal Fathala wildlife reserve. Everything was so well organised. We all have great time also just relax and enjoy the hole trip.

title: THE GAMBIA EXPERIENCE
text: I booked with Aji on the Fathala safari tour. It was a one to one trip, and so I had a very personal experience. Aji had plenty of tips and pointers, and I enjoyed it so much, I booked a second outing with her to the crocodile pool and Serekunda market, where Aji really came in to her own haggling on my behalf to get me some bargains. Aji is very good at what she does, and when I return to The Gambia I'll use her services again.

title: Warm and wonderful tour guide
text: Aji is a warm and knowledgeable tour guide. She made an amazing experience even better and I will be happy to do further trips with her

title: Beautiful day
text:
More than a wonderfull day with the only female guide in Gambia AJI. Together with her colleague Malcom, she made it a unforgettable day for us!
We recieved a lot of information and importantly: it was very pleasant and we were taken care excellent care of.
Rina&Magdaleen

title: Highly recommended
text: We had an amazing experience discovering The Gambia thanks to the excellent tour of Ali Sowe. He made us feel very comfortable and safe and we had an unforgettable day. Highly recommended!

title: Als je echte Gambia wil ervaren moet je met Aji op pad.
text: Een dag op pad met Aji als gids. Het echte Gambia gezien met 4x4 jeep en goede chauffeur waar veiligheid voorop stond. Eén tour met een lach en een traan. We zijn op plekken geweest waar gambianen van lege weggegooide blikjes kookgerei maakten, op markten, op de koeien en geitenmarkt, bij de visverwerking, paradise beach en we hebben een aantal locale families ver in rimboe bezocht. Op advies van Aji 50 kg rijst en 2 zakken met lolly’s gekocht en daar uitgedeeld. De armoe en dankbaarheid van deze mensen is enorm. Wat zijn wij rijk…. Echt aan te bevelen als je het echte Gambia wil zien. Daarnaast vertelt Aji veel over het leven en de locaties in Gambia. Super mooie en indrukwekkende dag gehad.

title: An exceptional tour by a wonderful tour guide
text: One of the best tour guides we have ever experienced. Aji was personable, professional, and very knowledgeable. She was prompt and took us on an event filled day where we saw every site there was to see in the Gambia. We highly recommend using her for all of your tours.

title: Great 2 Day Tour
text: We just did the '2 Day Gambia Adventure' tour and thought it was excellent. The boat trip on the first day was the highlight, very peaceful and we saw plenty of hippos and crocs. We stayed at Sensending Camp which was basic but clean, we had a shower and toilet in the room and a full mosquito net with no holes in. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly and we were able to stop at a few impromptu sites along the way (e.g. to watch a troop of baboons cross the road). All the food on the tour was tasty and we had a cooler full of complimentary soft drinks. Really glad we booked!

ownerResponse.text:

We hope you will relate your experience with African Adventures Tours with friends and families and they will also join us for a great experience.

title: Great trips
text: We did 3 trips with them and we had a great time. The guides are just fantastic, they will do their very best to please everybody. You can just feel the love that they have for their country. Great way to see the Gambia and visit the local people. As they are a registered company maybe the price is a little higher then non registered tour guides but when there is a problem they will fix it asap. Next time we go to the Gambia we will surely book some more trips with them

title: Mooie trips!
text:
We hebben tijdens ons verblijf in Gambia 3 trips gedaan. 
We vonden de 4WD de mooiste. 
De organisatie heeft goede gidsen, waarvan enkele ook goed Nederlands praten. Het is een mooie manier om meer van Gambia te zien dan alleen strand en hotel.
