It was just a regular sized, thin pizza (my bf couldve eaten it all by himself if he wanted to). So half a pizza was all we got from 7am til 6pm). In comparisation of other tours, this tour was really too expensive (80 euro).

Because we didn't like the first tour, we wanted to cancel the second tour (since we had to do about the same route for that). I sent Simon Tours a message to inform about our options. He proposed another tour that day, but we already did that tour with Black and White tours. I said that to him, and he never texted me back, so we just lost the money without any agreement. 

We did some tours with another organisation, which in our opinion was much much better, such a shame...

title: Simon Badjan Taxi- en tourist guide for excursies op de zuid Bank
text: Onze vaste chauffeur voor al ons vervoer naar Banjul, Bakau, Tanji, Tujereng, Turntable, overal op de South bank waar u maar heen wilt voor een rit of een dagprijs

title: Very unorganised
text: So we agreed a price for a day trip to sanyang and we got in the car, they then decided that wasn't enough so we increased the price and started on our way then they decided that was still not enough so they called someone else to take us. Very badly run company, I don't often give bad reviews but holidays are short agree a price and stay with it.

title: Perfect
text: Wij kennen Simon al zeker 12 jaar en hij heeft ons altijd perfecte tours bezorgd! Keurig op tijd, vriendelijk en zeer begaan met de lokale bevolking.

title: Fantastiska upplevelser i Gambia
text:
Mamma och dotter på sista minuten resa hade turen att möta Kawsu Tours första dagen och bokade Fathala Park, Roots och Kunta Kinteh Island tur.
Det blev en 12timmars fantastisk tur med massor av intryck och upplevelser.
Vi var även på en tur till Tanji Fishing Market, Crocodile Pool och Monkey Park även det en händelserik dag. Vi hade bästa guiden i Omar som berättade om alla upplevelserna för oss, han tog väldigt väl hand om oss och vi kände oss väldigt trygga i hans sällskap.
Vi var väldigt glada över att vi valde ett lokalt Guideföretag och inte följde med på resebyråns utflykter. Är helt övertygade om att vi fick en helt annan upplevelse än de som valde researrangörens turer.

title: Great guided tour
text: We have been on a lovely holiday in Gambia and in this connection we have used Kawsu Tours for 3 day trips. Lamin, as their guide is called, is both skilled and a guide who follows you all the way on the trip. It is a really good experience, which we can highly recommend to everyone else. Five big stars from here. Greetings Johnni, Line and Silas from Copenhagen

title: Monkey Park
text: We hebben een hele leuke trip gemaakt naar een lokale markt en daarna vaar het Monkey Park. Het was een hele leuke en gezellige trip. Veel gelachen en lekker rustig de tijd voor alles. Ik zeg een grote aanrader.

title: The best in The Gambia
text:
The Best if you planning to visit The Gambia

Lamin is the best Guide you can have 
For al sort of excursions 

Safari Wildlife Markets Local food All is included

title: Fabulous and fun, safe and organised, honest
text: Wonderful trip to Fathala game reserve in Senegal. We did trips with Kawsu Tours in Jan24 and now Dec24. Fair prices, professional guides and safe, good vehicles. Trips adjusted to suit mobility needs, very flexible and nothing too much trouble. Verywell looked after, shade and seats always found and offered for those in our family who needed. Good English and sense of humour. No fuss, relaxed and organised. Kawsu runs Kawsu Tours and their travel agent stall/shack is on the road/Lane neat Kombo Beach Hotel and Sunbeach Hotel. Highly recommended you tell all the other tour guides, taxi drivers etc you are with Kawsu they accept and move along. Fabulous trips and we did many.

title: Ausflug nach Tanji und Lamin mit Einblicken in die Community
text:
Wir haben den Ausflug ins Tanji Bird Reserve, Fish Market und Lamins Lodge bei Kawsu gebucht und wurden dabei von Aladdin und Omar geführt. Die beiden waren sehr herzlich und haben uns tolle Einblicke in den gambischen Alltag und ihre Community ermöglicht. Beim Fish Market durften wir den gesamten Verarbeitungsprozess der Fische sehen (von Fangen über Verkauf und haltbar machen). Außerplanmäßig gab es dann noch einen kurzen Stop beim Craft Market und auf eigenen Wunsch hat Omar uns noch den Animal Market gegenüber gezeigt. Die Mangrovenfahrt bei Lamin war ebenfalls spannend und sehr herzlich von den beiden Kapitänen durchgeführt.

In unserer Straße vor dem Hotel gab es mehrere Touranbieter. Bei Kawsu hat uns besonders gefallen, dass er nicht aufdringlich war und uns Raum gegeben hat unsere eigene Entscheidung zu treffen, was wir wann machen möchten. Wirklich ein top lokaler Touranbieter, zu dem wir immer wieder gerne kommen würden, wenn wir nochmal nach Gambia reisen und was anderes sehen möchten!

title: Alles in orde en volgens afspraak.
text: Met Kausu tours een bezoek aan Lamin lodge gedaan. Onderweg nog een bezoek gebracht aan de lokale veemarkt, ook een ervaring op zich. De ene dag geboekt en de volgende dag gegaan, was ook laagseizoen in het hoogseizoen zal dit mss anders zijn. Alles in orde en goed geregeld.

title: Loved it and coming back Dec 24
text: Great trip, personal guide and reliable service. The owner really listened and amended our trip to suit my mum who had mobility issues. Lamin was a careful driver. Very helpful and we loved sitting on the back of the jeep. We had a great laugh on our bird watching trip and boat trip.

title: Kawsu tours
text: They are based in Kotu.We booked the 5 in 1 package. Our guide was a charismatic young man called Lamin. He was entertaining and also very informative. Their price was very reasonable and their customer service was excellent. They helped us try a range of delicious local delicacies, which we really liked. No effort was spared and we  highly recommend their service! 😊

title: Kachikally crocodile & Serrekunda
text:
Amazing experience with Omar and Becks from Kawsu Tours who drive us to Bachau to see the crocodile pond.It is a sacred crocodile pool used as a sites for fertility rituals. 
Now a popular tourist the ancient freshwater pool with many crocodiles situated in the heart of the labyrinthine residential suburb of Kachikally.  According to oral tradition, shortly after the Bojang Tribe arrived in the area 500 years ago, they were visited by the fertility spirit.  The site remains a popular pilgrimage site for barren women, who come from far and wide to douse themselves in its curative water (any child born after a ritual bathing of this sort is invariably named Kachikally). 
Then we drove onto Serrekunda where Omar and Becks attentively guided us through the labyrinth of passages to see the tradional local market in addition to the 'tourist' market. We gained a valuable insight into local life at the butchers, fishmongers and charcoal sellers. Many thanks to Kawsu Tours for organising.

title: great people with a positive attitude
text: We asked Kawsu to help us organise a trip to the Tanji Fish Martket - our guide was Lamin, who made the trip a great experience - he showed us many places we wouldn't have looked at on our own; we walked around quietly, unhurriedly, he gave us a lot of valuable information; it was such a nice trip that a few days later we asked him for a transfer at the airport, again everything went off without a hitch, we highly recommend Lamin and Kawsu, great people with a positive attitude!

title: Reliable, safe, courteous and professional
text: Lovely little travel agent shack near Bakotu Hotel and Kombo Beach Hotel. Honest and friendly service, very reliable and courtesous staff, very fair prices. Highly recommend.

title: Great days with Kawsutours!
text: Very interesting tour to Bakau, crocodile park, the museum and many other destinations. We used the Kawsutours during our whole stay in Kotu! Will highly recommend our best ever driver Beck for others! Thank you even Lamin and Alasan!

title: Loved it
text: Friendly Kawsu takes you on a no frills tour seeing the real Gambia. We went to a village and saw alcohol being made from cashews and ate roasted nuts.

title: Een echte aanrader
text:
Wij hebben gebruikt gemaakt van Kawsu tours nav een aanbeveling via vrienden. Vanuit Nederland hadden wij het telefoon nummer van Kawsu gekregen en hebben hem geappt met de vraag ons van het vliegveld op te komen halen. Kawsu reageerde gelijk en stond keurig op ons te wachten. Hij stond klaar met een open safari jeep en de vakantie begon gelijk met een fantastische beleving! Tijdens onze rit naar het hotel vertelde hij van alles over het land en de cultuur. 
Wij gingen voor een relaxte zon vakantie maar wilden natuurlijk ook iets van het land opsnuiven. Dus wij vroegen Kawsu wat voor leuke tours hij ons kon aanbevelen? Hij heeft ons afgezet bij het hotel en zei, ga eerst even relaxen, dan kom ik later langs om eventuele opties te bespreken. Dus zijn wij een paar dagen later een hele dag on tour geweest. FANTASTISCH! 
Wij zijn echt in het diepe gegooid en hebben de Serakunda markt bezocht, zijn naar een lokale kleuterschool geweest waar wij spullen voor mee hadden genomen (potloden, stiften, kleurboeken, spelletjes...ect ) wat was dat hartverwarmend. 
Een batik fabriek, naar de Lamin lodge in de mancrove en aan het einde van de dag naar de lokale vismarkt, dit was een te gekke belevenis. Onze tourguides en chauffeur waren fantastisch. Ze hebben ons veel verteld over alles, de gebruiken en de cultuur. Zij hebben ons echt een veilig gevoel gegeven!
Zo hebben ze ons ook weer terug naar het vliegveld gebracht. 
Kawsu is een ECHTE AANRADER!!
Thanks a lot Kawsu. greetings from Holland

title: The best guide of Kotu. Our guide Lamin is a great and cheerfull guide.
text:
We are a dutch couple and went with Lamin (Kawsu Tours) on a daytrip. It is our first holiday in Gambia.  Many men wants to be your guide and it is hard to say no, because you know that everybody needs money to live.  But we liked Lamin at first sight, by the pleasant way he makes contact. Lamin and his driver Aladin took us to many interesting places: the animalmarket, Abokupark, Laminlodge, Brikama kraftmarket, lunch at Paradisebeach and Tanji-fishmarket.  He is a great guide and a very pleasing and cheerfull guy. We event went to his familyhome,  where we met his kind parents and brothers and sisters. Lamin offers the best quality for the price we paid. We can highly recommand him. 
Wim and Maria

title: A lovely lazy day experience
text: A great day from start to finish.Greeted on  the boat  with coffee or tea plus biscuits..Then upstairs on the boat for a bit of sunbathing and enjoying the scenery before dropping anchor to do fishing which is optional. Always help at hand with applying the bait.We caught a good amount of fish.A great lunch was provided by Aisha.Plenty of cold drinks on board.I was sad when the day was over.A big thank you to Kawsus team.

title: Gambia ontdekken met een vriendelijke Gambiaan, die Engels en Nederlands spreekt
text: Kawsu is de lokale vraagbaak die al decennia touristen zijn land laat zien. Dit alles op zeer vriendelijke wijze. Hij spreekt Engels en (redelijk) Nederlands en zorgt goed voor zijn landgenoten en zijn gasten. Achter veel andere tour bedrijven zitten niet Gambiaanse eigenaren. Hij is eigenaar en zorgt dat Gambianen werk en te eten hebben. Met meerder auto's, waaronder een prachtige Landrover uit 1986 met een vrachtwagen motor, laat hij je Gambia ontdekken en waarderen. Er is echt van alles mogelijk, van simpele taxiritjes tot meerdaagse tochten door het hele land, inclusief boottochten. De prijzen zijn zeer schappelijk en liggen beduidend lager dan de tarieven die je elders betaalt. Ook zijn gezin en dorpsgenoten heb ik mogen ontmoeten en inmiddels kan ik zeggen via hem heel Gambia (en stuk Senegal) te hebben doorkruist en kan hem van harte aanbevelen!

title: Fantastic
text: I went with Lams Tours first to Basse and then spent a night at my favourite spot  Jang Jang Bureh Camp just beside the Gambia River. Its so peaceful and close to the nature there. A fantastic experience to find peace and quiet but still with lots of birds and monkeys around. Lams took us on a bush walk and explained all about trees and bushes that are used to cure illnesses. Interesting. Lams is a fantastic tour guide and now he has a new trip to Guinea Bissau, Guinea Conakry, Sierra Leone and Liberia. This will be my next trip for sure.

title: Highly Recommend!!
text:
Ishamel was the tour guide assigned to us, we used Lambs Tours for an airport pick up and did the Fathala lion walk/Safari with them. 

Ishamel is a delight to be around, knowledgeable and very helpful. Throughout our tour it felt like traveling with a friend rather then a tour guide. 

On the day of the airport pick up he was there on time waiting for us, and went out of his way to help us exchange money on route to our hotel.

Again, on the day of the Fathala lion walk/ safari Ishamel was there to pick us up on time, he is well established so traveling from The Gambia, across the river and into Senegal and back was made very easy, with not a lot of waiting around.   

The Fathala lion walk was a great experience but it’s not as natural as you expect (but again they are lions). The Safari was great too with a range of animals in the wildlife park to see.

title: Amazing Country, Amazing Guide
text:
Calling Lams tour a “tour” would be underselling it. It is a true experience. Me and three others enjoyed the two day trip to Georgetown, a day trip to Guinea-Bissau and a tour around Banjul. To start, Lams is extremely friendly, personable, and flexible. He can modify the tour on the fly to do things he thinks you might enjoy. Our trips included several impromptu market stops, motorcycle rides and a stop to enjoy a scenic sunset. The planned itinerary of the tours was excellent and The Gambia is filled with wonderful people and beautiful locations. 

We visited two families one in the Gambia and the other Guinea-Bissau. These visit gave us the chance to see how locals truly lived. It was different than many other “local” or “village” tours that I have done around Africa in that the trips weren’t prearranged and we just stopped at a house at random. This allows you to enjoy authentic hospitality instead of trying to be sold things. 

Lams is an expert in making your tour as seamless as possible. We did a day tour to Guniea-Bissau from Banjul which required crossing 4 borders. Lams helped quickly through the borders as he has connections with the border agents. He is also an expert to navigating markets, roadblocks, and any other things that pops up along the way. He speaks several languages and can communicate easily with people across Gambia, Senegal, and Guniea-Bissau to help translate for you or help with any issues that may arise. 

I could write more on how great our 4 days with Lams was, but in summary you should just book him. You won’t regret it.

title: The Best
text: First of all, everyone should come to The Gambia. It is an amazing country with the best people. If you want a legitimate, "authentic" experience in a new country/countries while still feeling comfortable and safe, Lams is perfect. He wants his visitors to experience the real Gambia (and other countries he tours in), to learn history, and to see how people live. He has the best personality, knows a ton about the history and culture, and is an extremely funny and comfortable guy. We did the two day Guinea-Bissau/South Senegal trip with him, and a 1/2 day Makasutu-Wide Open Walls Art Villages/Banjul Markets day with "Smiley", who was also wonderful (which we tailored to our desires, another great attribute of Lam's-if you're a planner you can give your input and adapt his itineraries to meet your needs). We now consider him a friend for life, and we'll definitely be back.  Come to the Gambia, and do at least one longer trip with him to see Africa as it should be seen!

The Georgetown Tour and the Tour to Kunta Kinte Island are good and very interesting. You can feel safe when you go with Lams Tours

title: Fishing trip

title: Day tour in Western Gambia
text: I had a wonderful day tour with Lams around Western Gambia.  We saw the crocodile pond, Serrekunda market, a goat/cattle market, Paradise Beach, and a fishing village.  Lams has 15-20 years of experience in tourism, and it shows.  He is extremely professional, positive, funny, and works hard to tailor the trip to the people he is with.    It was a wonderful way to experience Gambia, and learn a lot about the island, and the culture(s) of this country.

title: Highly Recommended
text:
We chose Lams Tours  for a trip inland to Janjanbureh (also known as Georgetown). It’s a two day trip with an overnight stay at a riverside ‘camp’ with traditional African roundhouses. Lams was busy with another trip so we went with Smiler and Blacker, two absolutely sound lads that were great guides. 

An overview of the trip: We set off early from our hotel and started the six hour drive. The minibus was comfortable and cold water was provided. You see so much more of the real Gambia when you’re driving through towns, villages and countryside. It’s an amazing place. On our way we stopped off at a busy market in Farafenni, which was cool. Then we crossed the rather large Senegambia Bridge and made our way to Wassu to see the stone circles. We met a local guide here who showed us around and explained the history. 

Then a short drive to the riverside to board a boat, heading into the River Gambia National Park. This was a really nice way to spend a couple of hours, searching for hippos and chimpanzees and learning all about the conservation of the area. We then had some time to chill before heading to the roundhouses for the night. 

The camp was a great experience, watching the monkeys play as the sunset over the river. We had some food and a few drinks then hit the sack. The morning came quickly as the call to prayer floated out from the mosques over the river, and were soon up and having breakfast. 

Day 2 began with a ferry over the river and a visit to the slave house and the other remaining colonial buildings. Very interesting  and well presented information. On the drive back we stopped and bought some very hot chilis from the market and our mate up front made us tuna and chilli sandwich, which was good fun. The rest of the drive was spent relaxing and taking it all in, that was until we spotted the Aston Villa wall from the Gambian Young Football Academy. Being a Villa fan I had stop and get a picture! 

I rate this trip highly, and I was very impressed with Smiler and Blacker too. We did get to meet Lams as he did our airport taxis, he’s a very bright man with some exciting plans for future trips. I can recommend Lams Tours anytime.

title: Amazing Senegal Experience
text:
We went for the South Senegal tour with Lams Tour. Very nice day very interactive and loads of activities. The boat ride to Kailo village and the Kailo Village was the highlight of the tour. A day very well spent with Lam and Bakarey. 

Kafountine fishing village was lovely and we stopped there in a  restaurant by the beach for some very delicious lunch.

There are many tour companies in Banjul / Serrekunda but  will suggest you to go with Lams tour. They have a well organised tour plan and they are a reputed company. Avoid the cowboy tour guides in the Beach Area. 

We will definitely come back to Gambia again and will do some more trips with Lams in the future.

title: Day Trip to Guinea-Bissau
text:
I was a little bit scared how a day trip to Guinea-Bissau will be. A long trip and a lot of boarder issues???? No!
It was an amazing tour, starting very early in the morning and back in the early evening. Lam organised on a way that I could not imagine. We got a VISA at the consulat in Senegal and at all boarders it seemed to me that Lam knew all people there, it went smooth and fast, so that we could spend a very special day in Guinea-Bissau, where we visited a family organisation, villages and drunk fresh palm wines. Unfortunately we could not visit that day a school because it was a bank-holiday (Womens Day).
It was a great trip with an unique touch to discover villages with real life and people, far away from tourist routes in a country where normally it is not easy to discover - was a highlight during my vacation!
Best car that I had in all my trips in Gambia and a careful driver and wonderful lunch included in a private kitchen in Senegal

title: Fantastic 2 day trip to Guinea Bissau and Senegal
text:
Lams and the team are fantastic.!!! This was our second visit to Gambia and having booked a few tours with Lams previously (5years ago) I reached out and made contact again prior to our visit for an over night trip down to Guinea Bissau and South Senegal. Lams was quick and Efficient in his responses and arranged to meet is in our hotel reception the day after our arrival in Gambia to discuss the final details for the trip. A couple of days later we headed off with Lams and his colleague Bakary on our adventure to Guinea Bissau.

Despite the early start of 6:30 Lams greeted us with a big smile and soon had us all laughing as we headed south to the border with Senegal where he assisted us in exchanging some money into francs,the required currency for the neighbouring countries. Shortly after crossing the border we stopped for a lovely breakfast and coffee before visiting the Guinea Bissau embassy to obtain our visas which Lams helped process quickly. Next stop Guinea Bissau, where we changed vehicles to drive along some incredibly dusty and bumpy roads to visit a local school to hand out some supplies and a small village to taste some Palm wine and experience the locals way of life, which is a humbling experience.

After saying our goodbyes to the family, we headed back to Senegal for our overnight stay in a lovely guest house on the shores of Kafountine. Now I must admit this guest house far exceeded our expectations, and I’m glad I trusted Lams judgement. 

Next morning we set off on a boat ride along the river and mangroves, spotting various wildlife along the way before reaching an island, where we were greeted by another family to experience their way of life. Again this was another humbling and insightful experience. This was then followed by a tour of Kafoutine, taking in the sights and smells of the bustling fishing port and local market.

Lams and Bakary delivered on everything and more that had been promised for our 2 day adventure and we can’t wait for future visits. There’s are a lot of guides in Gambia but lams and the team really do stand head and shoulders above the rest. They won’t disappoint.

title: What a guy !!
text: What a guy !!, Lams collected us from the airport on arrival at Banjul and we spent seven of the next eleven days in his company. We were determined to get 'off the beaten track' and experience the real Gambia and Senegal. Nothing was too much trouble and after the first day we felt like we were 'part of the family'. Every tour was perfectly organized and always included considerably more than the advertised package. Lams is very passionate and has a wealth of knowledge about his country, it's history, its politics, its traditions and pretty much any other subject which may be of interest. We laughed continuously  while in his company and have treasured memories which will stay with us forever. I would award the highest recommendation possible, well done !!

title: Great Experience
text: Recently returned from The Gambia. We booked a tour to Fathala reserve as well as a day trip through southern Senegal to Guinea-Bissau. Lam’s was quick and efficient answering all of my many questions prior to arrival and was knowledgeable about all of the COVID requirements for each border crossing. He arranged for a staff member, Smiley to pick us up at the airport. Smiley and another co-worker Solo brought us to Fathala and were great at arranging ferry tickets and helping us navigate the Senegal border crossing which was a little chaotic. The open air vehicle was relaxing while looking at the animals in the park.  Lams himself took us to Guinea-Bissau. He also helped with all of the border crossings and explaining the uses of all of the local plants. He was knowledgeable about the culture and customs. We took an exciting ride through a local village, the colorful and energetic market, and even treated us with some palm wine at a local village. Lastly, Smiley spent the day helping us get COVID tested in a challenging multi-step process before dropping us off at the airport to go home. He waited for us to check in and guided us through customs. Lams and his crew is highly recommend tour company. You won’t be disappointed. Enjoy Western Africa!

title: Professional and exciting!
text: I met one of their guides in Kuntaur, Gambia, and got the opportunity to join with him and the group he was guiding at the time. We went to Janjanbureh (Georgetown) and learned everything about the island's role during the transatlantic slave trade. The guide was very knowledgeable and charming and has an excellent network of partners all across the country, and the driver was very responsible and respectful. Would definitely recommend!

title: Really interesting tour  - highly recommend
text: Genuinely great tour. I did the 4-in-1 tour with Sana and Barra. It was much more than i had expected. We visited Kachikally Crocodile Pool (there's a really interesting little museum and stunning birds as well as the crocodiles), Serrakunda market, a livestock market, Lamin lodge for doughnuts, coffee and hanging out with monkeys, the home of a local family where we ate with them and chatted about their family life, a chilled out restaurant at the beach followed by a swim in the sea and finally Tanji fish market. The guys were really knowledgeable and we had some great discussions. Would definitely recommend.

title: Everything Gambia & Some Of Senegal
text: We travelled with Arch Tours, Lamin, and his team, for 11 days out of our 14 day stay in Gambia and they were amazing throughout! Took us into the interior to George town, off the beaten track in Senegal to Tobor (as well as Dakar), arranged some fishing for us, as well as some more local sightseeing trips. Very accommodating, knowledgeable, and friendly, and simply could not do enough for us. Would highly recommend as a one stop shop for all your Gambia tours. Thanks guys! And sorry for the delay in posting a review!

title: A GOLDEN PARTNER IN THE GAMBIA FOR ANYTHING YOUR NEED
text:
Further a fantastic experience, my wife and myself are very happy to recommend Arch Tour services. Being in partnership with M. Lamin Conteh (CEO) was a true and valuable relationship: Reactive, Flexible, Connected, Kind and VERY Professional, M. Conteh is a man of trust ! We had great support before, during and after the events.
We had a specific and big challenge: our wedding organization while being french citizens. Thus we needed comprehensive local support to arrange many details.
M. Lamin Conteh and his staff provided many quality services such as: guest transport during the celebration day, tour organisation (ex: boat reservation for "root" excursion and great guides), locations visits for the weeding and booking, calls support, local interfaces with businesses or administrations, various additional topics beyond the base scope that we agreed?

title: Great comms, great guides, great driver!
text:
Took the Georgetown 2 day trip and 4 in 1 day tour, plus airport pick up and drop off with Arch tours. Excellent comms ahead of the trip from Lamin who made sure we were happy throughout.

Each trip had similarities but both were worth doing. Great guides (ML & Dawda) and driver (Barra) who really were part of the fun as well as taking the time to explain the country and culture. 

Can't fault it!

title: Fantastic
text:
Excellent tour that was most informative, enjoyable and thought provoking. Lamin is an ex cellent tour guide and communicator.
We will not hesitate to use him again and highly recommend Arch Tours.

title: Brilliant tour
text:
We did a half day sunrise bird watching tour including breakfast with Dawda as our guide. He was very interesting and knowledgeable and made us feel like friends. The tour consisted of a trip on a boat from lamin lodge and a walk around the local allotments and oyster catching area looking at birds. Dawda did a great job finding lots of different species for us to see. This was followed by a lovely breakfast at the lodge. We then went on to the nature reserve and did a forest tour on foot. Dawda and Assam (our driver) were very keen to help us out and take us to our next accommodation which was quite a long drive away. 
Highly recommended

title: Excellent day Tour
text:
Had an excellent day with Arch Tours to Fathala Wildlife Reserve.  Dawda was our excellent representative who looked after us every step of the way and offered a great insight, not only for the trip itself, but also into Gambian culture.

This trip is so much more than a wildlife reserve.  Getting to the Reserve involves travelling through the two countries, getting a local ferry across the river Gambia and passing through the Gambia/Sengal border control - this is an experience in itself.  It was reassuring to have Dawda with us for this.

Fathala is a lovely, well-run park with excellent facilities.  During the game drive we saw rhino, giraffes, antelope, warthogs, beautiful birds etc.  We also did the guided lion walk which was amazing.

Thank you for a wonderful day.

title: A lot of faces of Gambia
text:
great tour where you can see some highlights. From the very touristic Corcodil Pool over a very impressive and touchable school visit up to a lunch break at the most beautiful beach in Gambia.
The transport vehicle was a real African version but the driver did a good and secure job. The guide was a lovely friendly person and took all his intention for having a great tour. 
With this tour you see a lot of interesting things in one single day

title: Perfect tour!
text: Would recommend this tour 100%! What a great day it was! Comfort breaks, lots to see, very knowledgeable and nice guide, food (that’s included) was great, one of the best tours I’ve ever done! You get to see lots of Gambia in one day.

title: Great Day Out & Informative Way To See The Real Gambia
text:
We first found this company via Tripadvisor and via other recommendations, we contacted Arch Tours directly and received a detailed response and the offer to tailor make the trip to our wishes.  

We decided upon the 4 in 1 Tour and we delighted by the service and every aspect of the Tour, our guide was very engaging and knowledgeable and took care of our every need and comfort.

Comfort Breaks, Drinks & Snacks and a good Buffet Lunch at the Beach.

A genuinely authentic trip that entertains, educates and opens your eyes to how lucky most of us are in this unequal world.

Thank you to all at Arch Tours

title: The tour that never happened
text: I waited 30 mins to be picked up at The Kololi Resort which is right across the street from the apartment I’m in. No one came. I called from someone phone and no one answered. They didn’t reach out via email or on what’s app. I’m so disappointed. I’m leaving on Tuesday and wanted to see more of Gambia. Poor communication

ownerResponse.text:
Hello Dear,
Sorry for what happened but please check your email.You booked via TripAdvisor viator for the 4 tours in 1 day on the 11th and wanted to go immediately the next day which was the 12th of February.I immediately responded to you and said if it was possible to do the trip on the 17th Simply because there was no one lined up for that day which unfortunately I didn’t get a response from.I tried checking if I will see your WhatsApp number but all to no avail.
The next morning you called us and recently there have been a problem with Africell,the network provider.Few hours later,I contacted your hotel and a guy picked it up and I told him to convey my message to you.Another guy who claimed to be your friend also called me and I told him the same thing.If only you had read the message I instantly sent you,you won’t have been disappointed !Sorry once more...

title: Great Tours and great team that is customer focused
text:
This was our second time in Gambia and having used other tour companies last time (including Arch Tours) , the team at Arch tours were/are in a different league. We attended 2 tours with the team this time as follows:

A 1/2 day river cruise/Abuko Nature reserve - My wife and i were accompanied by their bird expert Dawda and driver Barra. The river cruise along the gambia river was very relaxing, with Dawda pointing out the differing birds along the way - lunch at Lamin Lodge (lots of monkeys). We also had an hour at the Abuko reserve - again lots of birds so make sure you have a good camera. Dawda and Barra were very friendly and took care of our requests, so cannot fault them. 

Our second tour was the 2 day Georgetown trip - this was a real experience seeing parts of gambia that most tourists pass by. The trip to the market on the border with Senegal with pigs and cattle just wandering the roads is got to be seen to believed. We were accompanied on this trip by tour Guide ML and Barra again as driver - I found ML great company over the 2 days discussing a range of subjects within the Gambia for those interested in more than just seeing the next Monkey. We had another boat trip on the Gambia, this time it was fresh water and again the differing bird populations. We also got to see the Chimpanzees and some Hippo's on this boat trip. Overnight stay in Georgetown was very basic  Second day the tour of Georgetown was cut short due to covid restrictions and it was then the long drive back to the hotel. we spent lunch at Abca's Creek Lodge -  a lovely place in itself (more birds while eating lunch).

overall the two tours I cannot recommend the guides and Barra the driver enough - wonderful team and so professional.

Would have no hesitation in using Arch Tours again when next in Gambia.

title: Well run great guides, on time, will use again
text:
Very well run good guides who spoke English very well, did the lazy day cruise was great and s great way to meet people.

Went on the Fathala day trip, this was very very good too, take plenty of repellent though the guide at the park provide some  for the tsetse flies 

Went to lamin lodge on the sunset cruise
Great boat trip , food was poor but didn't matter  the experience was great and the singer was great too.
Certainly one to remember, loads of repellent needed it's a bit of a mosquito hotspot

title: Tour company with top customer service
text:
Had a fantastic tour with Sana (guide) and Omar (driver). Both were very professional and easy to talk to. I learned a lot about history and life in The Gambia.

Was impressed enough to book a 2nd tour the next day. They recommended the Makasuto Forest tour as the Roots tour was unavailable due to road conditions. Was glad they did as had Dawdah (guide) and Ahms (driver) leading the tour. Both kept the same high standards I experienced the day before. They even went out of the way, after a slight miscommunication about lunch, and brought me to a restaurant and waited while I ate.

Dawdah further helped me with travel arrangements for crossing the border to Senegal, which is much appreciated.

On both tours, I was the only person and there was never an issue with minimum no. of people.
Arch Tours is a small locally owned company which I can definitely recommend.

title: Amazing trip
text: Enjoyed the safari trip & the walk with lions and the guide dawda was helpful with us and made us feel safe & stayed with us the whole trip. Thank you the driver for getting us there and back

title: GENUINE TOUR OF GAMBIA
text:
We had an awesome day with Lamin on the 4 tours in one day. From the croc park to local family home, beach and fish market a long with many more stops, it was such an interesting introduction to the culture & sights of Gambia. 

Lamin is super professional & very well informed about everywhere we went, he had such a wealth of knowledge. They have a good vehicle and drive very safely to all the destination, he even had a cooler of refreshments available at any time to us. 

I can honestly say that I felt very confident in Lamin he is super kind, courteous and honest. I can 100% recommend him for any tour you want to do.

title: A cut above the rest
text:
I’ve used this company for many years and their standard of service is excellent.
This year we were an adult family group of 8. We did the 4 x 4, Fathala including Lion walk and the Lazy Day cruise. All amazing and very enjoyable.
It does not matter which hotel your staying in Lamin will send a car and take you to the office to book your trips and return you to your hotel.
I always email him prior to arriving to arrange this. He will also email a price list to see what’s currently available and on what days. Descriptions of trips and itinerary can be found on their website.
It’s very easy to see why they have the Trip advisor award of excellence.

title: Lamen saved the day!
text: After a great day of touring the Roots tour,  we headed back to catch the ferry we needed to take to board our cruise ship in time for "All Aboard and Sail Away", only to discover that all the ferries had been cancelled for the rest of the day due to political demonstrations in the port.   Since our ship was leaving in 90 minutes, and it took about 30 minutes to ride across the Gambia River, this was not a good scene.  However, Lamen sprung into action and found someone with a fishing boat that would take us across the river to the fishing village on the other side, where we walked to a waiting car and made it back the the ship with 25 minutes to spare!  We cannot thank him enough!  We loved the tour, but even more we loved how he took such good care of us and made it his priority to insure we got back in time.  Excellence in action!

title: Georgetown/ Janjanbureh/ McCarthy Island
text: 2 weeks ago we went on the 2 day trip to Janjanbureh (also known as McCarthy Island and Georgetown) with M.L. as our guide and Tom as our driver. What a fantastic trip! We have seen so much in such a short time. Everything was well organised by Arch Tours. From the booking untill the drop-off at our hotel. M.L. and Tom took really good care of us. There where plenty cold drinks available during the entire trip (water, cola and fanta). On the first day we visited a local market, did a trip on a donkeycar, visited the stone cirkels and had a nice lunch at a lodge near the river. After lunch we went for a riversafari. We could see the chimpansees very well. The hippos we couldn't see very well. Only saw there heads for a short moment because of too much wind. But at least we have seen them! Back at te lodge we could not stay overnight, because it was fully booked. Instead we went to a lodge/ guesthouse in the centre of Janjanbureh. The accommodation was nice. There was a diner and a breakfast buffet, both very good. The rooms are basic, but sufficient. We had a bed for 2 persons with mosquitonet, good mattress and an ensuite bathroom with shower. After breakfast we went to the slavehouse and paid a visit to a family on a rural compound. It was good to see so many aspects of Gambian life. Not only by the excursions/ visits, but also on the road. On our trip back to the coast we had lunch at Abca's Creek lodge. Very beautiful place, also for just a (good) lunch. Because it was very hot that day, the shade of the trees was welcoming! After lunch we only had to drive for an hour and Tom en M.L. dropped us of at our hotel for that night. This trip is so worth it!! Thank you so much Arch Tours (especially M.L. and Tom) for this great experience.

title: Lazy River
text:
Another fantastic day out with Soloman and the team at Bushwackers
They can be found at the junction on the strip & are spotted by their bright green T-shirts.  We were collected promptly from our hotel and started our journey to Denton Bridge. On the way we stopped for ice then bait for the fishing. Soloman was a great guide who looked after us all day. He moved around the group sharing his bird watching knowledge and helping with the fishing, he was very informative about the local area and cultures. We felt totally at ease and safe in his company. The boat supplied a gorgeous buffet for lunch and nothing was too much trouble. As it was my birthday they had arrange Prosecco & cake ! 
Would highly recommend them for all the trips while in The Gambia

ownerResponse.text: Thanks for putting this beautiful review for us and using our services.

title: Excellent Tours
text:
There is plenty of choice of tour companies on the Senagambia strip, but we liked the look of the Bushwhacker Tours office and was not dissappointed with our choice.

We took a South Gambia 4x4 day tour with Lamin which gave us a taste of the real Gambia outside of the tourist spots. We whent round a local market, visited the crocodile pool, the local livestock market, a local school and a local fishing village, as well as visiting the lovely paradise beach for a spot of lunch.  All through the day, Lamin’s local knowledge and information ensured we got the best of the day and felt we had a real education and learning experience.

We enjoyed the trip so much we then took a second trip which was the lazy day river cruise. A wonderful day was spent on board the boat, spending time looking at the birdlife, fishing and swimming. We were well looked after by our hosts with a delicious buffet lunch and tea/coffee and cake in the afternoon, with soft drinks available throughout the day.

We have no hesitation in recommeding Bushwhacker Tours for all your tour and day trip needs whilst in The Gambia.

ownerResponse.text: Thanks for using our services and putting this wonderful review for us.

title: Outstanding "Roots" Tour
text: Fascinating day out made all the more interesting by our guide Malcolm ( Lamin) Ceesay. The trip consisted of a 2 hour boat trip down the river Gambia to the village of Jufureh where we were given an extensive history of the slave trade and the history of Kuntekinte of Alex Hailey "Roots" fame. (Jufureh was Kuntekinte's home village) After a tour of the village and a meeting with the Chief and some of Kuntekinte's descendants we boarded the boat and then served lunch. After the lunch we cruised around St James' Island now renamed Kuntekinte Island , we boarded a traditional pirogue boat and were taken to the island. Malcom kept us entertained with tales from the history of the island. We then boarded the main boat which took us back to Banjul. This tour is a must for anyone visiting Gambia, Malcolm was a star imparting his vast knowledge and answering questions en-route. I would have no issues at all with recommending Bushwacker Tours for anyone visiting, from our pick up to being dropped off  it was a 100% experience.

ownerResponse.text: Thanks a lot for taking your time to put this wonderful review for us. It's well appreciated.

title: Wonderful trips in the safe hands of 'Malcolm'
text: We stayed in Kololi for a week, 4 days we had trips out with Bushwhacker Tours. Our Guide Lamin 'Malcolm' was very friendly and had good local knowledge. Explaining to us many aspects of cultural and community life, ensuring we got to see as much as possible. He was flexible with timings and nothing was too much trouble. We had to postpone our first trip due to illness on the morning of the trip, which was quickly and readily rearranged for the following day, all with a smile. The drivers drove well in basic but adequate landrover and minibus. There was a plentiful supply of soft, chilled drinks included. The trips we took were the 4 x 4 day out, Sita joyeh (Baobab Island), Abuko Nature Reserve and the Roots trip. All very enjoyable but the Roots trip be prepared for plenty of hassle from the locals to buy or give money/sweets. Highly recommend Bushwhacker Tours!

ownerResponse.text: Thanks a lot for using our services and putting the a review on trip advisor for us. Very much appreciated.

title: Outstanding Choice.  Happy to recommend.  Lamin 'Malcolm' Ceesay was excellent!  5*s
text: I was nervous about pretty much everything in The Gambia.  Bushwacker Tours were an outstanding choice.  We were collected on time, in a suitable vehicle with a good driver.  The general information was good throughout.  The boat was excellent and food was good.  My girlfriend and I didn't want to go shopping and Malcom understood and prevented the shop owners from harassing us.  He was very knowledgeable and kind throughout.  Honestly, happy to recommend.  Sorry it has taken me 10 months to get round to posting this review!

ownerResponse.text: Thanks for taking your time to put the review for us. Well appreciated.

title: Bushwhacker tours Day trip
text:
My partners and I had a great time loved the canoe ride  we enjoyed getting in the county of Gambia 
Staff were very friendly and helpful and knowledgable 
We enjoyed the day

title: Lazy Day River Cruise
text: Sulayman Manneh (Solomon) took us for a day's fishing and it was a relaxing, enjoyable, friendly, informative and entertaining day out. Soloman is a great guide.

title: The Bushwacker team continues inventing new places of interest!
text: After so many times, we're still very satisfied about the qualified team of Bushwackers. They definitely know all the lovely spots and they know how to spot all the gems of 'The Gambia'. The trip upcountries is 'Highly recommendable' as you get the chance to explore the African life far beyond the coastside. They take enough cold drinks to comfort you on the way. We were also very pleased about the South Adventure daytrip. If you don't want to miss out an interesting landmark - they are certainly 'The best team to choose'

title: Lazy day river cruise
text:
Thanks to Ali for arranging our lazy day river cruise. Thanks also to Lamin for a good day, fishing was fun even though I didn't catch anything!!! 
Lunch was amazing and Dot and I had a very relaxing day.
Look forward to our next trip with Bushwhackers a brillant team.
Thanks again 
Maria & Dot
March 2018

title: 2 days travelling through the north of Gambia
text:
I went for the third time to Gambia and I never did this trip. The coast is lovely but so diverend from the other parts of Gambia. This tour gave me the opportunity to see how the people live in their villages,  Enjoy the landscape and to see the jungle of the Gambia river by a little boat. We have seen chimpansees and hipo's. 
I wouldn't have missed this trip it gave my holiday a special experience.
Lamin our tour guide was very good told us about history and nature. 
Thanks for the fantastic 2 days Tessa and Hens

title: Lazy Day boat trip
text: Yet another really good day out with Zack, nothing is ever too much trouble and always really interesting, knowledgeable company. Buffet was really tasty, the boat crew were excellent and left us at the end of the day even more chilled than we were before. Good trip for bird watchers and those that enjoy their fishing - or just for a bit of sun bathing and swimming, something for everyone really.

title: 6 in 1 tour with Solomon and Seedy - fantastic day!
text: A very full day experiencing the real Gambia for myself and my husband, together with a fellow Englishman in a 4x4. Thank you so much Solomon for being such an interesting and knowledgeable guide. There was no question we asked that you didn't know the answer to! Thanks too to Seedy for being such a safe and careful driver.  We were looked after extremely well. Liz & Mick.

title: They tried really hard to arrange what we wanted, and were so responsive
text: We didn’t end up going on a tour with them, but they worked really hard for us to arrange a specific trip. They were really responsive in communicating with us, and seemed to be offering a really good service. In the end we just didn’t have enough of us to make the trip viable - our fault, not theirs. Based on the level of professionalism we saw, I would have absolutely no hesitation in using them in future, and they would be the first place I’d look for a group trip.

title: De manier om Gambia te verkennen
text:
Niets dan lof. Rondritten in kleine groepen, individuele begeleiding, deskundige uitleg, geen vraag was te veel om te beantwoorden. Wij deden de tour met Zack, een heel sympathieke gast die ons veel bijgeleerd heeft. Alles gebeurde zoals afgesproken, zonder meerprijs. Boeiend om ook eens met mensen van daar te praten over Gambia - Europa...
We hadden ook een toer via de touroperator geboekt en daar hadden we spijt van, was duurder en niet zo tof doordat we met een grote groep waren.

title: Breary/Clarke
text:
Our first trip to The Gambia and it was perfect , we got to see so much in the week we were there . our tour guide Zack was amazing his knowledge and attention to detail is priceless can’t recommend him highly enough , in my opinion he made our holiday by giving us the opportunity’s to experience real Gambian life and insights into their culture . Many thanks 

Paul breary

title: 1-day North Senegal trip (Fathala Reserve)
text: We had a great day together with a guide name Malcolm. The trip itself was nicely organized, with good cars and convenient times. We even had a big cool-box with soft drinks. Malcolm is a professional, very friendly and knowledgeable guide. Definitely worth recommending!

title: Zeker een aanrader
text: Afgelopen week hebben mijn zus en ik 3 dagexcursies geboekt bij bushwhacker tours. Alle keren hadden we Zack als gids en dat is goed bevallen. Hij is enthousiast en gedreven en weet waar hij het over heeft.

title: Lazy Day Fishing Trip
text: Recently visited The Gambia for the first time.  We booked a fishing trip with Bushwhacker Tours located in Senegambia Strip.  Our guide was named Solomon (Sol) who picked up from our hotel and joined us on the boat.  There were only 6 people on the trip along with crew.  Sol was brilliant as he identified various birds, put bait on rods and provided the beers!  The lunch of chicken, salad and chips was cooked fresh on board and was very good, especially the small area the cook had to work in.  Would definately recommend booking with Bushwhacker Tours ( ask for Sol) as it was a really enjoyable day especially as this was mŷ first time fishing and even managed to catch 2 fish!  Even if you don't want to fish, you can relax on the sun beds.

title: Kunte Kinte Island
text: Had a brilliant day out visiting this very sombering place, our guide was Malcom x / lamin , he took perfect care of us and I will certainly use this company again on my return to The Gambia ....

title: Misinformation
text:
We approached Bushwhacker tours to see if they could do a trip to Georgetown (its a 2 day tour) . they said they could, but after 4 or 5 visits and a few delays it became clear they could not do the tour with two people. Instead they arranged for another company they knew to do it. a time and a price were arranged but they failed to pick us up. When i called them they said they had never agreed with bushwhacker to do it. 

Bushwhacker  kept us hanging to stop us booking with someone else but in doing so ruined our Holiday. 

Also check the exchange rate before you go in , they will lie to you about what it is so you end up paying >5% more.The excuse they will give is that hotel give a bad rate but compare their rate with the internet and you will see it is infact them who are giving the bad rate.

title: Three Unforgettable Journeys with Black and White Safari – Beyond Expectations!
text:
Three Unforgettable Journeys with Black and White Safari – Beyond Expectations!
I want to sincerely thank Amadou (Armstrong Jobarteh) and the entire Black and White Safari team for the incredible experiences I shared with them during three different 3-day tours in The Gambia and Senegal. Referring to their new slogan, this was truly a “Together we Go” experience. They stand out in professionalism, deep knowledge, and brotherhood. A real recommendation for anyone!
________________________________________
Trip 1 – Nature & Culture
We first travelled via Brikama and Soma to Kauren Rivercamp, located on a hilltop in Kauur with beautiful views over the Gambia River. On the way we passed stunning savanna and wetland landscapes and even a sacred giant kapok tree. After a tasty lunch at the camp we continued to the impressive Wassu Stone Circles – mysterious megaliths with origins lost in history.
From there, we joined a 3-hour boat safari through the Gambia River National Park, which felt like the Amazon: lush nature, chimpanzees along the riverbanks, and breathtaking scenery (though the hippos and crocodiles stayed hidden that day). We continued to historic Janjanbureh, where we spent the night in a small riverside lodge enjoying a magnificent sunset and warm company.
The next day I asked Armstrong to take me to his remote birthplace village, far from the main roads. Spending a day and night with his family was a heart-opening cultural experience: delicious local meals, tea ceremonies, and authentic hospitality. Sleeping arrangements were simple (on mats, eventually inside due to heavy rain and mosquitoes) – not my most comfortable night, but absolutely unforgettable and meaningful.
________________________________________
Trip 2 – Safari in Northern Senegal & History
This trip began with the ferry from Banjul to Barra, already an adventure in itself. From there we drove to Albadar to visit the ruins of Santo Domingo slave collection point and St. James/Kunta Kinteh Island. Our senior guide Lamin moved us deeply with his powerful storytelling. He masterfully conveyed the tragic yet important history of slavery and the resilience of the Gambian people. Thank you, Lamin – your gift for history is unmatched.
After visiting the slavery museum, we stayed overnight in a comfortable lodge nearby. The next morning, we continued into northern Senegal to Fathala Wildlife Reserve, a sanctuary where large African animals that once roamed this region freely have been reintroduced. After carefully checking the ethics of the place, I chose to experience only the Lion Walk. Yes, the cubs are bred and hand-raised for this, which one may question – but being close to these magnificent creatures was still deeply impressive.
From there we drove north to Toubacouta, where we explored mangroves by boat, visited islands with giant baobabs and kapok trees once used as refuges, and enjoyed a magical silent pause at a bird island during sunset. We spent the night in a cozy lodge before returning to The Gambia.
________________________________________
Trip 3 – Southern Senegal & Djola Culture
The journey to Ziguinchor and on to Mlomp was long and the road poor, but the landscapes – wetlands, savanna, and even patches of jungle – made it worthwhile. In Mlomp we visited two enormous sacred kapok trees (around 900 years old!) where the Djola people still hold ceremonies. We also explored the Djola Museum with exhibits on rituals and culture, including the first two-story African house built with traditional materials.
Our guide Lamin translated everything clearly, making the visit rich and meaningful. The Djola, being the main inhabitants of Casamance, maintain their cultural independence even within Senegal. We then visited Oussouye, where the King resides in his sacred forest, serving both as spiritual mediator and advisor. He is not always open to visitors, but thanks to a local Black and White contact, we were privileged to be granted a brief greeting.
That night we reached Cap Skirring, where we stayed in a comfortable hotel. The next morning, we took a boat trip to peaceful river islands inhabited only by Djola families – no roads, no cars, only nature and silence. Here we visited a fetish site under a sacred tree, where locals leave offerings to the spirit world for healing and transformation. For me, it was a fascinating but also slightly unsettling experience.
On the way back, heavy rain set in for the rest of the day and night, cancelling our planned beach time. Still, I couldn’t resist walking to the ocean in my swim shorts and raincoat – the sea was wild and powerful, the tropical beach dramatic under stormy skies. Afterwards, I spent a wonderful evening with my Black & White friends, sharing conversations and tea ceremonies.
Finally, we returned to The Gambia with a short stop to explore Ziguinchor, ending this adventure on a high note.
________________________________________
Conclusion
Each of these three tours was a unique mix of nature, history and culture, always guided with warmth, respect, and professionalism. Traveling with Black and White Safari is far more than sightseeing – it is a journey of the heart.
I can highly recommend them to anyone seeking not just a holiday, but a deep and authentic experience of The Gambia and Senegal.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: A Truly Exceptional Week of Excursions – Unforgettable Experiences for All Ages and Abilities
text:
I organised a week of independent excursions through Black and White Safari for a group of 12 friends from the USA, South Africa, and the UK. Our group was incredibly diverse – including my 87-year-old aunt and a cousin who is an amputee. I can wholeheartedly say that every single person in our group thoroughly enjoyed every excursion, and the experience far exceeded all expectations.

Black and White Safari, along with our incredible guides Lamin and Sofia, were simply outstanding. From the months of careful planning with Armstrong to the warm, attentive delivery of each trip, everything was perfectly managed. The care, patience, and knowledge shown by the guides made every moment enriching, accessible, and deeply memorable.
________________________________________
The Excursions:
1)	A Magical Overnight Stay in Senegal at Hôtel et Lodge Keur Saloum – Toubacouta
This was the highlight of the week. The hotel was beautiful and luxurious, offering a relaxing and peaceful setting. The sunset cruise on the Saloum River – part of a UNESCO World Heritage site – was unforgettable. We encountered incredible birdlife and breathtaking scenery. A once-in-a-lifetime experience.
________________________________________
2) Fathala Wildlife Reserve: Game Viewing, Walking with Lions, and the Roots Tour
Everyone was thrilled with the game drive and the unique opportunity to walk with lions – a truly exhilarating experience. On the return, we visited the “Roots” site, which was thoughtfully included to reduce ferry crossings. The guide made this historical visit deeply personal and moving, encouraging reflection and conversation. It was very powerful and left a lasting impression on us all.
________________________________________
3) Wild Chimpanzee Experience at Baboon Island
This was a long day with about 10 hours of driving, but absolutely worth it. Seeing wild chimpanzees in their natural habitat was awe-inspiring. Along the way, we experienced authentic rural Gambia – an eye-opening and humbling journey. This trip would benefit from an overnight stay to make it more relaxed, but it was still an amazing day.
________________________________________
4) 4x4 Adventure including Abuko Nature Reserve and the Crocodile Pool
A fun and interactive day! Everyone enjoyed seeing hyenas and getting up close to crocodiles. The trip ended perfectly with some relaxing time at a beachside hotel – a lovely way to wind down.
________________________________________
Final Thoughts:
Every single excursion was made accessible and enjoyable, even for guests with mobility challenges. The professionalism, kindness, and energy of Lamin and Sofia made a world of difference. Their knowledge and storytelling added depth to every stop, and their enthusiasm was infectious.
We’ve come away from this trip with lifelong memories, new perspectives, and a deep appreciation for The Gambia and Senegal. The entire week was filled with joy, learning, and connection. I cannot recommend Black and White Safari highly enough �� thank you for making our adventure so special.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Black and White are GOLDEN ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
Booked the full day Safari through whatsapp with Armstrong who is an absolute gentleman. Communication was impeccable and Armstrong ensured that we knew exactly what to expect before our day out. He is kind and a genuine pleasure to deal with. 
Lamin and the lovely driver collected us from our hotel, arriving in plenty of time with a warm welcome. We instantly felt safe and welcomed. 
Lamin was so knowledgeable and taught us loads of interesting things on our drive through Banjul to the port. Our ferry tickets were purchased super quickly and after a little wait we boarded. We sat on the top deck and Lamin even got us access to the VIP Room out of the sun which was greatly appreciated. It was fantastic to experience a totally new culture on the ferry and experience the Gambian way of life. I really enjoyed it. 
At the border Lamin ensured we crossed quickly and with no stress, he took care of everything for us and we felt completely safe with him. 
The Safari was incredible and it was a completely new experience for me, seeing the animals so close. I especially loved the newborn giraffe. I loved the information that the ranger, Mamadou, gave throughout the ride and enjoyed sampling some of the fruits he picked for us. 
The lion walk was a once in a lifetime experience and it was really special. The rangers looked after the lions really well, they were kind and you could tell they shared a unique bond with the animals. 
We visited a small restaurant for a lovely lunch and I loved the chicken domada dish I had! 
Soft drinks were provided all day and the driver and Lamin ensured that we had plenty to drink. 
I loved listening to their stories and learnt so much about The Gambia and Senegal. 
If you are considering a day trip, I would definitely recommend Black and White 
 as they really are brilliant at what they do. 
As a Cabin crew member I have experienced lots of different excursions worldwide, but the service from Armstrong, Lamin and the whole team at Black and White Safari is amongst the very best. Thank you so much for looking after us and allowing us to create wonderful memories. 
Faye x

title: Culture, history and wildlife with friendly and knowlegable guides
text:
My wife and I had three very enjoyable days with Black and White tours.  
First, we took the two day tour to Georgetown in the company of Lamin and Saffia (a bubbly and friendly trainee guide).  My highlight was the stone circles at Wassu - the place where ancient leaders were buried.  My wife's were seeing Hippos and Chimpanzees on our boat trip on the Gambia river.  
Lamin was able to combine a safari in Senegal with the Roots tour into a one day trip.  This was great as it meant we could do all we wanted.  Lamin is very knowledgeable, especially regarding the history of the Gambian slave trade.  He is descended from Kunta Kinte's brother and his passion came across very strongly in that part of the tour.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The best people to show you Gambia
text:
We used black and white safari for 3 trips during our weeks Gambia stay. Also for airport transfer. 
They were always on time and very well priced, all trips included soft drinks and water all day from a cool box, and a lunch stop. The team went above and beyond to show us Gambia and keep our family well looked after. We visited Senegal wildlife park, which part of the trip takes the ferry and when we got there we walked with the lions, once in a lifetime experience only 3 places in the world offer this, they didn't push the lions to do anything they didn't want to and they have done this since they were cubs, didn't need yellow fever this was sorted by our guide at the border. 
We did 4 x 4 day.. went to crocodile pool, another bucket list activity as you can touch there tails and backs and walk amongst them, we went to a local school, visited a local family and experienced there way of living, went to the fish market, lunch on the beach and a local market where we bought our souvenir for our home. 
We also did Gambia home cooking, 
We spent the day with a family at their home, we went to the market to purchase what would be cooked for lunch, the market is definitely not like anything you see at home and is an experience in itself. Then returned to see how they prepared and cooked and eat as a family and joined them for eating lunch. The Gambia people are very friendly, they don't have things we all take for granted at home, but still smiling and still wanting to help people and look after each other. The trips were very humbling and we made memories to last a lifetime, and makes you think twice before being complacent and complaining about things at home that after going on this Gambia trip, really don't matter in hindsight. Thanks for a great time black and white safari, can't recommend them enough ❤️

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Franchement déçus
text:
expérience magnifique pour la cuisine mais quelques bémols pour d'autres excursions effectuées avec eux 
déja je ne sais pas pourquoi la famille d accueil doit leur préparer un plat à emporter , ils n' ont pas grand chose a manger et on leurs enlève également cela.
Si vous voulez pousser la Jeep quand elle s'arrête n'hésitez pas cela est arrivé 2x .
Par courriels le patron ma dit que la visite de Fathala valait la peine au final trop de végétation donc pas vu d'animaux hormis 3 girafes 5 zèbres et 3 petits phacochères pour 6 heures de route aller retour c'est cher payer  le patron n'a même pas proposé un remboursement partiel ..sachant qu'ils nous a compté 200 euros pour un total de +- 60 euros que cela lui a réellement couté je trouve cela malhonnête 
si il vous propose le taxi sachez que cela coute réellement 21 euros avec votre hôtel aller retour lui par contre vous le compte  à 50 euros 
les restaurants choisis lors des excursions sont abominables de plus les guides n'avaient parfois qu' un plat pour leur 2 conclusion nous avons donné nos plats aux guides en prétextant que nous n'aimions pas pour qu'ils puissent manger a leur faim de plus vous devez payer vos boissons au restaurant pourtant il vous dit que tout est compris dans l'excursion 
Je pourrais continuer la liste de nos déceptions mais je vais m’arrêter ici 
LA seule chose que je ne peux nier c'est qu'ils sont toujours a l'heure pour les départs des visites

title: Naar Senegal (Kafoutine) met Lam's Tours
text: Wij hadden in oktober 2019 een tour met Lam gemaakt naat Kafouitine in Senegal vanuit Bakau. Perfect. Wij werden al vroeg opgehaald, erg stipt op tijd en in een open 4WD (Mitusbishi) naar de grens gereden. Lam regelde ale formaliteiten aan de grens. Ergo zonder oponthoudt stonden wij eerst in niemandsland en daarne bij de grenspost van Senegal. In Senegal lokaal een ontbijt genuttigd. Zeer smaakvol en zonder risico! Toen opweg naar Kafoutine, een visserplaats. Daar de lokale markt bezocht en met een boot een bezoek aan een dorp op een eiland gebracht. Erg indrukwekkend, zeker de moeite waard om te zien hoe de mensen daar wonen en leven. De gastvrijheid is overweldigend. Naderhand met lam gegeten in een goed restaurant. Tegen 18.00 uur werden wij afgezet bij ons hotel in Bakau. Perfecte tour!

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: BEST TOUR COMPANY IN THE AREA
text:
we booked a last minute holiday to The Gambia, and as usual I did a quick TripAdvisor check to see recommendations for tours etc and Lamstours came out top.  We were lucky enough to be staying at the Kombo Beach resort which is just round the corner from Lams, so on our second day we made our way round to the market place found Lams and sat down for a couple of 'julbrew's' and got speaking to the guys there, all of them were very friendly, we asked about tours and "Batch" told us about some of the tours that they do.  We booked the 4WD tour and sat and had another couple of "Julbrews" Lams became our go to bar each night just for a couple as they people there were so friendly.  Batch professed to be the Domino King so that was a challenge set for Neil lol.. so Dominos out and the games started.. 

On the day of the 4WD tour we were picked up on time by Batch and our driver Dembo. Batch explained that we would be going to the Monkey park first then the Crocodile pool, we would then stop at a school, go to paradise beach for swim sun and lunch, then our final stop was Tanji fishing market.

Monkey Park: On the way here Batch explained about the monkeys and how friendly the Green Velvet Monkeys were.  when we arrived Batch went and got some nuts for us to feed the Monkeys, we started walking through the forest, with Batch telling us all about the trees and the fruit that was growing from them, he was full of interesting fact, but all the time the monkeys were no where to be seen.  I was beginning to feel cheated, "what no monkeys at the monkey park!!" but I shouldn't have thought that, because 2 seconds later we were surrounded by Green Velvet Monkeys all sizes.  It was an amazing experience and one that I will never ever forget and will always be grateful to Batch for helping us get that experience hand feeding the monkeys has to be one of my best things ever, these clever beautiful funny creatures were mesmerising, I could have spend all day there.  But we had to move on.  while heading out of the forest Batch spotted one of the workers cutting open a jelly fruit which Batch had been telling us about, we went over and Batch asked if we could try some. which we did and I have to say it was amazing, so sweet.

Crocodile Pool - back in the truck and of to the Crocodile pool, not sure what I actually thought we were going to see/do there but heyho… OMG there were hundreds of crocs laying around, in the water, lying by the trees.  Batch handed us over to our guide Lam (first born son of the Mandinka tribe, that's why there are a lot of Lamins about)  he told us all about the crocs and the history of the pool he also got us to touch the crocs (not my best experience!! but its ticked of the bucket list) we were luck enough to see the Albino Croc (which is meant to bring you luck) again an experience never to be forgotten.  We were more than happy to give a donation to the crocodile pool for the upkeep.  

Nursery School - we had asked Batch if we could visit a school as we had brought some books paper pen pencils and lollies, he took us to a small nursery school which had children from 3 to 7, it was an eye opener but a great experience again, the children were so well behaved the two classes were split, the youngest group were 3 to 5 and they were all sitting writing numbers and letters the older class were doing sum etc the teacher explained that by the time the children move into the bigger class they can all read and write.  The school only teaches up to 7 years old and they are trying to raise funds so they can teach older children, again we were more than happy to donate to the school. 

Paradise Beach - we headed here for a relaxing lunch and a dip in the sea, the trip to the beach was off road!! and as Batch kept telling us we were getting a free massage lol on route Batch was pointing our trees and plants birds and animals and explaining about the farming etc within the area. he knowledge was amazing and made for a very interesting drive to the beach.  Lunch at the beach was amazing and the beach itself was beautiful and I can see why it gets its name.  Its not every day you share your sun spot with a couple of long horned cows just chilling on the beach!!

Tanji Fishing Market - we had been told before we arrived that we would have seen nothing like this before and yep they were right!! firstly Batch took us into a smoker, where they were smoking sardines hundreds and hundreds of them, the guy told us how the process worked the length of time and where they then send the smoked fish to.  We then made our way down to the water where the boats where coming in... I've never seen so many boats off loading there were women in the water with baskets on their heads getting the fish then bringing them on shore handing them over to someone else who was then gutting and cleaning.  There were children in the water picking up any fish that fell in (getting there meal for that night) it was a hustle and bustle and an eye opener that's for sure.  The types and amount of fish was unbelievable.

All in all this was one of the best trips with a fantastic guide Batch he was such a lovely young man and funny.  Lams should be very happy and proud that they have such a great young guide.  I feel that Lams tours is like one big family everyone is so friendly and couldn't do enough for you, you can get a "Julbrew" and play dominos what more could you ask for.  I would say its the best tour company I have every been with and will be using them again when we return next January.  Batch's Family should also be very proud of their son.  He is a credit to them

title: Terrific Day Tour of The Gambia with Lams Tours--recommend them most highly
text:
We made a port stop in The Gambia recently (January 2020), and consider ourselves very fortunate to have had the team of Lamin Ceesay, the owner of Lams Tours, and his associates Omar, as our tour guides.  They are truly excellent guides, in every respect—they are knowledgeable, experienced, friendly, gracious, adaptable, accommodating, interesting, reliable, and fun!
	We were able to organize our tour, in advance, via email and Whatsapp, from the U.S. with Lams (that’s Lamin’s nickname).
	Lams took us to the Makasutu Cultural Forest, where we went on a boat ride on the mangrove-lined creek, did some bird-watching, climbed the 4-story observation tower for an overview of the mangrove waterways, then took a hike thru the forest.  From our Lams guide Omar, and the MCF guide Lamin (a popular name), we learned how to identify trees, and all about their medicinal uses.  Little did we know what a pharmacopeia was available in this lovely forest.  We enjoyed a tasty local lunch, to the accompaniment of some Jolof dancers, then headed out.  Lams personalized this tour with a stop at the home of a local family, so we could see what life is like for just-plain-folks in The Gambia.  This stop is the kind of travel experience you can only have with a veteran tour guide like Lams, who tunes in to what you want to see, and make sure you get to see it, especially if it is off the beaten track.
	We made another stop at the Tanji Fishing beach/market/fish smoking facility, guided through the area by the ever-capable Omar.
	Throughout the day, Lams and Omar gave us in-depth commentary about the history, culture, people and political situation in The Gambia.
	This tour was ideal in every way—the plan, the A/C vehicle, the safe driver, the experience of the guides, the sights we saw, the understanding we gained, and the reasonable price.  If you are going to The Gambia, you would be lucky to engage the services of Lamin Ceesay, Lams Tours, and his team.  Have fun! We certainly did. 
Review of Lams Tours, The Gambia, email at lamstours1@gmail.com or go to www.lamstours.com:

title: Day trip to Guinea-Bissau, an amazing experience!
text:
We began our trip at 6:30am with a prompt pick up at our hotel by Lams. He was incredibly friendly and accommodating (despite a few ‘confusing’ hiccups with our booking prior to the day - thank you Omar for saving the day! - Twice!). We were all laughing before the trip had even started. 

A quick stop at the next hotel and joined by our guide Omar for the day with Lams as our driver. Giving us a detailed guide to the country and mapping out the day ahead. Before we knew it we were at the border for Senegal. Although there were many many checkpoints, both Lams and Omar got us through quickly with no problems. We did also make a quick stop for (included) breakfast on our journey and a quick pit stop for Coffee! 

Onto Guinea-Bissau next, where we changed drivers and cars (to something more appropriate for the incredibly bumpy roads!) with Omar and Lams still as our guides. We were taken to see a local family to see how they lived and to visit their home. An amazing eye-opening and humbling experience not to be missed. After this we explored our surroundings further with a great insight from Omar on the nature around us.  We then stopped at a bar for a local beer and went on to visit a local market before heading back to Senegal for a traditional African lunch. 

Lunch was very good and we were full for the rest of the day! Perfect end before heading back through the check points and onto our drive back to the hotels. 

A great big thank you to Lams for being so accommodating and ensuring everyone was happy and comfy at all times. For also making the day full of laughs and truly putting the customers happiness first! 

An even bigger thank you to Omar who went above and beyond to make our trip happen in the first place and for being so attentive to the groups needs. You truly know so much about the countries and it shows. You will go far!!!
