title: Drei hervorragend organisierte Touren in Gambia
text:
Wir haben während unseres Gambia-Urlaubs drei Touren und die Flughafentransfers über Lams Tours organisiert und alles hat wunderbar geklappt. Unsere Ausflüge gingen ins Fathala-Schutzgebiet (Senegal, 1-tägig), ins Landesinnere von Gambia nach Georgetown (2-tägig mit Übernachtung in Janjanbureh) und in den Südsenegal (1-tägig). Dabei wurden wir jeweils von einem Fahrer (Ismael) und einem Guide (Omar bzw. Solo) begleitet, mit denen wir uns sofort super verstanden haben und die sich in allen Fällen größte Mühe gegeben haben, das bestmögliche aus der Tour herauszuholen. Auch Sonderwünsche wurden sofort in die Tour eingebaut.

Unsere Erfahrungen mit den Touren im Einzelnen:

1.) Fathala: 
Sehr frühe Abholung am Hotel (6:30), dann ca. 30 min Fahrt bis zur Fähre Banjul-Barra. Da es extrem zeitaufwendig ist (es wird von bis zu 3 Std gemunkelt) mit einem Auto einen Platz auf der Fähre zu bekommen, blieb unser Wagen in Banjul und in Barra hat uns ein anderer erwartet. Von dort zur Grenze und von der Grenze nach Fathala sind es jeweils nur 15 min, aber die Grenzformalitäten dauern Ewigkeiten. Unbedingt Reisepass und Gelbfieber-Impfnachweis bereithalten!
Das Schutzgebiet ist schön, aber wer schon mal eine Safari in freier Wildbahn gemacht hat, der wird etwas enttäuscht sein: Die Zahl der Tiere ist sehr begrenzt und sie stehen meist wie "angerichtet" an den wenigen Wasserlöchern. Die Führerin vor Ort konnte wenig erzählen, die meisten Infos kamen von unserem Omar.
Auf dem Rückweg wurde auf unseren Wunsch hin noch ein Besuch in Fort Bullen eingeschoben. Die Anlage ist in keinem guten Zustand, aber das wurde problemlos vom Kurator des Forts herausgerissen, der uns so viele interessante Fakten erzählte, dass es eine Freude war. Ein echtes Highlight des Tages!
Auf dem Rückweg gab es vor der Fährüberfahrt noch Hühnchen Yassa in einem kleinen Restaurant, am Hotel waren wir gegen 16 Uhr.

2.) Georgetown / Janjanbureh
Abholung um 7 Uhr am Hotel, dann lange Fahrt (ca. 5 h) in den Ost des Landes entlang des Südhighways bis zur Senegambia-Brücke, dann weiter auf dem Nordhighway. In Farafenni kurze Pause um die Beine zu strecken.
Unser erstes Ziel waren die Steinkreise in Wassu (UNESCO-Weltkulturerbe) mit einer kleinen, aber sehr schön gemachten Ausstellung und sauberen Toiletten. Der örtliche Guide war dagegen eine Katastrophe: Der "Stone Man" sprach hervorragend deutsch, quatschte uns aber nur mit esoterischem Firlefanz zu und wurde auch noch ärgerlich, als wir Zweifel äußerten. Wir haben ihn irgendwann einfach stehengelassen und ignoriert. Dank der Ausstellung zuvor konnten wir das zu sehende auch ohne ihn einordnen.
Nach einem Mittagessen (Hühnchen Yassa) ging es mit dem Boot in den River Gambia National Park mit vielen Vögeln, eine Flusspferdfamilie und zahlreichen Schimpansen am Ufer von Baboon Island. Ein zwischendurch zugestiegener Ranger gab kompetente Erklärungen dazu. Dieser Teil der Tour war richtig toll!
Um 18 Uhr erreichten wir dann die Lodge auf dem Janjanbureh gegenüberliegenden Flussufer. Für Details dazu verweise ich auf den Tripadvisor-Artikel zur "Janjanbureh Lodge".
Am nächsten Morgen haben wir die Stadt besichtigt, immerhin einstmals die zweitgrößte Siedlung des Landes. Omar hat uns das Gouverneurshaus, den Markt und eine eine Schule gezeigt und uns viel dazu erklärt (vor allem viele uns unbekannte Produkte auf dem Markt). Danach übernahmen zwei örtliche Guides, die sich als "Crocodile Man" und "Master of the Slave House" vorstellten. Damit wurde es seltsam: Obwohl Janjanbureh/Georgetown erst 1823  - also zu einer Zeit, als die Briten den Sklavenhandel schon verboten hatten und sogar aktiv bekämpften - erbaut wurde, erzählten uns beide wilde Geschichten über den angeblichen Sklavenhandel hier. Man zeigte uns sogar entsprechende Gebäudereste, die sich bei nachträglicher Recherche als Getreidelager und Wohnhaus des britischen Verwalters erwiesen, und angebliche Handschellen und Züchtigungswerkzeuge (die sich als gusseiserne Rohrschellen und ein verbogener Anker erwiesen). Nur die Geschichten von dem Holzhaus der freigelassenen Sklaven und von Freiheitsbaum (allerdings im Bezug auf entlaufene Sklaven der umliegenden Stämme bzw. der Franzosen im Senegal, nicht auf Sklaven in Georgetown) hatten einen wahren Kern. Allerdings scheint diese Geschichtsverdrehung ein allgemeines Problem in Janjanbureh zu sein, das unter dem letzten Präsidenten Jammeh aufkam und sogar 2017 im gambischen Parlament kritisiert wurde.
Die Rückfahrt über den Südhighway an die Küste war lang (ca. 5 h), aber Solo tat sein Bestes, uns mit Geschichten über den Alltag in Gambia die Zeit zu vertreiben.

3.) Südsenegal
Abholung um 7 Uhr, dann Fahrt bis an die Grenze, die üblichen langgezogenen Formalitäten, und Weiterfahrt nach Kafoutine (ca. 1,5 h). Nach einer kleinen Pause in einem französischen Restaurant ging es weiter auf den Markt, wo Omar uns viel Unbekanntes zeigte und erklärte und eine Runde Bananen spendierte (schmeckten ganz anders als bei uns!). Anschließend Weiterfahrt bis zum Flussufer, wo wir auf eine Piroge umstiegen. Diese brachte uns auf die Insel Kailo. Unterwegs sahen wir wieder zahlreiche Vögel, zu denen es von Omar kurze Erklärungen gab.
Auf Kailo wurden wir vom Dorfältesten herumgeführt. Es gab Erklärungen und eine Demonstration zur Palmweinernte und -herstellung (mit Verkostung!) und zum Hanfanbau. Anschließend wurden wir durchs Dorf geführt - unsere Müsliriegel und Kekse kamen gut an, dass Omar nichts "praktisches" wie Reis oder Kleidungsstücke dabei hatte weniger - und wurden durchs Haus des Dorfältesten geführt.
Anschließend ging es mit Boot und Jeep zurück nach Kafountine, wo wir zur Anlandestelle der Fischerboote gegangen sind. Was für eine Atmosphäre! Chaotisches Gewusel in der nahezu undurchdringlichen Rauchwolke der allgegenwärtigen Fischräuchereien. Fotos sind hier nicht erwünscht und das wurde uns auch umgehend und unfreundlich klargemacht! Lang hält man es hier nicht aus, aber erlebt sollte man es trotzdem haben.
Zum Ausklang des Ausfluges gab es dann in dem eben erwähnten französischen Restaurant ein tolles Essen.

Unser Gesamtfazit ist sehr positiv, dank zuverlässiger Organisation und sehr engagierter Guides/Fahrer (Danke nochmal an Ismael, Omar und Solo!!!). Lediglich die lokalen Guides in Wassu und Janjanbureh waren eine Katastrophe, aber das haben wir dem Chef Lams bereits mitgeteilt. Könnte man einen halben Punkt dafür abziehen, würden wir es tun. Ein ganzer Punkt Abzug ist jedoch nicht gerechtfertigt.

title: Excellent Day trip to Makasutu
text:
My wife and I along with our kids (age 9 & 6 yrs) had a marvellous day long adventure with Lams and his apprentice guide, Batch.

I set up the day by sending Lams a WhatsApp and he responded immediately. I requested a van that had working seat belts (not the norm in The Gambia). He switched to WhatsApp video and gave me a tour of the van(!). He suggested a better day trip than what I had previously been considering.

On the day he was there promptly outside our accommodation at 9am and we set off. The kids loved the boat trip, and walking in a forest with a troop of baboons. My son got to try to scale a palm tree. The tour finished with a nice lunch (local cuisine) and some drumming.

We tried another tour company earlier in the week which was underwhelming. I am glad we switched to using Lams. I would definitely recommend to my friends.

title: My visit to South Senegal
text:
After visiting The Gambia numerous times over the years, I decided before my visit that on this occasion instead of spending all my day at the beach or the pool side I was going to go out and complete a couple of day trips.

 

I have already completed the Roots trip and visited Banjul on a previous visit, so this time I wanted to explore areas further afield. I had done some research and spoken to people who have visited The Gambia and I was recommend to get in touch with Lams Tours. Lams (Lamin Cessay)  is a highly respected local business man who has a wealth of knowledge and experience and is highly respected. I contacted Lams and he was happy to talk me thorough the trips available and he could bespoke the trips so I could get the most out of them. All of Lams team who I encountered where professional and friendly.

 

I decided that I would complete 2 trips and my 1st trip would be to South Senegal.

 

My day started just before 7am when I was picked up from my hotel by Lams who going to be my guide and Ismailia who was to be the driver for my trip to South Senegal.

 

I got into the open topped jeep (this can comfortably take 7 passengers) and we were soon on our way.

 

Driving through the towns to reach the border of Senegal, the hustle and bustle of another day in The Gambia was starting. I love seeing all the ladies dressed in their bright African dresses.

 

On reaching the border the process was made easy by Lams he guided me through what I needed to do and before I knew it I was in Senegal with an exit from The Gambia and an entry into Senegal stamp now in my passport.  

 

My first impression on entering Senegal was it was just like being in The Gambia, that impression did change during the day. The countries do share some similarities but are very different – the language and food the most notable.

 

We stopped in Kafountine which is the largest fishing village in Casamance and took a boat trip to Kailo island where we visited the gigantic Boab Baab tree. This tree is worshipped by the locals as a “god”. We spent time in the village before returning to Kafountine by boat.

 

Kafountine is the largest fishing village in the area surrounded by rice fields which thrive in the fertile soil found here.

 

We had lunch which was Chicken Yassa and rice, this is chicken marinated in onion, lemon and mustard. I have had this before but this was truly delicious. I found out that this is cooked by Mariama who is Lam’s sister, I had the opportunity to meet her a couple of days later. What a beautiful person she is inside and out.

 

Later in the afternoon I watched the fishing boats come to shore  with men and women wading into the waves to unload the boats and carry the fish back to shore in large buckets that they balance on their heads. They quickly unloaded their catch before rushing back into the waves to fill their buckets once more. The fish is then sold or smoked to be sold later.

 

Too soon it was time to leave Senegal to return to The Gambia, I arrived back at my hotel at 5pm, it had been a full day but it was well worth it.

 

I will post a review on my 2nd trip which was to Guinea-Bissau soon.

 

Both of my trips where wonderful and I’m so glad I was recommend Lams Tours.

title: Lamstours experience
text:
Afgelopen week zijn wij terug gekomen van onze vakantie in Gambia, Kotu. Tegenover ons hotel bevond zich het pleintje waar ook Lamstours gevestigd is. Bij passeren groeten de jongens van Lamstours vriendelijk en al snel kwamen we met hun in gesprek. Tijdens ons verblijf hebben wij twee trips met Lamstours ondernomen, Fathala wildpark en Zuid-Gambia. Beide dagen waren we met vier personen + chauffeur en gids. Dezelfde gids ging beide trips met ons mee. 
In overleg is veel mogelijk met Lamstours. De trips zijn flexibel aan te passen naar eigen wens, er is dus geen sprake van een strak vaststaand programma. Lamstours denkt hierin ook goed met je mee. 

Beide dagen hebben wij als zeer positief ervaren. Tijdens de trips werd veel vertelt over de plekken waar wij kwamen en tevens over de cultuur en alles eromheen in Gambia. Alle vragen werden enthousiast beantwoord. Het team spreekt goed Engels en doet zijn best om je een goede trip te verzorgen. Daarbij voelt het reizen met Lamstours veilig en doordacht aan. Ze brengen je naar de beste plekjes in Gambia. Buiten de trips om zijn de jongens ook altijd in voor een praatje/het uitwisselen van ervaringen onder het genot van een drankje, mocht je daar zelf behoefte aan hebben.

Lamstours heeft ons Gambia op een onvergetelijke wijze laten zien. 

Lara en Marcel (Nederland)

title: A day in the life of Guinea-Bissau
text:
Before flying out to Gambia I wanted to do a tour that would be really authentic and allow us to see a few more African-countries. I mean, Gambia runs like a small finger into the West-African continent and seeing countries like Senegal and Guinea Bissau only a stones throw away we wanted to see these two-countries. 

Step up Lams-Tours. Lams the friendly, humoured and extremely-knowledgable owner of Lams Tours enabled us to undertake a day-trip to neighbouring Senegal and Guinea Bissau. Without Lams, tours like this just would not be possible. This is due all the work that needs to go into it and overcoming any difficulties such as border controls, something which Lams waltzed through just like Andrea Pirlo would playing for Italy in his main-day. 

Before the trip myself and my friend gave Lams our passports with two-passport style photos for him to arrange our Guinea-Bissau visas while we relaxed at our hotel. The day started at 7am and Lams and his colleague Mo arrived at our hotel and whisked is away. An hour later we arrived at the Senegal border, and Lams guided us through with panache. In Senegal we stopped for a local Senegalese-breakfast all part of the service before arriving at the Guinea-Bissau border, without Lams getting into the country would be pretty much impossible but once again due to Lams and his knowledge of people, he conducts this tour regularly, he got us into this very interesting country like 123. 

The day was spent shopping for locals, visiting a local-village bar which served both cashew and palm-tree juice. It was delicious, and we even got involved with local dancing and had time to meet some very interesting locals and swap stories. I cannot lie and say this was by far one of the best experiences of my life. 

We arrived back in Gambia around four-hours later with a pit-stop for a local fried-rice lunch in Senegal, and the whole day could not have gone better. 

It’s a crime not to visit Guinea Bissau and it’s an even bigger crime not to go with Lams. This man is the real-deal.  

We salute you Lams!

title: Olika utflykter med Lams
text:

Ousman och Omar som vi åkte med var svin trevliga och tog väl hand om en. Dom förstod hur en del av folket kunde vara mot oss turister (något klängiga och vill bli kompisar) och fick därför vissa saker att hända. Jag skulle framför allt rekommendera Ousman då han känns som den bästa utav dom två. Inga dåliga saker att säga om dom och deras turer. Vi satt ensamma med familjen i bilen och inte med andra familjer mm vilket var väldigt skönt!

Alla i besättningen verkade riktigt sköna och trevliga och vi fick ett gott helhetsintryck av dom, kan varmt rekommendera Lams Tours

title: 3 tours with Janeya Tours
text:
We made 3 tours with Janeya Tours: Round trip, Fishing trip and Senegal Safari. We had a great and trouble free experience, because whole team (leaded by owner of this company - Kunta) did all the best to help us feel the Gambia. In all tours were included free refreshing drinks and lunch, what made all the tours comfortable. The whole team of  Janyea tours guides were very friendly and helpful, in fluent English language they told a lots of interesting facts about Gambia and daily life of the Gambians. 
Round trip shown us very clear picture of two Africas: touristic one and real one. It was really worth take this trip to feel real Gambia.
During the fishing trip we had a luck to catch several crabs and local fishes what made our day to be great.
In Senegal Safari we get unforgetable impressions of giraffes and elands.
Besides the great tours, we have got a free transfer from/to airport and full support when we needed get Senegal visas. 
One more time we want to say THANK YOU for all Janeya Tours team, which made our vacation unforgetable and pleasant. Highly recommend this company for every traveller who wants to have trouble free vacation with lots of great experiences.

title: Zeer betrouwbare operator om het echte Gambia te zien!
text:
Janeya Tours is te vinden op de strip van Kololi. Ze dragen oranje shirts en rijden in oranje jeeps en busjes. Het eerste dat opviel is dat de mensen van Janeya niet naar je schreeuwen als je over de strip loopt. Erg rustige, vrolijke en relaxte werknemers. Toen we vroegen naar een tour werden we uitgebreid geholpen door de eigenaar, Lamin Kinteh. Hij nam de tijd en wist 
goed uit te leggen welke trips Janeya allemaal aan kon bieden. Hij spreekt en verstaat behoorlijk goed Nederlands wat het communiceren makkelijker en leuker maakt. Daarnaast spreekt hij ook de lokale talen die gesproken worden in Gambia, iets dat niet iedere gids kan. Tijdens trips kom je daardoor makkelijk van A naar B en kom je op een leuke manier in contact met de plaatselijke bevolking.

We zijn in twee weken tijd uiteindelijk 4 keer weggeweest met Janeya Tours. We kunnen niet anders zeggen dan dat het ons zeer goed bevallen is!! Op elke trip is een gids én chauffeur mee geweest waardoor er veel aandacht is om uitleg te geven en te praten over het land. We hebben op die manier veel gehoord en gezien van en over Gambia. Elke keer op pad gegaan met een goed plan, maar steeds ook de ruimte gehad om tijdens de trip zaken aan te passen waardoor het helemaal onze 'eigen beleving' was. Ze luisterden erg goed naar onze wensen en sloten hier naadloos op aan. Steeds met kundige gidsen onze trips gedaan; ze weten veel, spreken erg goed Engels en dachten steeds aan ons qua eten en drinken. Er werd gezorgd voor lunches en op het dak een koelbox met allerlei drinken. Werd steeds bijgevuld waar nodig, ook met ijs om de boel lekker koud te houden. Op markten en andere drukke plekken werden we goed begeleid; ook dan houden ze je goed in de gaten en kijken ze naar je om. 

Lamin is de eigenaar van Janeya en zet zich in Gambia in voor uiteenlopende projecten en goede doelen. (Future Dreams The Gambia) Hij steekt een deel van zijn winst van Janeya in deze projecten en brengt spullen rond in Gambia die hij onder andere krijgt vanuit Nederland. Een goed gevoel dat een deel van onze kosten bij arme mensen terecht komt. Zo steunt hij kinderen om naar school te kunnen en deelt kleding uit in de arme binnenlanden van Gambia. We hebben pennen, schriften en medicatie uitgedeeld en hij begeleidde dit op een zeer respectvolle manier. Hij bezoekt steeds andere dorpen/compounds op zijn trips zodat meerdere dorpen kunnen profiteren van de toeristen. Zo zijn we in compounds geweest die Lamin ook nog niet kende en waar weinig toeristen komen. Een zeer bijzondere ervaring!! 

Al met al dus hele goede ervaringen met Janeya Tours. We hebben het echte Gambia kunnen zien. Erg goede verzorgde trips en heel erg veel geleerd over het reilen en zeilen van The Smiling Coast Of Africa.

title: 3 days trip with Janeya Tours
text:
We made  a special 3-days  trip with Janeya Tours. Everything was very well arranged. The first day we were picked up at the hotel at six o clock.  After 2 hours ride we had a very nice breakfast, somewhere in the middle of nowhere,  which was prepared by the guide. Fresh bread, eggs, even hot tea and coffee. We visited several family,s which were supported by futuredreams gambia. We visited the wassu stone circles, had a boat trip and then went to Janjengburehcamp. (very beutiful) the second day we went to Georgetown and learnde a lot about the slavery. In the afternoon we went to Tendabacamp, for relaxing time. The guide arranged a special footbalmatch for us, playing against the local football team.
The third day we also visited some familys and then we went back to our hotel. The guide had fresh drinks in the car, every time we asked him to stop for taking a picture, he did that. He knew  lot about the country. For us this was the best trip we ever had.

title: Super trip naar Tendebba!
text: Goed verzorde 2 daagse trip naar Tendebba gemaakt. prima verzorgd door onze gids en chauffeur. prima auto en de gids heeft ons veel over Gambia verteld. Janeya tours is absoluut betrouwbaar en leveren goede kwaliteit. volgend jaar naar George town.

title: zie veel in Gambia
text: Afgelopen maart waren we in de Gambia in het Sengambia hotel  in Kololi. Een mooi en goed hotel met vriendelijk personeel. Het land is mooi voor de natuur liefhebber veel vogels zelfs in de hoteltuin en mooi weer. Wil je meer zien van het land heb ik kennis gemaakt met een goede en betrouwbare gids in het straatje voor het hotel. Je krijgt een goede rondleiding door het precies wat je zelf wilt op elk gebied. Wij zijn met zijn tweeën met een gids geweest en dat was goedkoper en we kwamen op plekken waar je met een organisatie niet komt. Het bedrijf heet Janeya yours en zit 600 meter van het hotel en spreken een klein beetje Nederlands. J.Taling

title: Amazing trip!
text: Janeya Tours biedt verschillende trips in Gambia en Senegal. Wij hebben de Round Trip gedaan. De gids, Kunta, heeft zeer veel kennis en heeft ons heel veel mooie plekjes in Gambia laten zien. Wij gaan zeker terug naar Gambia en dan gaan we ook de andere trips met Janeya Tours doen. Kortom, een echte aanrader!

title: Janeya Tours de tour operator in The Gambia
text:
Met Janeya kom je op de mooiste plekken in the Gambia. De eigenaar is Lamin Kinteh en hij is zeer begaan met zijn reizigers. Samen met zijn personeel verzorgd hij goed excursies door the Gambia. Met eten en drinken aan boord van zijn jeeps kun je je echt super vermaken. 
We hebben zuid Gambia gezien met Lamin en ook zijn we naar Lamin Lodge met hem geweest en natuurlijk de tour naar Senegal naar het wildpark. We zijn blij dat we voor Janeya Tours hebben gekozen.

title: Een echte aanrader!
text: Janeya tours is opgezet door Kunta Kinteh. Een man die super begaan is met zijn land en de mensen die er wonen. Hij heeft jaren als touristguide gewerkt en heeft veel ervaring. Nu is hij voor zichzelf begonnen. Je kunt je wensen aangeven en Kunta zorgt voor een gepaste trip. Hij spreekt de Nederlandse taal best goed, wat altijd prettig is in de communicatie. Een echte topper!

title: Fantastische trip naar het binnenland
text: We hebben met Janeya verschillende trips gemaakt. Een eendaagse trip in het westen van Gambia. Heel verschillende dingen gezien,heilige krokodillenpoel, plaatselijke markt, maar ook samen met lokale vrouwen boodschappen gedaan en gekookt. Zo zie je hoe mensen leven, bovendien verdienen de inwoners daar een salaris mee. De meerdaagse trip naar Georgetown was ook een belevenis. Onderweg veel compounds bezocht, met de ferry de rivier over, een boottrip over de rivier waarbij wel nijlpaarden hebben gezien. ook leuk: één van onze medereizigers was een voetballer. Onze gids heeft geregeld dat hij kon voetballen met de plaatselijke jeugd van het dorp waar we overnachtten. Zo'n overnachting in een kam aan de oever van de rivier is geweldig. Geen sterrenhotel uiteraard, maar wel een fantastische sfeer. Wat ons aanspreekt van Janeya Tours is dat de eigenaar plaatselijke initiatieven steunt, mikrokrediet verleent en daarnaast ook nog vrijwillig voor een Nederlandse stichting werkt die arme kinderen uit het binnenland naar school laat gaan. (Future Dreams Gambia). Een bevlogen man, die dan ook nog de trips onvergetelijk maakt. Wij gaan zeker terug naar gambia, en zullen dan weer met Janeya Tours op pad gaan.

title: Roots tour
text: Since the boat which usually does the Roots tour by river was broken, we rearranged to do the tour by land with Arch Tours. This involves taking a ferry from Banjul to Barra (30-60mins but you have to wait for a ferry to arrive), then a Jeep for around an hour. This part of the day was actually really interesting, travelling through rural parts of the country. Then we visited the Kunta Kinteh compound, the local museum  on the history of slavery and took a small boat over to Kunta Kinteh island itself. A local guide at this point told us more about the history. We then had lunch and headed back. The day was really interesting and I’m now pleased the river boat was broken! Special thanks to our guide Dawda who was excellent, he gave us lots of info along the way and pointed out local birds.

title: Lazy day tour
text:
We moesten 60 euro p.p. betalen voor de tour omdat we alleen dalasi hadden moest dit omgerekend worden. Wij hebben dit zelf 10 x nagerekend maar hebben echt 15 euro te veel moeten betalen. 

Tour was verder wel prima. Weinig tot geen vogels en ander wildlife op de rivier wat we eigenlijk wel hadden verwacht.
Lunch was prima! 
Helaas wel teveel mensen op de boot waardoor er mensen geen ligbed hadden.

title: Superb tours again
text:
Superb tours again
After using Arch tours on our last visit to The Gambia, where we did the 4 in 1 trip and the trip to Fathala Wildlife Reserve, Senegal, we again decided to visit their office. Upon arrival we were greeted by Mr Conteh’s son, Lamin. We sat down and arranged a 2 day tour to Georgetown including an overnight stop at Jang Jang Borough camp, and told Lamin that we would also like to visit Kunta Kinteh Island the following week. As good as his word, both tours went like clockwork. The transport, a minibus arrived dead on time, (6-30am), and the guide introduced himself as Mo and his trusty driver Uncle Tom!!
 We set off and Mo explained that the ferry was not running that morning and that we would be driving across the new Senegambia Bridge, an engineering marvel only finished in January 2019. On route we stopped in a busy town so that Mo could exchange some currency for us, upon return we asked if he knew what kind of bird was feeding near our vehicle, He replied “I think it’s a Penguin” We had a good laugh about this and explained that Penguins do not go to Gambia for their holidays!! Then we moved on to a bustling township to have a wander around the market, Mo explained that a lot of Senegalese come here to sell their produce as we were not far from the border with Senegal. Mo showed us the different fruits and vegetables and told us that a lot of the donkey carts were used in the carriage of produce to market, and also if we wished to we could have a short ride on one! Upon getting closer to the carts we realised they were a little too high off the ground for us to get on both being in our 60s we declined! Our next stop was to the Stone circles of Wasssu. There we were met by the local expert who explained the mathematical significance of these burial stones. There is also a small museum showing the layout of the site and a mock-up of the discovery of a small tomb. There is also a small shop where you can purchase ice cold drinks, including Julbrew! There was a group of children at the gate to the site and we were told to give them any empty water bottles. Upon asking we were told this was so they could fill them with water from their compound. We quickly managed to find the empties in our vehicle and gladly handed them over. 
Next it was lunch at a lodge on the river bank, followed by a trip to Baboon Island. We and half a dozen other tourists boarded a small motor boat and within 20 minutes had pulled in to a small clearing on the far bank to pick up a local ranger, who then accompanied us to a site on the island where he knew the Chimpanzees would gather. The noise of the chimps is very loud and could be heard distinctly as we approached. We moored up about 20 feet away and observed these wonderful creatures, the ranger answering any questions we put to him. The main noise was coming from 2 Alpha males guarding their territory and facing each other across a small creek, each having a troop of their own up in the trees. To see this spectacle was absolutely fascinating, and even after half an hour when we were leaving, they were still at it! This is one of three islands with primates living naturally and the most populated with over 100 chimpanzees. Only rangers and veterinary staff are allowed to land on them. The other wildlife on this trip up the river included Hippos and lots of different birds.
Next it was on to Jang Jang Burreh camp and some well-earned rest for Mo and Uncle Tom. As it was starting to go dark, we were shown to our round hut which we quickly dropped our belongings and ventured outside to find the bar/eating area for a few Julbrews before hitting the sack! Situated on the bank of the river, the bar quickly rustled up 2 ice cold Julbrews, we were soon joined by Mo and Uncle Tom for a Vimto nightcap! The bar provides an excellent view over the river and soon a small boat arrived bringing some Dutch guests for a drink. After some interesting conversation we decided to retire for the night as it was now pitch black. Luckily Mo and Uncle Tom escorted us back to our hut as our mobile phones were both flat and we didn’t have a torch! In the morning we met for the buffet style breakfast with lots of monkeys trying to steal the food! The camp is very basic with no electricity, but the huts are provided with solar powered fans and luckily ours had one of the new ones which also has an LED lighting panel on, very handy if you need the toilet in the middle of the night! Tip, if you want the light on all night, switch the fan off and the light will stay on.
Next we went for the ferry to cross the river, the small car ferry was broken, so we crossed in a small motor boat to visit the slave house and dungeons on Maccarthy Island. This is quite a haunting place, especially the small dungeons which we were shown around by a very knowledgeable guide, who explained the horrors and torture that the slaves were subject to. The slave market is quite derelict, but again interesting as Mo was very knowledgeable. We also saw the slave house which has a depiction of the slave’s life on the side wall. All too soon it was time for our return back over the river where we rejoined Uncle Tom and started the long drive back, (approx. 185 miles) upon the way we stopped for lunch at Abca’s Creek Lodge. This place is in an idyllic location on the edge of a creek were people were enjoying swimming in the fresh water. We sat down with Mo and Uncle Tom and ordered our Julbrews, we then went out of the eating area for a cigarette and to admire the tranquil surroundings. Upon returning there was no sign of Mo and Uncle Tom? We enjoyed the meal of local (2) fish and chips, we then went to look for Mo and Tom. We found them outside at our transport and were told that they had been asked to eat their meal outside in a separate area which consisted of (1) fish and chips between them on 1 plate. We found this absolutely disgusting in the 21st century that this kind of behaviour still exists. We will never return to this lodge in the future. Arch tours have a policy that guests are not to be left on their own on tours for safety reasons, so I hope that this lodge will be apologising for this error of judgement. 
Except for the Abca lodge experience, we had a fantastic time on this tour and would highly recommend to anybody wishing to experience the ‘Real Gambia’
Special thanks to Mo and Uncle Tom for their expertise (not Penguins!), professionalism and enthusiasm on this trip and also the laughs.

title: Excellent smooth tour
text: We did a 1-day tour to the Fathala wildlife reserve in Senegal. Arch Tours and our tour guide Dawda were excellent, the tour was comprehensive, smooth and exciting. Dawda even tried to speak some Dutch with us. Really recommend this tour-operator!

title: Excellent choice!
text: Feeling really happy with our choice of Arch tours as a tour operator. Very kind, professional and the young boss Lamin Conteh has chosen people who hsve the best skills and knowledge for each trip. We contacted Mr Conteh via whats App before going to the Gambia and he sent us a price list. The preferred currency is GBP(or Euros)so take cash. His office was easy to find in Kololi and we booked 2 trips which had a £10 discount. The 3 hour river cruise from Lamin Lodge and walk about Abuko Nature reserve was with Dawouda, who is a passionate bird watcher with a keen eye. The day trip to Kunta Kinteh Island was with Manulamin, a history and political science student with a lot of knowledge about Gambia. A comfortable boat trip across to the Island, a very nice buffet lunch with sandwiches am and tea coffee biscuits pm and we were very lucky to see a pod of Dolphin both ways. Great crew, concerned for our comfort and safety at all times. Plenty to drink and eat on both trips and also the all important toilet opportunities. Do not hesitate to book with Arch. All the good reviews are absolutely correct. This would be our first choice on return to The Gambia. Highly recommended.

title: Early Bird en 4 in 1 dag tour
text:
Dawda was onze gids. Een hele vriendelijke man.  We kregen zeer goede uitleg van hem over het leven in Gambia.  De 2 tours waren erg mooi. We  hebben genoten.  Bij de 4 in 1 tour doe je heel veel indrukken op. Vooral op de school die uitgegroeid is van 100 kinderen  naar meer dan 1000.  Zo blij met potloden en slijpers. Bij een familie thuis.. wat een mooie familie. Dansen en springen, niets was hun te gek. Wat een plezier.
De Early Bird is een zen tour. Wat een rust. En wat hebben we mooie natuur en vogels gezien. 
Dawda.. dank je wel voor 2 mooie dagen samen met jou en Alfa (chauffeur).

title: Great Value!
text:
We took two tours with Arch Tours (4 in 1 and 2-day Georgetown) and both of them were perfect. The first one lets you know most of the main things in one day (including visiting a school and a family) and the second one is perfect to visit inner Gambia and its highlight boat tour with chimps and hipos.

Great time with both Emel and Dawda who were our guides in each tour. Besides the drivers were amazing.

Totally recommended!! :)

title: Brilliant private lazy day tour
text: Had a fabulous lazy day tour up the creek. This was a private trip - cost £200 for four with drinks, meal and transport. Done a few of these trips and this was was as good as any. Fantastic host in Dambara and the crew

title: Brilliant experience ! Book with the locals ! Fantastic guide (Fanta)
text:
We done the 4 tours in 1 day, and the Camel ride tour the following day. As it was the start of the season, we were the only people on the trip so it was like a private tour for us. 

I cannot stress enough to book with the locals in The Gambia, I'm not taking anything away from the holiday companies that you book your holidays with but why would you want to pay a lot more to go on a tour that may be guided by someone who isn't native to Gambia. If you want the full experience on your holiday and you want to know about the place your are at, you want to hear it from the horses mouth. It is also important help the Gambian tourist industry to thrive, not just so people can continue to have amazing times there like we did, but also to help Gambias economy which relies heavily on tourism. 

Our tour guide was Fatima (Fanta). She was a brilliant tour guide, very informative, very funny, and was able to answer anything we asked from her. We had some really interesting conversations! Both tours took place over the weekend and the camel tour was supposed to include a school visit. We were in the holiday mood not realising it was the weekend and the schools won't be open. However, on the second tour, she arranged for us to go to an Arabic school (they are open on weekends). This was not part of the tour, this was just because we were saying we would have loved to have seen a school. So we stopped off at this school not knowing if we would be allowed in. Luckily the headmaster said it was okay and he showed us around the school and we got to meet the children and see them in their classroom environment. It was a really nice experience that we will never forget and we were so thankful that Fatima arranged this for us when she really didn't have to.

The 4 tours in 1 day is a must if you really want to experience what The Gambia is about. We did so much on that tour that it would take ages to write all about it. But it was really really good! When we stopped off at Lamin Lodge for some tea an donuts, we were not aware we would be sitting with monkeys. I'm sure everyone is aware that you have to be careful with food and monkeys. We were all outsmarted by a well orchestrated gang of monkeys that made us look different ways whilst the others would steal our donuts. Highlight was watching one monkey run away with a china pot of milk... Unforgettable. That was a really nice place and a funny experience. Meeting the family in the village was an experience we will never forget, stepping out of the truck and being overrun by about 20 screaming children all grabbing on to us and kissing us. We earlier bought some sweets for the children at the market but now wish we could have brought more things for them. But they appreciated the sweets nonetheless more than any child from back home would appreciate an expensive gift at Christmas. We will never forget that. We did so many amazing things on our tours, it would take me so long to write about it all, but it was completely worth it !

Overall, fantastic trip, Amazing tour guide Fatima! Can't wait to come back and book other excursions with Arch Tours.

title: Perfekt
text: Fantastischer Service,immer zuverlässig und ansprechbar, keinerlei überraschungen oder zusatzkosten. Pünktlich auf die Minute. Auf jeden persönlichen wunsch wird eingegangen.Echt professionell - ist in afrika nicht selbstverständlich. Haben 6 Touren gebucht,jede perfekt organisiert.Makusuto,Fathala,sunset cruise besonders toll. Herlichen dank an unsere beiden guides Sanaa und Dawda - ihr wart großartig.Herzlichen dank !

title: Quite good
text: No complaints. Trip we went on was ok and the staff were very helpful. We went to Makasutu Forest which seemed to lack some atmosphere and wasnt that interesting.

title: Bra och välorganiserad tur till Fathala Game Reserve
text:
Vi bokade en tur till Fathala Game Reserve med Arch Tours som vi blev mycket nöjda med. Bokningen gick snabbt och smidigt på deras kontor som dock ligger lite avsides. Anledningen till att vi bokade med Arch Tours var att vi fick bäst förtroende för dem, när vi pratade runt mellan de olika aktörerna.

Upphämtningen startade kl 6 på morgonen för att vi skulle kunna komma iväg i tid och kunna se djuren innan det blev för varmt. Tyvärr så var inte alla deltagare lika morgonpigga, utan vissa hade försovit sig så att vi ändå blev lite försenade. Men Arch Tours gjorde sitt yttersta och mer därtill för att alla skulle komma iväg, trots att de inte hade någon skuld i detta.

Vi blev uppdelade i två öppna-bilar (ca 4 pers per bil) och där vi då fick den eminenta och trevliga guiden Dowda. Han gjorde verkligen sitt yttersta för att se till så att alla trivdes och fick ut så mycket som möjligt av turen, vilket vi även fick!

Turen i naturreservatet var mycket givande med alla de djur vi fick se och uppleva. Bra chaufför som manövrerade jeepen på ett säkert, tryggt och smidigt sätt.

I övrigt en mycket bra tur som även gav en liten fin inblick i det dagliga livet i Gambia och Senegal samt en trevlig båttur över Gambia-floden med lokalbefolkningen.

Jag skulle utan tvekan välja Arch Tours igenom om vi kommer tillbaka till Gambia och ska ut på en annan spännande utflykt.

title: Early bird & Creek fishing
text:
We hebben twee excursies gedaan via Arch Tours.  Alles was prima verzorgd. We hebben de Early Burd gedaan vanuit Lamin Lodge.  Veel vogels gezien: bee eaters, king fishers, de wouw, gieren, etc.  Deskundige leiding. 

De vistocht was fun.  We hebben groupers, frog fish, ladyfish en krabben gevangen. Een heerlijke dag op het water!

title: Roots Cruise: Fantastic!
text:
I visited Gambia for the first time this month and the whole experience was amazing. I chose Arch Tours for the Roots River cruise as they are contantly recommended on TA. They are professional, well organised, friendly, knowledgeable - explaining things well and 

I definitely recommend the Roots Cruise - the scenery along the trip is beautiful which provided opportunities for good photos. The journey makes you reflect upon the history of the slave trade which is emotional but allows you to take lessons from it.

Definitely recommend Arch Tours. 
If I ever go to Gambia again *God willing* I would not hesitate to use them for future tours.

title: Sunset cruise und Südsenegal
text:
Arch Tours ist ein Unternehmen auf das man sich 100 % verlassen kann.
Ich hatte über sie den Flughafentransfer, Sunsetcruise und eine Tour in den Südsenegal gebucht.
Die Sunsetcruise beinhaltet freie Softdrinks, Fahrt durch die Mangroven und ein Abendessen in der Laminlodge.
Unser Guide Lamin erklärte alles über Mangroven, Austern und Vogelwelt. Das Essen war Landestypisch mit musikalischer Untermalung. Affen und Katzen leisten beim Dinner Gesellschaft. Als Überraschung gab es eine Geburtstagstorte !! Vielen Dank dafür!!
Die zweite Tour führte in den Senegal, hier war der Guide Abdou, auch er war sehr freundlich, erklärte alles. Diese Tour führt durch eine schöne Flusslandschaft zu einer Insel. Hier leben Menschen die vom Hanfanbau leben und eine Naturgottheit verehren. Ein Baobab Baum. Mittagessen gibt es in einem Hotel direkt am Atlantik. Ein schöner Tagesausflug bei dem man den Senegal ein wenig kennenlernt. Bei dieser Tour vergaß ich meine Basecap im Bus, sie wurde mir am nächsten Tag ins Apartment gebracht. Arch Tours ist sehr zu empfehlen.

title: Unreliable - stranded at airport
text:
So, I contacted Mr Conteh from Arch Tours around 6 weeks before our trip to Gambia and agreed a price for two trips and an airport transfer.

I contacted him again a few days before our arrival and was assured all was well, and that their driver would be waiting at the airport for us holding a sign with our name on it.

Arrived at the airport with a tonne of luggage and two young children- no sign of our promised driver.

Spent thirty minutes in extreme heat and fighting off bumsters trying to locate the driver with the aid of the Thomas Cook rep to no avail. Kids by now were tired and getting upset, so we had to make other arrangements.

May well have been an isolated incident but our trust was destroyed and the start of our holiday ruined.

Booked the same tours with the Official Tourist Guide across the road from the Bakotu hotel.Look for the guys in the light blue tee shirts.

Significantly cheaper, and our guide for the two trips (Lamin) was amazing.

Save yourself a few quid and don’t rely on Arch Tours.

ownerResponse.text:
Hello Sir,
We are deeply sorry for the failed airport transfer!
We were at the airport as early as 18:30pm having known that your landing time was 19:00pm.We never failed Airport transfer and this day was the first time and it was an inauspicious day!As soon as we realized that it was almost 19:30pm,we called your UK number and it wasn’t working!We held an A4 size paper with your family name on it for quick identification but we still couldn’t see you!We actually left the Airport around 20:00.We are sorry anyway.

title: 4 tours in one
text: My favourite activity was 4 tours in one, - so many events packed into one day: the vibrant and busy markets and the crocodiles were so memorable. The donuts and coffee at Lamin Lodge were so delicious! Although I'm not into bird watching, the Merikkisah River ride was a lovely trip. Paddling down the river, listening to the birds was so peaceful. I learned many of the different birds names from the knowledgeable and bird watching enthusiast tour guide, Doudah. I would highly recommend Arch Tours for travellers to Gambia.

title: Gambian trips to remember and not forgotten
text: We booked with Arch Tours on recommendations and TA reviews and we we not disappointed. We did the excellent 4 in 1 tour which gives you an insight into the  real Gambian lifestyle and our guides Fanta and Douda looked after us very well and their narrative and knowledge was amazing and the groups questions were never too much. Our next tour was the Fatahla safari and walk with the lions. This was the highlight of our tours and a must if you want a once in a lifetime experience. Our guides Mo and Brooklyn were excellent and as we travelled to the safari Mo gave us all a very knowledgeable history of the areas we travelled through.  Once we got to the safari our guide Sally took us through the game reserve and talked us through all the animals and birds we saw which fantastic as being only metres way from the animals was a great experience. Once the safari was over our walk with the lions was next and although everyone was naturally aphrensive our guide Domoda and his team talked us through things and from then on we each did our walk with the 2 very large lions. Not going to say much other than you need to do this for an ultimate lifetime experience. Lastly the Roots tour again via road as the only boat to the island was not operational and this was not owned by Arch Tours as all other tour companies use this boat but that did not deter us. Again with Mo and our guides the trip was very moving and made you think about the life the slaves must have endured and only through the history been told can such events never occur ever again. Mo and the guides gave an excellent account and  at times , a moving account of the history and of Kunta Kinte , which I was fortunate to meet the actual surviving members of the Kinte family as part if this tour , one I shall never forget. In all I felt Arch Tours was excellent as their groups are small in number totalling no more than 8 persons and that enables them to provide a more personal service. The owner Mr. Conteh was excellent and efficient in arranging and advising the tours and all via email before and after we arrived in Gambia. You won't go wrong with this Gambian tour company as they truly are what they say they are.

title: Fathala reserve and lion walk
text: Wowzers another great day with Arch Tours. Gotta say it was a long day, early start and a long journey (3 1/2 hrs each way), the Senegal border was an experience! but worth it 😂. Our guide Dowda looked after us all day and never left our side, making sure we had plenty to drink and eat. Food at the reserve was great aswell, I had a lovely Hawaiian pizza and my husband had chicken yassa. The highlight of the day was the lion walk, if you go there don't just tour the reserve make sure you do this. What beautiful animals, and very well cared for. Another amazing experience with these guys. Thanks Dowda and Mo 😁👍🏻

title: 4 in 1 tour
text: What an amazing day. The tour was more like 8 in 1 than 4 in 1. We visited Serrakunda market, crocodile pool, lamin lodge, animal market, local school, Gambian home, Paradise beach and finally the fish market. What an experience, if you want to see the real Gambia with real Gambians this is the trip. Sanna and Aiesha were very knowledgeable and attentive all day, great guides and very protective!!!! 😂. Thanks guys 😁👍🏻

title: Fantastic guides
text: Going with Black and white Safari really enhanced our trip and taught us so much during the tours. We went on the safari in Senegal, Four wheel drive and day trip to Banjul- all amazing experiences. The itineraries were well planned and all the guides are incredibly friendly, experienced and knowledgeable. Warmly recommend booking through the website or in their office in Senegambia.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing experience!
text: The organization and setup was phenomenal. Our tour guide, Lamin was knowledgeable and experienced. I would definitely recommend.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Diverse dagtrips.
text: We hebben diverse tours gemaakt. Vooraf hiervoor via de email contact gehad. Alles heel goed geregeld. Driver was Bax en onze gids was Lemin. Ze hebben ons onzettend goed begeleid en uitgelegd over de excursies en het leven in gambia. Vakanties en trips in gambia zijn voor herhaling vatbaar en een aanrader voor anderen.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic experience with Black and White Safari
text:
Fantastic,extraordinary trips of a lifetime with the family 
February • Family 
Fantastic time.
Booked:
Senegal, Fathala walking with the Lions, extraordinary once in a lifetime experience.
Home cooking experience:
We had a great time with our hosts, cooking, chatting, eating together unforgettable.
Our highlight of the visit:
We were visiting a few local schools again unforgettable, emotional rollercoaster.
 East Gambia Trip:
Another great journey with our fantastic guides, visiting villages, families, monuments, museums incredible.
The Roots tour:
Emotional, powerful experience.
We would like to express how grateful we are for the wonderful journey, experience with Black and White Safari.
All amazing, hardworking people, Armstrong,Lamin ,Fanta, Sophia,Muhammad,Zac and the whole team.
Thank you so much for everything and see you all next year.
Adrienn,Lili and Vencel

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Outstanding full day shopping for, cooking and eating a festive meal
text:
When visiting The Gambia, to can count on Armstrong and his amazing team of Black and White Safari. 

We were 14 guests for this private shore excursion off the Holland America Zuiderdam. 

We started our cultural experience working thru the Banjul outdoor market where staff purchased the food and spices we would prepare for our opulent meal. 

We were hosted at Armstrong’s family home were we pitched in preparing the meal. 

Delicious.  A real cultural immersion.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: They were wonderful hosts to their country
text:
I must initially thank all the support that Armstrong gave me in the months leading up to the trip. We were 5 and we made an arrangement for several visits while we were in The Gambia. They were tireless, staying with us from dawn until after dinner. Our guide, Lamin, was always concerned about our well-being and always made sure that nothing got in our way. Our driver was extremely cautious, always with a smile. The agreed times were met and there was no time to return. With them we were able to discover real life in The Gambia, with all its poverty but contagious joy. They helped us distribute some clothes and school supplies that we took to give to those most in need, and it was an emotional moment for us. We take this whole experience for life, and they as friends. The trip between the capitals of Gambia and Guinea-Bissau took 10 hours. They still had to return on the same day. There were countless stops, between borders and police barriers with unbearable heat and road dust getting into everything. Lamin, not even in this odyssey, left us alone. 
Congratulations on your professionalism and humanity.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Relaxte boottrip in Gambia met Janeya Tours
text: Een  relaxte boottrip met Janeya tours. Op de boot zelf werd een heerlijk lunchbuffet klaargemaakt, en dat in een keukentje van 1 m2. Terwijl de 2 kokkins daar mee bezig waren voer de boot tussen de mangroves door. We zagen vogels, vrouwen die oesters oogstten en er was tijd om te vissen. Er was ruim voldoende aan drinken op de boot, koffie thee met wat erbij, maar ook soft drinks en bier. Op de boot heb je zowel de mogelijkheid om in de zon als in de schaduw te zitten. Echt een aanrader voor een ontspannen dagje.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Unforgettable excursion with Black & White Tours
text:
Three of us booked a trip to Dakar in Senegal with Black and White tours.  What an amazing and memorable trip it was.  Lamin took great care of us, was the most faultless and attentive guide and nothing was too much trouble. Also not forgetting Ibrahim our driver, who did a fantastic job.
  
As others have mentioned the ferry crossing is a different experience which we really enjoyed especially on the way back!! 

Lastly I cannot forget to mention Armstrong who organised the trip.  Thank you so much to you and your team for your professionalism and leaving us with an unforgettable memory of our excursion.   

I would definitely recommend and use Black and White tours again the future, well done!!!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Black and white
text: Had a 7am start with Muhammad from black and white went down to banjul ferry not there got carried to a dugout wow experiance in its self went other side of river gambia and into a open top 4x4 crossed into Senegal no problem and on to safari Park was given a huge stick and went walking with lions fantastic experiance and then into safari Park needless to say returned on real ferry thank you Muhammad for a fantastic day a memory for life

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Senegal Fathala Safari
text: Wow what an experience! The ferry across the river was experiencing maintenance difficulties and wasn’t running on the day we did this trip (April 3rd). This was completely out of the hands of the B&W team, but as in any service industry, it’s how you deal with problems that sets you aside. Our guide, Lamin (ask for him if you book and you won’t be dissatisfied), found us a local pirogue boat and with a shoulder ride to remember we were aboard without getting wet. After a short drive to the boarder we were on route to Fathala Reserve where we saw Rhino, Giraffe, Warthog, Monkey plus much more. Lunch on the way back was included in the price and the local Chicken Yassa didn’t disappoint. Thank you Armstrong and Lamin for a brilliant, unforgettable experience.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The best gambian experience
text: The tours were amazing lots to choose from great service the best gambian experience with these guys Muhammed and fantastic was our tour guides and the driver bax we also used them for our airport taxi we felt very safe and we can't wait come again

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Extraordinary trips of a lifetime
text:
Booked Roots tour,, Safari and walking with lions. 
Had the absolute pleasure of tour guides,, Yaya,, Butt's ,, and Muhammed.  3 very polite,, knowledgeable,, helpful and informative young men. Faultless

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Cooking a traditional Gambian meal
text: Myself and my girlfriend went on the cooking tour. It was amazing we saw a traditional Gambian Compound, went to the market to buy  fresh food and fish then we returned to the compound to cook two complete meals that would feed 30 people.   Being in the open air, seeing the young children and helping with the cooking was delightful.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Roots experience. A must do tour if visiting the Gambia
text:
Wow! What an amazing day !  We booked with Black and White Safari located on the strip. We were a group of 4 ladies aged between 20s to 60s. Two with mobility issues. 
As a child I remember watching the series Roots on the telly and then reading the book. An awful time in history.  We learn from history not erase it.
We were picked up promptly from our hotel by a friendly guide from Black and White Safari who shared lots of information on places we passed as we travelled to the port. 
The ferry journey is an experience not to be missed. It’s a colourful game of Testris as they fit onto the ferry the cars, lorries, buses, goats, carts, poultry and hundreds of local people selling their wares. All this can be watched from the safety of a seat above deck. You do wonder about health and safety as late comers are jumping onto ferry as it moves off! 
We were met at other side in Barra by another driver and our Roots journey began where we were also joined by a local guide. We visited the remains of San Domingo fort, the slavery museum and had short boat ride across to Kunte Kunte Island where slaves were kept. 
Food was given in local restaurant. Cold drinks were provided throughout the day. We were well looked after and felt safe. 
Great day with a brilliant tour company. Black and White safari looked after us from start to finish. Highly recommend.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: An amazing experience!
text: Booked 3 trips with Black and white after my friends that have used them for years recommended. Each trip was fantastic, very enjoyable as well as informative! I learned so much and would highly going with this tour company.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Highlights of our 2 weeks in Gambia
text:
We did two tours with Black and White- the 7-in1 safari and the Fathala Reserve. 
Firstly the 7-in-1 which we had the Incredible Fanta guiding us and the wonderful Bax driving us. We visited so many incredible places, where we were fortunate enough to see how Gambians really live. It was a truly humbling experience and we feel really lucky to have seen it for ourselves. If you book this excursion, try and book it on a Sunday! This way when you visit Paradise (Sanyang) beach, you'll be able to watch the cultural wrestling! The trip was well organised and flexible
 A special shout out to Fanta who was so confident and knowledgeable. You are really talented Fanta! 

Next trip was to Fathala with the lovely Joe who is one of the kindest.people I've met. He looked after us all day long. There was a ferry delay (not his fault at all) and he made sure we were looked after and checking in. He was so knowledgeable on the area and answering our questions, and was so great to learn about his family. Both my husband and I absolutely loved the safari, and to be honest the journey to Fathala is worth it alone just for the experience! Go with open eyes and and remember you're in Africa where things are different here- embrace the experience.

Armstrong who runs the company was excellent in communication. I booked the trips last year and he had touched base with me regularly and met us on arrival in Gambia, welcomed us and ran us through the process. It was professional but also very friendly. 

I would recommend anyone to book a tour with these guys. You made our holiday in Gambia incredible!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Best local knowledge, HIGHLY recommended!
text:
We spent total 8 days with Lamin and Bernard, first 3 days all over Gambia, and then 4 days in south Senegal, and Kunta Kinteh island for one day.
In Gambia we saw many animals, including hundreds of birds, hippoes, dolphins and chimpanzees. We visited remote villages, and the kids were happy to receive toys we had brought from home for them. We took boat rides and saw a lot of local life and nature.
In south Senegal we visited both Cap Skirring and Kafountine, interesting and beautiful places! Lamin and Bernard really made us feel safe at all times, everywhere! So it was the best way to really experience western Africa.
If you book with B&W safari, you will get good service and will feel safe. So you can concentrate in experiencing and enjoying your holiday. I love photographing, so these trips with them were excellent opportunities to enjoy my hobby. See the pictures!
Just remember, this is real Africa, sometimes things happen. We had a small problem with our car, but it was interesting to visit a garage and see how the problem got fixed. No biggie. Also, in south Senegal the roads are not that good, so keep that in mind if you don't like potholes 😁.
Either way, if you want to experience Gambia with a local company, go with Black and White Safari, HIGHLY recommended and you will be happy you chose them over the not-gambian companies.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic trips and company
text:
This company excells in great communication, I booked our trips via whatts app before we got to Gambia which made things so easy.
We had 2 trips with black and white safari tours the first been the safari with lion walk and it was amazing we got to see all the animals and the walk with the lions is a must it's a once in a lifetime experience
The day it's self was very long especially in the heat  but there's nothing I would change, our guide jo was great too pointed places out on the way and help and looked after us the whole tim.
For the 2nd trip we did the four wheel drive which again was a fantastic day we visited the crocodile park and stroked the crocodiles, we visited the markets which was good to see but it was definitely an eye opener, we hosted a school where the children were so happy and in their classes they demonstrated what theyve learnt, we also visited the wood carving factory which was ok but it wasn't really a factory it was more just a wood carving market really and every stall holder had carved the same thing, from there we went onto paradise beach for  some lunch and a little relax time, the 2 of us and the other couple that were with us weren't interested in the fish factory which was to follow the paradise beach so therefore they gave us more time at the beach 
Armstrong and his team are lovely people very knowledgeable and helpful 
I would highly recommend these trips and definitely through this company

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great day with black and white tours
text:
We chose black and white tours because last year we had a great experience with them.
This year's visit didn't disappoint we went on the roots tour to Kunta Kinta island this involves a full day of travel in cars and on the ferries (which is an experience on its own) a boat journey and a meal using all local people and restaurants.
Our guide for the day was Mohammed a really nice guy with a great sense of humour and local knowledge.
The actual content of the tour is really unsettling for all of us who have grown up in a multicultural society and being a more personal tour than the big operators can offer as you have a personal guide arranged by black and white tours.
Therefore you get a better understanding of the horrors involved and can spend time talking together instead of having to rush to catch a bus.
A really great day out could not fault it.our third trip with black and white tours over the last two years. Fantastic team. We will be back and will use this local firm.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 1st trip to Gambia & Black & White Safari’s set the Standard for keeping the customer happy 😃
text:
Wow, what can I say that I haven’t read previously about Armstrong & his company ‘Black & White Safari’s’

When looking at tours / excursions in Gambia we wanted to book local not through large company’s. Like you are now, I searched through and read many reviews of different operators and came across B&W Safari’s and thought their reviews must be to good to be true, but i’ll give them a go.

Best decision we made, I emailed Armstrong & that same evening he came back to me & suggested using WhatsApp to keep in touch.

His communication up-to a month before travelling was top notch, immediately putting my mind at ease.
Discussed my requirements, beyond the usual standard tours being offered and he only requested a very small deposit and to pay him the rest when we see him here in Gambia. 
(This man was ticking all the right boxes)

Communication continued to clarify bits and bobs regarding the country before our arrival.
We arranged to meet at our hotel, which took place a day before our planned excursion, however my wife wanted to change the itinerary last minute, i thought this may cause some tension. How wrong was I, Armstrong said leave it with me a few hours and i’ll come back to you. 
A man of his word, he did just that! all sorted.

Our driver Bakary and our Guide Fax picked us up on time and with smiles on our faces.
I feel like i’m going on, but I want to express what genuine guys they are, a credit to Armstrong and their country.
My wife was struggling with the heat to the point of tears (living in England, it’s been below zero every  night and a max of 8c during the day) so to suddenly be very high in the 30’s it was a shock to the system. 
Bakary and Fax did everything they could do to put a smile on her face again and make her feel more comfort, which worked and was appreciated by both herself and me (happy wife, happy life)

I’ve gone on enough, so much more i could say to express my gratitude, the experiences that we would have missed without them, their genuine care to make us happy.

Do what I did & give them the opportunity to impress and email Armstrong.

When we come back I know whom i’ll be calling
Thank You
Armstrong
Bakary
Fax
Fanta

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic Trip to Gambia - 3 Day Tours
text:
We booked ourselves in with Simon for a two-day Gambia experience trip, but due to a flight delay, we had to reschedule. Simon was completely understanding, and helpful in re-booking for us. We opted for the North Senegal tour followed by the 2-day Gambia experience.

We had an absolutely fantastic time, especially on the two day tour, where everything was perfectly organised, and Simon it was a pleasure travelling with him. As it was just the three of us on the trip, Simon was able to accommodate to what we wanted to do.

If you are ever visiting Gambia, I would highly recommend using Simon!

title: Fantastic
text:
Wij hebben 4 tours met Simon gedaan, en vonden het echt te gek.
Simon deed echt alles om het ons naar wens te maken, en we werkten samen een flexible planning uit.
Die gaandeweg nog werd aangepast. Hij was ook zeer bezorgd wanneer 1 van ons ziek met een zonneslag naar Fatallah meeging.
(Hij wist zelfs binnen weggetjes via via om de zieke sneller aan boord te loodsen en uit de massa te houden).
Zelfs in de laastste tour (met souvenir shoppen) looste hij ons naar alle kleine marktjes en deed hij zijn uiterste best om enkele moeilijke verzoekjes te doen slagen.
We hebben een geweldige tijd in Gambia beleefd en dit grotendeels door Simon zijn ervaring en goed humeur.

title: Excellent 2 day trip with Simon
text: We spent 2 days visiting around 3/4 of The Gambia on Simon's excellent taste of the Gambia tour.  Taking in travel north and south of the Gambia river, we were treated to experiences with wildlife, locals and the Gambian culture.  Seeing Chimps in the Chimpanzee rehabilitation project was a particular highlight for me, but also listening to the history of the slave trade set to drums by local Georgetown aural historian Taka (definitely worth listening). The two day tour is a lot of driving, but you will get to see a huge part of the real Gambia outside of the resorts - you can even play the local driving game of 'count the police check-points'!  However, add to the excellent schedule the fact that Simon is a genuinely knowledgeable, informative and thoroughly nice bloke to act as guide and host, then I can't recommend his trips enough.

title: Top excursies!
text: Wij hebben drie excursies gedaan bij Simon: open truck safari naar fathala, South Gambia tour en lazy day boottocht. Alle drie waren super! Simon heeft alles goed geregeld en ook de chauffeur (mustafa) was super vriendelijk. Ik zou Simon aan iedereen aanraden. Hij weet veel te vertellen over Gambia en hoe alle mensen wonen en werken. Hij zorgt ervoor dat je je veilig voelt en je aan niets ontbreekt. Ook de mensen van de boottocht waren erg vriendelijk en hebben ons goed geholpen met het vissen, dit hadden wij nog nooit gedaan. Wij hebben drie top dagen gehad!

title: Authentiek Gambia
text:
Een schitterende dagtocht South Gambia met Simon Tours!
Gids stipt aan het hotel, met chauffeur in open jeep.
Bezoek Batik Factory, Serrekunda Market, lokale smid ( recuperatie blikjes)
We waren enorm onder de indruk, geen toeristen gezien, allemaal zeer authentiek!
Gezellige boottrip in de mangroves, vertrekkend vanuit Lamin lodge,  prauw met roeiers, super.
Gids heeft ook vele gekoelde drankjes bij zich voor ons, aangenaam.
Dan met jeep off road, tussen de dorpjes, naar paradise beach voor lekkere lunch, all in.
Daarna bezoek aan vissersdorp Tanji, terugkeer van de vissers, een must, met bezoek aan visdrogerij etc.  
We hebben een onvergetelijke dag beleefd, een echte aanrader.
We reizen heel veel, maar dit is echt de moeite waard.
Geen toeristentrap, wel real life in het echte Gambia

title: Two day tour - A real Gambian experience
text:
We have just returned from the ‘Real Gambian Experience (2 days) with Simon-Tours. It was an unforgettable experience that we will treasure. We saw chimps and hippos in the wild, which was wonderful. The highlight of the trip was our visit to a tribal village and also to some nomadic families. We’re were amazed by the warmth of the welcome we received.
Our tour guide, Simon, was very well informed and friendly. Everything was well organised and we felt secure in Simon’s capable hands. We would highly recommend  this trip to anyone interested in Gambian wildlife and culture. We would definitely use Simon Tours again.

title: Good organisation, friendly, informative guide
text:
We did a 2 day trip to Georgetown and River Gambia National Parc and some stops along the way. Our guide, Simon was very informative and has made the trip worthwhile.
The only thing we didn't like to much was the way the clothes (presents) where handed out to the (poor) women in the village.

title: Fantastic trip to Georgetown
text:
We did two trips with Simon tours, the James island roots your and the two day/1night trip to Georgetown.
         The roots tour was interesting if not a little commercial though I would still recommend it as everyone who visits The Gambia should learn about the countries history and their people's struggle.
       The 2 day trip to Georgetown was absolutely fantastic and would highly recommend, it was the highlight of our holiday. 
          En-route to Georgetown we visited the local Sunday market at farafenni which was a great experience before heading to the river Gambia national park in which we spotted many variety of bird, monkeys, lots of chimps and 6 hippos!!! 
        The back to basic camp was lovely and situated on a quiet spot on the banks of the river, it was a great place to watch the sun set with a few beers  with lots of monkeys for company! 
        The following morning we had a quick tour around Georgetown before heading back on the return journey. We stopped at a small village off the main road and got to meet all the villagers, the chief and even play some football with the kids. 
        We were then lucky enough to even meet some Senegalese nomads who were walking their cattle from eastern Senegal all the way to the Gambian coast, they warmly  welcomed us into their homes and Simon did a great job of translating for us so we could chat with them. 
       We then stopped for lunch at a beautiful hilltop spot with great views before finally heading back to the hotel. It was a great trip that we'll never forget, thanks Simon 👍

title: Heerlijke ontspannen en relaxte dag op privé boot!
text: Samen met twee vriendinnen boekte we heel gemakkelijk via e-mail contact een Sunset cruise. We werden netjes en op tijd opgehaald bij ons hotel door Saidou (Simon) en zijn driver. Daarna werden we naar Denton Bridge gebracht (de opstapplaats van de boot). Onderweg kochten we nog wat aas om op de boot mee te kunnen vissen + wat drinken voor aan boord. Eenmaal bij de boot aangekomen bleek dat we met z'n drietjes een hele boot voor ons zelf hadden! We hebben heerlijk genoten van deze trip door de mangrove van de Gambia rivier. Bij Lamin Lodge kregen we een heerlijke lunch. De bemanning was ook erg vriendelijk en liet ons lekker ons eigen gangetje gaan. Bij het vissen hielpen ze waar nodig. Kortom, een zeer ontspannen trip, precies wat we nodig hadden! Bedankt Simon Tours!

title: 2 daagse tour
text:
Een geweldige 2 daagse tour over the Gambia river, bezoek lokale markt en bevolking. Gids was Simon die een ontzettende brede kennis heeft wb land, bevolking, fauna en flaura.
Onvergetelijk en zeer zeker aan te raden.

title: uitstekende gids
text:
Wij namen al contact op vanuit België met enkele lokale gidsen waarvan we controleerden of ze in orde waren met de nodige papieren. Van deze gidsen leek Simon ons de meest interessante. Hij was duidelijk in zijn antwoorden, zijn prijzen lagen goed. Wij reserveerden verschillende tours bij hem. Ter plaatse kwam hij de eerste dag langs in ons hotel om de tours af te stemmen op onze wensen en verder af te spreken qua tijdsindeling, zodat we onze 14 dagen vakantie konden opvullen. De tours waren stuk voor stuk aangenaam, met veel uitleg over de plaatselijke gebruiken, gewoontes en wetenswaardigheden. Steeds waren we in kleine groepjes, soms zelfs als enigen. Als we er 1 moeten uitkiezen als hoogtepunt, is dit de 2-daagse reis naar Georgetown met de boottocht door  river park, de overnachting in het camp bij Georgetown en het bezoek aan een plaatselijk schooltje en een stam. Ook hier steekt Simon tours boven de gewone tour-operators uit: hij bezoekt steeds een andere stam zodat iedereen eens een steentje kan meepikken: je hebt immers op voorhand je huiswerk gemaakt en hebt een cadeautje bij voor je gastheer of vrouw: een paar oude kledingstukken of een stuk zeep. Alles wordt met een glimlach in ontvangst genomen.
Op een paar van onze trips hadden we een collega-gids in plaats van Simon mee: Mariama, een aangename jonge vrouw die niet de brede achtergrond van Simon heeft maar ons toch ook voldoende kon vertellen.
We zijn dan ook heel tevreden over de service die we ontvangen. Simon heeft onze vakantie onvergetelijk gemaakt.

title: Great Time in The Gambia with Simon!!!
text: I spent two weeks in the Gambia with my husband in January 2018. As first timers we had no idea as to what expect, so we contacted a few tour operators in advance to get help to organise our time there. Simon was the only one to answer and he answered immediately! We consequently booked 5 tours with Simon-Tours: Abuko and Lamin Lodge, Fathala, Makasutu, two day trip to Georgetown and Roots. We were mostly on our own on these trips and had such a good time. Simon has a lot of information and made sure we got to see other things than just the tourist stuff. Simon was always on time to pick us up, which we appreciated!  Highlights for us was the Sunday market in Farafenni, the boat trip in the Gambia River National Park, the dusty and bumby road in a yellow taxi to get to Kunta Kinteh Island and the island in itself together with Sana, the overnight stay in the basic camp by the river opposite Georgetown with all the monkeys, the ferry form Banjul to Barra to name but a few. I would definitely recommend Simon-Tours for any travelling in the Gambia!

title: Dé gids voor Gambia, van harte aan bevolen door Nicole en Gert-Jan.
text: Na wat zoeken voor een betrouwbare gids in Gambia op internet ben ik bij Simon Tours uitgekomen. Via de mail een afspraak gemaakt bij ons hotel. Bij de live kennismaking meteen al duidelijk dat we hier met een eerlijk en kundig persoon te maken hadden. Uiteindelijk 3 trips gedaan. Twee dagen George town, 1 dag Senegal en dagdeel Paradise beach. Hij is er wanneer je hem nodig hebt, vol informatie en toch ook op de achtergrond. Wat een goede gids en reis(bege)leider. Simon heeft zeker een bijdrage geleverd bij onze positieve kennismaking met dit mooie land met optimistische mensen. Aanrader dus!

title: Great tours
text: We booked with Simon tours for 2 tours. We chose the Makosuto forest walk and the lazy day river cruise. Both tours were very well organised. We had superb guides and the transport was very good quality. Both were good value - compared with the tour operator. On the makosutu forest walk there were 3 of us and on the river cruise just us 2, that meant we had a very personal service that was very much appreciated and superior to other similar tours. Thank you to Simon, the drivers and the guides you all provided a super service, friendly knowledgeable and very personal. Absolutely smashing, I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend.

title: Alles goed geregeld!
text: Via TripAdvisor hebben we Simon tours gevonden. Omdat hij al goede beoordelingen had, hebben we via de mil contact met hem gezocht. Binnen een korte tijd hadden we contact en mailde hij alle beschikbare opties. Er stond al direct bij dat alles mogelijk was! Toen we in Gambia waren spraken we af met Simon in ons hotel. Daar bespraken we wat we wilde gaan doen en zien en welke dagen onze voorkeur hadden. Dat is het fijne aan Simon tours! Zijn flexibiliteit en aanbod! We kozen voor een 2 daagse tour en een dag naar Senegal. Alle dagen waren goed geregeld! Eten was prima onderweg in leuke lokale restaurants. Simon weet de weg en je kan helemaal onbezorgd genieten wat Gambia te bieden heeft. Het voordeel van Simon tours is ook dat je in kleine groepen rijst in plaats van groepen van 20 personen zoals andere maatschappijen doen. Dus heb je interesse in een tour in Gambia..... boek bij Simon Tours!

title: Fijne betrouwbare gids!
text:
We zijn 1 dag op pad geweest met Simon. De South Gambia tour gedaan, erg mooi en de moeite waard! Een hele mooie afwisselende dag. Je gaat in de ochtend naar de Serrekunda market waar iedereen in de ochtend zijn boodschappen doet, we liepen ook door een winkeltje heen en ziet daar hoe o.a. alle pannen, lepels en bedden werden gemaakt. Je komt ook bij de lokale bewoners. Wat leuk is is dat Simon je altijd meeneemt naar een ander gezin waar normaal geen toeristen komen. We hebben geluncht op het mooie stand Paradise beach en om de dag af te sluiten naar het vissersdorpje Tanji geweest. Ook erg bijzonder en mooi om te zien! 
Deze tour is aan te raden en erg leuk om met Simon mee te gaan. Een dagje in de echte wereld van Gambia.

title: Amazing good
text:
We booked 2 tours from The Netherlands before we traveled to The Gambia.
The contact was very pleasant, it felt good.
Simon is always on time to pick you up at the hotel.
He is a Local and knows incredible much about his country.
This are not a standard tours the hostess sells, but tours with lots of infomations about the nature, history, the local people etc.
We had 2 fantastic days and decided to book another tour extra.
Every thing is arragend before you leave in the morning so no time loss.
With Simon Tours we enjoyed The Gambia very good.
Also it is big fun to travel with Simon, lots of humor.
We recomand Simon tours for the whole 100%.
When we go back to The Gambia we will know who to choose as guide.

title: Two day trip
text: Just returned from excellent trip to Georgetown staying overnight in a camp. We met with Simon a couple of days before to choose the trip with no pressure to book. We were collected early from our hotel - the Banjul ferry is the first experience not to be missed followed by lunch at a local restaurant. A boat trip meant seeing chimpanzees, hippos & even a crocodile. The camp was fab, really cute little houses living amongst monkeys etc On the way back we visited proper local villages followed by a visit to the stone circles - a great insight into the real Gambia & Simon is such a nice man who really cares. Would definitely use him again.

title: Perfect
text:
Simon Tours heeft ervoor gezorgd dat onze kennismaking met Gambia perfect was. Eerst de Acclimatization Tour gedaan: o.a. monkeyforest en crocodile pool, daarna een drankje op een heel bijzonder mooie plek. Hele leuke dag en vooral geluk gehad bij de aapjes. Het waren er heel wat.
