Later de tweedaagse Georgetown-tour. Wow! Met een ander stel en weer o.l.v. een super gids het binnenland in. Geen massatoerisme.  Heel speciale plekken bezocht en mensen ontmoet. In dorpen geweest en scholen bezocht. Simontours zorgt ervoor dat niet steeds dezelfde mensen bezocht worden. Neem je iets mee, dan komt het beslist op een goede plek terecht. Ook een heel bijzondere tocht over de Gambia river! Chimpansees, hippo's, natuur! Schitterend.  En overnacht op een super leuke plek. 
Ook de South Gambia tour mag je niet missen! Serrekunda en Tanji, maar ook de mangroves moet je gezien hebben. 
Alle dagen goed verzorgd, frisdrank en water ruimschoots aanwezig onderweg. Perfecte lunchlocaties.  Super aardige begeleiding die ook heel respectvol zijn naar de mensen die je bezoekt.  Kon niet beter. Geen grote touroperator tegengekomen.  
Dankjewel Simon tours! We zullen jullie bij iedereen aanbevelen.

title: Wonderfull experience!
text: We booked the two day tour with Simon and what an experience it was! Simon showed us the real Gambia and took us to great places! We saw Nomads, visited a local village and a school and made a boat trip on the river Gambia. Simon cares about his country and chose to show us local restaurants (with a tremendous view) where other travel companies don't come. When we come back to Gambia, we will definitely make a trip with Simon again. Everything is well arranged and Simon is such a friendly person. Keep up the good work, Simon!

title: Two week holiday in Gambia
text:
Thank you for the best tours in Gambia. We really enjoyed everything and Zack was very intelligent ja friendly guide. We are very happy for everything and recommend Bushwhacker Tours to everyone. 👌☺️

Regards
Tiina and Veera
Finland

title: Goed geïnformeerd en persoonlijk. Tours met kleine autoipv bus
text: Zeker aan te raden. Vanuit ons hotel hebben ze een van de jongens van bushwacker gebeld. Hij kwam bij ons langs. Kantoortje zit op Senegambia strip. De prijzen zijn iets lager dan bij bijv via de organisatie die Corendon adviseerde. En bij BW ga je in kleine groepjes(bovenstaande ging met een bus) wij gingen paar keer met z'n tweetjes. Gids weet veel en was in voor gesprekken over van alles echt heel leuk.

title: Perfect cocktail of interesting Gambian landmarks
text:
A very knowledgeable guide and driver do their very best to take you to very interesting landmarks. A custom made additional visit to a local school gave us the chance to support the children with very useful schoolmaterial. To be guided on Serrekunda market and the most important Fish Factory at the coastside was an absolute topper as it opened many doors for making interesting pictures.
A very worthwile tour with a lot of highlights which we will always remember.
Thank you for that.

title: Lazy days trip
text: Thank you zak for another amazing trip.. as always your knowledge  is vast and your personality  shines. .. thank you for  making our trip perfect  x

title: Great two days trip to Tendaba and Bitong
text:
During my holidays in Gambia in November 2016 , I found an office of Bushwacker Tour.
Me and my wife went on a two-days trip with them to Tendaba and Bitong .During the 
tour our guide Zaka showed the great knowledge about the nature in Gambia, as well as local traditions and professionalism. It was one of the best trips of mine that I have ever taken part at. We are very grateful  for the great time together and we would like to recommend this company to everyone .
Grazyna and Witold

title: Thank you zac
text:
Your heart , passion and love for The Gambia shines on your tours we had an excellent time and learned so much as you shared your knowledge with us during the tours Linda and I can't thank you enough and look forward to next year . I hope anyone travelling to The Gambia reads this review and books with you they will not be disappointed

See you and The Gambia again soon 

Linda and christopher 😁😎🇸🇳

title: Great to go local
text:
Having read the great reviews here, on arrival in Gambia we spurned the Thomas Cook tours and walked into the office of Bushwackers on the Senegambia Strip. Instantly made welcome and arranged a Roots tour with our guide Zack. Prompt pick up from the hotel, (not Gambia Maybe Time...) and soon we were on our way up the river to the villages of Albreda and Juffureh. Zack could not have been more helpful or informative, as throughout the day we had our own guide whereas the TC group had 1 guide for 20 tourists.
We were so pleased we then booked a jeep safari. There were some sights that we had already visited and Zack spent time creating a tailor-made tour for us. The day was amazing, including a bee farm, oyster farm, Lamin lodge, a batik factory, a boat trip through the mangroves where Zack identified dozens of bird varieties for us, and of course a meal on Paradise Beach.
I would strongly recommend Bushwackers, keep your money with the locals

title: Open Top Jeep - Paradise Beach
text: Spoke with Zack on the Senegambia Strip who explained UK tours take the money out of Gambia but local tours are for local people so we chose to book 2 tours with local guides. Zack gave us full information on what was available during our stay and he was our tour guide for our chosen tour (Open top jeep), where we did a lot of varied things in one day (Crocodile pool, markets, Food on paradise beach to name a few) all by open-top jeep. Zack was very professional and educated at every stage. Id definitely recommend Bushwhackers! Hope to see you all again in the future!

title: Kunta Kinteh
text: Been out for the Kunta Kinteh tour with Lamin the tour guide. He was very knowledgeable and polite. Couldn't fault him or the tour. Would recommend Bushwacker Tours to anyone planning an excursion from Kololi.

title: The Gambia Experience!
text:
We decided to use a local tour company rather than use the one offered by Thomas Cook and used Bushwacker Tours twice. We went to Fathula park in Senegal and the River Routes boat trip which involved a walk around a village and James island. On both trips we were cared for by our guide, Lamin, who was a fantastic guide, so friendly and fun. He knew a lot about all the places we saw and their history and made us feel very welcome.
Fathula park is a long journey and really great value, we were lucky to see amazing animals including rhino, warthog, zebra and antelope. 
I would definitely recommend using this tour company to book your trips, there were many more available but unfortunately we were only there a week. Perfect excuse to come back ;)

title: Lamin Ceesay made our holiday
text:
We have returned home from our first trip to The Gambia with a third son! Lamin has become like part of our family. From our first trip out with him to James Island for the Roots tour to saying bye on our last day he was wonderful. Stopped in the strip with his catchy greeting and request to spare 5 minutes to listen to him explain the tours, he was professional from start to finish. We had arrived in The Gambia with sweets, balls, crayons and paper for the children in the poorer villages and Lamin was a great help here

. The tours are amazing value, especially the 4x4 adventure which at £40 each for the full day was almost too cheap. We visited the serekunda market, livestock market, crocodile pools ( so much better than I was led to believe, many crocs to touch, not just one!) Lamin Lodge where my husband had to fend off a green velvet monkey who wanted our doughnuts, Paradise beach for lunch and a sunbathe and the fishing village of Tanje. What a day! Lamin had also stopped off to allow us to share some of the goodies we had for the children which was an emotional experience. If you do visits please at least bring some balloons or pencils and sweets. some of these children have nothing and these are a real treat. 
We also booked another 2 trips with Bushwacker, the evening cruise along by the river Gambia which was very romantic as we saved it for valentines evening. All in all I can only say we were spoilt. We were so well looked after and learnt so much we really felt we had got to know this beautiful country. Lamin answered all our many questions and was faultless. His driver was als very good and we always felt safe. I could ramble on ...... Lol!

title: Zack the best
text: Can't praise Zack enough, he is a very knowledgable person and also made my experiences on both our trips excellent as I have walking difficulties and Zack helped me to get on and off boats ,jeeps etc. I can highly recommend both the Roots and the Senegal trips, At the safari park and the walking with Lions (totally amazing) Thankyou Zack  Ina and Ronnie

title: river cruise
text: we went on the river cruise it was a wonderfull day,the crew and guide were very helpful and friendly.We had some great food that was cooked on the boat.Also we cought some fish.A very informative and organized tour company,Christine and Rob

title: Proffessional, Fun and Guaranteed Memories
text:
Though we decided to do a lot of the more local attractions via bush taxi and a trusty guide we met on our first day. We decided it sensible to go to the Fathala Nature Reserve in North Senegal, with Bushwhacker, mainly for peace of mind.

I'm glad to say that at no point did we regret this decision! The trip to Fathala is not simple, it requires a transfer to Banjul, a busy passenger ferry, transfer to another vehicle; a busy border crossing and the small matter of driving around a massive park surrounded by wild animals.

Our trusty guide Lamin though, did this all in his stride; we were very well protected whilst navigating every part of this journey, he was fun, had a wealth of knowledge and was a constant source of conversation about everything and anything all the way to Senegal and back.

I would always suggest varying your experience in the Gambia, by taking a stride in the shoe of a range of locals. However, for assured safety, enjoyment for we felt was a fair price, I would always recommend this cheerful, Gambian run tour company. Thank you:)

title: 100% Recommend
text: Just back from our holiday to Gambia, where we chose to use bushwackers to do the Janjanbureh trip and the gambia river cruise. Zak was our guide on both trips and truly went above and beyond to make sure everything was to our satisfaction and made sure we enjoyed ourselves. His knowledge and passion for gambia is inspirational. The two drivers used for the trips Sanna and Lamine were excellent drivers and made all car journeys smooth and safe. The trip to Janjanbureh had so much to do and we always had enough time to complete it at our own pace. I would highly recommend this trip and even more so with bushwackers as the attention to detail is more than you could ever expect. All meals were great and plenty of drink was available and offered constantly throughout the trip. The river cruise was a lovely lazy cruise with space to enjoy the sun, plenty of chances to give fishing a go and even sample what you have caught, a chance to swim in the Creek and excellent food cooked on board as well as drinks offered through the day again. When I return to gambia I will most definitely book all my future tours with these guys and highly recommend giving them a go!! Thanks to bushwackers for making our holiday so much better!

title: Great staff and beautiful trip
text: We took a sunset & dinner boat trip with Bushwhackers from Oyster Creek to Lamin Lodge. Bushwhackers staff Lamin and Zak were great - friendly and professional, very knowledgeable about birds and nature, history, culture and they looked after us very well. The cook managed to rustle up a remarkably good feast from a tiny kitchen and the bar was stocked with beer, wine, soda. Beautiful peaceful river scenes, interesting to see the mangroves and Lamin lodge is well worth a visit - a former colonial lodge turned scooby doo ghost house!

title: More than 10 excursions with Bushwhacker Tours, all excellent, not once disappointed!!
text:
We have visited the Gambia 4 times in the past 15 years. Since our first visit, we neglected the dishonest advice of the big travel-agents for not using local guides, and decided to do our excursions with local tour guides. 
In that way we met Alieu Bayo, the founder of Bushwhacker tours. They are our preferred Gambian tour agency because they really care for their customers and their personell. 
Bushwacker tours is charging less than the bigger travel agencies and/or offer more service like food and drinks included. Insurance is also included, but we never needed it. 
We always travelled just the two of us or combined with another couple, mostly in an open jeep. Because it is such a small group, we feel free to ask more than we would do in a large group. There is much more interaction and we learn more about the Gambia in that way. Besides that the guides are well trained and can answer nearly every question. Bushwacker tours can also offer bird watching trips with excellent bird specialist as tour guide.
Jan and Petra van den Munckhof, Nijmegen, Netherlands

title: fishing in Gambia
text: A great day fishing among the  mangroves,boat was spacious,and in good  condition,staff very friendly and were great at helping bait our hooks. food was gambian,and very tasty. thank you lamin for a great time

title: Bushwhaker Family
text:
Been there done that got the t-shirt second trip with bushwhaker fantastic guides and drivers.
Great experience a MUST when coming to Gambia......

title: Geweldige ervaring met Bushwackers
text: Ben nu 6 keer in Gambia geweest en heb iedere keer contact gehad met bushwackers in kololi.Heb ook iedere keer diverse tours met hun gemaakt,en het mooiste is nog steeds Fatala park in Senegal waar je kunt dollen met de leeuwen.Ik ga eind van het jaar weer terug en zal zeker weer met hun enkele trips maken.

title: Walking with Lions
text: A very enjoyable day with a lot of memories to takeaway. Arch tours provided a fab team for the day which included Fanta and Mo who were professional and well informed on The Gambia. Walking with the lions is an amazing experience which I encourage all to do. Keep up the good work!

title: Superb time
text: We went to see some brilliant animals and mammals,ive seen quite a few wild animals close up,first time seeing rhino thou,fantastic

title: Niokolo kuba national park senegal
text:
A great experience to go on an authenic african safari! this is so different from the fathala park. Here the animals still live in the wild and its always a suprise what you will get to see ! Arch tours is a great company, the director Lamin is very helpfull and he speaks perfect english. We made our own itinery and he even did his research and give some extra services and activities added to the tour. the driver thomas is a good skilled driver he took a long drive and still kept us safe the whole time! also abdou our guide whas very funny and it whas easy to translate from english to france it whas very helpfull on our journey. the lodge that we stayed overnight whas amazing with tradional round huts live enterainment and incredible views over the river, we loved it so much. included in the prices whas: safari, guide, food and drinks, visa, waterfall visit, and tribe visit, transport. Love to come back one day and explorer more of gambia and senegal!

we loved the services of the company and the lovely staff i would really recommand this company to anyone!

title: Senegalin Fathala Arch Toursin matkassa
text: Gambian lomamatkamme kohokohta oli päiväretki Abdulin ja Davidin matkassa Senegaliin. Arvostan pientä ryhmää (7 hlö) ja huolehtivaisia oppaitamme. Jo pelkkä Gambi-joen ylitys Barraan lautalla oli elämys paikallisten joukossa, avolava-autolla läpi Senegalin rajakylien ja perillä Fathalassa näimme kaikki eläimet mitä nähtävissä oli. Pikku seepra ja kirahvi olivat suosikkini. Retki oli loistavasti järjestetty, saimme aamupalaa lautalla, lounaan Fathalassa sekä kylmiä juomia matkan varrella. Abdul johdatti meidät sujuvasti lauttamatkat ja Senegalin rajamuodollisuudet. Lämmin kiitos hienosta päivästä!

title: Wasted evening
text:
Booked Arch tours for their sunset cruise, should have been £55 pp paid £45pp.
No problem with staff all very attentive.
Problems started with the boat, do not know how it was still afloat, toilet was a disgrace, general state of the boat was very poor. No where to sit on upper deck if you wanted to risk going up, no safety talk no life jackets nofirst aid kit
Trip on the river was o/k but if you are not into birds you will be bored for 2 hours
Sun set was very good.
Then we stopped at Lamin Lodge for evening buffet, not the lodge I remember it was very run down, poor lighting considering the floor is very uneven, toilets were disgusting, filthy, to flush you filled a bucket with river water? There were black bugs all over the toilets.
The buffet was awful consisting of
Salad?
Rice 
Noodles
Some type of red sauce
Chicken on the bone
Baracuda 
I was up all night with D and V
The journey back to our accomodation was an experience,  in a open sided canvas roof land rover with the exhaust fumes coming in.
All in all a very poor trip, even if the food, boat and the lodge had been o/k the all round trip was not worth the full price of £55 pp.
Typical Gambia,  very over priced trips using third rate equipment.
There are lots of companies offering trips, choose with care

title: Do NOT go on Roots River Cruise
text:
We have used Arch tours regularly during our 3 trips to Gambia over the last 4 years. Previous experiences of Arch have been outstanding.....including the Georgetown trip we did with them a few days pre the river cruise.
To start with the less important issue re the river cruise.....our tour guide was Mo. He was 'invisible' to us for virtually the whole trip - he made no effort to build a rapport with us and never once spoke to us to see how our trip was going and whether we had any questions etc. This is unusual for Arch, normally the guides integrate with their clients and stick closely with them.
However the most important issue re this tour, was the lack of seaworthiness of the vessel used. To cut a long story short, the boat (carrying 65 European passengers) broke down on the cruise outwards to Juffreh/Albreda and had to be partly towed by a small pirogue with an outboard motor. This was just a foretaste of what was to come.
On the return journey, the boat broke down again (we were already nearly 2 hours behind schedule).....darkness was falling and we were 'marooned' in a choppy sea 5/6 miles firm Banjul port - virtually at the mid point of the river as it flows into the Atlantic.
We broke down around 6-45pm and after nearly an hour of indecision, the captain called for a navy rescue. Darkness had fallen and there was a massive lack of communication from the crew and our Tour Guide....most of the crew 'hid' down below or in the wheelhouse.
A navy cutter/ gunboat was sent out to us - it couldn't find us. Our boat had no signalling equipment to aids the Gambian navy-- the Captain resorted to using his mobile phone as a means of attracting the attention of the naval vessel!!
It took the Gambian navy vessel over 3 hours to get to us...at around 10-15pm.
Regrettably the Captain decided to open a free bar when he could sense the anger of the passengers--this was a grave error of judgment. A number of (unfortunately British) middle aged men decided to over indulge (after a day of drinking anyway) and I had a particularly nasty encounter with one individual who used extremely foul language to me for not getting out of his way quickly enough on his way to the toilet. This was in front of a couple if elderly ladies.
The Gambian navy arrived and quite quickly took control- we donned lifejackets and it took over an hour to tow us back to Banjul. We finally got back to our hotel at 11-30pm.
The boat apparently had broken down 3 or 4 times over the previous month and was obviously not fixed properly and was completely unseaworthy and illprepared for the emergency that befell us. The boat is over 40 years old, showed signs of botched cosmetic repair and would have been condemned in a more health and safety conscious country.
Arch tours have told me they will not be using this boat again (by the way it's the only one that does this river cruise) and will be doing the Roots trip overland from now on.
Please boycott this tour if it involves this boat - it is owned by a Spanish person apparently.
I wish I could be more positive about Arch Tours, because they have been great in the past....but they put us on this tour and it is therefore their responsibility to ensure the safety and well-being of their clients.

ownerResponse.text:
Hello Sir/Madam
Thank you for the feedback.
I am deeply sorry for what happened on the roots river cruise the last time.We are also very pleased that you enjoyed the 2 days Georgetown trip.
First of all,the invisibllity of our rep Mo was due to the ongoing problems of the boat and he had little time to interact with the guests.He was at the time of the incident busy on the microphone  at the captain’s cabin trying to update people on the boat about the intervention of the Gambian navy.Everybody was in a state of despair when the engined stopped in the middle of nowhere and he along with some of the other reps from other tour companies were busy helping the the shipmen to fix the machine but their help was fruitless.
There were 70 passengers on the boat and it was dark to see anything.All the lights on the boat were off so he couldn’t trace the two of you because it was very dark to see a thing.He called to me to inform me that he can’t find you.Again he later called and said he has found you.Actually the captain was seen nowhere and it was Mo who in fact rang the Navy to get rescued because the Navy said that they weren’t even aware of  what was happening meaning the captain didn’t call them.
It was state of Chaos and the guides were busy making arrangements to get rescued and we are very sorry for the little interaction you had with him.
Except the two of you, we fully refunded  the other 6 people all the money they paid for the trip because it isn’t worth it.You came to the office and narrated the story  and I later went to your hotel to see you but couldn’t see you.
Actually the boat is used by all tour agents in The Gambia since it is the only boat here.It is our job to ensure the safety and security of the tourists we take on trips .Be that as it may,WE WILL NOT BE DOING THE ROOTS BY BOAT except we have a new tourist boat in The Gambia.The lives of the people we take on trips matters the most and we won’t take any risk in the name of business or making money.So for now,we can only do the ROOTS BY LAND for safety reasons.This won’t happen again.Nothing will be missed out since it is the same slave villages and slave island you will be visiting.

Once again,we are really sorry for the incident and we hope to see you again to please you once more.Thank you

title: Senegal Tour
text:
Did a fascinating excursion into Senegal  with driver Solomon and guide Abdul.     What a tour including a good lunch
We did our tour as aa couple in a jeep alone.   Great

title: Great Day Out
text:
Booked this tour in the UK based on previous reviews.
We booked the 4 in 1 tour costing £55 per head and only had to pay for the trip on the morning of the tour. All soft drinks and lunch included)
Opportunity to experience a taste of Gambia in one day.
Picked up from the hotel on time in an open top Jeep. 
Took a walk through Serekunda market, haggled for some local products, took in the the hustle and bustle of the Serekunda vast market.
Then went on to Kachikally crocodile pool were we got up close and personal actually touching the backs of the crocs - thankfully they are all fish eaters!! Great photo opportunity.
Brief stop at the cattle market before heading off to Lamin Lodge for a coffee break with freshly made donut balls, yummy
We stoped at a local school and where given a warm welcome by the children and teachers then went on to visit local village family to learn how they lived and daily Gambian life.
From here we we travelled to paradise beach for lunch and spent a few hours on the beach (lunch, soft drinks and sun beds included)
Our final stop was Tanji fish market to see the vast array of freshly caught fish and the processing of them.
From the colourful fishing boats to the vast number of people buying selling, processing fish, maintaining nets and boats. We even witnessed a wrestling match on the beach ( a show of strength) which all made for a great day.
All of this would not have been brought to life without our fantastic guides Moh and Fanta whose knowledge and enthusiasm where outstanding and truly brought The Gambia to life and made this day an unforgettable one for us.
Thanks guys

title: BEST TRIP COMPANY !!!!
text: we only went on 4 in 1 trip in Gambia, nut it was WOW!!!! this is best trip to see, feel all Gambia, best guides, best service,  a lot of information provided about Gambia and visited places, with fun, free drinks service in jeep, free lunch included. JUST BEST BEST BEST !!!!!

title: South Gambia - Full day
text: Surrounded with beautiful smiles, me and my girlfriend had a great time on a tour around Gambia's points of interest. Sanna and Fanta picked us at the hotel and we head straight to check the crocodiles. Fanta is a very talkative girl, with a very strong and nice personality. Sanna is always ready with a smile and jokes. We went to the market and had an impressive local experience of colors, smells and also tastes. There is where the action is, and I can guess there is not much photos of this experience, as Gambia people are not very fond of cameras. We had lunch on Paradise beach in a beautiful place where we could also experience the sand wrestlers. We were also in a huge fish market, where we were in the middle of thousands of people. Always with the nice company of Fanta and Sanna. They deserve to grow as tourism professionals. They knew very well how to take care of us.

title: Must book!
text:
Four friends and i booked two tours with arch tours. The first tour was the "four tours in one" option. This took us to the Serrekunda market, the crocodile pool,the livestock market, lamin lodge(with fantastic donuts!), a government run school, a family's house, paradise beach and the fish market. The tour was so eye opening and diverse but what made this trip was talking to the guides Lamin, Fanta and Sanna. Their knowledge about the Gambia and their fantastic personalities definately made this trip unforgettable.
The next day we travelled to Senegal to the Fathala national park. We got up early and drove to the ferry where we travelled over to Senegal. We crossed the border and within a very short space of time had seen a rhino, zebras, giraffes, warthogs and many different antelope. We enjoyed the company of our guides on the previous day so much that we were initially disappointed to not see them on our trip to Senegal but our guide Sheriff proved to be just as professional and knowledgeable about the area. He made the border crossing as easy as possible and ensured that we beat the queue for all of the crossings and felt safe at all times. He had a great sense of humour and made sure that we all enjoyed the whole journey. It was so interesting to talk to all of the guides and learn about their lives and the Gambia and Senegal. We all thoroughly enjoyed our time with Arch tours and would recommend anyone visiting the Gambia to book with them.

title: Fathala naturreservat - Senegal
text:
Udflugt til naturreservat i Senegal - safaritur i reservatet hvor vi var så heldige at opleve og se giraffer, vildsvin, aber, næsehorn, krokodille osv.
En stor oplevelse, som jeg godt kan anbefale videre

title: Leuke volle dag
text: Wij deden de 4 in 1 tour met Fanta en Sanna. Leuke jonge mensen die veel weten! Wij hadden bijna niets voor de kids mee genomen wat ik zelf heel jammer vond omdat je ze daar onwijs blij mee maakt maar ook aandacht zorgde voor een lach op hun gezicht. Ik zal adviseren schriftjes, pennen, speelgoed en geen lollies die ze overal verkopen. We hebben veel gedaan en lekker in een open truc rond gereden. Zeer afwisselend programma en je leert veel over het land. We zijn bij een familie op bezoek geweest, markt, vissers aan het werk gezien, krokodillen, strand en zelfs Afrikaans worstelen. We waren in totaal met z'n 3en, 2 gidsen en de chauffeur! Zeker de moeite waard!

title: Excellent service
text:
Sunset cruise

Great little evening trip, very relaxing down the river, nice sunset and we even had the boat to ourselves!

Great guide (Dawda), informative and friendly throughout.

Food at the end was in a unique location and a nice finish to the evening.

title: South Senegal Tour
text:
Great day our! I can imagine this is a less popular tour than the northern Senegal tour but it was well worth it and very ‘different’ to a normal trip!

Great guide and driver (as always from Arch tours), informative, aware and helpful through the day. Abdula was our guide and was excellent.

Great seeing local markets and the hustling fishing area, getting a real feel for the Senegal coastal towns. Relaxing boat trip up to the island and the farms you visit were definitely something you’d not stumble across at home!

Would recommend and again, we would also recommend our guide Abdula!

When visiting the island, would be great for people to bring a few bits for the children who live there. Wished we’d known this in advance!

I even left a beer in the cooler, had a knock at my hotel door a few hours after arriving home and they’d brought it to the hotel for me, typical of the great Gambian people!

title: The best tour company in Gambia
text:
We arrived in Gambia and went to the Arch Tours office, were we met Mr Conteh, the owner of Arch Tours. We booked the North Senegal one day tour (Fathala safari) and the 4 tours in 1 trip. 

Fathala trip - we thoroughly enjoyed this trip. It is an action packed day full of adventure. We seen all the animals available and did the 'lion walk at the safari park. please note that this is optional and costs £25 payable on the day but this is clearly explained and well worth the money. The animals are not drugged and very alert with a unique bond with the rangers/trainers making it possible.

4 tours in 1 trip - another action packed day! The school visit and family home visit were our highlights here. The guides makes you feel safe. Please bring stationary for the local school as they are very appreciative. Also, please bring a gift for the family visit - they are inviting you to their home and showing you around, so it is only courtesy. you visit the market in the morning and I bought a 25kg bag of rice (around £10) for the family. they were very emotional as it would feed them all for 2 weeks!

PLEASE READ THIS NEXT PART - the TWO main reasons to choose Arch Tours is the personalized small groups and the friendly guides! The Gambia Experience are a larger company that offer similar tours at a similar price - PICK ARCH TOURS - we often passed The Gambia Experience tours and they had large groups in seated vans. With Arch Tours we were a group of 2 on the first trip and a group of 4 on the second. It really makes it a very special experience. Now the guides, Sheriff was our guide for the Fathala trip and he was a pleasure. So enthusiastic to explain local culture and keen to make the trip special for us. As it was the two of us and Sheriff, by the end of the tour we were all like best pals! On the 4 tours in 1 - Sanna, Ayesha and Soloman (driver) were our guides. What a pleasure they were. Sanna was special - like Sheriff, he was so keen to give you the 'local' experience made our trip extra special. Ayesha  - what a girl she is. Full of energy and enthusiasm and an incredibly infectious laugh. Soloman was the driver and in charge of 'Solomans bar'  - always making sure you are well hydrated with a selection of water and soft drinks.

The guides are what differentiate Arch Tours from its rivals. It is a local family business and deserving on your custom. When I return to Gambia I will be returning to Arch Tours as we wanted to do more but were only there for 1 week!

Thanks for an unforgettable experience, I hope the owner, Mr Conteh, knows how lucky he is to have staff like Sheriff, Sanna, Ayesha and Soloman working for him.  

Richard and Lois

title: Great trips!!!!
text:
Booked two trips with Arch Tours the Roots by boat and Fort Bullen (with village trip) and received a half day free to Banjul and markets.   We had 3 separate guides, Fanta, Dave and Mo all were incredibly friendly and knew their information about everything!!!  A special thanks to Mo for his trip to the village where we were able to meet and help a local family who even gave us breakfast!!!
Dave always had time for us even when we walked past on an evening and went out of his way to say hello and make us feel welcome
Lamin who we think is the owner was great at giving us advise on which trip to book and was extremely thorough with his nformation and guidance on what was best for what we wanted to see

Thank you guys for making our trip so memorable and amazing!!!!

title: wild trip
text: went on 2 trips with Arch Tours the first was to Marakissa  with Dauda our guide for the day must  say he knew his birds , went down river in a canoe first of all and then for a walk,  seen a lot of colourful birds .Then we  had lunch  and sat watching all the birds around restaurant.  Next we  went over -night to Georgetown had a great trip  seeing Hippos and Crocs on theGambia lots of Birds to. Stayed in the Camp overnight and that was an experience,  lovely meal then we had local Dancers to entertain us another great trip thanks to Arch Tours and I will send pictures to Dauda.  Bye for now

title: Safari
text: What a fab day we had. The guide was very informative,  the ferry was a real slice of Gambian  life. The walk with the lion's  was a highlight of our holiday, a day to remember.  Thank you. Highly recommend  this. We have booked for the Roots river tour with them next week.

title: Great trips
text: Booked 2 trips with Arch Tours the Roots and the 4 in 1.  Both trips where excellent and value for money.   We where very lucky on the way back from the Roots trip we saw loads of dolphins.  We had Sherif as our main guide in the 4 in 1 trip but Dave also cane with us on both trips and he was really great and  a good friend.  Would recommend Arch Tours.

title: Lams Day Trips
text:
We Booked 2 trips, Fathala and Birds and Breakfast with Lams before we left the UK. We also arranged for Lams to take us to the Chimpanzee Rehabilitation Centre for an over night stay. We received Emails confirming these within hours. Once we arrived in Gambia we messaged Lams and arranged a meeting for the next morning. Once we met Lams we knew our trips would be exactly we wanted and we weren't let down. Our transport was always on time (Mostly early) and we always felt safe with the driving (a bonus in Gambia).The guides were all very knowledgeable especially Abdoule on his remarkable ability to find the most elusive birds! so much so we organised a extra trip with him to a Nature reserve.
We felt so much at home with Lams that we arranged to go on the Roots James Island tour a long day but well worth it.
Would highly recommend and will be using them on our next visit

text: Vi var i Gambia i januari i år och bokade tre utflykter med Lams. title: Fatala Safari
text:

The safari itself was great and we got to see Rhino, Giraffes etc well worth a visit.

title: Brilliant service
text: We researched tour guides & services before leaving for The Gambia & opted for Lams. So glad we did as his service is exceptional - we used his services twice for 2 bespoke journeys. First was to collect us from Banjul airport as we landed & get us to Fathala Reserve in Senegal for a 3 day stay & then collect us again & return to Senegambia. We could never have undertaken this journey on our own, especially with the ferry across the river. Second was a day out to Tanji & then on to a very secluded beach - what a brilliant day, so perfect.  On both tours we had the expert services of Lam's top man Bakary - a lovely guy who couldn't do enough to help us. Very reliable & flexible to accommodate whatever you fancy doing.  Many thanks Lam & Bakary for looking after us so well

title: An amazing experience
text: We booked a visit to Fatala park with Lam’s and I can’t recommend them highly enough. The guides couldn’t have done more to help and the courtesy and welcome we received was exemplary. There is much poverty in Gambia yet so much dignity and warmth from our hosts. This, rather than the safari itself, was what made the experience so humbling and life-affirming. I left feeling we, as a nation, have a great deal to learn about what truly matters in life in our current mean-spirited national discourse.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours

title: Lams Tours
text:
My husband and I have just returned from our first trip to The Gambia. After researching the area and what there was to do I found Lams Tours recommended by others and again after researching Lams as much as I could I made contact with him directly several weeks before we travelled. Lams responded very quickly to emails and efficiently to all questions I had and I booked the Fathala Reserve and 4WD Tours (no need for payment in advance). Once we arrived and settled in we went round to Lams to check our booking and make payment. We were greeted by Ismaila who was very friendly and welcoming, a receipt for payment and a pick up time from your hotel is provided (all above board), we also met Lams too... nice man with a great sense of humour.

The Trips...
Fathala Reserve
A really good day and worth every penny. Ismaila was our guide for the day and really did look after us. Be ready for an early start (6:30am), pick up from the hotel and taken to the port for the crossing to Senegal. There were just ourselves and another couple and Ismaila made sure he kept us together, sorted tickets, boarding, currency and got us through borders. Once at the reserve we were also joined by a ranger who gives a full commentary as your driven around looking for the animals. There was a stop for refreshments and after the safari we had lunch (food and drinks included), then it's back to catch the ferry home.
You don't need to take anything with you other than a camera but i would recommend sun cream and bug spray.

4WD
Just my husband and I on this one, pick up from our hotel was at 9:00am.
WOW This trip is amazing, definitely value for money and a real insight to the Gambian way of life. The day is packed from beginning to end, firstly off to the monkey park with our guide Ousman and driver Bob (we had read to take nuts for them...The monkeys not guides! :) but there is no need they were also provided), a good walk around with everything explained along the way and plenty of interaction with the monkeys, we didn't feel rushed to leave. Then to the crocodile park and met with their guide who walked us around, helped us interact with the crocodiles and answered all questions. We then opted just to drive through the market rather than walk (not keen shoppers) but a real insight to the hustle and bustle of everyday life. On to the batik factory where you witness and can have a go at wax dying materials and the option to purchase items, Ousman helped with translation but you haggle your own price.
Off we went again, stopping to buy pens, books, sweets and rice before visiting a local family. They were kind enough to let us visit their home and talk to us about their way of living.
We then went onto Paradise beach for the option to swim and lunch (provided), before visiting a local school. Finally on our way home we visited the fish market and smoke house.
All in all a packed day full of emotions, led by brilliant guides who look after you well and are concerned for your welfare, intent on making sure you get the best experience.
I would suggest for this trip you take a camera, sun cream, and money.

Apart from the tours Lams is also a small bar where you can buy drinks at half the price of the hotel and sit chatting with locals, they also do money exchange at a better rate than the hotel and not that we tried it but I'm sure we will when we go back again, they offer airport transfers.

I am so glad that we opted to use local people for our tours and not be put off by our tour operator. I definitely recommend without hesitation.

Lams you have an excellent team working with you, keep up the good work and we hope to be back next year. Thank you Ismaila and Ousman for making our holiday a truly amazing experience xx

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours

title: If you want to see gambia this is the place to go
text:
me and my wife have just arrived home from our first vist to the gambia (we are already looking at going back)my wife researched things to do for our first trip and found lams tours on trip advisor and wow im so glad she did they are excellent....we booked 2 trips the 1st was to fathala wildlife reserve which was an amazing day our guide smiley(he really is a very happy young man)made the trip very enjoyable and one we will never forget.....thank you smiley and see you again next year

the second trip was the 4x4 we got picked up by our guide ousman and our driver bob we then headed to the monkey park where ousman took us to feed the monkeys this was an amazing experince in itself i never dreamed i would feed a monkey....next we went to the crocodille park(must admit i was a bit nervous of this)but i got to stroke a crocodile i must of been crazy but im glad i did....after this ousman took us to a craft market where we looked around and brought some gifts from the local traders...we was never hasseled into buying any goods....we then went to visit a local family living in very poor conditions this was a very humbling experience this family had no food yet could still smile(we left this family with a bag of rice and tears in my wifes eyes)we then made our way to paradise beach and had our lunch this place was amazing.....we then made our way to a local school to donate some books and pens..and the last part of our trip was the fish market which was very intresting...all in all i can truley say that these trips will be forever in my memory the guides are excellent and truley have a great passion for there country and what they do...so thank you lams tours and a massive thank you to ousman and smiley who really made our holiday so special

these are a few pictures of our trips sorry ousman but i did say i would put your picture on trip advisor

title: Gives You Perspective
text:
You will have to bear with me as I was 10 or under when I visited The Gambia and have no idea if this was who we did the day tour with but I remember visiting the Crocodile Pit and at the time there was a really big Croc you were able to go up to and stroke although a have a memory of it potentially being so old that it was blind and had all of its teeth pulled out so it couldn't bite anyone but don't quote me on that as it is an old memory.

We may of also visited a fish market and I remember being on the back of a Land Rover with lots of little kids running after us and we gave them sweets, I think you were asked to or given an option of bringing old clothes and sweets to give to them.

I try not to but when I think of the little kids It makes me feel ashamed that some people have nothing and yet are so pleasant and all I want are "things" I don't mean to be a bleeding heart but it certainly gives you perspective, I believe. Its that long ago that I have an actual photograph of me with that Croc, way before the digital revolution.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours

title: Lams Tours
text:
Myself and my partner have just had a week staying in the Kombo Beach Hotel. We looked at trip advisor before we traveled and saw that Lams Tours came highly recommended and was very close to the hotel. 

We emailed Lams and booked two tours. The Fathala Reserve Tour and the 4WD. The communication from Lams was excellent and everything was booked in before we left the UK. All our questions and emails were replied to very quickly. 

One of the guides, Ousman took us on our Fathala trip. The trip was amazing, picked up on time, cold drinks provided and an excellent home cooked Chicken Yassa for lunch together with freshly baked bread sourced on route. Ousman arranged the boarder crossings seamlessly. Along with the Driver and the personal guide at Fathala they went out of their way to find and make sure we saw all the animals in the reserve. Ousman and the drivers we had on the day were perfect. They were very friendly and excellent drivers and guides. 

Bakery was the guide that took us for our 4WD tour. This again was amazing, picked up on time and cold drinks throughout the day. The monkey park was brilliant, Bakery provided monkey nuts to feed the monkeys which were extremely friendly and happy to sit on your shoulders. We then visited the crocodiles and did not expect to be up so close and even get to stroke them. We had a very tasty lunch at paradise beach, picking anything we wanted off an extensive menu, which was all included in the price. The family visit was enjoyable and very humbling. Be sure to take plenty of lollipops and sweets for all the children. Bakery and the Driver were brilliant all day long.

Lams tours is located in the market place just round from Kombo Beach, they have a small bar inside Lams which serves drinks for half the price of the hotels. We were made so welcome here and had a great time having a few drinks with the staff. 

All the staff at Lams tours are amazing and friendly. The tours were cheaper with Lams than with the tour operators and you get the added local touch which really made our trips. Plus it was just us and the guide rather than being packing in a bus. We saw many trucks driving around Fathala with 8 or more people in the back, it was just us 2 on our trip and it was cheaper and much better. 

We can not recommend enough.

title: Great Tour, Great Price
text:
I went to the village of Jufureh Albreda and Kunta Kente Island with Lams Tours. 

I have always wanted to retrace the same steps as Alex Haley in his search for his roots.

It was a full days journey that included ferry and a long drive along a dirt trail road.  

I  felt very safe throughout the trip and they catered to all my needs including stopping the vehicle so that I could take photos of the breathtaking African landscape.

There is a bar just outside Lams which serves the cheapest Jul beer in Kotu. This is where tourists in the know come to drink. Don’t be intimidated by the men sat outside.

They all have a purpose to work and this is their local too. You can strike good conversation with them and learn much about the country. They are warm as are most Gambians, and they are generous to a fault and will give you their last morsel of food. 

I was lucky to drop by on their lunch break and be offered to join them. Best food I have ever tased in Gambia.
