title: Tailor made day trip
text:
We were approached by a Bushwhacker agent on the Senegamiba Strip in Kololi. He explained about Bushwhacker and the tours they provide.
We had only one possible day left to book a tour in our holiday, which was exactly this day.

Given what we had already seen and still were going to see, he tailored a 4x4 day trip for us to the rural villages, to see the life in rural Gambia, the Paradise Beach for lunch and relaxation, and to the Tanji fish market.

Half an hour later, we were picked up at the hotel by guide Lamin and the driver.

Lamin showed told us about rural life in The Gambia, how people live in the villages. We visited a typical rural home and made a lot of kids happy with 'minty'.

Lunch at the paradise beach was fantastic, as was the view.

At the Tanji fish market, Lamin showed us all the activities going on there... Landing the fish from the boats in buckets, the distribution in wheelbarrows, the trading right then and there on the beach and the ways of preservation (smoking, icing, salting and drying).
This is an absolute must see when you visit The Gambia!

Lunch and drinks (except the ones on Paradise Beach) were all included and abundant.

A great compliment to Lamin and the driver for their friendliness, enthousiasm and knowledge and the ability to get that across.

Pricing of Bushwhacker tours is probably not the cheapest, but certainly cheaper than our tour operator.

We will certainly use Bushwhacker tours for our day trips when we visit The Gambia again.

title: Bushwacker tours
text: We went on the south Gambia 4x4 tour in March 2015 and couldn't fault it. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly as we're all the staff. I would recommend this tour company to anyone.

title: 4 x 4 Tour
text:
We went to Bushwacker Tours after being recommended by friends.  They had very varied trips available and very good value for money, far cheaper than the the tour operators. We certainly made the right choice.  Zack tailer made a tour just for the two of us and he was also our guide for the day.  Zack was the most wonderful person, very, very informative and knowledgable and he really looked after us and treated us like royalty.  We felt that we had seen the 'real' Gambia.

Endless cold drinks all day and a fabulous lunch at Paradise Beach.

We cannot recommend Bushwackers highly enough, especially Zack, and we shall certainly be using them again next  year.

title: Professional, informative and fun!
text:
We did the 4x4 (Gambia in a day) tour with Bushwhacker and another half day tour with another local company (who shall remain nameless..our attempt at "spreading the love" with so few tourists arounf and giving business to other players backfired on us ) and after that experience appreciated our day with Bushwhacker even more.. 
Worth peeling your eyes out for the green shirts/stand as unlike Archtours (it wasn't them!) these guys arent that well signposted, but will give you a print out of offering with prices and won't do a hard sell - big plus point as the strip can get a bit tiring.. 

Only thing I'd change about our day was the way the school visit is arranged - I'd rather learn more about the different schools, from private to state and see different schools; as opposed to having the kids "sing for their donation" with their teacher explaining how much they've improved the school thanks to donations and how much their rent is (expect to be put on the spot in front of a classroom with a box and a notebook recording who gave how much), but not so much about how much do the parents actually pay for their kids to attend... 

Thanks for a great day out Zack!

title: The best way to see The Gambia is via Bushwhacker Tours
text: We had a very comprehensive tour with Soloman as our guide and enjoyed every minute. If we go next year we will definitely use Bushwhacker tours again. We were well looked after and the cost was much less than other tour guides. Great value for money.

title: Fantastic
text: Unlike other companies they were not pushy for our custom and gave us a leaflet to take away to have a look at their excursions, we therefore decided to book a safari! We were greeted by our tour guide Zack at the planned time, the safari itself was amazing and we were lucky enough to see all animals (although this is made clear from the start you are not guaranteed to see all as you can't predict nature). Zack himself was also amazing, throughout the day he showed us different sights of Gambia and also explained about the locals and what different people were doing. To add he also carried about an ice box full of drinks for us all day long; it was a pleasure to spend the day with him! I would reckomend bushwacker tours to anyone! Definitely value for money and a fun day out! Once in a life time opportunity!

title: Awesome tour with Bushwhacker Senegambia!
text:
If you visit a country and wish to take part of the country's history, favorite places, want to experience the beautiful countryside, learn and take part of its culture while having great fun ... Well, then you should visit Bushwhacker tours! 
We got the honor to meet Zack and Ziddy, two young men who made our trip fantastic! We visited everything... from crocodile river to the country's largest market. One of the most amazing experiences was also the fishing harbor. We went on two tours with them, Gambia 4x4 and fishing in the river,  and both tours were really worth the price! Food was included and they served drinks throughout the tour. The price was good and we felt safe the whole time.

Hope you will like the Gambia as much as we do. And once you've taken you there, visit Bushwhacker tour in Senegambia! The tours we went out on, fit perfect for couples, friends, family and even if you go alone!

title: Excelled - Great professional people.
text:
I don't normally write reviews, but this was needed.
We visited the Gambia on the 26th for a weeks holiday. As part of that we planned a trip to visit various sites and projects. We met with Bushwhacker's Zack who was incredibly helpful in organising an itinerary that suited us - not an off the shelf tour. He adapted it to suit our schedule and requirements. On the day of the tour, it was the morning after the attempted military coup. We were to be collected at 9AM. Zack came to the Hotel at 8 to find me to talk with me personally. He said that the Radio advice was that there was still confusion as to what had happened, and people were being advised to stay at Home or in their Hotels. For this reason, he advised that we delay or cancel the tour. Now, this is at a time when Business in the Gambia is slow. So, it would have been very easy for them to simply take the money, run the tour and take the risk. But they didn't. Very professional. We asked if he could keep us posted through the day, to see if we could do the tour the following day, which he did.
Not even our own Travel Company - Gambia Experience - knew of such detail, or stopped tours. Our rep was utterly useless. People were still going out with other tour organisers, oblivious to what was happening.
So we undertook the tour the following day. It was brilliant. Even my 15 year old daughter thoroughly enjoyed it. Zack was very knowledgeable, had a great sense of humour, engaged with us very well and managed the day splendidly. Beautiful sites and scenes that were a bit off-piste to the norm. The Driver CD was also very careful and attentive. Good vehicle and suitable for our South Gambia Safari. Importantly Zack, managed the local Gambians very well - always polite, and when confronted with a few lively 'Lads' at the local Fishing Port, he handled them exceptionally well. With authority, calmness and a smile. Locals liked him a lot. But he put 'us' first at all times. Very service centred.
Great experience all round - would thoroughly recommend them. Very professional and likeable people. Great ethics. And the money stays in the Gambia, to support local people. I wish them very well for the future.

title: All sorts of trips available with Bushwhacker
text: If you are traveling to Gambia, I would recommend you to book Bushwhacker trips. It is located in a very convenient place, just in the middle of the main commercial road in Kololi beach. They pick you up from your hotel. They offer different types of trips, half or whole day, relaxing, cultural, animal watching trips. Our guide, Salomon is very knowledgeable and reliable. We felt very save, learnt lots about Gambia and had lots of fun.

title: Fathala trip
text: We booked through Bushwhacker tours to go to Fathala game reserve, It was a long day but well worth it. Soloman our guide was brilliant and I could thoroughly recommend them to anyone wishing to get out and about

title: Betrouwbaar en goed
text: Super goede partij om excursies mee te doen. Vaak 1 op 1 excursies. Met Arke of met andere clubs wordt je vaak in een bus rondgereden en heb je geen leuke dag (veel te veel nederlanders) Met deze lokale gambiaanse excursie club kom je overal, voor hetzelfde geld en vaak met minder mensen (dus meer interactie) Aanrader!

title: Amazing Experience & Very Friendly, Trustworthy and Skilled Staff!
text:
We can sincerely recommend Zach and the other staff for offering such great experience with their tours! We did the tour in Makasutu National Park & the Gambia 4x4 and it was in one word amazing. Such a great, interesting and meaningful day full of diversity and we've learned so much, since our guide Zach knows what to tell and how to tell about his beautiful country. Besides, the guys are extremely easy going, friendly and really make you feel very comfortable! 

A big 10+ for these guys and we highly recommend not to go on excursions with your travel agent, but book with locals like this one on the strip, because in this way, you support local community, which really needs this chance! 

We will soon post some pictures & videos for them to share!

:)

title: Lamin Tours
text: This guy is excellent, I used him on all of my trips when in Gambia in May.I did the usual tourist trips they were very good, but also saw some of the real Gambia...fab. He has excellent knowledge of Gambia is very reliable also very good prices.The prices being charged by the reps were so expensive.I would highly recommend Lamin Tours. This is his email address...goldman861@hotmail.com......phone..+442203412338.

title: Don't bother with any other guides!
text: From arrival at the airport Farms, Zach, and Seedy (sorry if I misspelled) took care of us and treated us like royalty. This was our first time to The Gambia and were a bit nervous, Zach and the crew were ALWAYS professional and went above and beyond to make sure we had an amazing vacation.  They did our airport transportation on arrival and departure when I was unable to get it arranged through our hotel.  Our first tour was the 4x4.  It was amazing to listen to the knowledge Zach has, he knows his stuff and when he told me his favorite subject was history it shows.  The kids loved watching him pop open their soda bottles with a water bottle all week, he even took the time to teach the kids how it's done.  I believe they are the only group that provides drinks on the tours and goes in small groups.  This made each tour personal.  We also did the lazy day tour which was refreshing to just hang out on a boat fishing and seeing the sites if the oyster creek.  If we ever had any questions we went straight to the Bushwhacker office and were taken care of.  Leaving really felt like we were leaving family at the end of the week.

title: Best Service and Offers
text: Even it was low saison they could offer all tours within some days. The guides are very well and give a lot of information to you. I enjoyed the Roots-Tour much. Everything was perfect organized. I will never try another tour operator again.

title: High point of our holiday
text: Take a tour with Bushwacker. Friendly personal service with knowledgable guides. We went on the lazy days tour . There was only the two of us to a whole boat and crew. Zack our guide was very knowledgable about the birds and wildlife seen on our Mangroves tour as well as the history . Freshly cooked lunch, fishing, eating our catch, sunbathing,swimming in the river . It was such a lovely day. I would highly recommend.

title: Roots
text:
Het was wen zeer interessante excursie met erg veel informatie en onvergetelijke indrukken! De dag was relaxt en goede verzorging! 
Een tour die zeker aan te bevelen is als je Gambia bezoekt! Compliment voor bushwackers tours in kololi!

title: Roots Tour
text: What a fantastic day we had on the Roots tour. Zak the tour guide was fab and couldn't do enough for us to make sure we had a great time. The food was amazing and both my daughter and I thought it was the best we'd had on our holiday to Gambia. The guys truly went the extra mile to provide excellent customer service, it was so good we've now booked the sunset cruise for Thursday, can't wait!

title: Excellent As Always
text:
Bushwhackers always deliver first class service and always with a smile. Nothing it seems is ever enough trouble for these guys & girls. Honest, friendly and very genuine indeed. My wife Jill & I have  used Bushwhackers each time we have visited The Gambia and would not use any other tour company... Thank you again Sol and Gang, see you next yer...

Nev & Jill Pettitt (England)

title: Fabulous people
text: We did the 4x4 trip with sid the driver and Solomon as the guide. It was a fantastic tour, taking in some amazing sites, with superb commentary all day long. The market and the fish market were mesmerising and the images we saw will stay with us for a long time.......... The way the locals stay positive despite such poverty is a lesson for us all. This company were £20 cheaper than the official Thomas Cook tour and I am so glad we were privileged to spend time with these guys. Thank you and I would recommend them to you all.

title: Excellent trusted guides to the see The Gambia close up
text:
This was our first trip to The Gambia and we wanted to see as much as possible without the hassle of organising our own transport etc. but we wanted to do something with a local owned company.

Black and White Tours were perfect - we had great communications with Armstrong on whatsapp prior to arriving and then he met us at our hotel on the first day and talked through the options.

We opted for the Senegal safari and the 4WD 7-stop tour which sounds whistle-stop but you get plenty of time at each destination.

4WD: Yaya was an excellent guide on the 4WD day... very knowledgeable and chatty. We went to places that we would not have seen on our own - a bustling non-touristy market, a working fishing village, a school and a family compound. The museum was as fascinating as the crocodiles. (FGM!!!) Yaya conveyed The Gambia's history and political/social issues and we came away better educated with a changed perspective. Be prepared to make donations at the school and compound. What is little for tourists means a lot to the locals. Tip generously. There was a welcome beach stop for lunch.

Senegal: Again this was excellent and I would recommend. This is a long hot day. They are right that the ferry crossing is an experience in itself. We were well fed and kept cool with drinks on hand at all times but I would suggest you bring snacks (or buy on the ferry from the many vendors) as our lunch was taken very late.... after the safari on The Gambia side of the border. Yamin handled all the border crossing/constant police checks. We were in a group with 2 other friendly couples. We didn't opt for the lion walk and one of our party who did was upset about how the lions were treated so look into whether this is for you. The safari however was great and the animals have a large area to roam - we saw zebras, giraffes, water buffalo, a rhino, lots of fun trying to sneak up on animals.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Sehr gute Tour
text: Wir haben die Safari nach Sengal gemacht mit Löwen Lauf. Es war wunderschön. Der tourguide(Jaja Jobarteh) war hervorragend und hat alles gut erklärt. Wir haben schöne Fotos gemacht und können es nur weiterempfehlen.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great Days Out, Not to be missed.!!
text: Can only echo the positive reviews from others. We booked three tours with B & W, the safari with lion walk, the four wheel drive, and the lazy day fishing and  were not disappointed.  Our guide, Ya Ya ,and the trainees Mohammed and the lovely Sophie  looked after all our needs on a one to one basis, and gave comprehensive guidance and information throughout. I doubt such service could be supplied by larger tour suppliers,The Senegal safari was a long day with much travelling ,not for the faint hearted , but in particular walking with lions will never be repeated and was unforgettable.The four wheel drive day started with stroking crocodiles and then we were shown the real Gambia, with visits to school, markets and fishing villages. Truly memorable. The lazy day fishing was exactly that, we were two, with two guides, and a crew of four, on a two deck boat. We saw similar size boats with  20 plus visitors on board.! A Lovely day with a great lunch cooked by mama on board. All in all we had a great time and our thanks go to Armstrong and all his staff.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: These guys are the best!
text:
I’d like to take this opportunity to thank the amazing Armstrong and his team at Safari Blacknwhite for all they have done with organising all of mine and Tias trips and excursions whilst we have been here in The Gambia. 

On every occasion we felt safe and well looked after and am so glad I picked these guys out of the tour companies out here! 

We were always picked up on time, and pretty much had 1:1 tours!!!  Our guide Lamin was so knowledgeable on the history of Gambia and there was no question we couldn’t ask that he didnt know the answer too!! 

Our friendly driver too - kept us entertained the whole time and they all have the biggest smiles ever!!! 

I also chose this tour company as they contribute 5% of their earnings to the local school we visited - and I’m all for giving back!! 

I hope to do fundraising in the new year to be able to help with projects alongside Armstrong to allow more children a better education in The Gambia. 

For anyone looking to visit - please use these guys.  

You’ve been amazing - with nothing too much trouble - eve. Helping us find plugs haha - and we can’t wait to come back!!!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing experience with Black & White Tours and our wonderful tour guides .
text:
Five of us travelled to The Gambia to celebrate birthdays and celebrating life.
We booked two tour days, kunta kinteh island and the safari - walking with the lions.
Our fantastic tour guides were Lamin & Fanta and our wonderful driver Sol who us around on both days to our tours.

We had an amazing time with them, they went the extra mile to ensure we were able to enjoy the full experience and attention to detail . 

This enabled us to experience the real 'The Gambia' and the local people, villages and markets .

The tours were reasonably priced and  we were not disappointed.

We would highly recommend Black and White tours and our tour guides  Lamin , Fanta & Soul and would certainly use them again on our next visit.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Brilliant
text:
Had the pleasure of getting to experience 3 tours with Armstrong and his amazing team we decided to do the 5 tours in one day (fantastic) and the team arranged  a jeep as it was my preference we did the lazy day fishing cruise (highly recommended) and my favourite makatousu forest. 

Armstrong and team were always available and helpful for any questions and queries we had and ensured we got the best experiences on our tours

I would highly recommend this company for all tours in the Gambia

Also do take tea with Armstrong and team for another amazing experience

We miss you guys much love Mariamma and Oomie :)

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: A very good and professional company that we sincerely recommend if you want to get to know the real and beautiful Gambi
text: We went with the company "Black and White Safari" and bought two trips "Four Wheel Drive" and "Senegal Safari". Everything was organized very well, the company took care of the tourist's safety at every step. "Four Wheel Drive" tour is a great tour that shows you the real Gambia. The tour highlights important areas of life and history in The Gambia that are important to know and remember. "Senegal Safari" trip through Gambia to Senegal to a lion park. An interesting experience and a must-see, especially the walk with the lions. A very good and professional company 👌 that we sincerely recommend if you want to get to know the real and beautiful Gambia. Greetings to Amadou 👍and our guide 🏆 Lamin 🏆, who is amazing and the best in Gambia number 1.  THX  ;)  🤝 Lamin

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 2 tours - Amazing Days
text:
We booked the fathala safari and the roots tour with black and white and I can genuinely say they are a very professional outfit and all of  the staff that we had the pleasure of meeting were excellent. 
Everything that was in their control went like clockwork. Unfortunately some of the services like the ferry from Banjul to Barra are out of their control so you need to drop in Gambian mode and just be happy.
Both tours were fabulous. The roots tour was headed up by Lamin who was very knowledgeable and made the day come alive with his facts and  stories. It was nice to see that they have a program of bringing through new young trainees and we had Mo accompanying us on the day learning on the job.
We also did the safari across the  Senegal border. Once again this was navigated with the guidance of tour leader Joeoe. The experience of seeing Lions, giraffes, antelope , zebras, monkeys and water hogs all close up was breathtaking and certainly met our expectations.
 It was a long hot days but on both trips you are kept well hydrated with the drinks provided . You are also provided with good quality restaurant meals.
They do more trips which we will explore next time we come here but I would certainly recommend black and white if you are considering some trips for your holiday.
A big shout out to Armstrong as well who owns the company. We were in dialogue via WhatsApp prior to my arrival and he always did his best to provide answers to all of our questions.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastisk dag med Black and White Safari
text:
Vi havde en fantastisk dag med Black and White Safari. 
Hvor vi var på en rundtur hvor vi besøgte et marked hvor de solgte geder og får. Der efter var i på en farm hvor der var hyæner som blev fodret og så gik turen til Lamin Lodge hvor vi sejlede op af floden hvor vi så det store elefant træ. Da vi kom retur fra sejle turen kørte vi et et sted hvor vi spiste ud til floden og lige på den anden side af floden kunne vi se Senegal.
Efter maden gik turen til reptil parken hvor vi skulle hold store og små slanger. Til sidst skulle vi besøge et Tanje village museum.
Så helt igennem en fantastik god dag og så Tor tak til vores 2 guider og vores chauffør

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The best tour company in Gambia.
text:
Armstrong and his team, especially Lamin, Safie, Ibrahim, Pax and Pa were very kind, helpful, knowledgeable.

Armstrong will go out of his way for his clients, I was hesitant to give Black and White the full amount so Armstrong said I can pay bit by bit but after speaking to him I trust him like family and gave him the full amount.

We only had budget for the lion walk and 4x4 cruise but we decided to do the sunset River cruise too which we are so happy we did.

These last few days I have had some of the best experiences of my life.

Thank you Black and White I really hope I see you again.

Kind regards

Hassan and Khadija

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Helemaal geweldig
text: Black and White begeleidde ons het grootste gedeelte van de week dat wij in Gambia waren, en dat doen ze goed! We kregen veel informatie over het land, er was altijd een grote koelbox met koude drankjes binnen handbereik. Op de markt, bij de grens met Senegal en waar we dan ook heen gingen, waren we veilig in de capabele handen van Black and White. De kookworkshop, op de compound van één van de medewerkers van Black & White, was een geweldige ervaring. Armstrong, Saffie, Abraham, Jaja, en de anderen, chapeaux en bedankt!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great experiences with a great team.
text:
Booked 2 solo private trips with Black and White. First, Lamin and Bax took me on the Roots tour. I had wanted to visit Kunta Kinteh Island for years, and I could not have had the best guide in Lamin. An easy journey by Landover, ferry, car and river pirogue, full history, great lunch. Evocative and moving.
By the end of the day I felt I knew a little about the history of slavery in Gambia, and a little about the lovely people of the country. 
Lamin, Bax and me had a 2nd day together on tour, roaming around Tanji, the crocodile pool, craft market, Serrekunda market, paradise beach. Alot of laughter, good company, flavours of Gambian life. Importantly, we visited Mansa Maru nursery school, which was a privilege for this primary school teacher. So very impressed with the dedication and commitment of the school staff, and Armstrong's earnest support for the children.
Thank you so much for everything.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Janjanbureh (Georgetown) Overnight trip.
text: Incredible experience on this 2 day tour with Black and White. Highly recommended! The owner was helpful and friendly when booking. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable. Our driver was very safe. Will definitely book other trips with them when I return 🌟 🌟🌟🌟🌟

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 2 day trip
text: The trip was Absolutely fantastic, our tour guide Lamin is very knowledgable and is able to answer pretty much any questions we had during this trip. We did an overnight trip to George Town and had a trip in the river spotting chimpanzees and lucky for us captain hippo knew exactly where to find the 🦛, on the way back we also visited a school at our request and were pleasantly surprised how well behaved and polite the children are. Overall the trip was amazing thank you team BLACK AND WHITE also Abraham for getting us there and back safely.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Add Immediately to Your Vacation Agenda
text:
This was an excellent experience, I would highly recommend adding this to your agenda when visiting the Gambia. The owner, Amadou, opened his home and family up so that we can experience authentic Gambian home cooking. First we changed into traditional clothing. Then wee were able to go to the market, pick out all the ingredients needed for cooking. It was a hands on experience. We cut vegetables, prepped the food, and actually cooked. We also enjoyed Ataya (Gambian Tea) while we cooked.

My favorite part was sitting together to enjoy the meal. We ate from one large dish and everything was delicious. By far better than any restaurant (and the food at the Gambian restaurants are tasty).

It's a full day experience, but worth the time. We plan on visiting The Gambia again and will make sure to do this tour again to try a different meal.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic tour
text: We went on the overnight tour to Janjanbureh. It was a fantastic trip and our guide Lamin and driver Bax were great to be with, very helpful and friendly. Lamin explained a lot about the history of Gambia and is very knowledgeable. A highlight for us was to see the Chimpanzees in the River Gambia National Park. We also loved our visit to a small Gambian village. We highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see how people live in Gambia and learn a lot along the way.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: fathala safari
text: Het was een geweldige ervaring om in een safari jeep te rijden. De reis er naar toe was goed verzorgd. De gids Sheriff beantwoordt keurig al je vragen, geeft goede uitleg en is zeer behulpzaam. Keurig op tijd zijn wij vertrokken naar Senegal, geweldig nogmaals

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Voyage culturel incroyable
text:
Je suis venue en Gambie en solo trop pour 3jours et croyez-moi ça valait le coup d’être fait ! C’était court et j’y retournerai cela est sûr. Merci à l’équipe de black and white safari d’avoir été aux petits soins jusqu’au bout .

Merci à Amadou , Lamine , Jabi pour votre professionnalisme et cette découverte de ce beau pays .

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Once in a lifetime experience
text: We went for a safari and walking with lions with Black and white safari tours on Monday 24th April.  Lamin was an excellent guide, friendly and knowledgeable . Highly recommended

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Met our expectations!
text: We did two tours with Black & White Safari (home cooking and four wheel drive) and they also helped us organize land transport between Dakar and the Gambia. We traveled with our three young children who really enjoyed the experience! We were grateful for all the support provided by Armstrong before and during our trip and are happy to recommend his company!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Friendly tourguides and great tours
text:
My girlfriend and I visited the Gambia in November 2016. We read about Simon tours on tripadvisor and contacted him by email before we flew out. We went to Fathala wildlife park with our guide Sanna and we did the Roots tour with Fatu.
I would highly recommend using Simon Tours, especially for the Fathala wildlife trip. Here we were in our own safari jeep with just one other couple, so had plenty of room to stand up and see everything that was going on. I noticed that the other tour groups I assume who had booked through the Gambia experience were on much bigger jeeps with I would say 20 or more people on them meaning they were restricted in what they could see.
Our tour guides Sanna and Fatu were friendly and informative and it was a pleasure to share our experiences with them!

title: Xmas Holiday
text: We spent Xmas in Gambia this year and had 3 days out with Simon, We did the Roots tour, Fathala Wildlife Park and a half day tour that we made up ourselves, all trips were fabulous. We contacted Simon by email  just before we went on holiday. He was very quick to return a message and then met with us in the Hotel Bar. He arrived on time every morning and made sure we all ok when we were out with him. Would recommend you make contact before you go to plan your trips. He was much cheaper than booking through the holiday rep and much more flexible. HIghly recommended.

title: South Gambia tour
text:
We had a great trip with Simon from Simon Tours. We contacted him by e-mail and he answered within an hour to make an appointment. Very nice man and very knowledgeable about what to see and visit. He knows the locals and beside the general points of interest he chooses his own destinations by visiting compounds in the countryside that are not overrun by other tourists. We travelled by open jeep. Gives you a lot to see, hear and smell. We went with a party of four and paid € 45,- per person. Not really cheap for Gambia but a much better price then e.g. Booked by Tui. (€ 58 p.p.)
We had a lovely day, drinks and lunch were included and he has an answer to all our questions. If you want to go on a tour, Simon is our man. Thank you once more Simon. 
Regards, Henk and Lucie, The Netherlands.

title: Uitstekende ervaring met Simon!
text:
Wij zijn net terug van 10 Gambia (Kotu). Op internet lazen we goeie reviews over Simon, dus wij hebben hem een email (info@simon-tours.com) gestuurd, zijn kantoor zit NL in Kololi (ergens tegenover de African Queen restaurant). Simon reageerde al binnen een uur, en diezelfde avond kwam hij in ons hotel om te bespreken wat voor opties hij aanbied. 

We hebben gekozen voor de South Gambia Tour (Batik Factory, Serrekunda Market, Mangrove boat tour van 1 uur, lokale bevolking bezocht (veel andere aanbieders komen hier niet), Paradise beach en Tanji Beach).  Dit alles met een range rover met max 6 personen. 

Het was een onvergetelijke dag! Ik heb al veel gezien van de wereld, maar dit was echt een fantastische trip. Ik heb die dag wel 1000 foto's geschoten onderweg :)

Simon is een Gambiaan die echt een goed hart heeft, snel reageert per email en begaan is met de lokale bevolking. Op deze tour bezoek hij willekeurig steeds andere woongemeenschappen zodat je daar pennen, schriftjes, zeep en andere dingen kan (als je wilt) kan geven. De kinderen zijn er zo blij mee. Dit in tegenstelling tot een andere tour die we deden naar James Island (niet met Simon tours geboekt) waar de kinderen nogal hebberig overkwamen. 

Simon is echt een super aanrader!

Groetjes

Niek

title: prima dag en genoeg gezien !!
text: Een dag met Simon opgetrokken,( met zijn chauffeur. ) alles in overleg en lekker rustig en prima om zo Gambia te ontdekken ! Behulpzaam, luisterend en vertellend zodat je betrokkenheid voelt en op plekken komt waar je alleen absoluut niet zou komen . Hij kent iedereen (lijkt wel..) en ik denk ook de nieuwe president ! Thanks Simon ! Greetz, Siny and Oscar .

title: Individuele bush tocht met gids.
text:
We werden keurig op tijd opgehaald door Ousman van Simon tours. Wat een geweldige dag heeft hij ons gegeven. Hij heeft veel informatie over alles en nog wat en er is geen moeite die hij niet wil doen. We hadden een klein akkefietje met een Gambia die te veel vroeg voor iets. Ousman is terug gegaan een heeft ons het te veel betaalde terug gevraagd en gekregen. Geweldig.
We zijn diep in de bush geweest, kleine dorpjes gezien. Veel uitleg gekregen over bijvoorbeeld wat ze verbouwen en hoe. En ook over de begraafplaatsen. 
Simon tours is even duur als de tours met meerdere mensen. Persoonlijk vonden we de individuele tour beter.
De volgende keer gaan we de meerdaagse tour doen, met Ousman.

title: Bekwame en betrouwbare gids!
text: Wij zijn een week met Saidou (simon) op reis door Gambia geweest. In Nederland contact met hem gezocht en op dag van aankomst de tours met hem afgesproken en geboekt. Saidou is zeer betrokken met zijn gasten en speelt goed in op persoonlijke wensen. Simon tours maakt gebruik van local chauffeurs etc. Dat is goed want zo verdwijnt je geld niet in de zakken van de grote touroperators. Deze touroperators  (tui en Corendon) delen bij aankomst een flyer uit aan de gasten waarop in hoofdletters gewaarschuwd wordt  om vooral geen tours te boeken bij local tourburootjes. Trap hier niet in betaal minder en steun hiermee ook nog eens de plaatselijke bevolking ipv het spekken van de grote touroperators.  Het voordeel van boeken via bv Simon tours is ook dat je individuele tours krijgt of in kleinere groepjes. Saidou bedankt voor je gastvrijheid en al het moois wat je ons hebt laten zien!

title: Super fijne gids
text:
Afgelopen december met hem twee tours gedaan, helemaal geweldig.
We komen dit jaar in december weer terug, ook dan gaan we Simon weer boeken.

title: Honeymoon
text:
Me and my new wife Pamela used Simon tours for all the trips whilst in The Gambia. From James island through to Makasutu. Makasutu was by far the best, the creek, the baboons, exceptional. And alpha the tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and kind. 
Senegal - safari. This was fantastic, saw plenty of animals on this trip and was even allowed to leave the 4x4 in the reserve and take a walk which was great
James island - a very informative trip with knowledge of the history, be prepared for a long day! We were lucky enough to see wild dolphins on this trip.
Makasutu - cannot fault this trip, everything was great, perfect in fact. 100% must do. 
Monkey park - really good trip, get to hand feed the monkeys who are surprisingly gentle and if you are really lucky they will get on your shoulders.
Finally the crocodile park. All the reviews on how fantastic this place was made me and Pamela extremely excited to see. Shame that we left disappointed as it was more of a fly through visit and only got to touch smaller crocs (not the famous Charlie). No mention of Charlie really.

title: Zeer bekwame gids
text: Simon is een zeer vriendelijke en hele bekwame gids met oog voor detail. De excursies konden we combineren naar eigen wens. Altijd op tijd en vertelt mooie verhalen. Mede dankzij Simon een top tijd in Gambia gehad. We konen terug en hopen dat Simon ons weer op sleeptouw wilt nemen.

title: Professional tours
text: Simon took us on two tours, Roots and to Fathala wildlife park in Senegal. We pre booked by email a few weeks before arrival - he sent us plenty of info and answered questions promptly. We then got a full rundown on arrival in Gambia of our trips. Both were run very professionally and we knew what to expect. We had young kids with us (5 and 7) and they did just fine. I can wholeheartedly recommend for super experiences. I only wish we'd have had time to visit the mangroves too. Thanks Simon!

title: Safari senegal en 2 daagse tour georgetown
text: In 1 woord "fantastisch" zeer goede en aardige gids die veel uitleg geeft en aan wie je ook alles kunt vragen over Gambia.

title: Onvergetelijke excursies met een innemende en zeer bekwame gids
text:
We hebben 3 trips met Simon gedaan. Naar Senegal, 2 daagse trip naar George town en een halve dag trip.
Simon heeft kennis van Flora, Fauna en brengt je op plekken waar je met een reisorganisatie niet komt. Hij is vrolijk, oprecht, behulpzaam, betrouwbaar, vriendelijk  en ook nog eens gezellig. Hij kent de bevolking(soms denk je dat hij iedereen kent) en hierdoor gaan deuren open die voor anderen gesloten blijven. Heel innemende persoonlijkheid. 
We hebbenn heel veel gezien van Gambia en zijn van dit land gaan houden. 
Wij raden hem dus met allerplezier aan.
Daarnaast raden wij gambia ook aan een prachtig land en terecht wordt het de smiling coast genoemd. We gaan zeker volgend jaar weer en natuurlijk weer met Simon op ontdekking
Simon TOP !!!!

title: Fantastic Guide to the real Gambia
text: This was our first time in the Gambia. We were there for only a week and wanted to experience as much as we could of Gambian Culture.  Simon was great and responded to our emails promptly before we left and offered us a selection of tours and dates. We met with Simon on our arrival at our Hotel in Kotu. He was friendly and keen to accommodate our plans. We spent two days with Simon, doing one tour to Senegal and one of the South of Gambia. Spending time with Simon was a pleasure, he wasn't pushy, but keen to share his knowledge and  appreciation of his culture and his country. We always felt safe with Simon and his drivers. We plan to return next year and will be asking him to help us explore more of the Gambia - Thank you :)

title: Unbelievable good south gambia tour with simon.
text: We had a great south gambia tour with simon. He does not only show you the tourist stuff but also the other gambia. Going inland to meet the natives and racing over the beach! Always patient and explaining details of every day live. Perfect service and helpfull in any way. Forget about the others , let this guy cook up a great tour for you!

title: Simon Tours
text: Simon heeft ons een paar dagen mee op pad genomen in Gambia. Simon is een hele prettige gids, staat overal voor open en is erg betrokken bij de lokale mensen. Hij weet van alles te regelen, Wij zijn onder andere naar Makasutu, Janjangbureh en Senegal geweest met hem. We hebben enorm genoten van het land en alle indrukken. Vooraf hebben wij contact met hem opgenomen via simontours@hotmail.com. Hij reageerde heel snel en uiteindelijk kwam hij ons in ons hotel op de eerste dag bezoeken om afsrpaken te maken. Dit was erg prettig. Wij raden hem zeker aan!

title: Lokale gids waar je alles mee kan regelen
text:
Al voor ons vertrek naar Gambia hadden we contact opgenomen met Simon. De dag na aankomst met hem de verschillende mogelijkheden besproken en 3 excursies bij hem geboekt.
Bij alle excursies heeft hij zich uitstekend aan de afspraken gehouden. Alles was prima verzorgd.
Als je echter een vogelexcursie wil maken, vraag dan wel een goede gids mee, want van vogels heeft Simon niet veel verstand.

title: goede gids
text: Mooie excursies met Simon tours gemaakt. Goede communicatie al vanuit Nederland. Houdt zich aan de afspraken en goedkoper dan de andere organisaties. Ook kan je bij hem afwijken van het vaste programma en doen wat jij wilt. Hij is netjes en correct. Het echte Gambia ontdek je pas met een lokale gids die ook naar dorpen gaat waar niemand komt. Hij heeft geen vaste adressen. Het was voor ons de eerste keer, maar zeker niet de laatste. Ik kan Simon tours echt aanbevelen. Hij is eerlijk, goedkoop en goed. We hebben mooie dingen met Simon mogen ervaren

title: Explore the real Gambia with Simon Tours
text: Laat je onderdompelen in de Afrikaanse cultuur en ontdek het echte Gambia met Simon Tours. Een absolute aanrader voor een onvergetelijke reis.

title: The Gambia experience
text:
Simon is een correcte man met eerlijke prijzen en brengt je naar plaatsen in gambia(ook waar extreme armoede heerst) waar niemand komt. Bijna een hele week met hem op pad geweest en nooit geen enkel probleem gehad .Doet alles voor zijn gasten.
Goed bereikbaar via email en telefoon. Hij zal altijd  proberen je te woord te staan.
Nooit geen onveilig gevoel gehad.

title: Fishing & 4x4 tour
text: Jay Jay our tour guide was very friendly, very knowledgeable and a likeable bloke. He took us out twice, once in the boat fishing and once on a tour of the Gambia incorporating markets schools villages and a crocodile pool. We loved it all. He was informative and answered all our questions.

title: Roots tour - a great day out.
text: We took the roots tour with Bushwhacker and had a really enjoyable day out. Our guide JJ was extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic. We were picked up from our hotel and delivered back there at the end. All in all I would highly recommend this company.

title: Third Year with Bushwhacker !
text: We have travelled with Bushwhacker for the past 3 years and have never been disappointed. The guides are dedicated, professional, attentive and enthusiastic. We did three trips with them this year - Roots, South Gambian Adventure and Lazy Day and they were all excellent value for money with lunch included. Our thanks to JJ, Zac,Solomon and our drivers.

title: Roots tour
text:
We did the Roots tour with Bushwacker Tours and really enjoyed it.  It was a last minute arrangement as we were talking to another couple in our hotel the previous evening who said they were going, so we texted the company there and then (it was 7.30) - even at that late hour they got straight back to us, and at 8 the following morning we were picked up from the hotel reception.  Our guide JJ was excellent - knowledgable and enthusiastic, and every aspect of the day was very well thought out (including an excellent lunch on board the boat which took us up river).  In Albreda and Juffureh we met the village chief and members of Kunta Kinteh's family as well as visiting the small but interesting museum.  There is also a craft market where they have some lovely things for sale but be prepared for the hard sell - and if you like something don't be afraid to haggle!  The visit to James Island in particular, where slaves were held for a fortnight before the long journey to the Americas, was a very moving experience.  (We were also lucky enough to see some dolphins on the way up the river in the morning.)

Highly recommended!

title: Professional
text:
We did two trips with Zak, JJ and Solomon and what more can we say than that they exceeded all expectations; were professional and knowledgeable; slick, friendly and courteous. JJ even had time to take us in a taxi to Westfield on Sunday to find an open chemist to cure a bit of Banjul Belly. 
We can't compare Bushwacker to any other local tour operators but I doubt if you'll find better. Go on, just do it, the trips are great and I thoroughly recommend the 4x4 Southern Gambia excursion, just remember to take enough sweets and money for the school kids.

title: Great experience !!!
text:
Bushwhackers took us on an amazing evening river cruise which was one of the greatest highlights of our Gambia trip. We loved every bit of it from the prompt start to the great buffet dinner cooked by Saffie at the end of the cruise. The food was one of the most delicious  we ate during our entire holiday. Zack our guide was full of enthusiasm; he explained everything thoroughly and made the 3 hour cruise very enjoyable. Cold drinks were on offer throughout the evening and tea was served after dinner. The views were just truly amazing and the tranquility of the river was soooo relaxing , would definitely highly recommend the whole experience.
Zack and his team were very professional in their approach and made the whole experience worthwhile. We cant wait to go  back and try some of the other excursion trips:)

title: Great tour
text: We did the 4 x 4 tour and it was more than expected. Was really interesting seeing the different places. Jane the guide was really enthusiastic and knowledgable which made the day really fun. The only criticism is that the day felt a little rushed at times, but that's to be expected when squeezing so much in. Alligator pool was my face bit as you actually got to stroke them! Was nice to relax on the beach at the end too. Really recommend this tour, was a great day.

title: Verkligen trevliga turer!
text: Varierat utbud. Vi gjorde två turer med dessa trevliga killar. En till krokodilparken och Banjul med marknad, och en som hette Roots. Båda var väl arrangerade och värda att göra. Roots var dock den som vi gillade mest. En hel dag med mat och massor av sevärdheter på Gambiafloden. Turen skulle gått på söndagen men blev ändrad till måndag eftersom den stora färjan på floden gått sönder. Personalen på Bushwhacker fixade en annan båt så vi kom iväg. Åker vi tillbaka till Senegambia kommer vi självklart att göra fler turer med detta bolag.

title: Excellent trip.
text: Been to Gambia before and tried other tour operators, would highly recommend Bushwhacker tours .The trips were at a reasonable price compared to others and nothing was skimped on.       We booked  the 1 day trip to Sennegal  the animal reserve it's was ok ,saw plenty of wildlife monkeys,zebra,rhino,crocs,giraffe,the cheeky bugger warthogs who escape into the peanut farm and steal all the nuts and various antelope however what really made the trip and what we would highly recommend you doing should you book this trip is the walk with the 19 month lions amazing and a memory which will last with me forever. Our tour guide JJ and the driver were brilliant and very professional.Further more you got what was written on the tin, the company is owned by a local which means money going back to people of Gambia .their office is on the main road of the strip in Kololil near the bottom end towards the senna gambia hotel .Hope this helps.

title: Senegal trip & river cruise
text:
The Senegal trip was a fantastic experience from start to finish - walking with the lions is something I will never forget (or the pirogue trip on the way back! ). We went in a small group of 6 with two excellent guides, JJ & Zak, who looked after us really well . Would recommend Bushwhacker to anyone going to Gambia as nothing too much trouble, including mending my husbands glasses for him on a day we weren't even on a trip with them!  
The river cruise included too much fishing for our liking but that is just a personal preference and did not detract from a lovely day cruising on the river made more enjoyable by Zak our guide who's enthusiam is infectious.

title: Chimpanzee Rehabilitation Trip
text: Just returned from a wonderful 2 weeks in Gambia We did the 2 day Chimpanzee trip into the north and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. JJ was our guide and was so knowledgeable about the area and all the wildlife, and much better at photographing it than us, that he really made it special. The Waterhouse and tents overlooking the river were amazing, even though some of the toilets and outside shower were a bit of a challenge!! We had an excellent driver in 'smiler' and saw so much more of the 'real Gambia' than we would have done around the hotel. We also did the 4x4 trip also with JJ and once again he gave us a fascinating insight into Gambia and it's people. Thanks to everyone at Bushwacker tours for helping to make our holiday special

title: Gambia by 4x4
text: Nice trip, although the visit at the school was a bit too much as the principal ambushed us with some real hardsell of donation searching.

title: Lamin Lodge
text:
Thanks Bushwacker tours for a great day "JJ" excellent tour guide with a good sense of humour, would recommend them for any tours you might want to make while in the Gambia, CD was a good driver. Brikama Craft Market great bargaining skills required but good fun. All food  and drink included fantastic value for money and a lot cheaper than the larger Tour operators. 
Margaret, Dot & Maria

title: Happy Days!
text:
This was my first trip to The Gambia and it certainly will not be my last.

It was a complete culture shock for me. Until now, I had never ventured outside Europe.

For me, it was love at first sight. I was completely enchanted by the vibrant, colourful landscape and the people are the friendliest I have ever met. Nothing was too much trouble and my every need was catered for.

My two good friends and travel companions surprised me with two day trips for my upcoming birthday. A whole day visiting the delights of south Gambia in a jeep and the "lazy day" river cruise, with a spot of fishing.

There were six of us on the south Gambia tour and we were accompanied by three exceptional guides. Mandor, Zach and our driver CD. They could not have taken better care of us.
Their knowledge of local history and customs was outstanding. I have never enjoyed a history lesson so much! Every stop we made seemed to be more interesting than the last. My personal favourites were the (chaotic) Serrakunda Market, crocodile pool and museum and Paradise Beach. I think I was in a state of shock and awe for the whole trip!

For anyone planning a holiday to The Gambia, the smiling coast of West Africa, I would highly recommend Bushwhacker Tours. You will not be disappointed.

My only disappointment was that I did not have more time to go on other trips with them. However, when I return to Gambia I know exactly who I'll be booking up with. BUSHWHACKER TOURS!!!

Thank you guys for making my first Gambian experience a truely memorable one. I look forward to seeing you again in the (not too) distant future.

Tara Wilkinson
Co Laois
Republic of Ireland

title: Gambia ontdekken met de specialisten van BUSHWHACKER TOURS
text: Tijdens ons verblijf van een week in Gambia met ons gezin tijdens de kerstvakantie wilden wij natuurlijk meer zien van het land. In het plaatsje waar wij verbleven, Kololi, vonden we het bescheiden kantoor van BUSHWHACKER TOURS, gelegen op de "strip". Wij spraken twee dagtrips af. De eerste dag ging de tocht met een open landrover naar verschillende interessante plaatsen in het binnenland en aan de kust.  De tweede dag voeren we met een boot de rivier de Gambia op naar een aantal historische plaatsen en een eiland die een belangrijke rol speelden in de slavenhandel. Beide tochten waren tot in de puntjes verzorgd, zeer informatief en uiterst plezierig en professionneel begeleid door onze gids Mandor die met veel liefde en toewijding over allerlei culturele détails van zijn land en de verschillende Gambiaanse stammen uitleg gaf. Aarzel niet om het kantoortje van BUSHWHACKER TOURS op te zoeken om één van de vele mogelijke trips af te spreken. Wij komen zeker terug!!

title: Roots Trip een aanrader!
text: Als je met Bushwacker's deze trip maakt, heb je een gevulde dag, die zeer gevarieerd is, informatief en tot in de puntjes verzorgd. Een mooie boottocht over de immens brede Gambia rivier, met bezoek aan twee slavendorpen en James Island waar de slaven twee weken vastgehouden werden alvorens de grote overtocht te maken. Eten en hapjes zijn prima verzorgd en de bediening en gidsen zijn vrolijk en maken veel grapjes. Een aanrader!

title: Best tours ever!
text:
Bushwacker tours is very client-friendly, always thinking about what the customers would like. Also the personel (guides and drivers) are like one big familiy. It's nice to see that they are mere friends than colleagues. It makes that they are enjoying each others company, which leads to a pleasurable atmosphere. Cars and boat are in very good shape, drivers drive very carefull, so everything is safe.
Food and softdrinks are included and still they are cheaper than the big tour guides. But still everything is organised very well. They also have insurance in case something happens. 

In short: the best tour company.

title: Roots Tour
text:
this tour gives a very good insight into how the slave trade worked and the effect it had on the Gambian people.
It starts with a boat ride from Banjul to juffureh where you meet Kunta Kinte's ancestors and also meet the only female chief in africa.
After lunch on the boat you visit James Island now renamed Kunta Kinteh Island, then back to Banjul by boat.

title: Another excellent trip
text: Just returned from Kololi where we have been on another good tour with JJ from Bushwhacker Tours.  We did the early morning bird watching from Lamin Lodge.  JJ is a wealth of local knowledge and history and is obviously well thought of by the other tour guides.  The trip was very good value for money and included a fab breakfast with the monkeys.

title: Gambian experience
text:
We went on a trip to north Senegal and had a true Gambian experience,the ferry was not working so JJ our guide was fantastic and suggested that we can get a boat in stead so we said OK,after a short walk we were on a beach with hundreds of people milling around a couple of long boats and loads of men with numbers on their chest and then we sore why and thought O.M.G ,in order to get on to the boat we will have to get on one of the men's shoulders and then they would walk in to the sea and put us in the boat what an amazing experience, the rest of the trip was fantastic and JJ was very informative about everything and sorted everything out for us. We can't recommend bushwhacker tours highly enough and will not hesitate using them again on our next visit to the beautiful the Gambia and the Senegambia hotel.

Derek and Mandy xxxx

title: Do the lion walk!
text: We went with them to do the lion walk / safari in Fathala. We did have to wait a long time to get on the ferry in the morning. According to my phone, it was an hour and 45 minutes from the time we arrived to the ferry terminal up until the ferry departed. Otherwise, everything was smooth. There was a truck waiting for us on the other side. There were lots of cold drinks available. The lion walk was fun. I've been on safari before in South Africa, yet I still felt this safari ride was OK. I enjoyed seeing the warthogs. My husband has never done a safari and he was loving it. The guide was able to answer our questions without difficulty.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Unforgettable Experiences
text:
I did three outings with Black and White: Overnight to Georgetown, Home Cooking, and a visit to a local school. 

I am a solo traveller, and was relatively nervous coming to The Gambia, however the customer services of Black and White ensured that I felt confident and safe the entire time. They were professional, friendly and worked incredibly hard. 

If anything was too far out of my comfort zone (I'm not a fan of the manic markets) they were quick to adjust or amend the tours to ensure I had the very best experience. 

Special thanks to Alex and Bernad who were brilliant on the Georgetown overnight trip. There was a slight hiccup but they were always fully in control and in 10 minutes a solution was found and we were back on our way. 

Thank you so much for memories that will last me a lifetime (especially seeing the hippos!!!), and I will definitely be returning to do some of the other adventures on offer in the future.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Georgetown overnight trip
text:
Brilliant Trip. Information before from Armstrong and during from our guide Laminate was excellent. Ebrima our driver was safe and also very knowledgeable. From the start we got off on time and visited so many hidden gems as well as the regular things on our itinerary. 
Lamin’s knowledge and experience meant that we saw so much, he seems to have the inside track on everything. 
I would without don’t use them again.
Thank you

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing safari and lion walk experiences
text: Wow what an incredible experience! First class service from a wonderful local company. It was my and my two teenage children (13 and 15). The day started with a private taxi ride to the ferry. Full on cultural African experience with all the sights, sounds, smells and views we loved it. The Lion walk was incredible and worth every penny - what an amazing thing to do to see these majestic animals up close in their personal environment. Next was the safari tour and we saw all of the animals including pumba!! Guide was brilliant and a beautiful reserve to explore. The journey back was equally interested and we rode in our keep through the Senegalese countryside and towns. Guide was a joy to be with and he looked after us so well. Could not speak highly enough of the whole experience 10/10. Don’t hesitate to book with these - go local and ignore Tui.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Trip of a lifetime
text: Did the safari tour to Fathala, first tip do not use Tui they simply add margin and use a local tour operator. Obviously we chose Black and White tours the main contact was a guy called Armstrong they do have an office on the Senegambia strip take the turning by Hard Rock restaurant. We booked the trip during a quiet period and at first it looked like it would be me and the wife taking a private tour, we paid £260 which covered the ferry crossing into Senegal the safari tour and walking with lions. We were picked up from the hotel and advised that there would be six of us on the tour I did have a little chuckle remembering I had been charged for a private tour (read more later). We picked up four others from local hotels and set off to the ferry port I won’t go into great detail or it will ruin your trip but I will say the trip to the ferry is an interesting drive! At the ferry port whilst waiting to board our tour guide Saliaim said hey Brendan we owe you some money and gave me back 1500D equivalent of £20 which was the difference between a group and private tour. No disrespect intended here but we are in Africa and that brings some unusual financial dealings 😅 fair play to Black and White tours I never expected any kind of refund cheers Armstrong. The waiting at the ferry port is an adventure in itself and you will really get to see real life away from tourist resorts, same again for the ferry crossing. Then onto the lion walk alls I’ll say is do it!! Post lion walk we did the safari not bad but does t compare to the big safaris I’ve been luck enough to do in Kenya but for first timers you won’t be disappointed. We then headed back toward the ferry but had a stop for lunch on the way which we pre selected on the way out good food drink and hospitality all included within the price of the trip. Then back to the ferry and after another great experience back to hotels. Things I forgot make sure you bring paper copies of yellow fever vaccine we had ours on our phones crystal clear in every way but rejected at the Senegal port authority I was issued with a fine (well let’s call it that😅) of 1000D for the two of us no point getting upset or frustrated just remember your in Africa and the fine is all part of the story when you get home. Conclusion if you like adventure and are looking for a trip that you will never forget book this one - absolutely loved it big shout out to the team at Black and White Tours.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Banjul City highlights tour - A great day out
text: We took the Banjul City highlights tour with guide Lamin and driver Bax who could not have been more proud of their country. Both, speaking fully acceptable English, were very flexible on what to see and do. First they took our input then produced a customized tour. We visited the Crocodile Pools & museum (worth the stop), local woodworking shop, fish market (produces 4% of the country's GDP) and drove through Gambia's largest market. A tasty Gambian lunch was served on a quiet beach. The only negative was the older van having no air conditioning, most likely the result of Covid and the lack of tourists. Armstrong, the very kind owner of this family business, was extremely responsive in all our correspondence mostly via WhatsApp.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent tours, highly recommend!
text:
I went on two tours- the safari trip to Senegal and the fishing day trip on a boat. Both times Saliff was our excellent guide, tackling especially the border crossing into Senegal in a very helpful and professional way.

I highly recommend this company, Saliff is a calm, friendly and knowledgeable guide, the tours are well organized and the operator is a local business. There is a cook on board at the fishing trip preparing the most awesome Gambian food and I could learn a trick or two from her...

The safari trip is sheer excitement and the fishing trip pure relaxation hanging out on a colourful wooden boat with some Gambian reggae playing in the background drifting down the mangrove lined river into the bay.

Beatrice in March 2023

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Black and White are the no-brainer choice for once in a lifetime tours
text:
We signed up for the 6 in one Gambian Experience and Senegal trip - both were truly memorable in different ways. As the other reviews say, Armstrong is super responsive and sets the professional tone for all interactions with Black and White. After a couple of exploratory emails he agreed to meet us at our hotel on our first day. He drove us back to his office off the Senegambia strip and gave us a run through on the trips available. He was keen that we got what we wanted but also presented other options without being pushy.

Lamin was our guide for the 6 in 1 tour. This is probably the best tour I have ever been on. Travelling to The Gambia you are visiting a third world country that has a very well organised and sanitised tourist area. It would be super easy to visit The Gambia and enjoy the beaches, the food, the hospitality - which is first grade. However if that is all you do - you will have missed out seeing the real Gambia in all its complexity. Lamin and the tour gave us an insight into the Gambia that would not be possible visiting on your own, nor if you went with a bigger and perhaps more exploitative tour. Black and White are embedded in the community and the community support is core to its purpose. In this way we were able to experience a little of life for real Gambians from walking around the market, visiting a local school and a local family. These visits were sensitively handled and left me feeling I would like to learn more and support these communities. The tour combined some more touristic elements such as visiting the crocodile pool, fishing village or wood carving market - but it is the earlier elements that will stay with us forever. This tour is not to be missed. At times challenging but all the more worthwhile for that.

Our trip to the Fathala Wildlife reserve in Senegal was the original reason for us finding Black and White. In this tour, Salif was our guide. This is a more touristic trip but no less enjoyable. The walking with lions is optional - but you should definitely sign up for that as everyone else visiting is doing this. The lions are tamed from birth and well trained. Our initial concerns that they may be drugged was tackled by Armstrong during booking and was confirmed to really NOT be the case during the visit. The man mountain of the lion "tamer" bottle feeds the lions from being cubs and hence he has a strong bond with them. The Banjul-Barra ferry crossing was my favourite part - again getting a chance to see how real Gambians go about their daily business. Top tip - make sure you bring a yellow fever card. The Sengal border guards want to see that yellow paper (we only had an NHS print out of our vaccinations). Salif had to work hard to sort out the issue at the border - and this is where Black and White excel. You are truly in safe hands. 

As a company they fill the important gap between the local guy on the street outside the hotel offering guiding (which I would recommend for short trips say to the monkey park) and the big organised tours by the likes of TUI affiliates. Black and White give you a personal experience in a small group or just a couple, give you total piece of mind from beginning to end and have professionally trained guides whose local knowledge is second to none. 

On a side note Gambians have had a very hard time of it of late. COVID wiped out business for everyone and the business is only just starting to come back. in March 2023 it was still pretty quiet - so go visit before it gets back to full popularity. Everyone in the tourist business only get a 6 month season - so the guides end up working in the building trade or going back to their villages to help out on the land in subsistence farming. They need your support now more than ever - so be brave and swerve the big organised tour and have a real adventure with Black and White.

title: Experience Gambian life first hand - and get to eat what you cook!!
text:
Fabulous experience from start to finish. My daughter and myself were met promptly at hotel reception by our friendly guide who, with his driver, took us to a Gambian home where we chose the meal we would like to cook. 
Dressed in Gambian clothes, making the experience even more authentic, we were taken to the market to purchase the necessary ingredients. Didn’t realise that ingredients are purchased fresh every day as they don’t have facilities to keep them fresh!
Back at the family home we prepared the ingredients with guidance from our Gambian family. We helped with the whole process of preparing, cooking on the charcoal fires, cleaning the pots, serving the food and finally sharing the meal with the family. 
Felt fully immersed in this Gambian experienced and quite humbled by the work needed to prepare the meal. Never will I complain about preparing Sunday dinner at home again!!  
Brilliant experience and learning opportunity. Thank you Black and White Safari - a memorable day!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic 5 star tour and service.
text: As a first time visitor to The Gambia we wanted to do a tour that would be a highlight and a lasting memory. Having read the reviews we contacted Armstrong. The service was exceptional and information informative. We decided to arrange a bespoke trip combining two tours! I would highly recommend this to you. We did an overnight to Senegal which included an authentic safari tour, walking with Lions experience and a sunset boat cruise around the mangroves. Our overnight accommodation was of a very high standard and had a pool for relaxation in the afternoon. The highlight of the tour came on the second day when we did the Roots tour. Anyone who is old enough to remember Roots & the Kunte Kinte story will relate immediately. If before your time get researching. The tour looks at the history of Slavery and the story of Kunte Kinte. Not wanting to steal the thunder of the tour I would simply say this is a MUST on any trip to The Gambia. Our guide Lamin was OUTSTANDING, if you are fortunate to tour with Lamin you are in for areal treat. Extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Take time to discover Lamin’s story and history!! WE ARE EXTREMELY HAPPY AND PROUD TO PROVIDE THIS REVIEW AND REFERENCE!! As a small aside the fact that you take a tour with Black & White directly helps the local community as the company donates 5% of your tour cost to good local causes.

title: Goede gids
text:

De South Gambia Tour is een prima tour om een goede indruk van Gambia te krijgen.
Wij zijn hier en daar van het plan afgeweken om een school en compound te bezoeken waar we het een en ander hebben afgegeven.
 De Roots tour gaat terug naar de slavernij. Ook indrukwekkend.

title: Brilliant, and safe with Simon Tours
text: Simon was very good, booked with him by email before my daughter and I came out. Felt totally safe with him and his driver. Did the James Island tour and the South Gambia tour, brilliant. Lovely Country to visit.

title: The gent of gambia
text: I booked a last minute deal earlier this month to come to the gambia and had 1 week and wanted to experience as much as I could. I had read reviews on here and gave simon an email a few days before I left. Simon was very informative in his emails and we arranged to meet on the evening of my arrival at my hotel. I was travelling alone and as a white 20 something I had been warned about the attention I would recieve. With simon I was not approached by anyone, not that it would've been a problem if anyone had! We walked to his office and ended up going to the crocodile pool!! Simon doubled up as my camera man too and I ended up booking a couple more tours with him! On my own simon was happy to still take me on the tours and I basically had my own tour guide! He was very good at answering all my questions and very patient (I talk a LOT!) and I learnt so much about and was able to impress my friends back in the UK with all my new knowledge. Simon is such a gentleman and a great guy I would really recommend using his services if visiting as he goes out of his way to show how wonderful the gambia is! I really enjoyed the makasutu trip. The only thing was as a lone traveller and lack of tourism at the minute i was unable to do the senegal trip as visas etc would cost too much and I appreciated that Simon did not try and push the trip just to earn money as some other places would. I'm hoping to go back later in the year to bring my mum! My advice is go longer than a week so you can take full advantage of the tours Simon offers so you can appreciate the gambia!!! Thank you Simon for giving me a fantastic holiday experience.

title: Excellent and discrete
text:
Simon gave us an excellent service. We are three friends from Barcelona, we contacted him via e-mail and he replied immediately all of our questions, one after the other in a long e-mail exchange.
Once there he took care to meet us in our hotel the day previous to the excursion to decide where and when to meet. So next day early in the morning he picked us up at our hotel.
Unlike all the other guides we hired (four in total during our stay) he was the only one not to harass us expecting future tours, actually he didn't at all. Also, he gave us lots of space to go on our own, but never hesitating to talk with us and answer our questions if we wanted.
He also got rid of any harassers around us, in one ocasion even having to stand a big argument by the harasser.
Last, we hired him for the Fathala trip, but when that was over we asked him to show us Fort Bullen in Barra and give us a walk around Banjul, which he happily accepted, adding 2 additional hours to the tour which he didn't charge us for.
Simply excellent, best guide during our stay, by far.

title: Superb bespoke service - gave us exactly what we asked for
text:
We contacted Simon before leaving the UK via email and I was immediately impressed by how quickly he responded, giving me the information I had asked for and an offer to meet us at our hotel to discuss what we wanted to do. As first timers to the Gambia, we arrive at our hotel in Kotu and settled in for a few days before deciding to text Simon to arrange a meeting - by then, we had started to get an idea of the sort of one day tour we wanted to go on. We definitely did not want to be shipped around on large tourist buses, enduring things that were of no interest to us - we wanted something small and bespoke and which gave us a flavour of the real Gambia.
At our first meeting Simon said he was happy to arrange a trip just for my husband and myself - but we said that we happy to share with another couple if they were keen to do similar things. In the end 2 couples - one English and one Dutch went out with Simon for the day on a variation of the South Gambia tour.
We had an amazing day out (10 hours altogether). We visited Serekunda non-tourist market (we were the only tourists I saw), the animal market, Lamin Lodge, a local school (our request), a trip into the bush to visit some local communities, Paradise Beach (for a late lunch) and Tanji - fish market and smokehouses (again we appeared to be the only tourists there). I would say that the choice is yours as Simon will try to give you exactly the experience you are looking for.
We had the choice of going by car or in the back of an open Landrover truck - we chose the truck. The driver was safe - and Simon kept an eye on speeds and overtaking etc. to ensure we all felt comfortable. The truck was old - and as you would expect for the Gambia, but it got us around safely and comfortably - and perfect for going off road.
Simon was an excellent guide - giving us great information and answering all of our many questions - he was charming and relaxed and obviously passionate about his country and its communities. At no time was there any hard sell - or any attempt to sell us more than we had asked for - and this was a refreshing change.
The cost of the tour was about the same as those quoted by the bigger tour companies and well worth the money. If we return to the Gambia we will definitely around another tour with Simon (maybe the overnight one).

title: Interesting tours
text: We (a Dutch couple) have read several reviews on the internet and decided to contact Simon for a tour in Gambia. Simon responded very quickly and agreed to meet us at the hotel in Kotu. We discussed various tours and negotiated a price. The prices of Simon are competitive and better than from the (international) tour operators. We would definitely recommend Simon as a guide. He is friendly, speaks English very well and provides a wide range of  interesting tours. Especially the South Gambia tour and the Makasutu park. Also, by avoiding the big tour operators you are able to help the local people, since you are able to visit local villages, markets, shops and schools where the big tour operators do not stop.

title: Lam's and his team are unbeatable!
text:
As usual, I did as much research as possible before choosing Lam's Tours and he did not disappoint!
Lams was great to deal with - responded promptly to emails and answered our questions clearly so that we could decide what trips would suit us most. He and his team were always punctual and well prepared - with everything needed to make our trips enjoyable and worthwhile.
We did three different excursions  with Lams Tours  and each of them was very special in different ways.
Firstly we  did the safari trip to Senegal with two of Lams team - Bakery Daffeh and Malick Jarju -  and they were amazing - they looked after us every step of way.  The trip involved a great ferry trip in the early morning ( v cold) and then a short journey into Senegal before embarking on our safari. Whilst the game reserve is not huge it still gave a great and exciting flavour of African wildlife and some amazing photo opportunities. 
We then did a  very packed 4wd day tour with Lams himself which involved a trip to the monkey sanctuary, the sacred crocodile pool, Serekunda Market.  the aptly -named Paradise Beach and the fish market. The sights and sounds and smells were amazing and a great insight into local life. Also on that day Lams drove off into a village and approached a family - at random it would seem  - to ask if they would allow us to visit them in their home. This was a very humbling experience and in some ways the highlight of our whole trip  - as the family were so warm and welcoming in spite of living in very challenging conditions with no electricity or running water. And they were very patient about answering all our questions .On Lams advice we took a gift of a sack of rice and we had some small gifts ( not sweets) for the children. It hardly seemed enough in return for their kind hospitality.
Finally we went on a morning of bird watching which involved another very early start but was absolutely worth it as the birdlife in  The Gambia  is so varied and  amazing.
What makes Lams Tours stand out is that they are prepared to go that extra mile to ensure you have a good time... For example, there was no way Lams was going to leave the monkey park until my daughter had got the close up photo opportunity she hoped for! Also - we wanted to try local Gambian food but were struggling to find somewhere good. - so Bakery and Malick kindly gave up their evening to take us to a local cafe for the best meal we had in our whole holiday; and the best company.
Give Lams Tours  a try - you won't be disappointed.
