title: What one wishes every tour to be like
text:
I would strongly recommend Lams Tours to any one who visits Gambia and wants to experience highly personal encounters with people, culture and history.

Lams is one of those rare 'guides' you cross your fingers and hope everyone you book with will be, but sadly all too seldom turns out to be. 

It is personal, it is relaxed, it is not on the 'main tourist highway'.  You will never be 'shuttled along' to the next destination, but rather Lams pays attention to what you seem to be enjoying and adjusts accordingly. You also never get the feeling that every destination / restaurant / family visit is a 'well trodden track', because it is obvious Lam's chooses them at random where appropriate (sometimes it is not).  That might mean it takes another few minutes to locate a family who wants a visit, but hopefully that turns out to be a win for everyone. If you have any specific wishes, Lams will also try to incorporate these. What he does not do (unless you specifically ask, presumably) is to take you to a point of sale where a more cynical traveler might suspect commissions are given.

Importantly, Lams also demonstrated obvious extensive experience in the region.  He was knowledgable about history and places.  He was able to obtain official visas for us on days when consulates are not open due to long-standing relations. He never once needed GPS.

Lams also genuinely appears to be enjoying what he is doing and it consistently shows through in his energy levels.

Absolute full marks for quality. Combine this with a strong offering (he goes to places not all others do) and very fair prices and it is a winning formula.

We took two tours with Lams.  One was a day trip from Gambia via Senegal to G. Bissau, the other highlights of Gambia. We are considering coming back to visit more remote regions and villages in the region and would not do it without Lams.

title: Energetic and Friendly!
text:
When trying to plan our trip to the Gambia I was a little apprehensive because day tours seemed very expensive, and I also wasn't totally sure what I was signing up for. We did the 4x4 as well as the sunset boat cruise (the latter of which did not live up to our expectations). Definitely try to bargain a bit; Lams was very open to my request for a discount because our group was large and because we were looking to do multiple things. 

Lams himself was very professional and met us in the morning right on time. He himself did not accompany us for the day, but instead left us in the capable hands of Ousmane (our guide for the day), and a driver (Nikki). Both were friendly, knowledgeable, and pleasant. Ousmane especially had a lot of energy, seemed to truly want us to have an enjoyable experience, and was constantly keeping spirits high (ex, encouraged us to stand up in the back of the 4x4 when we were stuck in traffic to dance to the music!). If you're going to the Gambia, definitely ask for Ousmane and Nikki; they truly made the experience worthwhile! 

As for our day's itinerary, our first stop was at the Bijilo Monkey park. Go early in the morning to this attraction, as later in the day the monkeys become less interested in the tourists and become more standoffish. Because we went early they were delighted to see us and allowed us to get very close! Later we went to Paradise Beach for lunch, which was relaxing as well. The fish and domodas was especially tasty. For lunch Nikki and Ousmane also surprised us with a watermelon that they had bought earlier in the day; what a thoughtful treat! The day ended with the Fishing village which was cold and rainy, but Ousmane kept everyone's spirits high. Finally, they brought us back to our apartment in Khololi where we were staying, trekking through the neighborhoods until we finally found the location. Once again, they were thoughtful, knowledgeable, and pleasant. We couldn't have asked for a better duo!

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours

title: Go local with Lams tours
text:
What a great, fun way to see Gambia. Lams tours is in the market area. A small local tour company. Lams took my husband and I on the  4 wheel tour. As others we went to the monkey park where he told us about the work there and fed the monkeys and hornbills. Next Charlie at the crocodile pool. They are well fed so you can have a photo while touching one. Lams told us so much about the cultures of the 7 tribes then and now. We visited a batik factory with market, a cattle market. I have never seen so many goats in one area.Lunch at paradise beach. We had a lovely meal and the beach was clean and golden. The fish market in Tanji was amazing. Colours, smell and friendly. The high light for us was a visit to a poor family in the countryside. They showed us how so many locals live in poverty. Very humbling. We bought them a large bag of rice. We were told it would last about a month.
Lams will tailor the tour to your needs.
Great day we won't forget.
With a great guide we won't forget.
He should be No.1
Thanks Lams tours for making our holiday. Great fun and information.

title: Fortbildning / semester
text: Jag har varit på mitt livs resa i Gambia! Har rest med Lams tours förut men detta överträffade allt. Planerade resan tillsammans med Lams, berättade vad jag ville ha ut av den och han hjälpte mig med exakt allt! Lams fixade boende, var min chaufför, tog mig till Kachykally krokodildamm som är en helig plats för invånarna och en spännande plats för oss turister. Där finns även ett litet museum. Lams guidade mig igenom det och hans berättarförmåga fick den lokala guiden att tystna av skam. Den guiden kunde inte särskilt mycket så hans kunder började lyssna till Lams istället. En dag besökte vi Serekunda craftmarket där man kan fynda väskor, smycken, träföremål och en massa annat. Vi åkte till djurreservatet Fathala i norra Senegal där vi åkte runt på safari och mötte en gigantisk giraff-hane som inte gillade att ha oss så nära. I Fathala gick vi också på Lion-walk, det var så otroligt spännande att vandra runt en stund med 2 halvvuxna lejon! Jag är musiker och tog trumlektioner i 3 dagar för Mamou, en trummästare av Guds nåde. Även om du aldrig har spelat trummor förut så passa på - Mamou är en boren pedagog. Vi gjorde också en längre tur till Basse där den svenska föreningen Chigambas driver en skola. Vilken fantastisk anläggning ! Läs om deras arbete på nätet och imponeras! Det är precis så fint som det ser ut på deras hemsida . Min själ vandrar fortfarande runt i Gambia och jag är uppfylld av allt jag har varit med om. Jag vill varmt rekommendera Lams Ceesay som guide, han är glad och rolig, pålitlig , punktlig och serviceminded som få.

title: Lam's tours

Lam's listened to what we wanted to see and  made a fantastic bespoke trip for us.fatala is an absolute must -a full day seeing  Gambian life ,experiencing the ferry, but most of all the amazing animals .Lam's always looks after his guests really well, with nothing being too much trouble. Can't wait for January when we will be booking another few trips with Lam's  fun fun fun !!!!

title: Trips
text: Booked two trips with arch tours both trips were good especially the lazy day cruise would book with them again if I was doing any more trips

title: Great tour and tour guides
text: Great day out, visiting the crocodile park, Lamin lodge and a selection of markets & schools. Tour guides & driver were super friendly and very informative answering any questions that were asked. It was a fun day out from start to finish. You can arrange tours in a cheaper fashion but personally I would stay with the professionals.

title: Home Cooking Day
text:
We had the best day! Our companions, Ayesha, Fanta and (driver)Tom, were all kind, thoughtful and fun. We went to the market to buy fish, rice, veg and fruit, then on to a small village area. 

We are able to visit a house and then cooked lunch outside, traditional Gambian style. The local people were wonderful. We shared the delicious food and then we danced! 

The whole day was so well managed. To spend time with the team was delightful. We learned a lot about Gambia and Gambian food. Ayesha, Fanta and Tom are amazing. Highly recommended (although the loo is tricky if you are not able to squat!)

Thank you. We will be back!

title: 4 in one and Fathala tours
text: Arch tours were superb. We did two tours with them - the four tours in one day with guides Fanta and Dowda and the Fathala Reserve with Aisha and Abdul. They commit to small groups - it's much better than booking through one of the large tour operators. The guides work really hard to make sure you're happy and have a good experience. They are really knowledgeable and their attention to detail is superb. Abdul and Aisha were really great and very competent throughout. However, Dowda and Fanta were the best tour guides I've ever had for a 1 day tour. They were funny, exceptionally caring and knowledgeable and were superb with our two children (4 and 11 months). At times they were entertaining both, just so we could have a relaxed lunch. Highly recommended! I would strongly recommend the four tours in one - it gives an excellent summary of various aspects of Gambian life.

title: Fatala game reserve what a great day
text: We had the best day ever and Arch tours made it the greatest. We were picked up punctualy and as it was only a small group were soon underway Tom our driver on the Gambian side was professional at all times. Aisha and Abdul were entertaining and very informative about every aspect of the tour keeping us safe and entertaining us at the same time. We was met by baba who drove us to fatale to see the wildlife before we entered we were giving a breakfast of eggs meat cheese fruit bread juices and cold drinks after we had seen all the animals we were served our chosen lunches before heading back to our  hotels throughout  the day we were offered a variety  of drinks  we would like to say a big thank you to everyone  for making our day special

title: Great day out to Fathala reserve with lion walk
text: We had a great day today with the arch tours team (Abdul, Ayesha, Tom and Baba). We were picked up at 6.45am from our hotel and taken to the ferry and managed to get the fast ferry. Then we changed drivers and went to the reserve where we first had a lovely breakfast and then went on our safari. We saw all the animals billed, the only ones we had to drive around for a while for were the elusive giraffes but we eventually found them. Then on to the thirty minute lion walk. For us this was the highlight of the day to be so close to lions even if one of them kept running off lol. We were very well looked after the hole day, particularly when going through passport control in Senegal. For those new to Gambia this was for us a little overwhelming as the truck is surrounded by people trying to sell you things and it can be a little daunting but Ayesha and Baba in particular were good in navigatI got us through that. On our trip there were 4 of us which was nice as the service was a little more personal. We had food and drinks throughout the day and we felt safe all day. Highly recommend this as a day out.

title: Roots tour
text: We had a brilliant day out on the Roots tour. Sherrif acted as a tour guide just for our family and answered all the questions we threw at him both on the trip and even on the way to and from the boat. My mum has a disability and the getting in and out of the boat looked like it would be a problem but Sherrif and the boat crew went out of their way to make it as easy as possible. We would highly recommend

title: Fathala safari
text:
Although it took a lot of time travelling it was a Great safari trip. The Guides picked us up outside our hotel at 06.40 and headed to Banjul where we caught the ferry. At the other side there were jeeps waiting to take us off to the safari. The guides stopped off before we got to the Senegal border to give us a breakfast buffet from the back of a jeep which consisted of bread, cheese, cold meats, jam and ice cold drinks.the guides were amazing and stayed with us all day. Explaining Gambian way of life and making sure we werent pestered to much by street beggars. The safari was amazing. We saw rhino, warthogs, antelope, zebras and giraffes. After the safari we had lunch which was included in the price, we had pizza but struggled to eat it all. Then we did the 'walking with lions' . This was an awesome moment when the Lions ( Chris & Sissie) allowed us to walk by the side of them and got some great photos of them. The keepers were amazing and didnt try to force the lions to do anything. The Lions had great trust in them as did the keepers. 
A trip not to be missed

title: Top exciting day tour
text: We joined a four-in-one day tour, actually (if my counting is right) it was more a seven-in-one day tour 😀 Perfect way to get to know the beautiful Gambia in all its aspects. We particularly also liked to be on route with a small group of six accompanied by Fanta and Dave, our super professional guides. They introduced us well in the local life, we could ask them whatever question and we made a lot of fun. Thanks for this unforgettable experience ! Geert and Heinrike

title: Mixed Experiences
text:
Based on the very many good reviews on here I booked the 4 tours in a day with Arch Tours. All was undertaken by Whatsapp with super efficiency. The tour itself I would highly recomend. I lucked out and got a private tour which gave me plenty of time for photography. Dawda was my guide. He was informative and happy to flex around my interests. I would highly recomnmend this tour.
However, I also booked a three hour boat cruise. I was collected at 9.20 driven to the Lodge where we picked up the boat and back on dry land before 11.45. This also included a walk through a paddy field. So not a three hour boat cruise by any stretch of the imagination.
We were then driven back down a bumpy road to a nature reserve for a half hour walk. This lasted way way longer than half an hour and turned out to be a birding trip. None of the guests had known this on booking and none of us had much interest in looking at birds. It was frankly boring! Dawda (the same guide who had been so good the day before) seemed oblivious to our bordom and persistently nagged me(or so it felt) to confirm I had spotted the black blobs in the trees miles away! If birding is your thing, I think this would be a good trip, but afraid it isn't one for me.
We declined a return trip down the bumpy road for lunch and asked to be returned to our hotels. This was not well received. I also found the transport inappropriate on the second trip. We were in a non-airconditioned mini van. It was stifflingly hot.
Sorry! I do not recommend this trip. The 4 tours in one day however, excellent.

title: Fantastic trip to Fathala
text: Booked this trip with Arch tours as have done most excursions including this one before with them, we were recommended them eight years ago and have used them ever since. We were picked up at stated time by tour guide Sherriff,with his driver to be taken to Banjul for first ferry to Barra. We got the ferry which is a newer one than when we maybe last trip and it’s much quicker, then onto border with Senegal. Border crossing very quick with Sherriff taking care of everything.we then stopped for breakfast served on the back of the jeep in the bush. Then onto Fathala. We picked up a local guide and set off into reserve. Saw Rhino, Warthogs,Zebra all in fantastic settings, make sure to take hat, repellent and sun cream. Then back to main lodge to walk with lions, I think we paid £25 more per person to do this, then it was pizza lunch. From Fathala we went to a local village and back for ferry. We just missed ferry and were offerered option of taking Gambian ferry across river which is a pirogue, we opted to do this and it was brilliant, we were carried on shoulders to waiting pirouge in water and set off across river, life jackets supplied, it took about 25-30 mins to cross and was a superb experience, we were glad we missed the big ferry....what an experience! Then on shoulders back to beach on other side, picked up by another jeep and back to hotel. Great day out, highly recommended!

title: Amazing tour company and staff.
text:
We used Arch Tours for two trips while in The Gambia, the 4 in 1 and the Fathala Game Reserve in Senegal.  Both were amazing.  Mr Conteh, the owner, was very responsive to emails/watsapps before we left the UK and we got to meet him in person while we were there.  A great guy.  We were lucky enough to go out with Sheriff for both of our trips and Dave (Davey Boy!) for one of them.  Both were excellent guides and really, really lovely people.  Also a big thank you to our driver Solomon for keeping us safe. 

When we did the Fathala Game Reserve tour we did the walking with lions as an add on.  I was a bit apprehensive about this due to the ethics, as I have been to some places before where the animals were clearly drugged to enable them to be around people.  But I needn't have worried. The lions were clearly well looked after and very much loved by their rangers.  They had an amazing free roaming area.  They are young lions, about 3 or 4 yrs old, and are used to being around people.  Once they get to about 5 or 6 yrs old then they are deemed to be too unpredictable to be around people any more and are released into the wilds of the reserve.  It really was incredible and a must do, one of the highlights of our trip.  With regards to the ethical treatment of animals, I was also happy to see that the crocodiles we visited were also not drugged or de-teethed.  Just lying about quite content, well fed and in no way bothered with the physical strain of trying to eat a person!

If you do go out on the 4 in 1 tour, if you can, please try and take some stationary for the local school you will visit.  They are really in need of any support they can get.  A lot of the teachers are working for nothing as they get no public funding.  If you  are flying with Thomas Cook then you can get 5kg per person free luggage weight if you are taking stuff for charitable purposes.  

Fantastic tours, fantastic company, brilliant guides, I have no hesitation at all in recommending.

title: 4 Tours in 1 Day
text:
We had an excellent time on the tour. Fanta, Mo and Solomon were so professional and excellent as tour guides. We would definitely use them again whenever next we visit The Gambia. They were so engaging and kept us laughing for the most part. Would definitely recommend them. 

Sola and Bukky

title: Disappointed with 2 day "river" trip
text:
Organised with Arch tours really well via Whatsapp, Car was a converted Ford Transit connect van so rather uncomfortable for 3 passengers (no seat belts and unable to see out of the windows without hunching). What made this significantly worse was that we spent nearly all of the 2 days driving. 

Ferry crossing from Banjul took a while, which was almost total chaos, the guide & driver were excellent at navigating both crossings as quick as was humanly possible. 

We had issues with the drivers licence which delayed things too (on occasion). 

The worst part was that we only spent 1.5 hours on the boat, not even from a point to point, a return trip so in fact we went from Banjul to Georgetown and back all by car! Probably the best part of 9-10 hours in that uncomfortable van. Wasted about 30 minutes whilst the guide argued with the boat driver / chef. Who we then had to give a lift too from the boat dock to the hotel!) - even more uncomfortable in the van. 

Very disappointing for a "river trip", one that was expensive too. Should have been offered some kind of compensation really. Not a river trip. 

Stops were, Peanut farm, stone circles, boat, George Town, lunch (near Sinet).

ownerResponse.text:
Hello Sir/Madam,
We (ARCH TOURS) are deeply sorry yoir the dissatisfaction on our 2 days Georgetown trip.
The trip happened on a day that the ferries at Kuntaur were having issues with the propellers which is rather unfortunate and unusual.You have all rights to be disheartened.
From what you have explained,the trip didn't go as planned and we (ARCH TOURS) are ready to offer you a total compensation for we value very much the satisfaction of our customers on all our trips.Thank you

title: Brilliant
text:
Used arch tours five years ago and had a great experience then with the trips we done!so decided to see if still as good!my only concern was I had heard that the guy who owned the company had passed away and wasn't sure if was still running as well as it did by different people !!
But we thought would change it as contacted them before we arrived in Gambia and asked some questions which they promptly answered!
We contacted them when we got to Gambia and they sent a driver to pick us up.to take to the office in senegambia to make some bookings !!
We decided on the roots tour which we had previously done but this time we had to do it overland rather than the boat which was fine by us !!what a great experience we had the banjul ferry etc !a brilliant day was had a long day but well worth it with lunch and cold drinks and water provided throughout the day!!Also we booked to do the fathala safari in Senegal which again was a great experience seeing the animals, walking with the lions!!again the ferry each time madness but great !!special mention to Dave and shreriff  who made out trips so good and to Tom our driver also!!would def recommend people use the company when booking the tours

title: 2nd Year with Arch Tours
text:
After using Arch tours last year for 2 trips (4 in 1 and Makasuto 
cultural-forest) we returned to Gambia and had no regrets in choosing Arch tours once more to go on 2 more trips. This time we chose the Cultural Bonanza and Fathala Game Reserve again two more brilliant trips.
 Everyone involved in Arch tours from the owner, guides and drivers cannot do enough for you and you are made to feel so welcome . With good food and endless supply of cold drinks throughout the day you can’t go wrong.
 Hopefully be back in Gambia soon and straight back to Arch tours.  Thanks for making our holidays so special .
                        Mark, Roisin and Emma

title: 5 Trips in 5 days
text:
Before travelling to Gambia I looked into different tours with a range of companies and the reviews for Arch Tours and the amazing prices meant I couldn’t say no! I and my partner have had the best holiday ever and this is down to our accommodation and Arch tours so thank you.

Each tour provides cold water and other drinks throughout the entire day with lunch!

Fathala Game Reserve - This is an absolute must, what an experience. The tour guide Sheriff was amazing, and ensured the entire trip went smoothly, even crossing the border and on the ferry. The ferry is hectic but if you prepare yourself for a bit of chaos you will not be surprised. It took around 4 hours to travel there with a breakfast stop. In order for this travelling and the price to be worthwhile I would say you MUST do the lion walk. It lasts about 30-40 minutes and it is amazing. You then spend just over an hour driving through the reserve to see the animals, FYI there is not much to see however you do see, giraffes, zebras, buffalo, rhino but in small quantities. You eat at the game park and it was average food. Overall a fantastic day and well worth the money. This is most definitely an all day trip and you’re picked up early in the morning and get back around 5pm. For this trip you will need a jumper if you feel the cold as in the morning it can be a bit chilly, Passports and yellow fever cards (yellow fever cards are useful if not you can pay to get into Senegal without one), you will need a camera and just casual dress, you spend a lot of the day travelling so make sure you’re comfortable.

4 in 1 tour - I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who is visiting, you see so much in one day it is truly amazing. The serekunda market is such an eye opening experience but FYI you will not get that many photos as locals will ask you not to take photos of them as they are working. The crocodile pool was amazing and the guides were very knowledable! The photo opportunities here are amazing; they ensure everyone got the photo they were after! We then visited a school which was such an eye opener, and to learn about the education there - you can take gifts such as books pencils and food but you MUST give it to the head teacher and not the children. We then headed to paradise beach which is a lovely end to the day, a buffet lunch with lovely food and a sunbed on the beach and swim afterwards is just fab! This trip lasts most of the day which is good considering how much you do, you will need to bring a camera and beach attire, there are changing rooms on paradise beach which is useful!

Makasutu Culture Forest - This trip was really interesting, you learn so much about how people live and about the forests they have in Gambia. A lovely peaceful trip including a canoe along the river and a walk through the forest which is home to a large amount of baboons which you WILL see at the lunch time ha-ha! This trip was well worth the money and very insightful, trying the wine tappers jungle juice is good. This trip takes up most of the day we got back at about 3 pm, you will need to bring a camera and insect repellent.

Lazy Day River Cruise - Coming to the end of our holiday we decided this trip would be perfect so my partner could fish and I could lounge around in the Sun. We both really enjoyed this trip and highly recommend. There are two tiers to the boat so you can sit in the cool shade or on sun loungers on top. You will NEED insect repellent. You take a slow journey up the river with a snack break and then "champagne" break along the way before you stop for a swim! FYI this is a swim in the river in the Mangroves... it was lovely and refreshing however it doesn’t look too appealing! Lunch buffet served after swimming with a good range of food including the famous cottage pie which was excellent. The fishing could then commence, they have enough rods and bait for everyone and it was good fun with most people catching a fish! You will want to wear your swimsuit for this trip if you are sunbathing/swimming. There is a toilet on the boat to change if needed. This trip lasts an entire day and you get back around 4.30pm.

Camel Safari - I would only recommend this trip for the reptile farm as it was amazing to find out about the research, conservation and education provided to tourists and locals in order to keep their reptiles safe. Other parts of this trip were a let-down as you do not visit a school as advertised. We visited paradise beach which wasn’t advertised so we did not have any beach equipment but the lunch was okay. I wouldn’t say this was worth the money. Camera and casual dress is recommended for this trip as it does get hot in the day. This trip didn’t last too long as there wasn’t much to do and we were back for 2.30pm.

Because we booked so many tours we ended up with a discounted price and we more than happy with the prices and what we paid for all the trips. 

Overall I couldn’t recommend Arch tours highly enough the tour guides and drivers couldn’t do more to ensure your time with them is nothing less than fabulous. 

Thank you so much to Sheriff, Mohammed and Fanta and the drivers Tom and Solomon. Sheriff and Mohammed were the most informed and helpful guides you could come across and they ensured we really enjoyed our time so thank you.

title: Goed agency, gave tour (Early Bird Tour)
text:
Via de Lonely Planet kwamen wij bij Arch Tours terecht. Via WhatsApp de Early Bird Tour geboekt door de mangroven (startpunt Lamin Lodge). Er werd snel en in goed Engels gereageerd. Op de dag zelf was de gids keurig op tijd. Omdat we net voor het hoogseizoen zaten waren wij de enige twee op de tour; perfect! 
Wij hebben genoten van de zonsopkomst en de vele vogels op te tour. De gids was zeer kundig: spotte veel vogels en wist er ook veel over te vertellen. Zowel de excursie als Arch Tours dus een aanrader!

title: Excellent Tours
text:
We booked the 4 in 1 and Roots tours with Arch after reading the many excellent reviews on TA and I’m so glad we did. 
For the 4 in 1 tour we were in a group of 5 and just the two of us for the Roots tour, far better than the coach load sizes we often saw with other tour companies. This meant we were able to take our time at each destination, asking as many questions as we liked. There was certainly no sense of being rushed.
Mohammed was our guide for both trips and was an excellent host. Very informative and ensured that we were continually supplied with drinks. I was a little apprehensive about getting the ferry but Mohammed was skilled at getting us onto of off the ferry safely, avoiding the rush and the risk of pick pocketing.
Nothing was too much trouble for the Arch team, even sharing their fresh peanuts on way back and explaining the best way to open them...then to my surprise they stopped off to pick up a cake for my birthday which was a lovely guesture.
I thoroughly recommend Arch Tours for your next Gambia adventures.

title: 2 days George Town + The Roots tours
text:
After seeing so many good reviews about Arch Tours, I decided to book the 2 days George Town trip with my friend and we were not disappointed ! The trip was amazing, we had a fantastic time.. 

The tour guide Sheriff was very knowledgeable and friendly.. Same for the driver. The tour was so good that we did book the Roots tour a couple of days later.

If you are looking for a reliable and friendly tour company.. Go with Arch tours, you won't be disapointed

title: Superb
text: Wonderful trip to Fathala with Black&whie safari. Professional and reliable service. Highly recommended!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The best in The Gambia
text:
What an amazing company with amazing people in it! I would recommend going with this local tour company rather than through a travel agent as you go in much smaller groups or private for a cheaper price!

The owner Armstrong was so helpful, attentive and responsive. He picked us up from our hotel and took us to his offices so we could plan our week ahead. We did the following tours:
 - 4 wheel drive in a group of 5. This was a really good way to see the many things The Gambia has to offer. I especially enjoyed the crocodile pool and the fishing village.
 - Senegal safari with the Lion walk (must do the lion walk!). The ferry was also an experience in itself! We did this as a private tour.
 - Makasutu as a private tour which was beautiful. The park guide was super informative and the grounds were stunning. The food was also delish! 

We always felt safe and in the know with our tour guides who were always looking out for us.  We also got to nap in between on the long drives which was lovely in the heat. They also had ice cold drinks on tap which was needed!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Enjoyed our tours
text: Would defo recommend Black and White tours. Lamin and Yaya were very knowledgable and made our experience in Gambia a memorable one.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Wonderful experience
text: Good communication, nice people, good organised tours. The perfect way to learn more about The Gambia! Would book again!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great communication, great value, and a wonderful introduction to Gambia.
text: I went on three tours with Black and White Safaris. The city tour of Banjul, Roots, and the Round Trip (Crocodiles, Markets, Beaches and a lovely local school). Armstrong was extremely communicative during the booking process which made for a friendly and relaxing build up to my trip. The tours were on time, professional and the guides (Yahya and Alex) informative and extremely lovely hosts. They coped with any issues beyond their control such as roadworks and strikes with good grace and ingenuity and ensured the tours ran like clockwork. The food served on the longer tours was also very good, and cold drinks provided throughout which was very welcome in the wonderful Gambian sunshine. Very much recommended!  Abaraka Barke to everyone at Black and White Safaris. Hope to come again!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Incredible tour of The Gambia and South Senegal!
text:
We had an amazing, tailor made 3 day tour through The Gambia and South Senagal. We contacted a number of tour operators before our trip and Black and White were easily the best to communicate with. Armstrong listened to our requests and gave great advice on the best options for us, we actually changed our original plans a lot based on his recommendations! He met us at the airport when we arrived in The Gambia to discuss options in more detail, and we then booked a 3 day tour.
Lamin and Abriham looked after us exceptionally well - we had a packed itinerary and early starts each day. First we went to Georgetown, with a lot of stops along the way, including a boat trip where we saw chimpanzees and hippos! Lamin provided us with a wealth of knowledge about The Gambia, answering all of our questions, and Abriham was happy to stop whenever we wanted to take photos as we passed through the country.
The next day we drove to the border, with a stop in a local village which was a very special experience. Lamin handled all of the various border checks for us and it all went very smoothly. It was a long drive to the South Senegal cost but again with plenty stops along the way. We arrived at night, so waking up in the morning right on the beach was wonderful to see!
Highlights on the drive back the following day were a boat trip to a remote inhabited island where a local boy gave us a tour, and then a stop to meet a King!
I can't recommend Black and White Safari enough - they're the best tour company I've used (and I've been on a lot of tours!). We crammed in so many sights in a short space of time, and Lamin and Abriham made sure we were well looked after and safe the entire time.
If you're going to The Gambia, please speak to Armstrong about all the tour options they offer!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing
text:
Armstrong and his whole team were amazing through out holiday we did 2 trips with Sheriff and he made it fun and we learnt so much. We did the Senegal safari and 4 x 4 Gambian tour. They whole team were professional and helpful even when i needed to go to the bank Abraham offered to walk with me.
I recommend this company so much

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 5* Amazing
text: I visited The Gambia for the first time with my friend and her 4 year old daughter and we cannot recommend Armstrong and his team highly enough. Abraham and Sheriff especially who have not only provided unforgettable tour experiences - Senegal Safari with Lion Cuddling (would go as far to say is better than lion walking!!) and 4x4, but they have also helped us and advised us when we were unhappy with our hotel and wanted to move. They were patient with us and helped us move our luggage and have also provided us with transfers from the airport to hotel etc. Their knowledge of The Gambia and professionalism knows no bounds, we have continuously recommended them around our hotel and will continue to do so as I truly believe you will not get a better experience anywhere else!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: A trip to remember
text: We booked a tour with Armstrong to Fathala wildlife park. We arrived in the Gambia with TUI however their tours were fully booked so we went with these guys - no regrets! The tour was reasonably priced and very well organised. We heard about this company from a guest at the hotel we were staying. The tour rep that accompanied us was Yaya. He did a great job in coordinating the trip for us and getting us through The Gambia/Senegal border. I wish we were able to book more trips with them as I can almost certainly guarantee they would have done an excellent job.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Black and White tours made our Gambian experience one to remember <3
text: Black and White safari tours was recommended by a friend who said her experience with them was great so I took their number before flying out. Myself and my mum contacted them and found Armstrong to be very professional and efficient with his responses. Turns out the office was a short walk from where we were staying (Kololi Beach Hotel) and we met him in person. Setting up the tours was easy and hassle free and Armstrong was super friendly. The 1st tour we took was the 4-wheel drive where we got to really experience some of what Gambia has to offer including a wonderful Gambian lunch and visiting a nursery they help support. Our tour guide was Alex and he was amazing. He really took care of us and made us feel so welcome. He's such a respectful and bubbly tour guide who regularly made us laugh and made the experience for us a fun one! We loved it so much we went on a second tour where we got the see the Gambian river and visit the national reserve park. Both tours were engaging, enjoyable and a wonderful experience overall. Our driver was also lovely and worked hard getting us from place to place all day on both tours. We definitely recommend them! They provide drinks as well during the tour. Special thanks again to Alex, our wonderful tour guide and Armstrong who is doing an excellent job both supporting the community and running a great tour agency.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Brill
text: Armstrong and his crew Saliff and Baz provide  efficient safe and informative tours. They are very personable and a joy to do business with. Thoroughly Recommended

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great company
text:
This is an absolutely first Class trustworthy company 

COVID has hit hard yet they still keep smiling 

Armstrong always contacts  you even in the uk before you arrive 

He will get you at the airport if needed and you are very safe on all of the trips , we have used them now for many years and they have become friends 

A go fund me page had been set up to raise much needed funds to help local communities 

Gambia is a bit off the beaten track but the weather and the people are lovely well worth going .. see the real Gambia with Black and  white safaris 

Black and while , we will see you again , keep up the good work for the communities you support 

Thank you 

Ian and Darryl lewis

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing company from start to finish!
text:
Our first visit to Gambia was amazing and that’s largely thanks to Black & White Safari! I contacted Armstrong before we left the U.K. and met him at his office on the strip, when we arrived. 
We decided to book 4 trips, The Safari and lion walk, The 7 sights of Gambia, Roots and The Lazy River Fishing. 
SALLIF was our amazing guide and we requested his company for all our trips, which Armstrong kindly agreed with. In fact many of our trips included both of them, with Armstrong catching the most fish and agreeing to have a snake wrapped around his neck, which was hilarious! 
Every trip was brilliant, with everything organised to perfection! We felt safe and relaxed throughout and even ended up booking 2 more trips, The sunset cruise at Lamin Lodge and finally The Reptile Park and Paradise Beach. 
I want to thank them from the bottom of my heart and look forward to returning next year, when we will book many more trips including the 2 day Hippo tour ❤️

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Trips with black and white safari tours
text: Excellent service and well looked after by our guide Lamin. Well organised trip and very informative. Would use again.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Simply the best tour company in Gambia
text:
We have booked 4 trips, so I will review each one separately to give a true picture. 
This company, run by Armstrong, is amazing and one I can highly recommend. 
I would suggest making contact with them before you travel, but they can be easily found on the strip in Kololi.
All communication is instant, with Armstrong replying and answering any questions we had. We discussed what we wanted on our first trip to Gambia and his suggestions were perfect! 
Our first tour was the Safari in Sénégal and to Walk with the Lions.
Wow just wow! We were picked up promptly at our hotel and introduced to our guide Sallif. We enjoyed his company and trusted him so much, that Armstrong has kindly allowed Sallif to guide us on all the trips. 
The ferry crossing, safari and Lion walk went smoothly and were totally amazing.
But the important thing is that we felt safe and could rely totally on our guide at all times during the trip. 
You leave your hotel, drive to the ferry at Banjul and then cross to Barra. That in itself is amazing experience. Then cross the border to Sénégal and on to the nature reserve. 
Don’t think about just do it! ❤️

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 12 days roundtrip Sengal and The Gambia, including all major UNSECO sites
text: We (2 adults) went on a two-week round trip through Senegal and Gambia. Out of seven (!) contacted tour operators in The Gambia and Senegal, Armstrong Jobarteh’s Black & White Safari was the only travel company immediately replying to us and willing and able to meet and accommodate our demanding expectations. We went from Dakar to the north to Saint Louis and the bird sanctuary Djoudj, then again via Gambia with its historical sites and nature reserves (hippos, chimpanzees) to the south of Senegal to the Casamance to Cap Skirring and spent the end of the trip at the mouth of the Gambia River in Banjul and surroundings. We were in a different place almost every night and saw and experienced a lot of both Senegal and Gambia. Black & White Safari provided the experienced guide Lamin and the careful driver Bax for the trip and we were together for the whole trip. We had a packed itinerary and always felt safe and in very good hands with our travel companions. They were always keen to fulfil all our requests for sightseeing and nature experiences. Each accommodation was well chosen and met our requirements. During our trip, Armstrong and his team was always available and concerned about our well-being. As the routes involved countless police check-points and also crossed national borders several times, and finally the road conditions varied from decent and good to bad, it was not always easy to keep to the schedule. In this respect, our tour guide Lamin always had a good overview and thus ensured a good flow. The interaction with our tour guide was always sympathetic and friendly and we fully recommend the contact and cooperation with Black & White Safari. We emphasise this because although Senegal and The Gambia have a good tourism infrastructure on the coast, only simpler accommodation can be found inland or in not so touristic areas. In the run-up to the trip, it was difficult to find a travel company at all that could or was willing to cater to our ideas. We are therefore very grateful to Armstrong Jobarteh and his Black & White Safari for the effort he made to fulfil our wishes and make the trip an unforgettable experience that we will look back on with pleasure.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent Three-Day Tour of Gambia
text:
Through our many discussions on WhatsApp, Armstrong (owner) worked out an efficient tour for my wife and me. The tour included lodging, food (always good), guide and driver. Some of the places we traveled were Atlantic Coast mangroves by boat, Banjul Arch & Museum, Gambia National Museum, Wassu Stone Circles, Georgetown, Gambia River National Park by boat and many markets and bird viewing points. Armstrong picked us from the airport and returned us there.

Along the way our excellent guide, Alex, and terrific driver, Bernard, helped us meet people on the road or working in the fields. Everything Armstrong promised, he was able to deliver. He also monitored the quality of the service we were receiving. For example, we changed the hotel of the first night to another one on the second night, to have better value.

Armstrong can arrange trips from one to multiple days. He can also extend the trip to Senegal. This option should be considered, especially for southern Senegal. 

We spent three days, which is the minimum. Five to seven would have allowed a slower pace and more places to visit.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great professional tour operator
text:
The Roots Tour to James island was an incredible experience. We were pleasantly accompanied by Lamin who has extensive knowledge about the country's history. It was a great relaxing and educational day.
Our second tour was the Four Wheel Drive. Yaya and Alex took us on a full day trip to different interesting sights.
Black and White Safari is a great small scale operation with a personal touch and really great people. We definitely recommend anyone visiting Gambia to go with them. Thanks guys!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Une expérience inoubliable
text:
Nous avons fait 3 excursions : La réserve de Fathala au Sénégal, La forêt culturelle de Makasutu et l’excursion de 2 jours à Janjanbureh. 3 excusions incontournables à faire qui vous permettront de faire la tour de la Gambie. De voir de magnifiques paysages, de nombreux animaux dans leur espace naturel, d’aller à la rencontre de la population, de visiter de beaux villages, et de découvrir la culture gambienne. 
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour avec Black and white safari. Armstrong propose des excursions complètes, vous n’avez plus qu’à faire vos valises. Merci à Lamine, le meilleur guide, qui a su nous accompagner durant tout le séjour, et nous faire découvrir la Gambie et ses merveilles.  Une magnifique expérience, merci pour votre  professionnalisme, votre gentillesse et votre dévouement. 
Nous vous recommandons Black and white safari les yeux fermés.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 100% recommended
text: We booked the one day Safari Tour to Fathala as well as a 3 three day tour to Janjanbureh and Tendaba. Both trips were amazing, traveling was very relaxed with several short stops to see lots of interesting small things. Our guide Lamin did an extraordinary job and explained us many details about the country.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Senegal Trip, great experience
text:
We did the trip over our Christmas holiday. I have been to Gambia many times however have not done this trip. I was fully aware the trip now costs more so we were prepared for that. JJ and team collected us at our hotel, there was seven on the trip. Very informative guide and very helpful. Banjul yes this is busy too, however the guides are always very close to you all. The ferry is busy and again we knew this and were happy to experience this, not for everyone im sure. Drinks were provided whenever we needed them. We enjoyed the ferry and people watching. Short drive to the border, which again is quite busy but great for a  few photos. From Barra to Fatala park the drive was approx 30/45 mins, lots of children waving so its a pleasent drive.
At Fatal a short form to fill in and then on through the park with one of their guides on the jeep with us. Ok please dont go on this trip expecting  Kenya style Safari, as it does not compare. So accept it for what is. Approx 2 hours with sighting of Girraffe,One Rhino, Zebra, Antelope and Warthog, ect.
If you have never done a Safari that this trip is a great start.  Quiet dusty so again you need to prepare for that. On the way back we had lunch at Barra, which was quiet impressive. The Lion trip is not included in the trip and again we were made aware of this before we travelled.
We really enjoyed the day. Our guides were great.
Be prepared that the ferry may be delayed, this things happen. Our return journey was, not a problem for us.

title: value for money ? NO WAY !!
text: recently went to gambia and had a great holiday lovely people and warm weather just what we needed at Christmas time,we went on a trip to Senegal with bushwackers and after being 30 minutes late in the morning we headed off to Banjul for the ferry,this was chaos just a free for all we were told to expect this but it was mayhem !! anyway we got there and then headed to border control and had to pay £20 each for passport stamp !! what a con ,we had already paid £65 each for the trip,so £170 for a day trip for 2 plus spending money in  gambia is very expensive!! got to the reserve and were promised 2.5 hours in the jeep we only had 1 hour in fairness we saw some animals,then we were ask if we wanted to see some lions oh had would be another £20 each please NO WAY !! they can see the tourists a mile away,there are people starving in the same area !! went back for the ferry had a sandwich for lunch, was ill on the way back ! and back to hotel by 4.30 ish what a day,would I recommend  it? yes to gambia but at that price NO to Senegal trip with bushwackers,thomas cook have stopped the trip to Senegal due to health and safety reasons and I can see why!

title: Lamin Lodge birdwatching & Abuko Nature Reserve
text:
A good introduction to The Gambia's birds. We were picked up from the hotel at 6:15 am by our guide Musa and our driver (a bit early in our opinion and they were 15 mins late). We had arranged our half-day trip (boat ride near Lamin Lodge and Abuko reserve) the day before with Janaiba, who met us in front of the hotel -  a very nice and professional lady. 
During our boat ride in the mangroves, for which we had 3 nice guides, we managed to see the African Darter and the Pink-backed pelicans, which was great. After our boat ride we had breakfast (a bit late, considering we hadn't drank nor eaten anything since 5:30); the breakfast was excellent, cooked by a lovely lady who kept bringing us delicious food. Afterwards, we drove to Abuko Nature Reserve, which was interesting, but because we got there quite late and it was getting hot, we didn't see much. We did, however, manage to see the head of a crocodile, the African Jacana, a couple of monitor lizards and some bee eaters. The baboon cage is horrendous and we just wanted to leave after we saw it.
Overall, a pleasant first experience of the Gambia's birds, although slightly overpriced for what it offered.

title: Amazing! Would happily use again!
text: we are coming to the end of our holiday in the Gambia and have done all of our tours with Bushwhacker, the first 2 were the Makasutu Forest and the Sunset River Cruise, both amazing trips in themselves but made so much better by our guide JJ. He was friendly, attentive and his local knowledge is unreal, he knows every bird , was able to distinguish their calls and was some one who you could easily just spend the day listening to! Our final trip was the 4x4 trip and Mo was our guide , although Solomon was with us 2 as we were 2 Jeeps together, their approach was different to JJ's , they got your energy up as well as having the fantastic local knowledge, and I think a special mention should be said for their amazing dancing with the local ladies when we stopped by the fields on the trips. Ali the manager was also great when he came to the hotel to see us to arrange the trips, not one aspect of the staff or the trips could I find fault with, all genuinely lovely guys and fun trips, next time I'm in the Gambia, first thing I'll do is book more with them as I feel there is so much more to see!

title: Serekunda Market experience
text:
We heard about Bushwhacker tours through some friends that we were travelling with to the Gambia and met the manager, Ali, who was such a friendly and knowledgeable guy. He arranged for us to visit Serekunda market which is one of the biggest in the Gambia and well worth a visit for an explosion on all of the senses. 

He drove us there and navigated us around the maze of stalls and talked us through a number of interesting facts about the market and about the history of the Gambia.

We'd definitely book with Bushwhacker again - excellent friendly service and will accommodate any needs you have. Well done Ali and team!

title: Couldnt do more for you.
text:
We emailed Bushwhacker prior to arrival and arranged a meeting for the following morning of our arrival and discussed the available tours with JJ whom was present for all three of our tours. We opted for the 4x4 South Gambia trip, Sunset Cruise and the Fathala nature reserve in Senegal. 

We were provided with plenty of refreshing drinks and the stops for Lunch and the food on the Cruise were all lovely.

JJ was very knowledgable in a relaxed informal manner and was open to any questions we asked from football to religion to village life and was a excellent guide.

I wouldn't be true if I didn't express our disappointment at the Fathala visit as we saw very few animals due to the length of the grass in the reserve. Apparently it is burnt down around the 15th December to a shorter length following the wet season. After the owner of Bushwhacker Ali picking us up following the trip he suggested he knew the grass was long and we would have difficulties seeing animals.I would say if you are booking Fathala ensure the grass length has been resolved.

I would recommend Bushwhacker and would use them again. I would also say that JJ has an ambition to try a Mcdonalds and thus if you want to be in his good books pre pack a happy meal or cheeseburger for him!

title: The first choice for Gambia Excursions
text:
This is my second review for Bushwhacker having visited The Gambia.  I cannot recommend them enough for the personal and friendly service.

This time we visited Fathala in Senegal again to see how the lion cubs have grown since our visit back in March.  We also had two other wonderful days out on the Roots trip and South Gambia 4X4.  Both trips were excellent and informative.  

Their prices are very competitive with big savings on doing similar trips with Thomas Cook and you also travel in very small groups, sometimes just your own party so you have one-to-one service.

Big thanks to Mo, Zach and the rest of the Bushwhacker team and look forward to seeing you all again.

title: The only people to book with
text:
What can we say about Bushwhacker Tours, they are simply the best! We booked quite a few tours with Bushwhacker because we told them what we would like to do and they tailor made the tour to suit us. The best time we had with Bushwhacker and our guide JJ, was when we went to the Chimp rehabilitation Project in the River Gambia National Park. We were very lucky to have met two great people at our hotel who asked if they could come with us, it turned out to be the best thing we could have done, because with just the four of us on the tour, JJ and the driver it was perfect!  it was an early start, 6am but so worth it to see the sun rise as we drove along the south of Gambia, passing through beautiful villages and stunning scenery. Our drive was long and at times a bit bumpy and dusty, but that just added to the whole experience of getting out and seeing the real Gambia. We had lots of stops along the way, JJ made sure we had everything we wanted, drinks, something to eat and loo breaks!  He was great at spotting wildlife for us too and would jump out the mini bus to get us the perfect picture! While driving along we talked a lot and when we mentioned something that we would like to do, JJ pulled out all the stops to accommodate us, on one occasion we mentioned that we would like to go into a traditional village, on the way back JJ organised it just like that. 

Once we got to the CRP after driving up dirt roads, crossing rivers we were warmly welcomed by the staff standing on the deck of the waterhouse, we had a nice cold drink and a great lunch, after lunch we were shown to our tents, Prepare yourself for a hike though, up 120 steep steps. We had been given an hour to shower and change before we went out on our first boat ride to see the chimps. It wasn't just chimps we saw, hippos, a crocodile, lots of birds and monkeys put on a great show for us. After our boat ride it was back to the tent for yet another shower and to get ready for supper, after that it was off to bed for us,  just to let you know that there is no electricity here, you have to carry a solar lamp with you when its dark, the loo is a compost one and the showers are open air, but we loved it!  Day two, early rise, coffee and tea and then off again for our boat ride and tour to the place where the last Gambian elephant was, what a view! Back to the waterhouse for breakfast and then a lazy time on the deck until lunch time, when it was time for us to leave and the drive back on the north side of Gambia.

On the way back, once again JJ made sure he took great care of us. It was late when we arrived back to the hotel, but well worth all the travelling, its the only way to see the real Gambia.

We went on a few tours with Bushwhackers and we would highly recommend them.  Thank you Bushwhackers, CRP and thank you so much JJ for looking after us so well and making some great memories for us.

title: Lazy River Cruise
text: Very professional, and knowledgable. Special shout out to JJ - very good tour guide. Had the boat to ourselves as it was off season. Catered for our needs - vegetarian. No complaints at all. Word of warning - be careful if you decide to swim in the river, avoid if you can my freind and I have returned with some very nasty bugs!!

title: Makasutu
text:
Had a faboulous half day trip to the Makasutu Culture Forest. After being collected from our hotel, we were taken across the country through local villages, and got to see and experience the real Gambia. Upon arrival at the forest, We were taken on a nature walk where were saw a wide range of wildlife, including bats, birds and an entire troop of several hundred baboons walk past us, no more than a metre or two away. We stopped and met the old man who still lives on the reserve, and he read my girlfriends fortune (for a small fee). We were shown how palm oil is collected by one of the locals, and tried some of the delicious palm wine. The morning was finished off with a beautiful cruise in a canoe down the creek through the mangroves. 

The guides we had on the trip were excellent. Very friendly and knowledgeable. We were regularly offered cold drinks and given time to relax. On the trip back we had a really good chat with the Bushwacker guide (Solomon), and obtained a real insight to the Gambia and it's people.

Highly recommended!

title: Beste Touren
text:
Wir haben vorher einige Touren und Fahrten mit zum Teil "freien Fahrern" gemacht. Die Touren mit Bushwhacker sind nicht zu vergleichen. Haben bisher 2 gemacht - min 1 folgt noch. Sehr locker, gut informiert, sehr spontan und abenteuerlustig. Ganz großes Lob an J.J. Der uns bei der Safari nach Fathala begleitet hat. 

SEHR EMPFEHLENSWERT!!!

title: Very good guide
text:
We did the 1 day trip to Fatalah Safari Park in Senegal and the 1 day trip "Lazy Day" on the river The Gambia. For both trips, our driver was Modou. He's a very funny man that always laughs.
Our guide's name was also Modou. He is very professional. You can take the ferry with him without worries. His explanations are great and he does all the arrangements for you at f.e. the Senegalese border.
We enjoyed very much.

With Bushwacker tours, food and drinks are included in the full day tours.

title: 2-day chimp project trip - perfect
text:
Everything about this trip was magical. We were keen to go with a fully Gambian company and booked in advance by email; JJ came to our hotel the morning after we arrived to discuss details and options. After a very early start 2 days later and a two-hour (!) ferry crossing to Barra, we drove along the pretty good road north of the river, stopping frequently for cold drinks and wildlife; both JJ and driver Mo turned out to be brilliant bird spotters. At Kuntaur, we were collected by one of the chimp project staff for the half-hour boat trip to the camp, where we were given a delicious lunch and shown to our tents. Then off in the boat again for a couple of hours pottering around the islands watching the chimps, baboons, hippos and, as everywhere, stupendous bird life. Another great meal and then bed, to be woken up the next morning by bellowing hippos, screeching baboons and chimps and trees full of birds. The dawn view out over the treetops and the river was stunning - what a privilege! After breakfast and a guided walk (entertainment provided by the young baboons), back to Kuntaur and the car. A short detour to the world heritage Wassu stone circles and on upriver to Georgetown where we crossed to the south bank for the drive back to the coast. Home just after dark - a very full two days.
A relatively expensive trip (by Gambian standards), because of the cost of staying at the chimp project, but excellent value. JJ and Mo were highly competent and knowledgeable and a pleasure to be with. The only sour note was discovering that the other couple staying at Baboon Islands were there for two nights; next time!

title: Fantastic 2 days in our Gambian experience
text:
We went on 2 trips, The Gambian Experience and the Safari to Senegal. We were lucky in that we had JJ as guide both times. This man is The Gambia, bright, cheerful, knowledgable and an all round great guide. The Gambian experience was our favourite trip out, all day seeing the crocodile pool (Good), Serakunda market (Experience of a lifetime), Cattle and sheep market (Interesting), Paradise beach (Beautiful), The lady farmers collective (Left us speechless) and the fish market (every step was a new memory). The Senegal safari trip got off to a slow start when the ferry was delayed 3 hours, but even the wait was interesting, looking at the ferry, the Gambian trucks and colourfull local people, ferry journey was exciting, the actual Safari was good, but the animals are not exactly hard to find. 
When we go again, we will be doing at least 2 more trips out and asking for JJ to guide us. If you visit the Gambia, please dont hide in your resort, use JJ and Bushwhacker tours to show you the real Gambia and bring pencils and books for the children you meet. This little country has a big heart.

title: Fantasic tour company
text: This company were totally brilliant. We emailed them in January and they promptly sent us a full list of their trips and tours. We emailed them again on arrival in Banjul earlier this month and again had  a promp response from them. We were met by  JJ the following day at the hotel and he outlined everything we needed to know. We did the North Senegal/walking with lions with them. We found JJ to be absolutely amazing with his humour, knowledge and extreme care and courtesy of his clients. Soloman also accompanied us in another jeep as there were also a party of Lithuanians on the same tour who were also staying at the Laico. Again, we found Soloman to be absolutely wonderful. We loved very minute of our time with them and they were so much cheaper than Thomas Cook and are insured. No hesitation at all in recommending this company. We will most  definately use them next time.

title: Fantastic - "lazy day" and "4x4"
text: Excellent company - great service with fantastic value for money.  Highly recommended, thanks to Mo, JJ and Solomon!

title: Bushwhacker Tours Gambia
text:
We researched online with various tour operators in The Gambia and found Bushwhackers the best value for money without any compromise on excursions compared to any others.  We called them from our hotel and they were there in 20 minutes and we booked 2 trips with them. The first being a half day trip to Abuko Park, Brikama Wood craft market and a lovely boat trip through the mangroves at Lamin Lodge.

The next day we had an early start to catch the 1st ferry of the day in Banjul to visit to Fatala Park in Senegal and a 4wd drive through the park were we saw giraffes, zebras, monkeys, warthogs and a black rhino amongst many others. The highlight of our trip (and of the holiday) was a walk with three 11 month old lion cubs (for a small extra charge paid to the park).

We intend to return to The Gambia soon and will be using Bushwhackers again as they have other trips we wanted to take but didn't have time.

Thanks and a big shout out to Mo our guide and Mo our driver.

title: Excellent service!!!
text:
After doing a lot of research before going to Gambia, me and my partner arranged to meet someone from the company with the hope of booking a few trips whilst on holiday.

We were not disappointed!!! 

We were met at our hotel at the arranged time and were straight away happy with everything on offer. Not only were the trips very affordable, we as tourists also learnt a lot - our guide JJ was so knowledgable we came away not only knowing so much more about this country in Africa but we also felt like we had learnt a lot about the Gambian culture whilst still having lots of fun!

We booked two full day trips and got a half day free - take advantage - all three were amazing!!
Not only was JJ very professional, he was also kind, easy to get on with and also tended to the needs of all people in his party.

Please if you are travelling to Gambia, then you must use this company - They are excellent!!!!

Me and my partner came away feeling like we had made friends for life with the Bushwacker team. 

A tip - You must do the North Senegal Safari!!!

title: Amazing trip & company
text: Having known 'JJ' the tour guide from a previous trip taken a few years ago with another company, we had no hesitation in booking a tour ' Senegal safari' with his new company Bushwhacker tours. From the moment we were picked up from our hotel 'JJ' was a formative & attentive in every way possible. Nothing was too much trouble for him or his staff. Cold drinks was provided all day and a hot lunch was also included. The ferry crossing was worth the money alone, an insight into the real Gambia. Will definitely be booking another trip with this company when we return next year. Finally a special word goes to guide Solomon who was a pleasure to see every night on our way out along the strip.

title: lazy day river cruise
text: we were picked up on time at 9am by our guide Mo and driver Mo, the two mo's! and taken to our boat for the day which was moored right near the Denton Bridge at Banjul. we then travelled for 45 minutes deep into the mangroves catching site of many different birds as we travelled along. we then moored up and spent about 4 hours fishing and having lunch. we caught many fish. These included Lady fish, Angel fish, Cat fish and Frog Fish. The lunch was freshly cooked on the boat by Mary and cool drinks were avaliable both of these were inclusive of the price. On the return trip  after the water levels dropped you could see all the oysters attached too the roots of the mangroves. We were then taken back to the bridge and our hotel .

title: Best in The Gambia
text: When you visit The Gambia you must go with Lams Tours. They are the best and will show you the real Gambia. Fantastic

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: tour to senegal and fathala
text: We have used Lams on several occasions and have found all of his tours to be great value,  he goes above and beyond a tour guide, he his knowledgeable funny and very kind, on our most recent trip to Gambia Lams took us to Senegal and then on to Fathala wild life reserve, it was an amazing day and crossing on the ferry was an experiance not ot be missed, whilst at the Fathala we walked with lions and seen lots of other animals, we will continue to us Lams on our next visit to Gambia and would recommend him to anyone who is looking to have a great day out in Gambia.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Godt alternativ
text:
Lams er professionel og han skræddersyr din tur, så den fuldstændig passer til det du gerne vil se / opleve. Har du lyst til at gøre lidt på egen hånd er han et fantastisk alternativ til carterselskabernes udflugter.
Vi var med Lams i Georgetown, Chimp Rehap center, Fathala (Senegal) og i Syd Senegal. På alle ture var han opmærksom, informativ og ville os det bedste. Han har arbejdet i Danmark og kender derved den danske kultur.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Best choice in Gambia
text:
We were two Danish women on our first trip to Gambia and therefore wanted to do some tours to learn more about the country and its people. We found Lams on the internet before leaving from home and had a very nice email exchange with him, which resulted in us booking 4 different tours with him - one of them a 3 day, 2 nights trip.
It proved to be a great decision. All of the tours were absolutely wonderful and Lams is a great and knowledgeable guide. He is also great fun and if you are from Scandinavia, he knows a lot about Scandinavian humour and lifestyle as he has lived and worked in both Sweden and Denmark.
Whether you are interested in wildlife, Gambian politics, history, Gambian daily life or African music, Lams will be the one, you can talk to about all these matters. 
We also changed our money at his shop and bought our beers and soft drinks there. Anything else you need, just ask Lams, he will for sure be able to arrange it for you.
Gambia is a beautiful country to visit and with Lams aa your guide, it is even more remarkable. 
When we go back to Gambia next time, we will be sure to look up Lams again.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Un guía y un buen amigo
text:
Este mes de septiembre hice un viaje con mi pareja a Gambia, no conocíamos mucho de este pequeño país pero unos amigos habían ido recientemente y tenían algunos consejos para nosotros, y el mejor consejo que nos dieron lo compartiré con ustedes: Lams Tours. Con él estuvimos casi la mitad de nuestro viaje y entre otras cosas puedo resaltar si buena vibra, honestidad, cariño y sobre todo, siempre me sentía segura cuando estábamos con él.. y no es porque en Gambia sientas miedo, no, es muy seguro como país, pero me sentía muy confiada de los lugares a los que íbamos y las personas con las que hablábamos. Puedes elegir tours de un día o más, cambiar la ruta o adaptarla según tus necesidades.

El tour que incluye Paradise Beach y Tanji Fishing Village fue uno de mis favoritos, entrañables e inolvidable. Siempre buscará lo mejor para ti, eso tenlo por seguro. Además, puedes optar por visitas fuera de Gambia: a Senegal. ¿Te gustan los safaris? pues con él lo podrás hacer.

Sin duda, y sin pensarlo dos veces. Este es el hombre!

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Chigambas
text:
Då var jag och AnnGreth (min fru) hemkomna från ytterligare en resa till Gambia. Chigambas (CHildren In GAMbia BASse) som vår förening heter ligger 40 mil in i landet vid en ort som heter Basse. Vi tillbringade 8 dagar där med mycket jobb och många möten.
Under våra 18 år med flertalet resor varje år har vi anlitat många olika chaufförer. En del bra, en del mindre bra.
Vi vill framhålla att Lamin Ceesay (Lams) hör till en av de bästa vi haft under alla dessa år. En trevlig, rolig, ansvarsfull och serviceinriktad person.
Vi kan därför rekommendera att anlita honom för alla olika utflykter han anordnar!
AnnGreth o Janne Wickman

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: More than a guide
text: Just after a couple of minutes, being with Lams was like being with an old friend. We booked two trips with him but we ended up booking two more!!! He took well care of us and was always looking for us to feel comfortable and happy... plus you can talk to him not only about Gambia but about everything in general. He even drove us to the airport to take our flight back home. A couple of months after our trip we still get in touch with him via mails or text messages and hope to see him again soon. Totally recommended!!!

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: a wonderful tour to Paradise beach in Gambia
text: I've had the most wonderful tour together with a group, including my family. We went with our guide Lams Ceesay, on Lams Tours the Gambia, and experienced things we have never seen before, Lams is the best guide in Gambia! He is so funny and he took good care of us. I don't use to be interested in history but Lams could tell us the history of Gambia in a fascinating way and I have decided to learn more thanks to him. I'm looking forward to next week when we will go to Fatala and walk with the lions. I'm a bit nervous but Lams says that we will be okay. My family and I recommend Lams, he is the best guide. I'm a teenager and I'm not easy to satisfy, haha. We read on Tripadvisor that a person had written bad things about Lams. Please don't care about this person. Lams is wonderful !

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Bra guide
text: Åkte till Senegal och Fathala endags safari med Lams. Hade bokat via mejl på förhand och det fungerade bra. Han är kunnig, trevlig och tog hand om oss på bästa sätt. Kan verkligen rekommendera honom

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Worst person ever!
text: We had been talking to Lams before we arrived in gambia. Thought he was lovely, we arranged to meet up with him the evening when we arrived so we could arrange some trips but he seemed really pushy and when we decided not to go with him as he was too expensive and found someone a lot cheaper he came into our hotel which we thought was wrong anyways. He become aggressive and even threatening. All we said was we didn't want to do one trip with him but was still willing to go to do the snake farm trip but all he said was he wasn't taking us and walked off which was very rude of him. I would personally not go with him just for pure rudeness and how he reacted and that if you do go to gambia to make sure you look at other tour guides before considering him.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Daytrip to Southern Senegal
text: I had the best day of my life. Travelling alone is not always easy but Lams is a wonderful guide . I felt completely safe, got an excellent service and had a wonderful daytrip. I can really recommend this to everyone; alone or a group. If you bring children they will be as satisfied as the parents , Lams is so funny and wonderful with children. Check his website and you will find it hard to choose between the trips. Lams; I hope I will see you soon again!

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: The best guy in the Gambia!!!
text:
With Mom in the Gambia were only a week, but during that time Lams show to us so many interesting things! We fell in love Gambia thanks to him! Attentive, responsive, always will help! Lams-great photographer, thanks to him we have almost 1,000 photos! Monkeys, crocodiles, snakes, a walk along the river! So many memorable experiences! Thank you Lams! And greetings from Latvia!!
Book tours in advance - Lams very popular person in the Gambia!
Nina

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Fantastic
text: We have been to The Gambia many times and have only just returned last week. Once again we did a fantastic trip with Lams Tours. Also from the shop you can change your money, buy your beer , water and soft drinks from Marianne.The prices are much cheaper than some of the bars (which are getting expensive) and other shops. They do a great range of trips where you will honestly see and experience the real Gambia. Don't waste your money anywhere else..... these guys and girls are the best.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: A guide you can trust!
text: We spent a week in The Gambia at Kombo Beach hotel in December 2013. We were visiting West Africa for the first time and wanted to see and experience much more than just a great beach and highly touristic attractions such as Crocodile Pool and Monkey Park. Hence, we started researching tours well in advance and found Lams Tours on the internet. His individual tour to Guinea-Bissau through Casamance is truly unique and we couldn't find anything like it on the internet since Senegal introduced biometric visas in July 2013. The guides at the hotel deemed the trip to be unsafe as Casamance is supposedly a battling region and Guinea-Bissau is one of the poorest countries in the world. They really knew nothing - nobody we've met meant any harm to us. We went with Lams and had truly one of the most satisfying travels. We felt completely safe and comfortable and saw what we wouldn't otherwise be able to see even in the Gambia from great nature to real ethnography. Lams is a really great story-teller and will make you fall in love with Africa. He took complete care of us from getting the visas to go abroad, to food and drinks and the border controls. There was really nothing to worry about when were with Lams. We were so satisfied that we did a Gambian 4x4 tour afterwards which was also a fantastic experience. If you are staying at Kombo Beach, I would also recommend buying drinks and changing money with him as he offers a good rate and probably the best prices. If we were to return to the Gambia I wouldn't search for a new guide just a new tour to go to with Lams.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Trevliga Lams!
text:
Vi åkte ett större sällskap; vår familj, föräldrarna samt systers familj, till Gambia i januari 2014. En kollega hade varit där tidigare och vi fick tips av henne om boende, restauranger, sevärdheter och också tour guide, Lams. Den senare var en verklig fullträff, riktigt trevlig och riktigt kunnig och proffsig, otroligt mån om att få oss att uppleva det bästa av Gambia. Ett fullspäckat dagsschema som aldrig kändes stressigt.  Kan verkligen rekommendera Lams, måste helt klart vara den bästa guiden i Gamiba. 
/Jonas

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Suverän guide
text: Vi kontaktade Lams på förhand via mejl och bokade en utflykt. Han tog oss runt på ett säkert och bekvämt sätt, och fixade spontana avstickare efter våra önskemål och frågor. Lams är kunnig, positiv och förtroendeingivande.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
