text:
A great guide and person. Me and my wife had the luck of finding Lams and could organise some trips with him. Although he has some plans offered on his website, he is very flexible and wants you to get what you want. He is a fun and great guy, very documented about The Gambia, an expert on his job, and above all is very punctual!
We want to go back to The Gambia soon and of course we will book Lams full time!!!

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Bästa guiden i Gambia!!
text:
Tillbringade två veckor i Gambia med min då 7-åriga dotter vintern 2012/2013. Vi hade inte planerat några utfärder för resan i förväg. 

På plats blev vi rekommenderade Lams Tours av vänner. Och vilken fullträff! Lams är professionell, duktig, pålitlig och till skillnad från många andra så var det inte "Gambian time" som gällde utan han var väldigt punktlig. :)

Han tog oss med på flera utflykter som var helt anpassade efter vad jag och min dotter ville ha och göra, bl a besök på marknad där han även hjälpte oss att förhandla om priser, Fathala Park i Senegal (en heldagsutflykt som gav oss upplevelser som vi aldrig hade fått på resebolagets utfärder), vi besökte även en skola och SOS barnby.
Ett plus är att han pratar lite danska/svenska vilket gjorde att han även kunde kommunicera hyfsat med min dotter.

Vi kommer garanterat att anlita Lams Tours nästa gång vi åker till Gambia och kan varmt rekommendera honom.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Bästa guiden i Gambia
text:
När min familj rest runt i Gambia har vi åkt flera turer med Lams och de var över förväntningar.
Han kan mycket om landet och är väldigt bra på att ge fakta. Är det något man behöver hjälp med, tex växla pengar när man är i Gambia så Lams killen man ska gå till.

Utan tvekan bästa guiden 5/5

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: Lams Tours
text:
Hej!

Kan varmt rekommendera Lams för era utflykter i Gambia. Han är vänlig, skojfrisk och mycket pålitlig. Vi var där i slutet på november 2012, vi bokade egenhändiga paket med vad vi ville se och uppleva det var inga problem utan han löste allt till belåtenhet. Han har även växling av svenska pengar till gambianska samt kan ordna med billiga cigarretter så köp inget i taxfreebutiken io Sverige! 

Han tog även med oss gratis på en liten tur till en äkta gambiansk lunchresturang med väldigt god mat och mycket låga priser. Som tack för allt han fixat åt oss så bjöd vi honom på lunchen.....det kostade ju knappt inget alls :-)

Ni kan gärna kontakta honom innan ni reser ner till Gambia och han hjälper er med frågor via mail utan krav på att ni måste boka något. En välgt seriös och trevlig guide.

placeInfo.name: Lams Tours - Day Tours
placeInfo.address: BB Kraft market Kotu Beach, Kotu 4209 Gambia

title: le vrai bonheur
text:
ARMSTROG et LAMINE deux personnes adorables , qui nous ont fait découvrir la vraie GAMBIE , je suis tombé en admiration devant la gentillesse de la population 
L équipe a su s'adapter à nos désidératas ,  vraiment je conseille trés sincèrement 
MARCO

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Reliable, well organised, best quality trips
text:
It was the second time we chose Black and White Safari. Last time we went to Senegal and this time we took Georgetown trip. I highly recommend both: Black & White Safari and every trip they offer! Absolutely reliable, well organised and professional company. And to be honest, it was much more than that. We experienced full commitment of both the owner and the guide.  They made our trips unforgettable in a best way :-D Thank you for that and see you again as we definitely plan to come back to Gambia again!
We would like to thank Lamin especially. His knowledge is impessive as well as the way he takes care of turists. We consider Him our Friend and we'e grateful for what he does. Don't hesitate and start planning your tip to gambia - the Smiling Coast :)

To już nasza druga podróż do Gambii. W obu przypadkach skorzystaliśmy z usług biura Black and White Safari. Za każdym też razem podróżowaliśmy z Laminem - przewodnikiem. I za każdym razem byliśmy pod ogromnym wrażeniem Jego wiedzy, życzliwości, skromności i swego rodzaju opiekuńczości. Lamin dbał o nas pod każdym względem, co znacznie wykraczało przecież poza obowiązki przewodnika. Taki jest i za to ogromnie Go cenimy. Cieszymy się, że mimo pandemii udało nam się wylecieć. cały świat mierzy się z ekonomicznymi skutkami lockdownu, ale uwierzcie, że w Gambii, w której turystyka jest kluczową gałęzią gospodarki sytuacja jest naprawdę tragiczna. Mimo to spotkacie się z uśmiechem i  życzliwością. Dlatego dobrze się stało, że w tak trudnym czasie, kiedy w Gambii praktycznie nie ma turystów, mogliśmy wesprzeć to biuro i móc, po raz kolejny czerpiąc od Lamina wiedzę, po prostu cieszyć się Jego towarzystwem.
Dodam jeszcze, że to czego zwykle się oczekuje: punktualność, uczciwość, zgodność między tym co w ofercie a tym, co otrzymujemy - wszystko to jest w jak najlepszym porządku :)
Dlatego, jeśli wybierzecie się do tego pięknego Kraju, z czystym sumieniem i pełnym przekonaniem polecamy Wam Black and White Safari i Lamina jako przewodnika.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari Fathala
text:
Nous avons fait un safari dans la réserve de Fathala, nous avons eu la chance de voir beaucoup d’animaux et de pouvoir marcher avec les lions. La balade en fin de journée a été super. Le Sénégal regorge de magnifiques paysages. 
Notre guide Lamine a été parfait. Il s’est montré très professionnel et très avenant.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: An great tour
text:
It was a great tour, on the road there are many things to see and the tourguide Lemin knows allot wich make it very nice. The walk with lions was great and impressive, and then we had a bootride wich was unbelievble (for me) at a nice hotel we had dinner and lunch wich was also provided. I would recomment tgis trip.

Ralph Bombe

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Sur  Mesure
text: Bonjour ,   Nous  avons été super  contents de Black and White Safari-day  Tours  , J'ai  envoyé un mail  trois  jours  avant mon départ et Amstrong le boss m'a  répondu directement en français  en me  faisant  des propositions .avec guide  français .  J'avais aussi  demandé les transferts  depuis  l'aéroport , Mahomed et son chauffeur  nous  attendaient avec un grand  sourire  et notre pancarte . le  lendemain gratuitement  ,ils sont venus  nous  chercher à l'hôtel  pour aller chez le BOSS et discuter de  nous excursions pour  nous  faire un programme à  la  carte . , à  chaque  excursion , un chauffeur  personnel ,un guide anglais Lamine très  sympa  et notre  traducteur Mohamed . Tous  aux  petits  soins  ,  attentifs . BRAVO  NOUS vous  reprendrons la prochaine  fois .

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Top company!
text:
Communication with Armstrong prior to the trip was top notch. We paid 30% of the trip upfront through Paypal and paid the rest in cash in person. Lamin was our guide and he was fabulous – clearly knowledgeable and extremely friendly.
We booked 3 tours with these guys – the Sunset Cruise (this is not a cruise but a raft that fits 4-6 people, FYI!), the Fathala Game Reserve in Senegal, and the River Roots tour. The Senegal safari was our favorite, we saw all the animals in the park and also did the Lion walk, where we got a ton of gorgeous pictures.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: A Memorable Trip
text:
We actually booked 3 tours with Armstrong before we got to the Gambia.  We choose his company for the good reviews and also that he donates a fraction of the cost paid to local schools and community projects and loved the local level in which he operated.

From the start via email Armstrong was fantastic at coming back to me promptly to all my numerous queries (we counted 41 email at last count).  Nothing was too small and he was always so friendly and approachable.  He also included free airport transfers due to the number of excursions we booked which was brilliant.  

When we met him in Gambia he was just as friendly and helpful and nothing was too much to organise.  He and his team truly made the holiday.  

The senegal trip with lion walk was fantastic.  Sheriff was a great guide and fantastic with our daughter (who struggled in the heat).  He made sure we knew what was happening and guided us through the immigration process at the senegal border.  The lion walk was done by my husband who loved it, but its worth noting that the lions will be sluggish at this time as its hot and they would not normally be out and about.  Also the lions are not drugged which was a major item we needed to clarify.  Apart from fathala the actual journey was brilliant and experiencing the ferry was a lot of fun.  

We also booked a bird watching tour and a trip to Makasutu and the guides Papa  were very intersecting and helpful.

Overall Black and White are a fantastic local business and they should keep doing what they are doing!!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Unforgettable moments
text:
The trip to Kunta Kinteh (James) island is undoubtedly one of the highlights of our holiday to the Gambia. We were a group of 26 including one child. 
We were picked up from our hotel and were taken to the Banjul seaport where we boarded our boat it just our group only, which made it more like a family outing.
The boat was comfortable and spacious, very relaxing. Food and drinks were plentiful, and hot drinks were served in beautiful china cups and saucers. The majority of the group was vegan / vegetarians so i was concern that there might not be anything suitable provided on the menu, but my concerns was  soon diminished when i saw the delicious vegan and vegetarian food that was on offer.
The tour guides were very knowledgeable.
All in all a very good day it was also emotional but a memorable day.
I would definitely recommend it, everything  was professionally done,

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Senegal Safari with Lion walk
text: Can not rate these guys highly enough. We were looked after by Papa for the full day, he was knowledgeable, considerate and an all round great guy! We travelled across the border to Sengal and spent two hours doing the safari tour and then around an hour with the lions. Spending time with the lions was without doubt one of the greatest experiences of my life. So happy we choose Armstrong and the team and black and white.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Super goed georganiseerde safari naar Fathalapark
text: We hebben enorm genoten van de safari naar  Fathala park. Ruim op tijd zijn we opgehaald bij ons hotel en onze gids Lamin heeft ons een fantastische dag bezorgd. Alles was prima geregeld, de veerboot tickets, douane formaliteiten, drinken voor onderweg en lunch tussen de middag. De reis naar het Fathala park was al een avontuur op zich. In het park hebben we net zo lang gezocht tot we alle dieren gezien hebben.  Lamin wist een hoop informatie te geven over zowel het park als over Gambia in het algemeen. Mochten we ooit terug gaan naar the Gambia dan gaan we zeker weer een excursie boeken bij Black & White.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Reliable, well organised, best quality trips
text: I highly recommend Black & White Safari! Absolutely reliable, well organised and professional company. And to be honest, it was much more than that. We experienced full commitment of both the owner and the guide. They made our trips unforgettable in a best way :-D Thank you for that and see you again as we definitely plan to come back to Gambia! Best Regards from Laura and Jarek

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Senegal Safari und 4 Wheels Tour
text: Wir haben 2 Touren gebucht.Unser Guide war beides Mal Baba der sich sehr um uns gesorgt hatte. Wir hatten um eine kleine Gruppe gebeten und waren zu 5 am Ende mit guter Stimmung. 4 Wheels Tour war sehr interessant um einen Einstieg ins Land zu erhalten. Wir waren bei den heiligen Krokodilen, einer Schule, einer lokalen Familie, einem Ziegenmarkt, der Markt in Seregamba war mir zuviel. Die Leute werden sehr aggressiv wenn man fotografiert sowas habe ich international noch nicht erlebt. Es war somit ein schneller durchgang um irgendwie heil durchzukommen, paradise beach war auch nicht der schönste Strand und es gab sehr viele Bienen. Würde ich nicht empfehlen. Da ich vegetarierin bin hatte baba sogar extra was zum essen für mich besorgt. Das war sehr freundlich. Safari würde ich nicht wieder machen oder empfehlen. Das schönste war die Fahrt übers Land und Fähre. Safari ist in einem park wo man die tiere an futterstellen beobachten kann. Wie im zoo. Preis war super. Service war super. Schöne Eindrücke und ein wenig Kaffeefahrt.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Super
text: We zijn met black en white Safari naar Senegal geweest. Een echte aanrader als je wat van het land wil zien. 10 minuten voor afgesproken tijd aanwezig en met busje naar banjul. Daar ga je met een veerboot over naar Gambia zuid. De oversteek op de bootreis is erg indrukwekkend om te zien. Auto s vrachtwagens en mensen door elkaar heen op de boot. Echt een beleving. Toen we aan de andere kant aan wal waren stond er een open jeep klaar. Hiermee ga je naar de grens van Senegal. De tour gids regelt de nodige papieren om de grens over te steken dat lukt je zelfrechtvaardiging niet. Ook de grens passage is zeer indrukwekkend. Het park valt een beetje tegen. Wel veel beesten gezien een beetje als de beekse bergen in Nederland alleen veel kleiner. Erna kun je nog de walk with the Lions doen. Dat moet je wel echt doen super spannend. Op de terug reis krijg je lunch aangeboden op een door Engelse mensen opgezet school project waarvan ook alle opbrengsten terug gaan naar de Gambiaanse kinderen. Echt zeker de moeite waard echter park valt een beetje tegen. Maar de eigenaar meneer Amstrong is een super kerel.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: An adventure in Banjul
text: This tour was quite an adventure. We were met off the cruise ship by our Black and White safari team. After putting my wheelchair up on the roof of the minivan, we proceeded along some highway and some very rough, unpaved roads to a Gambian family's compound. We were dressed in "African" clothing then proceeded to a very busy, colorful market  to purchase food for lunch. This was then cooked, with our participation, outside on braziers. The results were delicious and it was an excellent way of getting a feel for the Gambian family's way of life. We would definitely recommend this tour.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Lazy day
text:
You won’t get better hospitality than with Armstrong and his team at Black and White

We just did a fishing trip but as always we’ll looked after by a great company 

We had pick ups at the airport which were on time and worth it 

Theses are honest hard working lovely people that will accommodate whatever you want to do in Gambia the very best in our opinion 

Good luck Black and White for the future ! See you next year

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: A Wonderful Experience
text:
I decided to book with Black and White tours based on their previous reviews and I was very pleased with this company. Having never been to The Gambia before I wanted a company that I could trust and Black and White Safari did just that. The company was very responsive to the messages I sent and questions that I had. 

The day of the excursion went exactly as planned with a prompt arrival by the driver. Both the driver and the guide were friendly and hospitable, always ensuring that we were comfortable and enjoying ourselves. 

I found that the benefit of booking with Black and White safari is the fact that the group you are traveling with is small; there were only 4 of us in our vehicle. I observed the other competitors and they had large vehicles with MANY tourists; possibly 25 tourists in their bus. If you are looking for a more personable experience I would suggest Black and White.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari to Gambia and Senegal
text: We had a great experience and was well taken care of during our stay. Armstrong and his team was very accommodating and helpful at all times.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Lion Walk & Safari
text: Had a great experience! My first time in The Gambia,I wanted to do the Lion walk.I compared prices to about 2 other tour guides this was far more reasonable and more for the price. The pickup from my Residence was on time(didn't stay in a hotel).We picked up another group on time then headed tothe ferry, cross the river,a great experience and something I've never experienced. Then a jeep was waiting for us to bring us to the park. We stopped to place our orders for lunch (food was provided,drinks not but price was good). I bought Candy for the kids that were by the place. Seems like they were coming in all directions..but it was fun! And they were smiling.We headed to the Gambia/Senegal border where adults & kids asked if you like to buy anything- peanuts,oranges,fruits,etc. The line wasn't too bad so no more then 30min maybe. We all crossed no problem. Then we headed to the park, saw the Ostrich & turtle right away. Then got out sticks and waited for the gate to open so we could provide to see the Lions. Our 3 guides were very helpful with the Lion& Lioness. Each person got a turn with walking,standing by the Lions & guides helped get some really great pics. We then provided on the Safari- good thing is to bring snacks,sunscreen,and bug repellent. Many flies around and the sun got hot at times,so if you don't like it bring sunscreen but I was loving the sun. Another jeep broke down ahead of us,our kind driver & guide stopped to help. We got parked in the shade- so we drank pop/water that was provided,and had some snacks while they helped. It was little funny seeing the people all out of the jeep under the tree-- I pretended to take a pic like if they were part of the Safari animals--lol was our humor in our jeep. We saw all animals but didnt see the Giraffes. Would of been neat but they weren't visable. Then we headed out of the park stopped to get lunch the kids recognized us and swormed the jeep. I didnt give candy out yet,and so they sat by the door patiently waiting. I had my bf give them the candies. The kids weren't allowed past the gates it was a charity house so the kids respected that. After lunch we then procided  to the border,caught thr ferry just in time to go across and back into The Gambia where a jeep was waiting and took us to our places of stay. Thank You Black & White Safari!! Our guides-Armstrong,Omar. Recommend you all to everyone who asked me about this Safari.Great Experience

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Perfect tours-really the Best!
text:
I really recommend Black&White Tours, they are very reliable and the tours are great. We had a airport pick up, Monkey park, Banjul City tour, Makasutu, South Senegal etc. all tours were well organized. 
The driver is super reliable and a very safe driver, the company can be very proud to have such a employee. All the best for the future and we will choose B&W Tours again for our next Gambia trip.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Cudowne wakacje
text: Wykupiłam 3 wycieczki z tego biura i jestem w 100% zadowolona. Z niczym nie było problemu, biuro jest zaledwie kilka metrów od hotelu Senegambia, w którym mieszkaliśmy. Polecam w 100% Black and White, profesjonalni i dostarczają wrażeń jakich nie zaznacie z nikim innym. Z nimi podziwiasz piękną Gambię z auta terenowego, a nie z hotelowego autobusu.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic trips
text:
I can highly recommend Bushwhacker Tours, their tours are good value for money and JJ, Mo (tour guide) and Mo (our driver) are very friendly, courteous, caring and helpful.  I did 2 trips on my own, the fabulous team couldn't have looked after me better and everyone else on the tour was really friendly. The day to Senegal, with JJ as our guide and driver Mo was fantastic, an early start but worth it to see the sun rise. The safari at Fathala Game Reserve was great fun and we saw a lot of wildlife in the 4x4. My second trip was arranged at the last minute and was 3 locations in half a day with 2 other lovely people to walk around Abuko Nature Reserve, canoeing up the River Gambia at Lamin Lodge and the wood craft market at Brikama.  Mo driving again and our guide also called Mo looked after us extremely well, even helping us to take photos on new cameras (!) and finding biscuits to stop my rumbling tummy! He was very professional and informative and answered all our many questions about the wildlife and life in The Gambia in general. Unlike another tour company who I went on one tour with, Bushwhacker Tours are exclusively Bushwhacker clients and they don’t combine their trips with other tour companies. 
Thank you guys, you are all great! See you next year!

title: South Gambia 4x4
text:
We chose to go on the South Gambia 4x4 tour, having picked up a leaflet from their office on the Senegambia strip. The price was cheaper than other tour agencies, and limited tours to 6 people.

The tour was absolutely excellent, and our tour guide Mo is an absolute credit to Bushwhacker - with only 3 of us on the tour he had a lot of time to answer any questions and left us to explore all the stops at our own pace! The paradise beach was the best (lunch/drinks included all day as well).

We would firmly reccomend booking any tour through Bushwhacker!

title: 1st class service!
text:
I felt very lucky that my travel agency had chosen Bushwacker Tours to pick me up at the river crossing in Kartong (border to Casamace, Senegal) to drive me to my hotel in Banjul. 
The drive turned out to be both pleasant and interesting since JJ, the outstanding guide from Bushwacker, came along and informed about all sights and curiosities we passed on the road to the capitol. Truly an amazing service that I had not expected.
Next time I'll make sure to book them for Gambian excursions!

title: Wonderful! Highly recommend them!!
text: We had 2,5 days with Bushwhackers: 1 day Southern Gambia 4x4, 1 day Makasutu and half day Abuko. Wonderful time had by all, including fussy 6 year old. The guides and drivers are very knowledgable and friendly. We felt really taken care of and would not hesitate to recommend to everyone going to the Gambia. Worth every penny!!

title: Much cheaper than hotel tours and fewer people
text:
We wanted to do a Birds & Breakfast half-day tour. The one advertised by our agent in the Sheraton Hotel cost £54. We had been on such a tour on our previous visit. It was good and we saw many different birds while walking across various types of terrain, but there were at least 20 tourists on the tour and when they get strung out, you can end up some distance away from the bird expert at the head of the line and miss not only his expert dialogue but his pointing out of each species.

This time we went with Bushwhacker Tours. The cost was only £35 each. Only my wife and I were on the trip, so we had the undivided attention of their bird expert (and in fact of a female trainee bird guide who was in training). We began with 90 minutes in a canoe, travelling through mangrove swamps near the Lamin Lodge on the neck of the River Gambia. We landed once during this trip for a bird walk. Then, after breakfast, we had another bird walk. We noted many colourful birds, aided by the guides' expert spotting, and greatly enjoyed the experience. We left the hotel at 6.30 and returned just after 11.00. 

I have already mentioned the two big advantages of going with this company. The price is much less and the group sizes are smaller.

title: Great company
text: We went on 4 trips with Bushwhackers - Roots, River cruise, Lamin Lodge and safari in Senegal. We had 3 different guides, Mo, Soloman and Kabba. All were friendly and knowledgeable. The groups were always small which was especially great on the river cruise (only 4 of us on the boat, plus the crew), and the safari (8 of us in a small  jeep that got us really close to the animals, unlike some groups we saw going round in massive noisy vehicles that scared the animal away). Great value for money. Would definitely use them again and highly recommend them.

title: Brilliant excursions with Bushwhacker Tours
text: We visited The Gambia in January in a party of 6, I emailed the company before going to get details of excursions etc. they arranged to meet us at our hotel the day after we arrived to arrange our excursions. This all went to plan, we booked 3 full day excursions which were all excellent, we were picked up on time and were well looked after at all times. Our excursions included all drinks and meals which were excellent. The guides ( JJ & Solomon) were very informative and very courteous at all times, they made our holiday very memorable . All the excursions were well worth the money and very enjoyable, we can thoroughly recommend them. We hope to return to The Gambia in the future and will certainly book excursions with Bushwhacker Tours

title: An amazing experience with 'Bushwhacker Tours'
text:
Travelling and exploring with ‘Bushwhackers Tours’ is an absolute must for any visitor to the Gambia & the Senegal regardless of whether you set off as an individual, part of a small group, or even a member of a large party. Bushwhackers can cater for all. It really doesn’t matter as long as your main objective is to see with your very own eyes what the Gambia & the Senegal genuinely have to offer and not just what some glossy air-brushed and otherwise touched up holiday brochure wants you to see.

All of those Bushwhackers staff my wife and I had the pleasure of meeting were courteous, knowledgeable and always on hand in an unobtrusive and helpful way. 

You certainly don’t have to be an intrepid or fearless explorer to experience first hand the real Gambia. Solomon (Sol) and the other Bushwhackers team members do all the hard work so you need only be prepared to enjoy yourselves. In fact, it is only fair to state that from personal experience, all the Bushwhackers staff go out of their way to please and to make your tour as comfortable and as safe as possible. Indeed, although it might sound a bit corny, it seemed to me their prime objective was to ensure their guest/s have as an enjoyable and memorable experience as possible. 

Jill and I booked two ‘full day tours’ that were each ridiculously good value for money and we were both absolutely amazed at just how much was crammed into each of those days. The same could not be said for all other tour operators and goodness, did we hear some horror stories.

The variety of tours on offer was most impressive and catered for just about everyone. We firstly chose the Safari trip into North Senegal (don’t forget your passport) and be prepared for one of the most surreal experiences ever whilst making the crossing from Banjul into the Senegal. We did it twice. 

Our second full day tour was in complete contrast and consisted of a ‘Lazy Day on the River’ sunbathing, fishing (I caught five) and an ornithologists dream come true, I counted 35 different and previously unknown species to me that is, and I rather fancy myself as something of a ‘twitcher.’

All our food and drinks and “I don’t mean some manky inedible packed lunch and local bottle of water” were included in the price. Meals were in fact very often cooked in front of you or provided from a decent restaurant menu with no nasty surprises or hidden extras… Except for, and wait for it. We were offered at no personal cost an additional half day tour from an impressive list of possibilities. This particular feature i.e. a free all inclusive half day tour being part of the ‘Bushwhackers’ constitution. In effect, a very practical loyalty reward or incentive for doing it the ‘Bushwhackers’ way and one that was by no means pushed in order to gain initial custom. 

We chose a slow river trip, through the mangroves to ‘Lamin Lodge’ (go check it out) and ‘Oyster Creek’ where millions of these delicious specimens are farmed and harvested almost entirely by Gambian women and young girls.

In conclusion, we thoroughly enjoyed Each of our experiences with Bushwhackers and will certainly tour with them again on our next visit to The Gambia

Neville Pettitt UK

title: "Roots" tour with Bushwacker
text:
We had a great day on the "Roots" tour with Bushwhacker Tours. It was easy to set up--we were staying at a hotel just down the street, and were able to make our arrangments just the day before the tour. On the day of the tour the guide picked us up at the hotel and took us to the port of Banjul, where our boat departed for the 2 1/2 hour tour upriver to James Island, famous due to the "Roots" movie; Alex Haley was able to trace his ancestors back to this village in The Gambia (Abreda/Juffereh). James Island holds the ruins of an old fort where the unfortunate people intended for the slave trade were held prior to being boarded on the large ships for the ocean passage. 

In addition to seeing the island, you also get a tour of the village, where you meet the village chief, relatives of Kuntah Kinteh of "Roots", and visit a small craft market. On the boat, you are served a morning snack, a very good lunch, and again an afternoon snack. At the end of the day the guide returns you back to your hotel.  We were picked up at 8:00 in the morning and returned to the hotel around 6:00, so plan for the whole day. It was a great experience and everything was very professionally done. I would highly recommend.

title: Bushwhacker Tours day tours review
text: We had a great experience with Bushwacker. They are really looking after their customers and the staff is very friendly. We did so well not too choose Thomas Cook as it was a much better experience: price and staff related. Our guide Mo was particularly nice and made everything to make our trip unforgettable. We went to the Fatala reserve for one day and we did the South Gambia 4x4 and we highly recommend both of them. We will come back!

title: 4x4 tour
text: The guide JJ picked us up from the Banjul  port and made us comfortable  the tour was for 6 attractions but he fitted 7 we booked on-line before we went to Gambia and paid when the trip finished highly recommended 8 hour trip including all drinks all day and a very nice meal on paradise beach Danny Dete John gloria

title: The real Gambia Experience
text:
Faboulous 4x4 trip knowledgable proffesional &reliable guides we had a fantastic day out mo & JJ our guides made this a great experience .
We have travelled to Gambia many times & done lots of trips but these guys were excellent and made it their aim to look after you &show you there beautiful country .very reasonable prices & by far the best trip we ever had would not hesitate to recommend & look forward to booking another trip on our return thanks for a great day our Mark& Della

title: Buchwacker tours in Gambia is the best!!!
text: We (15 persons) took 2 full day tours with Buchwacker tours.  Safari in Gambia and 4*4 in Gambia.  Both were GREAT!!!  The main guide we has was JJ, he was better than sliced bread......  ie VERY good!!!!  The rest of the guide and drivers were really good as well.  I am sure Buchwacker tours is the best Tour Guide in Gambia

title: Fabulous Tour Guides
text: Having just returned from a New Years break in The Gambia with my Husband, our first visit to the Smiling Coast.  Bushwacker Tours certainly made our holiday memorable.  We researched online the tours available from Buschwackers and emailed them for a price list.  We also arranged for Jainaba to meet us at our hotel in Kotu the day after arrival.  We booked the North Senegal Safari and the South Gambia 4 x 4 tour.  Mo was our tour guide for both of these trips, a very friendly warm knowledgable young man.  There was 6 of us on our trip to North Senegal, at the Fathala Safari Reserve we saw Rhinocerous, Buffalo, Water Hogs, Antelope, Hyenas and the the highlight for me a Giraffe, he took some tracking but thanks to our driver we found him.  Drinks were all included and a meal at Barra on our return journey.  Due to the ferry being very late we returned via the local boats (piroque) i think!! What an experience that was, being carried out on the locals shoulders to the boats.  Women and goats in the hull men on the top edge.  Oh how we all laughed a truly African experience!! Our second trip the South Gambia 4x4 tour was excellent, again we had Mo as our personal tour guide there was only 2 of us this time.  We visited the crocodile pool, Serekunda market, livestock market.  We stopped at one of the gardens where the ladies grow their crops and sell at market. I have a lovely photograph of them with us, such happy warm hard working ladies.  We drove through many rural villages, children run out to shout Hello and wave everywhere you go.  We stopped in one village and Mo got the children to form a haphazard line and we handed out pencils, crayons, playing cards and glider aeroplanes.  We next visited Paradise beach for lunch and a couple of hours to relax on the beach on sunloungers, all included in the price.  On our return we stopped at the Tanji fishing village.  Our Gambian holiday was great and Bushwackers tours made it a truly memorable experience.  Thankyou Mo and your company.  Lastly the prices were very good value.  Book with them you wont be disappointed.

title: Good value, very friendly and knowledgeable guides, highly recommended
text: I contacted Bushwacker Tours before I left England and they were on time and in reception waiting for me at the prearranged time.   They had already emailed me the details of the tours and the prices, so I was able to study the tours in detail before I arrived.   They explained that they needed a minimum of two people to run the trips but that I was sure to be able to join other people as it was their busy time.     I did the Roots Tour (with a very nice couple from Finland) and the Senegal Safari with a very friendly and charming Swedish family.   Both tours were excellent, the Banjul ferry being quite an experience!  I spent quite a lot of time with Solomon on the Safari and he was interesting to talk to and answered all my questions.    He is still in training as a guide but is well on the way to be a valuable member of this exceptional team.      Refreshments were included in the prices and they were well below the tour operator's prices.   I cannot recommend too highly this friendly, personal, knowledgeable and professional company.   They have a wide choice of tours and I only wish my trip had been longer so I could have fitted in more of their tours.

title: Great Staff, Great Value
text:
just returned from gambia and we went on 3 trips with Bushwhacker tours, Great value for money. we went on the safari to senegal with guide Mo . Who made the day with his knowledge and friendly manner. made us very welcome. have made a great friend with Him,even went out of his way on the return journey when the ferry was late . and we made a decision to try another way of travelling across the river like the locals do on the small boats .wat an experience. we then went also on the River cruise with Mo and again made it very enjoyable. great knowledge and a credit to the company.also soloman who i went with on the crocodile pool visit. my other half wasnt well so i wnet on my own.he took me around the museum first giving me loads of information and then onto see the crocs. it was a great visit with just me and he still went out of his way to give me has much information as possible. 
they are lcated on the strip just outside hotel near indian rest. give then a visit and say steve and sam recomended you to them .you wont be disapointed.keep up the great work guys see you next year

steve and sam

title: Will never book trips with Thomas Cook again :o)
text:
The staff at bushwackers are all very friendly and professional. The tours are well organised with refreshments included. The best thing about this company is they only allow 6 people on their trips, offering a personal touch. On one of our trips we were driving through a village and children were running after our jeep, it was really nice when we were allowed to stop and give the children sweets. 

My two friends and I went on three trips with bushwackers, roots, bush safari and 4 x 4, all amazing trips. My friends and I came away with some great memories and photos, such as stroking crocodiles and stroking baby lion cubs. These trips wouldn't have been so special without the staff at bushwhackers and thanks to them all especially Ali the manager. We'll be coming back in October and going on the two day trip upcountry. Cant wait and we'll have another boogie with Ali lol.

ownerResponse.text: I thank all our clients for taking time from all their busy schedules to put their honest opinion about their experiences with BUSHWHACKER TOURS.We will continue doing the good job we are doing because all of you mean a lot to us and we value you too.

title: Excellent value with friendly informative guide
text:
We never like going with overpriced tour company trips so when we were handed leaflet about Bushwhaker tours and saw they offered more than Thomas Cook for less money we booked.
We did The Gambia 4x4 and there were only three of us in a jeep plus the guide, JJ, and his driver.
We went to the museum and JJ provided some great insights into the Gambian culture and then to the crocodile pool where we could stroke the crocs without fear. Then o to the serekunda market where he guided us around and told us who would be unwilling to have their photo taken but joked the best photos were from those unwilling ! We got the sights and sounds and smells of is daily bustling market.Onto a school where we were entertained by songs and the children showing us how they knew their ABC, numbers, days of week etc.
Other stops included paradise beach, where we had an included lunch and where there was plenty of time to relax before our last stop of the day at Tanje fishing village.
Drinks were also included except at the restaurant.
JJ was informative and answered any questions we asked. He was friendly, polite and above all we had the personal touch.
Don't book a Thomas Cook overpriced tour which doesn't even stop at the market...book a Bushwhaker! We will book another tour with them again.

title: Panoramic Gambia!
text: South Gambia 4 x 4 Tour - It has the lot. We had a great driver and 2 guides. Museum, Crocodile Pool, Serrekunda Market, Free Soft drinks, Open top Land rover, School visit, Livestock Market, Free lunch and sunbathe and swim at Paradise Beach, Tanje Fishing Village and even dancing with the locals in the fields! What a great day thanks to JJ, Mardi and Maria.

title: bushwhackers are fab
text: Ali and his team at Bushwhackers are great. trips are good value for money and very informative. totally recommend the Roots trip and the Safari. i would use Bushwhackers again on my next trip to gambia.

title: Three Great Tours
text:
Having read good reviews and having limited time I decided to sign up in advance of arrival with Arch Tours for three separate trips. Arch are a local company so you know all the money goes into the local economy. Having looked around their prices seemed reasonable/good. They gave discount as I was booking three trips. I emailed and WhatsApp'ed them several times and they were great at responding. 
Tours:
- '4 in 1' this was really informative and you get to see a lot. It gives you some understanding of life outside the tourist areas. 
- 'Roots River Cruise' the boat used by all operators for this trip was broken so it was over on the ferry (an interesting journey) then overland by jeep (dusty so go in clothes you don't want to get dirty). If a long cruise up river is what you are after then check before booking. Interesting and informative especially for those who know the story (I remember the 1977 TV mini-series). Clearly it is moving for many and part of the history of others.
- 'Fathala Senegal' my main reason for going was to simply cross into Senegal.
The reserve is not a 'real' reserve as found in South Eastern/South Africa. It is populated with a relatively small number of animals brought in from South Africa (plus some recent local births).  That said the environment is close to that of a real reserve in that the animals are free to wander and fend for themselves. This means finding/seeing them can be hard. As the dry season grows longer into the new year then the grass and foliage decline and the animals are easier to see and more likely to be near a water hole.

On all my trips Arch were reliable, friendly, and informative. The food was OK to good (I'm a vegetarian). So a big thank you to my guides; Mohammed, Dave, and Abdou and my drivers.
If considering any such trip no matter who with you need to appreciate that Gambia and Senegal are relatively very poor. You will receive requests to buy things or give things. That said everyone was friendly and as in all of the area you soon learn to say no in a friendly and clear way. But I'd also suggest talking and interacting were you feel comfortable.
I'm happy to recommend them and I will use them if and when I return.

title: Fathara trip
text:
Well organised. On time with pick ups. Went to falatha pk. Stopped on route 4 gd breckfast. Ferry rather chaotic but thats gambia.
Not many animals to see but thats not arch fault. Adequate lunch.
£25 extra to do lion walk which we declined as had payed £90 each for trip. All in all thought trip overpriced as you spend most of the day travelling back n too.

title: Greatly enjoyed my excursions with Arch Tours
text:
I initially only booked the 4 in 1 tour and as I enjoyed it so much I booked the North Senegal (Fathala) and the Roots River Cruise afterwards.
I was picked up on time and my guides, Muhammad and Sanna, didn't mind answering my many questions!

title: NICE TOUR OPERATOR
text:
Arch Tours, Gambia is one of the leading tour operators in The Gambia with a well tailored and organise tour guides within and outside the Gambia. 
You can find them at serekunda axis of the Gambia. I advice and recommend Arch Tours whenever you visit the Gambia for a nice holiday.

title: Goed bureau
text: Alles netjes geregeld en goed verzorgd. Misschien iets duurder maar wel de moeite waard. Gidsen zijn prima en de verzorging is ook goed.

title: An amazing discovery
text:
What to say. A great experience delivered by great tour guides.
I took part in the 4 tours in 1 day experience and I need to recommend it. 
Starting from the chaotic and unique Serrekunda Market, going through a small village in the countryside and finishing at the largest fish market in the country. And this is just a part of tour that touches 8 different places in just one day. I was accompanied by two amazing guides, Dave and Mo and the driver Tom, that were very friendly and ready to answer any question or curiosity.
An amazing day to get a real taste of what is like to live in The Gambia. Thank you.

title: Intersting and a fun day out
text: The Guides pick you up from your hotel, and drop you off again. The tour was good, the places included a typical home in the bush, a school, a village on the river, a livestock market,a huge market and an even bigger fish market on the coast. They provided water during the trip and were very informative of all we asked. It was a long day but a great experience. Only one criticism was the jeeps in which we travelled were somewhat uncormfortable but i would go again nonetheless!

title: Reliable services
text: Small tour company with perfect programs, great services and helpful guides. Great way to experience The Gambia.

title: Goed reisagentschap
text: Wij hebben diverse tours met Arch Tours gedaan, en waren hier meer dan te spreken over. Onze gids was Sheriff genaamd, spreekt wat Nederlands en is een sympathieke gozer. Je kunt dit bureau vanuit Nederland al benaderen als je naar Gambia gaat, en ter plekke is er ook nog van alles te regelen. Wij kunnen Arch Tours van harte aanbevelen.

title: Senegal Fathala Day Trip, Lions
text: Arch were excellent from start to finish. E-mails prior were promptly answered. Tour guide Rhino looked after us all day. Great breakfast and lunch and endless soft drinks provided which were badly needed. Highly recommend walking with the Lions. Once in a lifetime. Bottom line Arch are top notch.

title: Great service!
text: I had called a day before to book for the safari tour, i was told I'd be picked up at about 7:20am the following day. At exactly 7:20am i got a call the tour guides were outside where i was staying. We set out on time, the tour guide was Sheriff, he was very professional and a very good guide. It cost me 85 pounds for the tour from The Gambia this includes the crossing of the ferry and the drive to Senegal. It was an easy journey, not stressful at all. I'd definitely be using Arch tours when next i am in The Gambia!

title: Fathalia Game Reserve
text:
Arch Tours are very Professional. We were really looked after from start to finish and felt safe with the team.
Free flowing cool drinks and ample food throughout the day. 
Mohammed was with us in our Jeep and proved to be a lovely guy, as were all the others.
We seen all the animals and done the lion walk which was a fantastic day.

title: Senegal Day Trip – Great Day Out
text:
After reading many positive reviews on TripAdvisor we actively searched out Arch Tours to arrange our trip to the Senegal Fathala Park; they are located just off the Senegambia strip.  From the start they were friendly, helpful and not pushy at all when trying to promote their trips.

We were not aware that transport would be via an open top jeep.  Whilst this was lovely once the sun was up, prior to sunrise it is quite chilly; take a jumper/jacket.  Our guide, Abdue, was great and really looked after us.  Following the Banjul-Barra ferry crossing (which was an interesting/good experience in itself) we set off towards the Senegal border.  Approximately 15 minutes after the ferry crossing we stopped by the side of the road for a lovely picnic breakfast; which was a great touch! 

Abdue helped at the border ensuring a swift crossing. It is worth noting that we were advised that if you did not have a Yellow Fever Certificate when entering Senegal there would be a 500 dalasi charge.

The facilities at Fathala were great.  There were lovely clean toilets and a restaurant serving a chicken dish or pizza. We drove through the park with a Fathala guide who pointed out the antelope, warthogs, buffalo, giraffes and the solo rhino. Abdue was always on hand to offer drinks (cola, fanta and bottled water) so we never went thirsty.

Only thing to note with this trip is that the ferry between Banjul and Barra is tide dependent, so you could find yourself waiting for quite a while for the ferry to arrive depending on whether it is high tide or not. The crossing itself takes between 20-40 minutes.

At the end of the trip we were dropped off back at our hotel. I cannot recommend Arch Tours highly enough; we had an amazing trip with them.  It was excellently organised and our guide was exceptional. I think it also helped that the group was only a small group (7 people) so it didn’t feel like you were being herded around as can be the case on coach trips.

One of the highlights of our holiday – thank you Arch Tours!

title: First Class!  Absolutely brilliant day
text:
Okay, I'll be completely honest.  My daughter suggested booking the Senegal safari with Arch Tours -  I was a bit wary about booking something like this with a local company.  I thought it might be a safer bet booking something like this through Thomas Cook.  But she was 100% right.  Very professional, the staff who took the booking were right on the mark.  Told us everything we needed to know.  Our guide, Abdul, was a total star.  Kept us all together and looked after us all day, and that took a lot of work, especially on the ferry!   The  The safari was brilliant, maybe we were lucky but we saw everything - giraffe, antelope, rhino, warthog, zebra, monkeys, 
 
We were picked up at 6am from the hotel, Abdul provided us with a good breakfast before we got the ferry across.  He also made sure we got the new ferry across and back, and that makes a big difference.  Lunch is provided at the safari lodge, you just have to make your order before you go out with your guides,  Pizza was excellent, but was a bit too big for me, couldn't finish it.  The nice thing about this tour was that there were 8 of us, so just a small group,  We were together most of the time, but split into two groups of four whilst in Senegal for the safari. Abdul split his time between the two jeeps so he was with all of us equally.  

Drinks were provided free all day whenever we needed them, and boy, did we need them.  Ice cold, and greatly appreciated.  Water, beer, juice, you name it.  

All of the staff we had dealings with were first class, with no exception.  

I have to say, this is the best holiday experience I have had.  And I would recommend it 100%

title: Roots by Road and River Cruise/Nature Park
text:
Two fantastic tours: great guides and drivers.

The Roots tour normally run by boat but unfortunately the boat was broken down so we took the alternative route by road. What a fantastic experience:
- travelling in an open top 4x4 with only 3 of us with 1 guide,
- taking the (chaotic) public ferry from Banjul to Barra (watch out for the bumsters/begging kids in Barra - can be persistent but we did not hand anything over)
- breakfast provided on a stop on the way to Jufureh and the slavery museum (picking a local guide up on the way who needs tipping but is value for money)
- small boat to Kuntu Kinteh Island before lunch, which is included, in a local restaurant (drinks with lunch cost extra, all other drinks during the day are included)
- finally you meet the Kuntu Kinteh family elders (donation is expected for the development of the village, the locals generally do not harass you here on the basis that you will later be making a small donation, approx £1 per person, for the visit)
- then it’s back home
- thanks Mo, Solomon, Yaya and Essa for the day 

The River Cruise and Nature Park involved:
- transport to Lamin Lodge in an open 4x4 with only 2 of us on the tour
- great guide in Dawda and Barra driving us (thanks for a fantastic morning chaps!)
- small boat trip around the creek seeing some beautiful birds
- then off to the nature reserve at Abuko for more bird watching, a nice walk and some (unsuccessful in our case) crocodile spotting 
- before heading back to Lamin Lodge for a delicious lunch

Well worth looking at using these guys, a local firm, great guides, small groups and better value than excursions through Thomas Cook, Tui, etc.

Will definitely use these guys when we head off to The Gambia again.

title: Amazing tours, Amazing tour guides
text:
Returned last week from a week in Gambia, I used Arch tours 6 years ago, so thought I would use them again as I couldn't fault them the first time.
Well I wasn't disappointed, we went on the 4 in 1 tour with Bob and Fanta and had a great day, they call it 4 in 1 but actually its 8 in 1 with the different places we visited, it was real eyeopener for us westerners.
We also did the Fathala Safari and lion view, what can I say wow! Thank you Sheriff and Mo for an amazing day, although a long day it was definitely worth it. At the Safari we saw all the animals. Then we did the lion walk, what can I say, when are you ever going to get the chance to stand 50cm from a real lion. A true memory worth every penny.
Thank you for everything Arch Tours, carry on the good work and will defintely return in the future.

title: holiday must
text:
Great experience with these guys.  👍would highly recommend arch tours for the best trip to the safari.  Great driver nipping through small spaces to get better view . well knowledged for the trip .
Anyone thinking about a trip this is a must and with arch tours you won't be disappointed.

title: You guys are just the best!
text: Cannot recommend them highly enough. We went on 6 tours with the team during our two week break there. Our favourites were the 4 in 1, makasutu,the North Senegal trip and anything to do with lamin lodge, My other half went fishing one day whilst I was taken off shopping! All the trips were with small groups of about 4 people which we felt made the whole experience more personal. Many thanks to all the team particularly Yaya, Dawda, Fanta, Sherif, Mo, Tom the driver... and anyone else we didn't mention. Keep up with the birdwatching Dawda!!

title: Absolutely Fabulous

The team are so friendly helpful and knowledgable they make the whole experience absolutely fabulous. 
Special shout out to Serif, Fatuo, Mo and Miamuna, thank you all for your patience and for being so helpful and making our experience one to remember.😘

title: Highlight of our trip to Gambia
text: We went on the Fathala safari tour, and it was without a doubt the highlight of our trip to Gambia. The tour guides were excellent and really made the trip special, and the safari in the reserve itself was an amazing experience. The tour was excellent value for money, and was the only time during our trip to Gambia that we felt that we were getting our money’s worth and weren’t getting hustled or taken advantage of for being westerners. I couldn’t recommend them more!

title: Excellent trips
text: Myself and my husband have just returned from a week in Gambia. We had read the reviews on here and after seeing the excellent reviews contacted Bushwhacker Tours. From the very first email they were polite and professional. A meeting was arranged at our hotel for the day after we arrived. JJ arrived he was lovely, very polite and friendly. He talked us through all of their trips and the prices (which is loads cheaper than Thomas Cook). He even gave us his mobile and office telephone numbers so we could contact him at anytime. We decided to book South Gambia 4 x 4 and North Gambia and Senegal. Because of us booking these we were taken to the monkey park (we did have to pay for the taxi and for our enterance) but we would never have seen it if we hadn't which was brilliant we were also given an extra trip free to the Nature Reserve. In the Monkey park the monkey roam free and you end up with monkeys sitting on your shoulder which is a once in a lifetime experience, South Gambia 4 x 4 was amazing. You are picked up on a Landrover and there is a maximium of 6 of you on the trip (unlike thomas cook where it is a bus). You are constantly offered drinks and they will accomodate almost anything that you ask. We visited a local school which was very humbling but very worth seeing. We walked around the market which gave you a lovely flavour of the area (unlike Thomas Cook who won't let you off the bus). We then went for lunch (inlcluded in price) at pleasure beach for an afternoon of sunbathing which was lovely. We then went to the local fish market which was an eye opener and then went back to the hotel. It was an amazing trip which showed you the real Gambia.  North Gambia 4 x 4 and Senegal.This trip was amazing. We saw Giraffes, Zebra's, lot's of birds and even a Rhino (we have been on Safari in Kenya and couldn't see one there). We drove round and round the park to make sure that we saw everything as the Giraffes were a little bit elusive. Nothing was rushed.  I ended up going to the nature park on my own as my husband was poorly (see my review for the Laico Atlantic hotel). I was that happy with the company I went on my own with another 2 couples. I always felt completely safe and was very well looked after. I would recommend this company to anyone thinking of going to Gambia as they are amazing and their service is second to none. Drinks are included at all times on your trip and are included in your price.  Big thanks to JJ and Soloman and our drivers as they were amazing.

title: Fantastic, friendly, professional, the best around.
text:
I have visited Gambia three times and have used Bushwhacker for tours every time I have been there. After experiencing a variety of their tours including Makasutu, Chimpanzee Rehabilitation (2 day), Fathala Reserve Senegal (Both 1 day and 2 day), South Gambia 4x4 and Lazy Day Cruise I can honestly say I would never use another tour company in Gambia. 
The staff are friendly, welcoming, on time, professional, they all have a vast knowledge on Gambia and will make sure you enjoy your tour. Ali is a fantastic boss and will make sure things go smoothly with your trip, treats his staff fantastically and you can see how happy they are to be working there.
On tours you will get soft drinks provided for you and usually lunch if you are on a full day tour. Before going to Gambia once I emailed them about some trips and they got back to me quickly to arrange the trips. 
The thing I love about Bushwhacker is you are not herded around, the tours offer freedom and a personal touch you would not get with larger companies. 
When I go back to Gambia I will definitely use Bushwhacker again, a truly brilliant company.

title: Professional and lots of fun
text: A local Gambian company who offer the same tours as Thomas Cook but at cheaper prices and with a much more personal service. The manager met us at our hotel and explained all the tours they offered and booking was simple, they even could do the tours on any day we wanted giving much more freedom than other tour operators who do tours on set days. On the trips we were with 2 other couples which is very different to the coach loads on the tour operator trips and meant we got a much more personal service and could do things at our own pace.  The guides were incredibly knowledgeable and friendly and kept us well stocked with the soft drinks that are included in the price of the trips. Cannot compliment them enough and recommend them to everyone considering trips in Gambia.

title: Thanks for making our holiday so fantastic
text: Bushwhackers are a local company, professionally run by Ali, we contacted them via email before we arrived in The Gambia and Ali came to meet us at our hotel to find out what we wanted to do and make arrangements for us. They are cheaper than the likes of Thomas Cook and the personal touch you get with these guys is fantastic, they have their own transport (open top 4x4s) and all the day trips included soft drinks all day and lunch. We booked 4 full day trips, Senegal Safari, Lazy River day, Masakkuta National Park and south Gambia 4X4, Do them all, we cant recommend them enough!! You will be in a group of no more than 6 and you really will get a true taste of the real Gambia. Our guide JJ was brilliant, we couldn't have asked for a better guide and he was more than willing to accommodate me in 'snap happy camera mode' and any extras we wanted to do. we had the privileged of going to his home village, an amazing experience which we never expected, very humbling. Please Please use these guys for all your trips, Bushwhackes will make your holiday special!!!

title: Why go anywhere else?
text:
1. A brilliant local Gambian company with a personal, professional touch
2. The tour operator trips are over priced and over subscribed, whereas on each of our trips we were always one of three couples and the cost was considerably less
3. Our guide was always friendly and well informed
4. We would highly recommend anyone who wants the true taste of Gambia to use Bushwhacker

title: Splendid!!!!!
text:
A lazy day indeed, wouldn't hesitate to do it again! Did the full day tour and our tor guide was well informed and patient.
The crew members were very pleasant and homely.
The food was tasty and great!
Would recommend this to everyone that visits Banjul.
It's an indigenous tour company, and patronage is encouraged.

title: Wildlife spectacular.
text:
We found Bushwhackers tours (www.bushwhackertours.com), a small local run company, via the Timbooktoo (in Fajara) bookshop and ASSET and it was an excellent experience all round. Two great trips; friendly and well-informed guides who were happy to fit our extra interests in with the trips we booked.
The two-day trip to the chimpanzee rehabilitation centre was great for wildlife. After the ferry trip and the car journey through the centre of the country (getting warmer and drier by the minute) we headed off on a boat trip in the River Gambia National Park, spotting: hippos, chimps, endless species of birds and a resting croc; followed by dinner and a night in tent-houses, waking up to the birds and monkeys….all at a reasonable price too. Only wish we had stayed longer!
If we do make it back in the wet season we’ll certainly be back to use your company.

title: Great Gambian owned tour operator
text:
This recently established business is Gambian owned, offers a truly personal service and a great African experience. Why use the big foreign owned tour operators offerred by the likes of Thomas Cook and be banged up in a coach with 20+ other people when you can have an open topped Land Rover with driver and guide all to yourselves ? We went on two full day trips to the Makasuta Centre and a Gambian River Cruise (called "Lazy Day" by the big tour operators). On the latter we also had the boat plus crew and guide all to ourselves! Both tours were cheaper than those offerred at the hotel and in return for booking two full day trips they offerred us a half day trip free ! What more could you ask for unless you actually enjoy being herded around like sheep ? 

The staff are lovely people so support a local Gambian company and put your money directly into the local economy.

title: Great tours, use Bushwhacker Tours to see Gambia and Senegal
text:
I recently used Bushwhacker tours to see around Gambia and Senegal following a recent visit to Gambia. I found the 4 tours that I went on all great. All the guides knowledge was extensive, they are local and certainly know their stuff!! The small groups were much better than going on a coach which was the option with the tour company, the price of the trips really reasonable for the entertainment we had. Use these guys if you want to get out and about and see more of Gambia than your hotel!!!
Thanks a lot to you all - Linda

title: Bushwhacker Tours - professional, fun & great tours
text:
We had done some research beforehand and had ideas about what we wanted to do and see in The Gambia.

Firstly do NOT book your tours through your tour operator e.g Cosmos etc – too expensive plus you will we be packed on a bus with 30 others.
Give your business to local Gambian companies like Bushwhackers, who we found to be the most professional & competitively priced when we checked around.

We booked 3 tours with Bushwhackers and all of them were great. The groups are small – we had 6, 4 and just 2 of us on the tours. This way its personal, very informative, friendly & fun.

The tours we did were – ROOTS, 4x4 South Gambia and a trip to North Senegal and were all different experineces in their own ways.
.
If I had to pick a favourite it was the 4x4 day out. This is packed with so much to see and do and was a wonderful way to get a feel for Gambia.  Never thought I would shake hands with a crocodile! Serrekunda market is loud, colourful & vibrant.  The school visit was moving and going through the villages and remote areas is eye opening – take your bags of lollipops for all those children. Finally you visit Tange the fishing visit – an amazing sight of so many people on the beach greeting the boats as they come in. Our guides were Mando & Forday and they were brilliant.

title: Senegal safari tour
text:
Armstrong team is the best. We went for all day trip to Senegal for Safari. Our host was fantastic. I can recommend the Black and White as a No 1 in Gambia. Perfect service, good price, special discout. PL. Z czystym sumieniem polecam , super ludzie , uczciwe podejście i jeszcze dostalismy rabat za przyprowadzenie znajomych. Całość 80 euro
Andrzej

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent and personal service
text: We had booked the Senegal Safari and the Makusutu tours well before our visit to Gambia. The day after our arrival we met with the owner Armstrong at his office to get some more details and settle the payment. We decided on a change of plans and do the so called 4WD tour instead of the Makasutu. We even changed the dates without any problems and really appreciated the flexibility! Both of the tours were great and our family including two kids always felt safe and well taken care of by our guides Papa and Yaya and the drivers. We had the guides all for ourselves and I definitely recommend choosing B&W instead of the international travel agencies if you want a more local and personal experience.

title: Fathala Senegal, 4 wheel tour, home cooking, Banjul highlights, Makasutu, Jinack Island, roots tour
text:
Wir haben uns aufgrund der positiven Bewertungen auf TripAdvisor für black & white entschieden und haben es in keiner der zahlreichen Touren bereut. Die Kontaktaufnahme erfolgte über whats app und war völlig unkompliziert. An unserem ersten Urlaubstag wurden wir von Armstrong vom Hotel abgeholt und im Büro von black & white wurden uns alle Touren nochmals ausführlich erklärt. Da wir uns für mehrere Touren entschieden haben, wurde von Armstrong ein Plan erstellt, sodass wir zwischen den Touren auch ausreichend Zeit zur Erholung hatten. 
Alle Touren waren sehr gut organisiert, die Abholung vom Hotel erfolgte pünktlich. Zwei der Touren erfolgte in kleinen Gruppen von jeweils 4 und 6 Leuten, in den restlichen Touren waren wir alleine, was wir sehr genossen haben. Unsere guides waren Lamin und Sheriff. Beide guides waren sehr gut informiert und stets bemüht, uns die Kultur und Geschichte von Gambia näher zu bringen. Alles wurde ausführlich und gut verständlich erklärt. Das Essen während den Touren war fantastisch und auch mit Softdrinks wurden wir bestens versorgt. 
Wir können Black & white Safari tours nur bestens weiterempfehlen und würden jederzeit wieder dort buchen. Dank black & white tours hatten wir eine erlebnisreiche und unvergessliche Zeit in Gambia. 
Wir möchten uns noch einmal herzlich beim gesamten Team von black & white safari bedanken und wünschen einen guten Start in die neue Saison. Macht weiter so!

text: I did 3 tours with black and white safari. Senegal safari, 7in 1 jeep tour and Makasutu tour. All were well organised and perfect. Armstrong and his team is the best!
