title: Fathala senegal und 4wheel Tour
text:
Die Touren waren immer super, die Guides und Armstrong waren Hammer gute Typen: lustig, sympathisch und vorallem erklären sie dir alles was du wissen willst. Alles von a bis z, Geschichte, Fauna + Flora und Land und Leute. Sie wollen dir das wirkliche Gambia nahebringen. Immer pünktlich + kleine Reisegruppe mit Klima im Auto. Vor allem sind sie auch sehr hilfsbereit, so hat Armstrong uns nach etwas Problemen mit dem fti-mensch vom Hotel ganz selbstverständlich in sein Office mitgenommen. Dort haben wir dann zusammen Mittagessen gehabt. Das Essen haben wir zuvor von einer einheimischen Küche geholt. Super lecker...😀 also alles im allem super! Alles super organisiert.  Wir danken für die geilen Trips! 

Sebastian und Anna

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari in Senegal und 4-Wheel Drive
text:
Black and White Safari ist eine absolute Empfehlung von uns!
Es gab keinerlei Komplikation und wir haben uns jederzeit super gut aufgehoben gefühlt.

Unser Guide war Lamin der Chief Guide von Black and White Safari. Wir konnten Lamin jederzeit alles Fragen was uns interessiert hat und er hat uns immer ausführlich über alls berichtet. Vor jedem Stop hat er uns immer eine kleine "Einweisung" gegeben bsp. vor dem Markt besser keine Fotos oder bei dem Wood Markt könnt ihr auf jeden Fall handeln. 

Größter Pluspunkt für uns war aber das im Gegensatz zu den ganzen Hotels die Einnahmen von Black and White Safari in Gambia bleiben und die Locals unterstützen.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Feedback Black & White Safari
text:
Positiv:
Ich habe soeben die zweite Tour mit der Black and White Safari abgeschlossen. Unser Guide Lamin war wieder sehr kompetent und hat alles auf leicht verständliche Weise in gut verständlichem Englisch erklärt. Dies ist sehr wichtig, da ein tieferes Verständnis der Lebensweise der Gambier nur durch eigene Beobachtung nicht möglich ist. 
Black & White Angestellte sind zuverlässig und die Termine wurden pünktlich eingehalten, was in Gambia nicht unbedingt zum Standard gehört.
Die Touren selbst ("4 Wheel Drive Excursion" and "Gambia in One Day") sind sehr informativ und vermitteln einen guten Eindruck über Gambia außerhalb der Touristenanlagen. Ich kann jedem empfehlen, einen Blick hinter die Kulissen zu werfen. Black & White ist dafür ein zuverlässiger Touranbieter.

Negativ:
Die Buchungsmöglichkeiten über Internet gilt es noch zu verbessern. Ein Besuch im Office ist daher vorab zu empfehlen. 
Leider muss ich aber auch von einer zweifelhaften Verhaltensweise des Besitzers von Black & White berichten. Auf der Website wird ein kostenloser Transfer zum Flughafen oder eine kostenlose Stadtrundfahrt bei 2 Buchungen versprochen.
Als ich für einem 3. Ausflug mit Black & White nachfragte, bekam ich statt eines angefragten Rabattes ein explodierendes Angebot von € 200, - für eine Reise, die öffentlich für 110, - ohne Mindestteilnehmeranzahl angeboten wird. Dies ist in meinen Augen unseriöses Geschäftsverhalten des Eigentümers mit dem Versuch einer Übervorteilung. Bezüglich der Preisgestaltung ist also Vorsicht angebracht.

ownerResponse.text:
First I have to say thank you for coming out with generosity in recommending the  various you book with us .Indeed we appreciate that so much and also proud of ourselves that we did not in any way let you down .

I would like to comment on the issue that you are claiming  the dubious action by the owner,you where told that Senegal tour was already available with others and the quote was given to you which is 110,you said well you already have an opponent with some one perhaps he is going to take you ..We did not put any pressure. 

You later came back and you where told that there is no trip to Senegal and my secretary told me you said you want to do it alone then we charge 200 is this what you called dubious action?
We take minimum 4 pax and if only 2 down is always a private tour which is obvious that price is more....
I don't remember even speaking with you neither seeing you when you are discussing the last Senegal tour. 
You where given an offer of a private tour only one person 

At least we are grateful that you had a positive experience from the previous tours  and regret that our offer of a private day tour to Senegal for only you did not take place base on the price disagreement

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Sérieux et sympathique
text:
Après avoir vus les avis et plusieurs contacts avec le responsable Armstrong nous avons pris l'option 3 jours et 2 nuits à la découverte de la Gambie et également la réserve de Fathala au Sénégal.
Ce programme nous a permis de faire la découverte de la vraie Gambie en découvrant divers type de village , le ferry de Banjul à Barra , le stone circle , la river Gambia national parc , le kiang west national parc , Georgetown , les lions de Fathala , des marchés colorés et deux nuitées en lodge typique , promenade en pirogue et en bateau , en quatre quatre et en mini van .
L'équipe est très sympathique et même un guide francophone nous servait de traducteur , des véhicules bien entretenus avec boissons offertes à bord , une prise de contact dés notre arrivée à l'aéroport suivie d'une présentation de notre réservation avant le départ.
C'est vraiment une agence au TOP , superbe à tout les niveaux.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Unforgettable day!
text: We totally enjoyed our trip to fathala! The lion walk was incredible. The ferry didnt go so we had to travel by the small boats which was Maybe the most impressive experience of all our trip in The Gambia! Alex is a perfect guide!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Gambia erlebnisreicher erleben als mit ner grossen Reisegruppe
text:
Ich habe im vorfeld mich über das Internet informiert was es für private Reiseanbieter gibt und die Entscheidung war einfach Black and white mit Armstrong und seinen Kollegen. Armstrong meldete sich promt bei mir .Wir tauschten unsere Nummern aus und haben sogar mal per Whatsapp telefoniert. Es klappte alles wunderbar. Im unseren Hotel dann angekommen vereinbarten Armstrong und ich auch ein Treffen wo ich dann noch weitere Gäste mitbrachte die gerne von Armstrong Gambia gezeigt bekommen wollten. Es waren wunderschöne Ausflüge -Gambia hautnah ohne viele anderen Leute ( wir waren zu 6)
-Alles verständlich erklärt wenn auch manchmal mit Händen und Füssen
-wir hatten die Möglichkeit alles in Ruhe zuerkunden ohne Stress oder das der Guide jammerte wir müssen weiter wir müssen weiter oder kaufen sie hier sie haben sonst keine Möglichkeit mehr
-bei den Ausflügen waren Essen und Trinken inklusive und jede Menge Spass
Wir kommen auf jeden Fall wieder 
ich habe jetzt noch tollen Kontakt zu Ihnen.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Einmaliges Erlebnis dank Black and White Safari
text: Ich bin auf den Touranbieter aus Gambia bereits vor Urlaubsbeginn im Internet gestoßen. Schon beim E-Mailverkehr vorab wurden alle meine Fragen schnell und ausführlich beantwortet, so dass ich mich gut informiert gefühlt habe und die verschiedenen geführten Touren vorgestellt bekommen habe. Vor Ort habe ich mich dann sehr unkompliziert mit Mr. Armstrong, dem Chef von Black and White Safari verabredet und auch hier wurde alles einfach und verständlich und ohne einer Verpflichtung zur Buchung erläutert. Die verschiedenenen Angebote sind für afrikanische Verhältnisse kein Schnäppchen aber im Vergleich zu anderen Anbietern günstig und bestens organisiert. Bei den letzendlich gebuchten Touren in den Senegal und einer privaten Tagestour in Gambia wurde ich vom Guide Yaya begleitet. Dieser war sehr nett, bodenständig und unaufdringlich. Er konnte alles in gutem Englisch erklären, beantwortete alle Fragen und machte so jede der Touren zu einem unvergesslichen Erlebnis. Ob die Safari oder der Spaziergang mit Löwen im Senegal, den Besuch eines lokalen Dorfes, das Fischerdorf, einen Besuch auf einem lokalen Wochenmarkt, dem Paradiesbeach oder die Bootstour durch die Mangroven. Ich kann daher Black and White Safari, deren Chef Armstrong und meinen Guide Yaya uneingeschränkt weiter empfehlen.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: perfect experience with excellent guides
text: Black and white safari tours are an exellent operator and I can highly recommand Armstrong and his guides. I contacted them before going to Gambia and I did all my tours with them. They are well organized, reliable, the guides know everything about the Gambia and answered all my questions very detailed. Compared to the bigger (european) travel agencies, you have much more individuality in smaller groups and the money you spent go to a local company and local people.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: ein einmaliges Erlebnis
text:
Wir wollten nicht mit einer großen Reisegruppe sondern in einer kleinen Gruppe auf Touren gehen. Deshalb haben wir bei Black and White gebucht und wir würden es jederzeit wieder machen.

Da das neue Office noch nicht fertig ist, war die Kontaktaufnahme für europäische Verhältnisse etwas komisch. Nachdem wir Black and White über Whatsapp angeschrieben hatten, verabredeten wir uns für den nächsten Tag. Wir wurden  am Hotel abgeholt und in ein nahegelegenes Restaurant geführt. Dort trafen wir den Chef Armstrong, der uns beraten hat und wir buchten eine Tour in die Fathala nach Senegal 

Wir wurden am nächsten Tag im Hotel von unserem Führer Lamin und einem Fahrer abgeholt und erlebten einen grandiosen Tag. Die Fähre benutzten wir ohne Auto, da auf der anderen Seite ein älterer, offener Landrover mit Fahrer auf uns wartete. Es war ein aufregender Tag und Lamin hat sich alle Zeit genommen uns alles zu erklären. 

Wir würden jederzeit wieder bei Black and White buchen. Vor allem da wir alleine unterwegs waren. Die großen Reisegruppen konnten wir nur bemitleiden.

Danke an Lamin!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Four wheel drive tour
text:
We spent the tour with Lamin and Bas who took us out on the four wheel drive tour. This was a very insightful and informative day where we sampled the real Gambia away from the resorts. 
We visited the crocodile pool, sampled the market in Serakunda, attended a local nursery school, met a local family and saw the crazy fish market at Tanji.
Lamin and Bas were great hosts & were entertaining and knowledgeable throughout the day. 
Black and White Tours have a fantastic philosophy of giving back to the local community with donations to local schools and helping families in need.
Highly recommended for anybody who visits The Gambia and an eye opening trip that will live long in the memory.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Goed
text:
Hele goede excursies gemaakt met Black&White. Veel gezien van Gambia dmv 3 excursies en nog extra een trip naar Banjul.
We waren steeds alleen met ons eigen gezin, wat wij erg prettig vonden. 
Een hele belevenis!
Stipt op tijd bij iedere excursie opgehaald bij het hotel. 
Flexibel bedrijf.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Truly outstanding
text:
My husband and I booked 3 tours with arch tours, the fatala game reserve with sheriff, the makasuta cultural forest with maimuna and the camel safari with fantau (can't remember the spelling correctly sorry!!) 
each one was amazing!!! 
We were one the same tour as zoe m below and actually saw them on paradise beach a couple of days later while they were doing 4 in 1 one and us the camel safari. 
Each tour was amazing in their own way and would definitely go again if we go back. The drivers were lovely and just a really perfect time. Sheriff really made us feel relaxed in the hustle and bustle of the ferry ride when it was packed!! 
Mianuna was brilliant and hilarious and friendly and fantau was an Amazing guide and even held a snake at the reptile farm!! 😊😊THANK YOU SOOOOO MUCH!!

title: Senegal (Fathala park) with Sheriff and 4 in 1 Tour with Mo and Mamouna
text:
Arch Tours are a local Gambian tour operator based in Kololi. They were actually based next to our hotel, Holiday Beach Club.

We (2 adults and an 8 yo) were collected at 6am by Sheriff and a driver and collected a few other people before heading to Banjul for the ferry.  The tide was out so only one ferry was making the crossing at that time so we breakfasted (with China cups!) on the dockside rather than in Barra. This was fine by us. The dockside was filled with people on pilgrimage to Senegal, vans with sofas on top, vans filled with grains and lorries. We went upstairs on the boat and enjoyed the view.

On the other side of the river, Barra, we joined a different van and continued to Senegal. The border crossing was fun. Sheriff had the forethought to get money from the bank at Senegal rather than in Barra, so we missed a lot of the boat traffic. 

Fathala was brilliant.  We entered the park in our van and pretty much every type of animal in the park was in the first clearing, with the exception of the giraffes so the 8 we set off hunting them.  A park guide (a lady who was very funny in her direction to our male driver... "Direction left! Left!") joined us who used her walkie talkie to the other vehicles to see if anyone had spotted them.  Along the way we saw monkeys and antelope.  We eventually found them in deep grassland.  It felt like a proper safari!

We had pizza in the lodge and then I did the Lion Walk. I was given a stick and joined a group of other stick holding tourists and off we went into a gate marked "Danger Lions". Oh my gosh. And there they were.  Two very full lions (they eat every few days and I reckon this it's a reason they don't eat the tourists because they appeared to be suffering from major food belly!). They were sitting under trees. We had photos with them right in front of us.  Very very bizarre feeling to have these beautiful beasts in front of you without a cage.  Apparently the sticks show the lions authority. You aren't permitted to touch them and when you're not being photographed you must stay in a pack. 

Meanwhile... my 8 yo son had an experience with the cubs. I thought they'd be very small but they were quite big.  He was able to stroke them. Amazing.  Sheriff escorted him and took loads of photos and videos for us.  He took a shine too our son and our son for him.

Sheriff was so knowledgeable and amazingly friendly and so so funny.  We'd ask him how long until (say) the bossy left.  He'd reply "3 minutes and 27 seconds". Have we got time to go to the toilet? "Yes, you have one minute and 12 seconds".

On the day we left our holiday he turned up at our hotel saying our son had left something in the van.  He went into his bag and pulled out a t-shirt with a photo of him and our son together with the Lion cubs.  Beyond the call of duty. I had a little weep!!

The second trip was with Mamounia and Mo took us to Serekunda Market (busy and full of life). Mamounia escorted us giving us lots of information.  We then went to the crocodile pond where we stroked them (what's with all this touching of dangerous animals??!!) and then off to Lamin Lodge for amazing donuts overlooking the water. We went to a school where our friends gifted them with footballs (the kids went wild, breaking into a game).  We will send them a parcel of toys and books.  And then we went to a family.  This was so touching. 11 children and parents without jobs. I handed out sweets to the smiliest children who kissed  my hands and hugged me. Wow.  Again, we'd love to send them clothes and games. And then to the beach for food. And then the fish market. An amazing day with fantastic staff. 

I cannot recommend this tour group enough.  They're great.  Their staff are great.

title: 4 in 1 tour
text:
Our guides, Maimuna, Dawda and driver Solomon were already waiting when we got to our hotel lobby 5 mins early, so a positive start. They call this the 4 in 1 tour, but it was so much more and a real insight into local life in The Gambia. Our first stop was Serrekunda market which was a total assault on the senses. It was Monday morning at around 8.30, so obviously a busy time, but we were taken through at a leisurely pace so were able to take in all the sights, sounds and smells.
From there we went to the croc pool, visited a local home, had tea and doughnuts at Lamin Lodge, then onto my personal highlight which was the school visit. We took lots of pads, pens / pencils and various other stationery items to donate to the school as their funding was cut in 2016, so they function on donations alone. The kids (aged 3-7) were incredible! We were treated to a few different songs and got to see a brief glimpse into what their school life consists of. It seems a generic term nowadays, but it was a very humbling but special  experience.
From there, it was off for lunch at Paradise beach. We were served a buffet style lunch consisting of local fish, yassa chicken, chips and salad. It was all delicious! The beach was stunning and the sea was calm and welcoming so we all enjoyed a nice break.

After some R&R we headed off Tanji fish market, which was another assault on the senses, but a great experience. We were escorted round by our fantastic guides who kept us up to speed with everything around us, as well as making us feel safe and looked after.
All in all, an amazing day made ever more memorable thanks to Maimuna, Dawda and Solomon.
Thank you 
The Webster Family

title: First Class!!
text: We found these people were the best for booking up trips, easy to find and very professional. Also fair price and a large variety of trips on offer to fit all tastes, the trip down the Gambia river is a great day out.

title: Gentili, disponibili e professionalmente capaci
text:
Devo ammettere che all'inizio non è stato facile entrare in "sintonia" con Lamin (queso il nome del titolare della agenzia), questo perché i tempi di attesa delle sue risposte alle mie domande e richieste di delucidazioni ai serrvizi da lui offerti erano molto alti, e per una persona come me che aveva i minuti contati prima di partire per l'Africa, questo non era particolarmente tollerabile. 
Successivamente le cose sono andare sensibilmente meglio, tanto è vero che, una volta arrivato a Banjul, ho usufruito del suo servizio di transfer dal porto all'hotel (il driver Yaya e la guida sono stati davvero molto pazienti nell'aspettarmi al porto) nonché di due tour, il "4 Tours In 1 Day" (eccellente) e il "Roots River Cruise" (molto deludente ma non per responsabilità del'agenzia). 
Tutte le guide con cui ho avuto a che fare si sono dimostrate gentilissime e all'altezza.
Successivamente il driver mi ha organizzato anche il transfer da Kololi a Elinkine (in Senegal).
Prezzi in linea con gli standard offerti.

title: Lazy sunday boat ride
text: Myself and my daughter and my friend went out on the boat ride with Fatou from Arch tours and thoroughly enjoyed the day . Fatou our tour guide was really helpfull and even done my daughters hair for her on the boat ! It was a great day and we will be doing it again next year when we go again , the food on the boat was home made and superb ! I highly recommend you try this trip !!

title: Amazing trips
text: We went on 2 trips 4 in 1 trip and fathala in Senegal. Both trips our guide was Sherriff who was brilliant (loves sweets and biscuits). He was very knowledgeable. Also thanks to Mo, Fanta and Fatu??. Brilliant days and supplied us with drinks all day. Also good company on both trips. Many thanks xx

title: 4 in 1 day trip
text: What a fantastic day. Our guide Sheriff was so knowledgeable and we had a great laugh with him. I would recommend Arch Tours to anyone visiting the area. Great price and fab people

title: My trips
text: Went on safari walking with lions,4in1 tour,all first class supported from start to finish very professional but friendly staff who are allways there to explain things, also done roots tour this is also a must if you want to explore gambia arch tours are the ones to do it with.

title: Lazy day cruise
text: We booked the tour through the hotel rep, having been recommended by previous visitors. The tour guide was friendly and knowledgable. The tour along the river included a swim stop at a sandbar and a chance for river fishing. The boat operated through Janes boats with sun loungers and a few chairs with shaded areas too. The toilet was clean and serviceable. The day included tea/coffee with brandy if requested, a hot meal and cava or orange juice. The staff on the boat were excellent and were able to name birds and point out the wildlife. The day ended at approximately 4.30pm.

title: Arch Tours-what great guides!! Lovely people!!
text:
5 of us took the Day Tour with the guys from the Arches, they were knowledgeable of the local area and made us all feel welcome and safe.
Definitely recommend Arch Tours if you're visiting Gambia.
Thank you to all at Arch tours but especially to Sherrif and Soloman the driver.

title: Praise for Arch Tours
text: I can totally agree with wiljolo being one of the sisters she referred to. Having researched the company before our arrival in The Gambia, we knew we were going to book a trip with them. I can honestly echo all of her sentiments. They were professional, good-humoured and the hospitality was excellent throughout the tour. We would not hesitate to tour with them again when we next visit The Gambia.

title: Arch Tours - The Best Day Out!
text: Together with my two sisters, we took the four in 4-in-1 tour and had Sheriff and Fanta in our vehicle as guides, with Solomon as driver.  From the very beginning they made us very comfortable and welcome.  They treated us as treasured Aunties and were delightful and charming as well as being extremely knowledgeable.  We got on splendidly with the other passengers, a family of three (also Londoners) and we found that the day was filled with much laughter and good humour. From crocodile stroking, donuts and coffee at Lamin Lodge (and a very cheeky monkey!) to an absolutely amazing lunch at Paradise Beach, we were never so well looked after.  Arch Tours even provided cool drinks throughout the day so we were well hydrated.  I can honestly say that it was the most enjoyable day out I've spent in ages!

title: Fantastic Service
text:
What can I say you have to use this company if your planning any tours in The Gambia. The service was so attentive from the moment I booked this trip to the fantastic day we had. I booked our safari several weeks in advance via email. I had prompt friendly replies to assure me everything was in place for our visit. 
On the morning of our trip we were met outside the hotel on time and totally enjoyed the company of Shariff the guide. Funny and knowledgable he made the day.
We did the Senegal safari and enjoyed seeing all the animals. Although a long day you do get to see true Senegal.
So pleased I used this company would recommend to anyone. Keep it local would rather put money back to the local company than use a big tour company.
Would definately use again highly recommended

title: Fun Day Out.
text: Used Arch Tours on Christmas Day for the Lion Walk tour. Overall very good, we had Sheriff as our guide who was fantastic. The trip itself is well worth doing if you haven’t been on a safari before, but you maybe disappointed if you have. Find the wildlife park itself on trip advisor and read reviews before booking. Take some pens, old t shirts etc and ask to stop at the village on the way back, high light of the day.

title: Roots Trip
text: The company are very good, have years of experience. The staff were punctual and knowledgeable and took care of us during our time with them. The trip was very informative and interesting although the downside for me was the only refreshments available were on the boat, it would be a good idea if some were available and included whilst you are on the islands. The other downside was the boat was very crowded. A must if you visit the gambia

title: "Amazing trips and very well organised"
text: Arch tours was brilliant. We could not find any fault with them. We booked 2 excursions with Arch tours. We did the 4 in 1 day and Roots tour. We had Solomon as a driver and Fanta and Bob as our tour guilds. They knew everything there was to know about the trips. We was lucky to have Bob on both tours and he was incredible. (2,000 years ago..My grandfather and your grandfather..🤣🤣) We would definitely recommend the 4 in 1 tours. The lunch on both days was incredible and they made sure we had plenty of fluids throughout the day..  Highly recommend Arch tours to book your excursions whilst in Gambia. We would like to thank all the staff that made our experience in Gambia a truly memorable vacation..

title: Highlight of the Holiday
text:
Whilst on our recent holiday to Gambia, we booked via Arch tours to go to the Fathala Nature Reserve in Senegal on a tour. Dreading the thought of leaving the hotel at 6am, i can honestly say it was worth it. We were promptly collected from the hotel by Sheriff who gave us a very warm welcome. We headed to the ferry port and had breakfast whilst waiting, we were made to feel very welcome and as a group of girls very safe. Sheriff had a great knowledge and approach, it was clear he enjoyed his job and took pride in what he did. We laughed alot along the way to Senegal and he shared his knowledge of the history and the Gambian ways of life. At the nature reserve we had a great experience seeing zebras, antelopes, water buffalo, monkeys and definite highlight was driving into the wooded areas and spotting the giraffes. A friend took the opportunity to walk with lions and thoroughly enjoyed it. Sheriff made the whole day a great experience we cannot recommend him enough. 
Mo was also on the tour with other guests and between them they kept us safe, made us laugh and feel welcome and kept us hydrated from their bar 
Highly recommended - Thanks Sheriff and Mo

title: Our visit to Senegal
text: Arch tours do a great job, our trip this time to north Senegal was well run by them, the firm's founder passed away I think last year and his son now runs the business from first floor offices just off the strip. Would recommend them  from our experience.

title: Awesome tours
text:
We did two tours with Arch. We really loved it! We went bird spotting on the early bird tour. It was amazing! We saw some rare birds and the guides gave us tons of information. 
Later we also went on the sunset tour. This experience was so special! 
We loved all the little surprises this guys prepared! Thanks for all the effort you put in it!
Just go and enjoy it!

title: Fabulous
text:
Took the 4 in 1 tour with Sheriff ,Fanta & our driver Soloman
Literally could not give enough praise
Well worth the money ,very safe , very knowledgable very friendly

title: Professional and Friendly
text:
My mother and I truly enjoyed the excursion to North Senegal. All of the Arch Tours staff we encountered  (Lamin, Sheriff, Dowda, and our driver), were amazing. Sheriff and Dowda were professional, friendly, knowledgeable, and amazing. It is worth noting that Sheriff has been trained in Hospitality and Tourism by the Gambia Technical Training Institute. After meeting him, I plan to inquire about how I can invest or otherwise support the school. 
Lamin was extremely polite and accommodating allowing me to change the day of the tour without issue. He was also apologetic when the drivers arrived a few minutes late gave prompt attention and an accurate time of arrival down to the minute. I was very impressed!
Sheriff and Dowda led with confidence, keeping watchful eye on the group and navigating us thorough the large crowds on and off the ferry. There were plenty of soda and water available and we were all well hydrated!

title: 2 tours both fantastic!
text:
We were lucky enough to book and go on two tours, the 4 in 1 and also the Senegal safari, both had Mo and Sheriff as our guides.

Mo and Sheriff are great guides, very knowledgeable, more than happy to answer any questions and they also make sure you are safe and well looked after. Both tours were well put together, we had plenty if food, drink and loo breaks. 

The 4 in 1 your was eye opening, this was our first time in Gambia so whilst we has a rough idea of what to expect as a tourist, this tour makes you see it from a gambian way of life also.

The exciting part was the crocodile park, to touch and be so close was just amazing, then the sad part of visiting a gambian home and seeing thier basic home and lifestyle makes you thankful for the luxury of home.  Then the in-between, the cattle market, the Fish market was just a great insight to thier way of life.

The Senegal Safari was truly frigging awesome, the trip on the ferry was scary but exhilarating, a mad dash to get on and off a huge ferry in amongst everyone going about thier day, dodging cars, vans, bikes and goats, then over the Senegal boarder to the safari.

We were so lucky to see the rhino, antelope, giraffes and wort hogs and I paid a little extra to walk with the lions, truly amazing way to spend and afternoon.

Then back across the boarder, back on the ferry and to the hotel safe and sound.

Just amazing and seriously worth every penny.

title: Very enjoyable day out!
text:
We done the 4 in 1 tour, our guide was Rhino and a female colleague whose name I've forgotten. Both were excellent providing a running commentary from the back of the jeep which made an interesting day. More than adequate soft drinks and water was provided with regular stops. The walk around the market was an eye opener!
The highlight of the 'safari' was our visit to a local school. The children had little but were happy and overjoyed to have visitors. We brought some 'penny lollies' with us unfortunately not enough for all the pupils, had we known the numbers we would have happily bought more. Staff were perhaps not as happy with us that day as the stick on each lolly was also a whistle and the kids soon learned to 'play' but not in tune! All the children emerged to give us a send off whether they received a lolly or not with the headmaster having to hold them back from the jeep!
Lunch at Paradise Beach was good, I would recommend  a day out on Paradise Beach which is better than those further north. 
Stopping off at the fishing port as they were landing their catch was interesting, the variety and volume of fish!

title: Arch Tours Go The Extra Mile
text:
We booked with arch tours when on a two week holiday in The Gambia mid November four people for Fathala Safari, by doing this we were able to book the Sunset Cruise £10.00 per person discount, we arranged this for our first Wednesday, I also told Ya Ya on booking that it was my wife’s birthday on the Tuesday and my sons girlfriend on the Wednesday, but I was ill and couldn’t go, we called only an hour before we were due to leave and asked if we could postpone it until the following week this was greeted by no problem, we then had a call asking if my Wife could meet Ya Ya in our hotel reception, he produced a large birthday cake saying he was very sorry we couldn’t go and they had arranged a birthday surprise but wanted to give us the cake, totally amazing.
The Safari was the following Monday a fantastic day from start to finish, with personal guide and just six people to a Jeep, cold soft drinks available all day you just had to ask and it was provided. Nothing was too much effort to do.
Wednesday we had our Sunset Cruise, we were picked up four of us with 2 guides and driver, we had our own little boat for a 2 hour cruise along the mangroves, reaching Laming Lodge, we were greeted by a solo drummer, we then had a buffet of a selection of hot food and fruit prepared just for us.
We then went downstairs by now it was dark but they had a fire with dancers drummer and fire eater again just for our entertainment which lasted about an hour.
We then returned to our hotel by jeep, again cold soft drinks provided throughout, what a fantastic few hours, we were made to feel so special, a big thank you to Arch Tours.

Russ, Cynth, James and Louise.

title: A Truly Amazing Experience with Great Staff, People and an Amazing Sheriff!
text:
This was my first visit to THE GAMBIA and I could not have asked for a more fulfilling 1st day.  The 4 IN ONE TOUR WAS SIMPLY THE BEST. Forget the number 4 as you experience far more than 4 places - EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY

From the start I was greeted nicely at my hotel at 7.30 am and helped onto the open top jeep.  SHERIFF was great as he ensured that we all knew each others names and clearly laid down the itinery for the day. We visited a number of amazing places which included SERUKUNDA MARKET (Bargains galore especially Shea Butter and Black Soap, THE CROCODILE POOL IN BAKAU (Amazing history and pics with the crocs), LAMIN LODGE (Amazing Structure and doughnuts or what we call sugar fried dumplings, THE CATTLE MARKET AND THE FISHING MARKET; (A very fishy experience but worthwhile experience to see what really goes on in both of thease industries.  We also visited a compound where families live and gained a thourough understanding of Gambian Polygamy (interesting to say the least).. We gave out sweets and donated money which was truly appreciated.  For me this was the most humbling aspect of the day.  Sadly the Headmaster of the School we intended to visit passed away on the same day.  We were kept informed of everything.  We also visited Paradise Beach for some of the most amazing food and relaxation.  

Sherriff was the main speaker, this man ouzed with knowledge and helpfulness.  Solomon (THE BAD BOY DRIVER) and Mo were also great too.  All staff took a caring approach.  However Sherriff just seemed to go that extra mile to ensure that we all gained the best experience, he assisted with bartering in the market and carrying our bags, he even took our towels to reserve sun beds at the beach whilst we ate and asked if we prefer sun or shade ....how thoughtful!!
I did not know that he was tour guide of the year but I can certainly see why as he is a true credit to Arch Tours. 

Throughout the day we were kept hydrated educated and entertained with fun and laughter and safely returned to our hotels,

I look forward to going back and doing seeing more amazing sights with Arch Tours who for me were simply the best.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

BLESSINGS TO MO, SOLOMON AND THE AMAZING SHERIFF! - Arch Tours, Thanking you!

TIPS - A sun hat will be needed at times and swimwear for Paradise beach. Don't Take pics of Official Staff in Uniform or Market Vendors without permission.  Keep an open mind!!

Come prepared to be both educated and humbled,,, bring sweets, books, pens, even clothes for the children and families in the compound as the things that we take for granted or may even throw away in the West, mean so much to those experiencing real poverty.   

PEACE AND LOVE

P.S - I also experienced the Roots River Tour but that intense experience warrants its own review.

title: Execellent
text: Myself and my daughter went on 2 trips with Arch Tours, Roots and the 4 in 1. Both were very good trips.  Lunch was delicious and we had a constant supply of cold drinks. We were well looked after.  I would highly recommend this tour company to other visitors. We had a lovely tour guide called Rhino an on the second trip he was with a young lady called Maimuna also a very lovely guide  who made us feel very welcomed an kept us informed about the different places we visited. I can not wait to return and go on some of their other tours.

title: Goed bedrijf
text: Arch tours is een prima aanbieder van excursies in Gambia. De prijzen zijn redelijk en met meerdere deelnemers kan de prijs naar beneden. Betrouwbare voertuigen en gidsen. Zeer behulpzaam.

title: Roots boat and island tour
text: Brilliant day out babou and rhino where great guides and friendly guys full of knowledge and answered all questions asked . Staff on the boat were helpful and food was lovely defiantly worth the money , best price in Gambia ! When we return we will be. Poking another trip with arch tours ! Great day great memories !

title: Fantastic Day Out!
text:
We went on the 4 in 1 trip on Friday 10th November.  What a wonderful trip.  I'm not sure where the '4' comes from as we were on the go all day with many visits included, there were more than 4!  We had an open-topped 6-seater jeep, take lots of sun cream and hand sanitizers!  We visited Serrakunda Market, very busy, hustle and bustle, the Crocodile Pool where you can stroke the crocs, Lamin lodge for coffee and doughnuts, a visit to a sheep and cattle market, Sangyang School where we met a class of 11 year olds and their teachers, visited a typical Gambian house and families, very humbling, we also distributed our sweets there with the help of our guides who controlled the children, then off to Paradise Beach for lunch and sun-bathing finishing off by a trip back to the Tanji fishing village.  This is a very busy place and, it's very smelly.. It's a fishing village!!  You will also see the fish-smoking area.  The day ends with another trip through the areas leading back to your hotels driving through Serrakunda, passing the Senegambia strip and seeing real Gambians going about their daily business.  Special praise once again to Arch Tours as our jeep blew its engine before the crocodile pool and a replacement jeep and driver, Omar, were found quickly with no delay.  The typical Gambian lunch at Paradise beach was freshly cooked and delicious but even better was the constant supply of refreshing ice cold drinks carried in cool boxes on top of our jeep whenever we stopped, no diet drinks though slimmers or diabetics but water also available and plentiful.  I cannot praise this company enough for such a fantastic day out.  Special thanks to the team on the day Sheriff, Rhino, a young lady whose name began with 'M' Mariama? and Omar our wonderful driver who stood in with a new jeep at the last minute.  One thing to mention, as you travel around, mostly in villages, you are welcomed and followed by scores of children who ask for sweets.  Whilst it's great to take sweets with you PLEASE DO NOT THROW THEM OUT OF YOUR VEHICLES!  Many children have been injured or killed racing to pick up sweets and run blindly in front of other vehicles.  We nearly saw this happen it was very upsetting.  There are plenty of opportunities to give children sweets en route, when you stop many times, your guides will control the situation whenever they can as the children are very enthusiastic!  It's also a nice idea to take pencils, books and crayons for the school BUT PLEASE GIVE DIRECT TO THE TEACHER OR SCHOOL ITSELF, as the teachers explain to you some children are more forceful than others leaving the shy ones with nothing.  If you do it this way your gifts are spread out fairly.

This trip is a great way to see the REAL Gambia, not for the faint-hearted though, you are on the go all day!  Absolutely brillant thank you Arch Tours... Highly recommended!

title: Excellent Service by very friendly & knowledgeable staff
text:
Just returned from our first visit to The Gambia. 
Whilst there we were fortunate to go on two trips with Arch Tours. 

Our first trip was 'The Roots' tour, our guide was Ibrahim (Rhino). 
A lovely knowledgeable man, he made our trip amazing. 
Also on our tour was a elderly lady (solo traveller) on crutches, Ibrahim was a real gent carrying her bag, ensuring she was assisted on and off the boats. 

After a 2 and a half hour boat ride along the river Gambia, we visited the villages of Albreda & Jufureh including the slave museum. 
A beautiful lunch was served on the boat before visiting James Island by canoe, an experience in its self! 
On the way back we were treated to afternoon tea, coffee & biscuits, followed by watermelon. 

Our second trip was to Fatala Safari Park, our guides on that trip were Bob, Mo & Sherrif. The service we received was second to none.  
We were picked up at 5am from our hotel, prior to catching the ferry from Banjul to Barra. After arriving in Barra we transferred onto the jeep, after a short drive from Barra we stopped in a clearing for breakfast. 
We were in the middle of nowhere, out came cups, saucers, tea and coffee along with cheese, ham boiled eggs baguettes and a range of jams, marmalade and honey. There was also a selection of water and soft drinks. 
Onward to the border, where our passports were stamped, then to Fatala Safari park. 
We were lucky to see the rhino who had been hiding for the last few tours, along with zebra, wart hogs, giraffes, gazelles and monkey's. 
The best part for us was the walking with lions, amazing animals.  

This was followed by lunch; a huge pizza & soft drinks (all included in the cost). 

After lunch we made our way home, calling in at a Senegalese village, where we were treated like visiting royalty. 
The children were just adorable, lining up I an orderly queue - I just wished we could have given them more. 
Back on the road again, to the port before boarding the new ferry this time back to Banjul, more soft drinks on the ferry - these guys were amazing hosts. Then back home to our hotel in time for happy hour too!! 

Would I recommend this company - Yes, Yes, Yes it really is a no brainer.

title: Roots 16/11/17
text: Just returned from roots tour had a fantastic time rhino our guide was brilliant the boat lads were funny and excellent looked after us buffet lunch superb if you want to visit gambia go with arch tours keep the money in gambia not with tour operators the roots tour interesting emotional

title: It's all true - These guys are perfect!
text: Took the day tour to Fathala safari park over the water in Senegal.  From the booking to the final drop off, they looked after us the whole way.  You really do need a great guide and local knowledge to get through the bun-fight that is the Ferry crossing, but once the scrum is behind you, it's a brilliant day out.  Special thanks to our 2 guides on the day Sheriff and Rhino.  10 out of 10 for care and attention to detail.  Look nowhere else. This is the place to book your tour.  Thanks. Mark & Lisa

title: Outstanding
text:
When visiting a different country it is very easy to book excursions with the hotel or tour operator. However i can not recommend Arch Tours enough.

We visited the office and met with the adviser there who was very friendly and helpful. It is cash only so please be aware - if you email before you visit the Gambia you can get an excursion list including costs so your prepared. Its worth noting the more tours you book you receive a discount. Its also worth noting unless specified drinks and food are included!

We selected three tours from Arch

4 in 1 Tour: Sheriff - Mo D - Solomon 

What a fantastic and humbling day each and every member of staff could not be more polite helpful and keen to show us the real Gambia, Solomon even taught my partner some of the local lingo. We visited a school, Crocodile park Paradise beach,Serekunda Market, Lamin Lodge finally stopping at the port where all the fish is brought in daily. We were constantly kept topped up with drinks and also had a meal at paradise beach.

River Roots Cruise - Bob

Bob was a great host he picked us up and took us onto the excursion - this one is mainly lead by the locals but Bob was always on hand and very friendly.

Sunset Cruise - Dawda and Maimuna

Wow what a trip we were the only two on this trip, Maimuna and Dawda were great they kept us well stocked with drinks and well informed during the trip. Dawda is a keen birdwatcher so as we meandered along he could point out all the local wildlife - superb. Lamin Lodge both Dawda and Maimuna were involved int he dancing and were both super to be around.

What really made the difference is the fact the team care a lot. We saw a number of the team whilst out and about in Senegambia and whilst out on other trips each colleague took the time to come and speak to us and ask how our holiday was and even giving us information even though we wasn't with them. Absolutely exceptional and professional.

Chrissy and I would like to personally thank

Mo D
Sheriff
Solomon
Dawda
Maimuna
Bob

Each one of these guys really made our holiday and we genuinely felt valued safe and that they wanted to show us around with pride and passion. Each excursion they picked us up on time to the minute as agreed.

Top Tips:

Pick up some sweats (Minty) for the children you see and any school materials you wish to donate.

Jerre Jeff.

title: Easy to book
text:
Booked 3 events, a creek fishing trip, a lazy day cruise and a Batik factory and market visit.
Be aware Arch Tours do not take any kind of debit or credit cards, so you have to have cash!
The folk who run the company are very pleasant. 
The fishing trip: I was the only one on the boat apart from the guide and the captain. We were out from 9.30am to 4.00pm. Caught quite a few fish, including barracuda, lady fish, cat fish.
The lazy day cruise: This got off to a bad start as we arrived at 8.30am for a 9.00am set-off, then ended up waiting until 10am for the Gambia tours bus load to arrive! However the trip through the mangroves was very relaxing with bird spotting, a swim, and some fishing; we even helped a couple of local ladies collect shell fish from the water surrounding a sand bank.
The Batik factory: The factory was closed due to the death of one of the owners, but the guide took us to an oyster factory, the local market and offered to include the crocodile park.
The guides are knowledgable and good company.

title: Superb company with amazing guide (Sheriff)
text:
We booked with Arch tours while searching for a company to take us to Fathala park in Senegal and are so happy we did.
We were collected early from our hotel by our guide Sheriff and driver Tom (we had a 2nd driver for Senegal leg, Mo) who was again really good.
Sheriff explained lots on route to the ferry terminal including the plan for the day etc.
Sheriff is a really good guide, kind,
Honest and very attentive.
We stopped on route for a great breakfast and as many drinks you can manage, then onto Fathala which again was really enjoyable and worth while. (We did the lion walk as is a must for the minimal additional cost)
Lunch was taken at Fathala, again with as many soft drinks you wanted.
We stopped in a local village on route back, giving the local kids some sweets and pencils etc were highly appreciated and very enjoyable.
Overall very professional and enjoyable.

Sheriff is a Chelsea Fan and a very good level goalkeeper and would be very grateful of any chelsea items or goalkeeper gloves etc, you may be thinking of throwing.... Mo is a Liverpool fan. Despite this they are both good guys.

(Gambia is a poor country so if you have space in your suitcase they are extremely grateful to receive any clothes, shoes etc)

title: Loved it xx
text:
We did the safari park tour. This tour was the absoulute highlight of our holiday. We were picked up from our hotel around half six in the morning.  Our jeep had 6 people altogether on it. Straight to the ferry where we were given a nice cuppa..
We stopped in the bush for breakfast. Eggs , bread, jam, cheese, english tea and loafs more . Awfully civilised lol ..
Then onto the safari park the whole time the boys were looking after us. Very professional and friendly guys. We were offered drinks constantly throughout the day. All included in the price.
We were lucky enought to find giraffes on our tour. After that we went to the lions which was completely unforgettable. Before the trip home. All in all a completely amazing memorable day provided to us by a fabulous company. We are back in feb and will definatly be doing at least one more tour. Thankyou so much xx

title: Senegal Noord
text: Samen met Sheriff naar Senegal Noord. Plezierige en goed georganiseerde tour met veel, relevante en leuke informatie. Sheriff is een hele goede en plezierige gids met veel kennis, lol en humor, die precies aanvoelde wat wij wilden. Wij hebben een hele leuke dag gehad en alles werd voor ons geregeld. Zelfs ontbijt onder een grote boom met verse eitjes, brood en koffie/thee als ook lunch. Erg aan te raden.

title: Superb Tour company
text:
We were recommended by friends to use Arch Tours for any trips we required, they did not disappoint. We arrived at the office just off the Senegambia road and were warmly greeted by Abdul, the CEO, and were sat down and given 2 bottles of icy cold water, (well needed due to the intense heat!) and given a brochure detailing all the trips. We explained that we had been recommended by our friends and wanted to book the 4 tours in 1 day and also the trip to Fathala Reserve in Senegal.  Abdul came up with a really good price and we promptly paid. He also advised us to do 1 trip the first week and the other the following week. We were picked up on time at our hotel and were greeted by Sheriff, our guide, and Buba the drive for the day and introduced to our fellow trippers. The tour started with a drive to Serrekunda market in the open top Land rover. Sheriff showed us round the market explaining what the foods were and showing us the local cooking pots and answering any questions we had. We next drove to Kachikally crocodile pool, a truly memorable experience walking around the large pool with crocodiles everywhere and Sheriff explaining the story of the fertility rites performed there. We then had the opportunity to have pictures taken crouching down and touching a large crocodile. When it came to my turn I was feeling a little nervous to say the least. The keeper of the crocodiles told me to lift the tail of the 6 foot croc, I did so with some apprehension and a picture was taken as the croc decided to move forward with me holding on to it!!, soon after it was time to carry on with our tour. Next destination was Lamin Lodge for coffee or tea and home made doughnuts. This place is amazing, built out into the Lamin Bolon, a tributary of the main river and constructed totally out of wood. As there is no glass in the windows, the monkeys roam in and out, one even picked up a half empty cup of coffee and sat there on the table drinking every last drop! Next we looked at the oyster collection point and told of all its uses by the local people. We then drove through lots of local villages waving at the happy children who ran behind the jeep expecting to be thrown sweets, we were advised not to throw any sweets as this has been causing tooth decay and also accidents. Next we arrived at a native compound and was met by the chief of the village who showed us around the compound, absolutely fascinating. Back to school next, a real Gambian school in the bush, again this was absolutely fascinating, to hear how some of the children had to walk 5 Kilometres from their village and then 5 kilometres home in the afternoon. I soon learnt why most Gambian people speak and understand English so well, this is because it is taught as a first language, their native tongue being second. Next to Paradise beach for a late lunch and swimming before our final stop at Tanji fishing village, the largest in Gambia. You can watch the beautifully hand made fishing boats arrive up on to the beach to unload their catch and then the process of smoking them. What I found interesting was their innovative use of old fridges and freezers, dozens and dozens of them filled with ice to preserve the fish. What a day to remember and to reflect on as we drove back to our respective hotels and chatted with our fellow tourists. All food and drink are provided on these tours. Thanks again to Sheriff and Buba for a truly wonderful and educational day, and of course to Abdul for making our holiday one of the best ever.

Ken and Lorraine.

title: Very well organised with good guides
text:
Very well organized tours and professional guides. Thanks to Mohammed and Sherif who were fantastic. I recommend the 4 in 1 tour.
Don't use anyone else!

text: Booked this trip it cost £50 each there was only us on this trip but ir still went ahead which was nice as they didnt let us down we went on the ferry which if you have any mobility problems give this trip a miss as it was absolutly rammed and it was dangerous to the amount of people and cars vans livestock but at the other side we went on a jeap to a museum and then on a boat to the island it was very interesting and we got lunch after would i go on this trip if id known how much travelling they was probably not but thats not black and whites fault just personal choice was it good value for money no bit overpriced but thats life

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great tour, great guide, great day
text:
We looked up different guide companies in Serrekunda here on Tripadvisor, and came across Black and White Tours. We called them up and Armstrong, the manager, came over to our hotel right away and showed us the different tours they had available. We asked to be given some time to think it over, which he was totally understanding with. Not pushy at all in trying to sell us anything, but just friendly and service-minded. 

We decided on going on the full-day tour to Senegal, going to Fathala nature reserve including the Lion Walk. On the day, our guide Lamin was there to pick us up right on time in a mini-bus. Lamin was super friendly and professional, and told us about the area as we drove out of Serrekunda towards Banjul and the crossing over the Gambia river. 

At the Gambia River, there was quite a bit of commotion as the ferry had broken down, and the only way to get across was in small wooden boats, which were packed with commuters, and young men trying to make a buck all scrambling to get to carry tourist on board the boats, for payment. It was quite a chaotic scene, but Lamin was very professional and collected and made sure to organize for a few people he knew, and payed in advance, to get us all onboard the boats. He made us feel very safe and was very professional during these somewhat chaotic curcumstances. 

On the other side, we crossed the border into Senegal (which Lamin also made sure to go as easy as possible) in an open jeep. 

Well into Fathala, Lamin arranged for us to go with the senior guide, who's name now escapes me, but who was very knowledgable about the reserve, it's animals and plants. He was a great guide and told us everything we wanted to know and more about the different animals we saw. We saw pretty much all the animals there were to see (rhino, giraffe, zebra, antelope, buffalo, warthog, monkey, etc) except for one species of antelope, which escaped us. Our drive in Fathala was a good 1,5 hours, and we felt totally satisfied when returning to the entrance. 

We then went on the lion walk, which was included in the tour, but held in a separate park of the reserve. It was with a much larger group, and was set up around a number of pre-determined "photo ops" with the lions, which made it feel perhaps not as natural and a little moure "touristy" than the experience of the rest of the park, but in the end, being only inches away from two fully grown lions, seeing them up close and walking with them was an amazing, once-in-a-lifetime experience. 

We then returned for lunch at a nearby school and restaurant, which was really nice, especially if you enjoy the Gambian dishes of Domoda and Yassa, like we did. 

The trip home was nice and leasurly, and the trip back over the Gambian river in the wooden boats even better arranged on the way back. 

All in all we had a great, unforgetful day, and quite an adventure! Lamin was a great, friendly, knowledgable and professional guide, who always made us feel safe and taken good care of. 

100 % recommend this company and their tours if you go to Gambia. We would use them again for sure if we come back.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing trips
text:
We visited Gambia in October 2018 and I had contacted Armstrong at Black and White Safaris a few months before we were due to arrive. He responded to my queries immediately and I had been in contact with him via email and WhatsApp.

We did a day trip to Senegal for the safari. We had Alex as our guide. The ferry crossing was definitely an experience. Alex was an amazing guide. Having done safari in Kenya before, the Senegal safari doesn’t compare at all, but it was worth the experience for the ferry crossing and visiting a local Senegal village during the trip.

We also did a tailored trip around Senegambia and main town with Armstrong. Again, we had Alex as our tour guide. We visited the local sights and a local school as well. We also visited the crocodile park which was awesome.

I would highly recommend Black and White Safaris as they are very knowledgeable, friendly, professional and a percentage of what they make goes back to the local community.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Journée magnifique
text:
Nous sommes partis toute la journée  avec Lamin et avons visité différentes choses : crocodiles pool, marché, école,  paradis beach, village, Tanji et l'arrivée des pêcheurs. 
Une journée remplie d'émotions surtout à l'école et dans le village. 
N'hésitez pas à prendre des affaires à donner à l'école et dans le village.
Une excursion comme nous les aimons.
Attention, en avril il fait très chaud. Pensez à prendre votre crème solaire.
Merci à  Lapin, un guide au top.

title: Toegewijde en betrouwbare gidsen
text:
Heel blij dat we via dit bedrijf onze tours hebben kunnen boeken. Thuis had ik al enige informatie opgevraagd via de mail (directe response) en een afspraak gemaakt om de tours door te nemen. Één van de gidsen kwam op de afgesproken tijd, dus geen Afrikaanse tijden! 

We hebben als eerste de safari tour naar Senegal gedaan. Mede door onze gids een fantastische ervaring. Lamin wist veel te vertellen over de cultuur, dit maakt de tour erg interessant. Ook in combinatie met de lion walk een erg bijzondere ervaring! Inclusief lekkere lunch en drinken, dus zeker de moeite waard.

De tweede tour die wij geboekt hebben was de 4 wheel drive. Hier zie je ook de andere kant van Afrika. We hadden het geluk weer met Lamin op stap te gaan. Bij deze tour zie je alle hoogtepunten en dieptepunten (zoals de armoede) van dichtbij. Zeer interessant en echt een ervaring die je vakantie compleet maakt.

Vergeet niet wat spullen voor de lokale school en familie die je bezoekt mee te nemen. Daar maak je ze erg gelukkig mee!

Geweldig dat deze organisatie bijdraagt voor de lokale bevolking.

Trip was amazing and a real eye opener traveling across to Senegal.  We then asked to do the sunset Cruise which they were happy to arrange for us on the same day so short notice but nothing was a problem and again this trip was fabulous.  Both guides. Kami and sherrif were excellent friendly and nothing was to much trouble.  All in all a very well run tour company.  Thank you so much xxx

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala National Park Senegal with Lion Walk
text: We booked our trips before we left the UK direct with Black and White. After a couple of emails to Armstrong who runs B&W I paid my deposit by Paypal. It really was so simple to deal with this company and they go out of their way to make sure you enjoy yourselves. I am finding it a little difficult to write this review as previous reviewers have said it all before me. Our guide for this and all our trips was Lamin. We found him very professional knowledgeable and passionate about his country and subject, he also ensured that we all had plenty of drinks throughout our long day. We were picked up from our Hotel at around 7.15am for this trip and arrived back at around 5.30pm. We saw all the animals there were to see and the Lion Walk was incredible. to finish the day off we were escorted back into Banjul by dolphins when we crossed the River Gambia. It seems like a long day when you look at the times but it flies by, The Black and White staff made you feel like you were having a day out with friends. Brilliant.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 3 fantastic tours with tour guide Alex.
text:
We went on three tours with black and white, each time with Alex a charming, intelligent and sensible young man.  

The first trip we did was to visit a Gambian house and cook a lovely peanut stew. We visited the market, cooked the stew and ate with the family in a remote village.  My worry was that this would not be an authentic experience, but worry not, this was 100% authentic, be prepared for a real experience of Gambian family living.   Not sure we can recreate the lovely food at home though!!!!

We also went on the safari trip to Senegal, worth every penny !!! And walk with the lions..... an experience not to forget! Plus a beautiful lunch.  

If you don’t do anything else do the the tour where you visit the school, paradise beach and fishing village.   This is a one day tour of Gambia, once again our tour guide Alex and our driver were amazing.  A great day all round !!

Well done Alex!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: best trip ever
text:
Realised today that I'd forgotten to put a review of my experience with Black and White Safari, my partner and I used this company to go the nature reserve in Senegal in December 2018. 

Just had a simply amazing time on the trip, our guide - the amazing Yaya looked after us really well, arrived on time, was courteous, full of information and coped well with two people on the trip who seemed to be determined to undermine him and spoil everyone else's day.

 With regards to the trip itself it was great, really enjoyed seeing more of Gambia and going into Senegal was an eye opener, especially the border crossing. My favourite part of the day was obviously the lion walk- Tala and Sisse the lions were majestic, amazing and very much in charge, when they decided to go for a walk t the watering hole that was it for the day- and we were ok with that having spent a mind blowing time with them. In summary I cant speak highly enough of everything we encountered- Yaya and the drivers were great, looked after us all day, Lunch at the charity village was really good and the work they're doing really affected us so much so that we've arranged sponsorship of a child through a relative of ours and we'll be going back in December 2019 because we've rebooked for the same hotel, same time everything so it must have been good. 

Thanks again to YAYA and Black and White Safari for a brilliant day

Infact we happy that we do not conduct such a service for this woman .So let it not bother you .

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Hugely grateful to Armstrong and his team
text:
Prior to arriving in The Gambia I booked three tours with Armstrong; The Senegal Safari with Lion Walk, Makasutu forest trip and the 4x4 tour. I paid a £25 deposit for each trip when booking and agreed to pay the rest in cash when collected for our first tour. Armstrong regularly messaged me in the lead up to my trip. We landed in the Gambia at 8pm on the Saturday evening and we were collected as arranged at 7am Sunday from our hotel for the safari. 

Armstrong had arranged for Yaya to conduct all three of our tours and he was absolutly incredible. We had the best three days with him and learnt so much about the country, the culture and customs of The Gambia. We never felt rushed and any questions we asked were answered thoroughly. 

Thank you so much to Black and White tours for making out holiday truly unforgettable!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 🌟🌟Outstanding!!🌟🌟
text:
We used Arch Tours on a few occasions when in The Gambia. The service we received was FANTASTIC!! My favourite trip was Fathala Reserve in Senegal!! We were promptly picked up at 6am where we headed to the ferry crossing (after stopping off for a delicious picnic breakfast)!! The ferry was a bit of an eye opener...lots of locals, school children and animals!! Once crossed, we continued to the boarder and had our passports checked and stamped. The scenery all along the way was breathtaking...for both good and bad reasons. 
The safari was fantastic, we saw all the animals we were hoping for and opted to do the lion walk as an extra. We had pizza for lunch before starting the journey back to The Gambia. A very long day, but well worth it!! 
Our tour guide for the day was Demba...he was amazing. Have us so much information throughout the day and nothing was too much trouble!! 
I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this company and Demba personally. Top Class!!🙌🏼👍🏼
🌟🇬🇲🌟🇬🇲🌟🇬🇲🌟🇬🇲🌟🇬🇲

title: 2 Family Tours
text:
We started talking to Abdul (owner) via email some months before we came and he was always very quick to answer any questions we had.

We book the "4 in 1" and Fathala reserve trip and he accommodated the days we wanted and even sent a truck to pick us up and bring us to his office to do the booking which he gave us a discount on.

The trips were as described elsewhere and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only snag we found was a mis-communication on the Fathala trip where if you booked the Walk with Lions at his office he could give you a discount to £20 per person but if you book it at Fathala it is the full price of £29 per person.

Our 2 daughters loved the open top trucks and cold drinks all day

title: Arch tours ... very much recommended
text: Arch tours - owner/organizer, drivers, guides are all - excellent. Very much supporting in creating must see/experience wishlist. We booked 4 trips with Arch Tours ('4 tours in one day'; 'Makasutu Cultural Forest'; 'Alex Hailey's Root Cruise' and a one day with ferry to/from Barra, Barra and fort Bullen and Banjul highlights). Could always hear what was being said - also during frequently used jeep transports. Freely asked questions. Heard/learned a lot about getting to know Gambia/history/culture/people/etc ... very much appreciated.

title: Uitstekend
text: Dagje met ach tours op pad geweest een hele lange te warme dag maar met prima gidsen en een uitstekende verzorging over de hele dag was top geregeld groet van Theo en astrid

title: AMAZING!!!! WOWeeee!!!
text: This travel company was brilliant.  We could not find fault with them at all.  We booked 3 trips with Arch Tours.  The jeeps had a maximum number of people allowed in each jeep so you could always hear what was being said and freely ask questions.  We did the Roots Tour, 4 in 1 day and the Fathila Wildlife Reserve, Senegal.  The travel reps we had were Demba and Sheriff and others but Demba and Sheriff were just the best.  We had Sol and another for our drivers and felt more than happy with them taking control of the wheel.  They could not do enough to help us.  They knew everything there was to know. Everything was organised so perfectly.  Timings were impeccable with the most amazing food and drink of any sort available in abundance.  We will be returning to the Gambia and we will definitely be using ARCH TOURS and requesting Demba and Sheriff!!!  We will probably do those three tours again as they were so fantastic. We even had some jokes!

title: Fathila Wildlife Reserve
text: Thsi was a superb tour which included a walk with the Lions. The two guides we had went above and beyond what they needed to do. Thank you Sherriff and Worker for a fantastic trip and all the attention to detail and for looking after John with him being an amputee it could of been a difficult trip but you guys made it a pleasure.

title: Amazing trips!
text: After reading the reviews on here we booked onto the 4 in 1 tour and also the Roots River Cruise. Wow....both were amazing. We were lucky to have Muhammed as our tour guide for both trips and he was incredible. A wealth knowledge, answered our questions and neither trip felt rushed. The lunch on both days was incredible too and lots of free drinks too...amazing value for money. As well as visiting and seeing some very emotive sites, we had great fun too...paradise beach stunning, as was the boat ride on the Roots tour. The highlights....well too many to name! Highly recommended and Abdul (the owner) was a pleasure to book with. A credit to The Gambia.

title: Op stap met Arch Tours
text:
Voor één week op vakantie in Gambia.
We zaten in het gezellige plaatsje Kololi.
Via Arch Tours 3 tours gedaan. Helemaal top. Goed verzorgd en enthousiaste gidsen. Erg genoten van de verschillende tours.

title: Fantastic day out, great staff
text: From the minute we walked into the office we were given a bottle of water and had a chat to a lovely non pushy man. We booked the 4 in 1 trip and had 2 great reps Muhammad and Walker with Tom our driver. The 3 gents looked after us all day giving us a running commentary and answering any questions. The trip was a visit to the market, the crocodile park, laming lodge, a tribal village, a lovely lunch on Paradise beach then on to the fishing village. A great full day out to see a part of the real Gambia at a great price with all the money going to a local firm.

title: Fantastic day trips
text:
Returned last week from my 1st holidaynto the Gambia and went on the Roots tour, 4:1 tour and Senegal day safari trip. All 3 trips were well organised and the regular free refreshments during the day particularly during the Roots trip were gratefully received and needed. All guides  were friendly, helpful ,professional and very informative.
I plan to return for a holiday next year and will be using Arch Tours again.

title: Roots and lazy day tour's
text:
Both tours were fantastic, the tour reps were friendly and very informative and the food provided was lovely. 
Would definitely recommend and use again.

title: Senegal/ walking with lions
text: Can't recommend highly enough.....had a fantastic day with great guides....well run and organised trip....nothing too much trouble.....thanks to Bob and Marie x

title: Roots Tour
text:
A good day (not too long) and very informative in regards to the history of the slave trade.  The three guides Bob!, Marie and Mohamed were very pleasant and looked after us extremely well - they were informative and approachable.  
   Places of interest were pointed out on the way to the port - the trucks waiting were something to see!.  On the boat trip we were given a breakfast snack, a good lunch and afternoon tea & snacks.
   At Albreda/Juffureh we were met by a local guide (and lots of children) who took us through the villages and to the little slave museum, followed by an introduction to Kunte Kiinteh's local descendants. 
  This was followed by the short trip to James Island (now Kunta Kinteh Island) the staging post for transporting slaves including a short rather amusing transfer on local  piroques from our boat.
   On return to the hotels our guides continued to inform and even gave a rendition of their national anthem (I'm not sure if they will make a talent show) an informative, emotive and enjoyable tour.

title: 2 trips, both brilliant.
text: Did 2 trips with Arch tours, both of which we could not fault. We did the 4 in 1 and the camel safari and where superbly looked after on both trips by guides Marie, Dawda, Solomon, Sheriff and Tom. Cold drinks and fantastic lunches at Paradise beach included in the price. The highlight of both trips has to be the visit to the village school on the camel safari trip but everything else we visited, Serekunda market, the crocodile pool, Lamin lodge, the village, Paradise beach, Tanji fishing village, the camel ride and the reptile farm were a delight.

title: Roots Tour
text: First Class Service from start to finish, with good snacks, drinks, service and friendly helpful guides.

title: Superb
text: Cheaper than the tours with the travel organisation (tui).  We went on the roots trip to james island and the surroundings.  We had a superb and relaxing day and exellent guidance bij Muhammed.   To banjul in a 4x4 landrover, then on a small charming old boat (big motorboat)  to the island and its surroundings.  Since we were in a small group (only three + guide)  the guiding was very private.  Comparing the other possibilities (taxi or big tour operator)  we would recommend doing the trip with arch (price/quality).

title: Citytour und Fatalah, Arch Tours 100% empfehlenswert
text:
Ich habein den letzten Tagen 2 Touren mit Archtours gemacht.
1.) 4tours in one day
Eine ausgedehnte local and ethno Tour..
Besuch des Serakunda Marktes, Austernfarm, Schule, lokale Familie, paradise beach, Krokodilteich, Tanji Fischerdorf...
Alles sehr spannend bunt und abwechslungsreich, vermittelt einen guten Eindruck von Gambuas heimlicher Hauptstadt und Umgebung. Persönlicher guide war Marie, die ihren Job sehr gut gemacht hat. Super freundlich und sehr informativ. Auch Tom der Fahrer war sehr gut.
Alles in allem eine 100% empfehlenswerte Tour.
2.) Ausflug in den Fatalah game park (Senegal) Die Anfahrt zieht sich ein wenig... erst 40min ab Kololi bis zur Fähre, warten auf die selbige... sie fährt wenn sie soweit ist... und dann noch mal 45min bis Fatalah inkl Grenzformalitäten.
Der Gamepark erinnert ein wenig an einen Safaripark und ist, wer Ostafrika oder Südafrika kennt, eher unspektakulär...
Spannender hingegen ist der dort angebotene Lionwalk. Ausflug zu Fuß mit zwei 5jährigen Löwen und Gelegenheit zu vielen Fotos...
Lionwalk sollte man sich jeinesfalls entgehen lassen wenn man dort ist !! Wird 5x am Tag angeboten und dauert ca. 45min
Fazit: gamedrive ok, Löwen super 
Archtours im Ganzen uneingeschränkt empfehlenswert !!

title: Great company
text:
I agree with all the positive remarks made by other clients.
Great company, great workforce, great prices.
Thank you! Wished we had booked Senegal with you instead of Thomas Cook!

title: The best!
text:
So we booked our excursions with Arch Tours.

We booked Fathala Game Reserve for my 25th birthday. They normally travel to Fathala on Wednesday but changed it to a Tuesday so I could go for my birthday. We were picked up at 6am and headed to the Ferry Port, accompanied by Sheriff, Fatou and Bob. Unfortunately we missed the first ferry but it wasn't the end of the world.  We had our breakfast early due to having to wait for the next ferry. We had an amazing picnic breakfast at the ferry port organised by Arch Tours. Eggs, bread, bananas, cheese, tea, coffee... you really couldn't fault it. We completed the safari and then done the lion walk. Free drinks were included in the price. Fatou, Sheriff and Bob made sure I had a birthday to remember... it was just amazing! I really can't thank them enough! 

We also booked the Roots tour which was accompanied by Sheriff and Bob. This was definitely a tear jerker visit but so worth it! Both Sheriff and Bob were so knowledgeable and helpful! The excursion included lunch on the boat. It was a beautiful day out! 

Don't book with your tour operator! Arch Tours are so much better! They offer many more trips. I definitely recommend them! Thank you so much guys for making our holiday one to remember! Hopefully see you again soon 😉

title: 4 in a day, roots river trip and 3h river cruise/abuko
text: in short, highly recommended. We were in gambia last week and did 3 tours with arch tours. We are a family of 5 with the kids between 10 and 13 years old. The 3h river cruise in the canoe was very relaxing, beautiful scenery, while Sherrif explained and answered all our questions.The roots river cruise was memorable where we all ended up playing bottleflip with our guide Muhammed and the crew from the boat. The trip means 2.5 to 3h of boat to get to the island, but time passed quickly :-) food was very good on board. In general on all the trips food is good and they make sure to have plenty of drinks along (watern cola, fanta, beer etc). Would recommend the 4 in 1 maybe to start to get a good idea of the country. The visit of the school had an impact on the kids (and us) as well. Thanks to Abdul, Sherrif, Muhammed, Fatou and Maimuna. All the best!

title: Generous, patient and trustworthy
text: Black and White provided us with several trips.  Each time, they collected us on time and were courteous and kind with all of us, including our 3 children, and we had a wonderful holiday.  Highlights were the sunset boat trip and meal at Lamin Lodge (both enchanting) and the trip to Senegal to see the safari animals.  When I mentioned that I was interested in what happened in the Gambia on Independence Day, they even took us to the stadium in Banjul for nothing!  They are a lovely bunch and you will always feel safe and relaxed.  Use them.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Good tour however lacked some organisation
text: We booked a 2 day tour with armstrong to Fathala with overnight at coconut island. We were picked up on time by our friendly guide and all went well until we reached coconut island. A donkey should gave been prepared to help carry the bags to the lodge but we were advised the guide was unable to get hold of the operator so we had to walk it carrying our bags. We were td this was only a 20minute walk but took more like 40min. At the island in the morning when we came to checkout they also said breakfast was not included despite having been assured by armstrong this was. After asking the guide to intervene he confirmed it was. The open 4x4 vehicles are great for the safari portion but not comfortable for driving long distances. Having paid 440 euros for this private tour we would have just ecpected a bit of better organisation. Despite this we still had a great 2 days. Recommend visiting coconut island.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Brilliant!
text:
We took two tours with Black and White during a week-long stay in The Gambia; Fathala in Senegal and Kunte Kinte village and James Island up the River Gambia.
Yaya guided us to Fathala and provided an attentive and informative service through what was probably the highlight of the entire week. Lamin guided us up the river, and his passionate narrative and explanation of the heinous actions of our forebears was deeply moving. 

I would thoroughly recommend B&W for their professionalism and their commitment to ensuring you maximise the potential of your visit to this wonderful country.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The only best part of my holiday
text: My son had been in touch with Armstrong months before we flew out organising a trip to senagal for the safari I've got to admit it wasn't without Panic when it came to meet them in person I wasn't sure who we where meeting whether or not these people where even genuine but I thought with 5 of us we had a chance if something was to go wrong.  It just goes to show that you shouldn't judge a book by it's cover these people picked us up the morning after we arrived drove us to the office we where sat down and some of the trips where explained to us we didn't take the money with us but Armstrong was happy to meet us at our hotel the following day to collect the money. We were not harassed or felt pressured into buying one of the trips the day if our trip arrived we where treat great there was 7 of us in our trip I recruited two people I met in the plane the night before we had a great time only Thing we hated was the queuing at the border 1 1/2 he's with little kids trying to get into your bags and pockets woman wouldn't leave you alone wanting you to buy things but this was out of our guides hands all in all great thank you
