placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The best choice if you want to explore the real Gambia with local people!
text:
We booked two tours with Black and White: the 4x4 and romantic sunset cruise. It was all arranged very correctly: with a receipt, flexible, on time,...
Our guide Yaya was great. The groups are always small: alone or with another couple.
Both tours were absolutely worth doing and i would definitly recommend. The sunset cruise takes you up to the mangrooves for a lovely and peaceful view, and afterwards a local dinner in a lovely wooden built bungalow with view on the sunset on the mangrooves.
The 4x4 is a busy day that shows you the real Gambia: Serrekunda, crocodile pool, paradise beach, local school, compound (bring some toys/sweets for the kids), fishing village. It is a confronting, but great experience. You need to do this (and preferably with B&W) if you want to see the real Gambia.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Armstrong
text: De laatste jaren veel contact gehad met Armstrong en zijn medewerkers. Topgozer met het hart op de juiste plaats. Goed en betrouwbaar bedrijf.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Simply the best I have ever experienced by a mile
text:
I have to be completely honest and genuine with the review I am to make about Armstrong and his team. First of all it isn't a team it is a big family which you don't just see but I honestly felt the family vibe which truly made me feel part of the family. Myself and my girlfriend first went on the Senegal safari with the lion walk, what an experience it was out of this world all made better by black and white, our guide Lamin( appologie if I spelt that wrong) went above and beyond for us and all who was on the tour, he really is a credit to the company. The second tour was the four wheel drive and what an experience showing us the croc pool, local school, paradise beach, fishing market, normal massive market and how the local Gambians live. These tours simply made our holiday perfect!! 
Myself and my girlfriend was on the way  to the Monkey park by ourselves and simply popped in to the blank and white office as we was passing to say Hi and Lamin gave us a guide to take and look after us for the next 3 hours at no cost! This company truly do put the customers happiness and well being first and let's be honest wouldn't get this service back in England!
I can not recommend enuf to anyone who is visiting Gambia to use Blank and White belive me you will become part of Armstrong's Family and what an honour it was to be amongst them all..

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Best tour company in Gambia
text:
I organised two of my tours whilst in England. I emailed Armstrong who was always prompt replying to my message and any information which I required. 
I wasn’t sure about paying the deposit upfront however it’s a safe as it gets as deposit is paid through PayPal and you immediately get a confirmation email. 

When me and my family checked into our hotel in Gambia on 21/12/18 Armstrong visited us at our hotel the next day 22/12/18 to introduce himself and explain in more details about the tours which I booked. We also booked a few more with him on the same day. 
Our first tour was the safari and lion walking experience which Armstrong team member Lamine was our tour guide. He is so kind and helpful and will also go 100% to make sure that we are having the best time. Drinks was provided often through the trip and lunch was good. You must do this experience we managed to see all the animals we defo had good luck on this day and the weather was beautiful but make sure you bring a cap to protect you from the sun. Also if you go to the safari you will be crossing the Senegal border which means you need yellow fever. However me and my family didn’t have this so we paid money to get trough which you can do so don’t worry if you don’t have the yellow fever certificate and it’s only like £10 GPB.

Lamine was also out tour guide for the Banjul highlight which we got for free as if you buy x2 yours from black and white they give you this free tour complimentry which was a good eye opening experience. 

Overall this company is very professional and would recommend them to anyone who is looking to visit Gambia and wishes to go on tours. They are great with kids and make the effort. 

No matter what trip you go on or whether your walking around Gambia or eating out the locals rely on tips. So make sure you also have extra cash to tip Resturant’s, tour guides ect... also try and not bargain to much with the locals as no matter what your buying it’s still less money compared to GBP or whatever country you are from.
I made sure I bought stationary to give the kids like pencils, books, ect... also the kids love football so be prepared you will get asked a lot to buy football or sweets. So maybe bring some over with you and just blow up the balls when you get to Gambia. 

Black and white safari are the best and I thank them for making our experience special.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great tour company
text:
We have just returned from The Gambia and booked three tours with Black and White, Fathala with lion walk, Sunset Cruise and the Four by Four. 
Prior to the holiday I emailed Armstrong who provided details of the trips and prices and was always very quick to respond. 
On our first day we were met outside our hotel and taken to the office to pay for the trips, where Armstrong was very friendly and informative.
The Fathala trip was a great day out, the ferry was a fun experience and the lion walk was just amazing! Unfortunately we did not see the giraffe but it just shows how big the reserve is as we drove around for two hours and still did not spot them! 
We enjoyed the dug out canoe at Lamin lodge as part of the sunset cruise trip, but the highlight of the holiday was the Four by Four tour,stopping at the crocodile park, Serrakunda market, woodcarving factory, local school, paradise beach, a local family compound and tanji fishing village. The local school visit was the highlight, hearing the children sing. 
All three guides were very friendly and informative and we would not hesitate to recommend Black and White Safari. The tours are far more personal that if you booked with the big holiday company.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Outstanding
text: We found black and white safaris online on contact we booked the safari and lion walk wow what a experience we was totally looked after from start to finish by lamin the ferry crossing is a experience in its self we was up close to most animals we saw and the knowledge of the guide was amazing we then booked the 4x4 tour what a fantastic tour this was esp visiting the school and village makes you appreciate our own surroundings yaya was our guide with Armstrong tagging along (funny guy) thanks for the memories 😀😀

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Everyone should do when visiting The Gambia
text:
I never write reviews...never...however today was just superb! Our day starting with a timely pick up from our hotel and a drive to Sally’s house. From there we were given optional traditional dress and taken to Sally’s local market where we bought food of our choice for our cooking class. We chose 2 dishes, both fish and 2 types of juice. When we got to Sally’s we went about preparing and making lunch from gutting the fish to pounding the vegetables. We cooked outside, in traditional style and when we were done preparing (which took a while)we played with Sally’s children and their neighbours. At the end of the day we all sat and ate together what we had made and felt a part of Sally’s family.

The most wonderful experience we have had since being here! Black and white safaris has been great and we have avoided any problems.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala Safari with Lion Walk & 4X4 Wheel Tour
text:
I booked my two trips with Armstrong from the U.K. before we arrived. I emailed him and we corresponded that way. He arranged for us to meet a representative from B&W safaris when we arrived, who took us to the shop to settle our outstanding balance, as we paid a deposit through PayPal to confirm our trips. 

Our first trip was to the Fathala Safari Park in neighbouring Senegal with the lion walk afterwards. Our guide for the day was Lamin and he was excellent. He was so helpful and knowledgeable, caring and professional. He stayed with is throughout. The ferry crossing was very busy but Lamin was very organised and ensured that we were all comfortable and that we stuck together at all times. The immigration queue at the border was long and took almost an hour to get through but was fine, they take your fingerprints, photo and want to see your yellow fever certificate. The safari and lion was amazing. It was so great to get so up close and personal with the animals. It's not a massive safari by any means, but it's a great experience if you have never experienced being on an open top jeep in the wilderness in search of spotting animals. Lunch is provided at a stop at a very clean and well represented B&B on the way back to the ferry. Soft drinks are provided throughout the day free of charge but you need to purchase your own drinks at lunch 

Our second trip was the 4X4 Wheel tour which takes you on 7 different visits in one day to see how The Gambia people live. Our guide was Yaya and he was excellent. Our driver Fams ( I think that was his name) was also great with a good sense of humour. Yaya was Very knowledgeable and ensured that we were happy and well taken care of.  We visited the crocodile park, Serrkunda market (which is the biggest and busiest market i have ever seen), a school, a wood carving market, Paradise Beach (where lunch is provided), a Gambian family compound and the Tanji fish market. The whole experience was Amazing and incredible value for money. It was so touching to see all the children singing at the school and showing us how they can spell. We brought books, pencils, Stationary and lollipops to donate to the school. We also brought lollipops and football's to hand out at the local village compound to the children. This trip provided an excellent insight into the Gambian way of life and it was so Amazing to mingle with local people away from the normal tourist destinations. 

I am so glad that I booked my trips with Black and white safaris -a local company - instead of with a holiday tour operator. You get a real sense of Gambia and its authentic and genuine. This company run a very professional and well organised service. The staff we met were all hard-working, attentive and very professional people. Trips booked through this company help to financially support schools and help local businesses. We thoroughly enjoyed our trips and have made some magical memories that will last a lifetime. I would recommended this company unreservedly. 5 stars  ☆☆☆☆☆

title: South Gambia Experience
text:
Ze bieden een gevarieerd dagprogramma met niet te grote groepen.
De gidsen zijn goed geinformeerd en heel erg behulpzaam.

title: Can't recommend enough! Excellent
text:
We booked 2 tours with Arch tours last week:

Senegal safari @ Fathala reserve - 3 of us went along with 3 Arch Tours guides, a driver in Sengal and a safari guide. We couldn't have been better looked after. Free drinks provided all day, breakfast off the back of the truck and lunch in the reserve. Our guides were so lovely and helpful. They all knew a lot about the area and never tired of answering our questions!

 4 trips in 1 - 5 of us went along and were joined by another jeep of 4 tourists. The trips were great and again the guides couldn't have been better. They answered lots of questions, kept us safe and showed us a real flavour of The Gambia. My only comment is that the stop is Serekunda market is very brief - probabaly ok as part of the trip but we walked down there a few days before and spent quite alot of time wondering around, there's lots to see and do but due to the tours busy schedule you only got to see small portion on the trip.
Be prepared at the fish market for .... you guessed it, a fishy smell. It was a touch smelly (especially as we're not used to it) but not that bad and at a fish market, you should expect some smells :) One lady in our group couldn't handle it but its really not that bad, just mentally prepare yourself for some whiffs. Deffo the most interesting part of the day!

Take sweets on any tours you do as there's always kids around that are grateful to be given lollies and treats.

Would 100% book with Arch Tours on future trips.

title: Brilliant tour company
text: Having looked at trip advisor arch tours came out on top and now I see why! Various tours at great prices are offered. I went on two tours, for booking two a small discount is offered. The kunta kinteh trip is a long 3 to 4 hour boat trip which can be arduous. An adequate lunch is provided. Once the destinations are reached they are extremely informative and educational regarding the slave trade and kunta kinteh family. Well worth the boat trip. I also went on the 4 in 1 tour which is a very busy day and full of colour and life of The Gambia which is absolutely fabulous and this tour is not to be missed! Muhammed, Isatou, Marie and Dawda where all totally brilliant and a huge thank you to all for making the tours the best things I've done In a long time!

title: gambia
text: Great trip would recommend this worth every penny one of the best places we been to need to see the crocodile

title: good day out
text:
an early start took us to Banjul to meet our boat.
After two hours or so up the river Gambia we disembarked at a village. We walked round the museum, and village giving the children pencils and exercise books. We walked further to the Kunta Kinteh village and met a decendant of Kunta Kinteh the 17 year old taken as a slave to America, the story of whom was immortalised in the book Roots by Alex Haley.It was a long walk and for someone who has walking difficulties took a long time. ( perhaps a wheelchair could be made available )
On returning to the boat we had an excellent freshly made buffet, a big selection of food and plenty of it, Definitely a 5 STAR rating.
We then visited James Island before returning to Banjul.

title: 4 in 1 Tour
text: Did the 4 in 1 tour at the beginning of January with Arch Tours. I had previously been on two trips with Thomas Cook but they didn't offer the 4 in 1 trip so I Booked with Arch after reading positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I have to say that I was not disappointed. Mohammed our guide was warm, knowledgeable and very attentive. Drinks were supplied throughout and we spent a good amount of time at each place that we visited. I compared prices with the tours that we did with Thomas Cook with their prices and they were roughly the same. However when you take into consideration that Arch tours have a lot less people on the tours and they supply drinks throughout, they obviously offer a lot more value for money. It is worth noting that you can pay Thomas Cook with a card, where as anywhere else takes cash only, should this be a consideration. Given the choice though I would definitely go with Arch.

title: Amazing day out with walk with the lions !
text: We booked the full day out trip to Senegal and Fathala nature reserve complete with walking with the lions. What an awesome experience. Pick up at 6am and then off to Banjul for the ferry to Barra and onto Senegal. Get your passports stamped. Breakfast in the bush first - good simple food and tea/coffee. The walking with lions was unmissable, truly great to film/take pics. Saw rhino, giraffes, zebra, antelopes, hogs from the back of an open top jeep and of course the lions. Met some lovely like minded people from the UK and we all enjoyed he full day out together. Lovely lunch before a trip back via village to meet overly excited children and hand out gifts. Cold drinks available all day and nothing too much trouble for the very friendly yet professional Rhino and Ibrahim - well done lads !! An excellent day put and a must do when you're in that part of Gambia/Senegal !! 10/10 Arch Tours. We'll use them again for other tours/trips.

title: 4 in 1 tour - Amazing!
text:
We had the most amazing day seeing the 'real' Gambia!
You're collected from your hotel in an open top jeep at around 8am, cold drinks and lunch are provided. 
First we visited Serekunda Market which was fantastic. We walked around the mea and vegetable sections where you can see how local meat and fish is prepared (flies and all) We didn't see another tourist the whole time we were there!
We went from there to Kachikally Croc Pool. The crocs roam freely around a sacred pool. You're given the chance to touch the crocs (if you're feeling brave) This wasn't the best bit of the trip and obviously all arranged for tourists but it was over pretty quickly and was fine.
Then we went to Lamin Lodge for tea and donuts. The lodge is built on stilts in the mangroves and it a lovely place to stop for a break overlooking the water. Watch out for greedy monkeys! 
I'm not completely sure of the order but I think we then went to see a traditional village and met a family. It did feel slightly intrusive going into the families home however it was eye opening to see how people live. We also met the local children and gave them sweets, which they were very happy with!
Lunch was a buffet of rice, chicken, fish, salad and chips at Paradise beach which is beautiful.  We then had about 1.5 hours to relax on the beach or take a stroll.
Last stop was Tanjil Fishing village. It's an amazing experience to see how the fish is dried and to see the boats bringing in fresh catches. again, we were the only tourists there.
A perfect way to see a lot in one day and not feel too touristy!
Would definitely recommend Arch tours!

title: 4 in 1 Tour
text: Fantastic day out to experience the real Gambia. Professional, efficient, informative and well worth the money! Tom, Bob, Mohammed, Isotoh (apologies if I spelt your name wrong) thank you for providing us a day we will never forget. No doubt the best day we had in Gambia!

title: Tourist please read
text:
There are many tour guides operating around gambia, they will hover outside your hotel telling you all kind of things. However there is Arch Tours in Senea Gambia. We used these guys due to recommendations. Totally professional and they go above and beyond for your welfare and care. We cannot fault them with kindness and dedication to your well being. 5 stars without question
They took us to north Senegal and were very organised and let me tell you after these guys know what they are doing. Yes you may save £5 going somewhere else but in long term it will cost you more using other operators. Getting through senegal border and crossing on the ferry is a task in itself. Arch made the process so easy and without them it would have gone pear shaped using 3rd party cheap guides.
Thank you for your brilliant tour and professional guides. I hope all tourists use you. Regards Dave - York ( UK )

title: Amazing lion walk .. !!
text:
My wife and I visited Gambia over the New Year and booked the safari trip in Senegal with Arch Tours. The booking in the office with Abdul was very easy and straightforward. We were picked up at our hotel ( Djembe ) at 6am !! by another Abdul, in a jeep , and were then taken to Banjul to cross the river. We met up with another 10 tourists and once over the other side split in two groups of 6 so plenty of room. Before we got to the Fathala reserve we all stopped for a lovely breakfast in the bush. Once in the reserve we all stood on our seats ( open top long jeep with side bars ) to get the best view possible. We saw zebra , hogs , rhino , giraffes , antelope and stopped off many times for photos. Our guide Abdul was very professional and good fun.
We paid extra for the lion walk and so glad we did this. You get quite a long time with the lions and plenty of photos taken by the Guide with your device. And you do actually get to walk with 2 lions , right behind them. There aren't many places in the world that you can do this safely. 
After the game reserve we visited a local village to hand out sweets and stickers we bought earlier. The children went mad for these and I wish I had more to give.
Be prepared for a long full day , we got back to our hotel at nearly 7pm , but it was well worth it.  Thanks Arch Tours.

title: 4 in 1 trip
text: Wonderful day out, markets, crocodile pool, Lamin lodge, monkeys, a typical village, a school, cattle markets and a fishing village, lunch at paradise beach,  Great company 1 jeep and 3 staff with drinks all day just for me and my husband Wonderful day

title: Great trip
text: My husband, daughter and I went on the Roots trip, great day out, would recommend it, great to see the African culture and slave island.  Muhammond and Bob were great and any questions answered. Very informative.  Lunch on the boat was lovely and drinks cheap and we had the added bonus of seeing dolphins swim around us.  Arch tours are very competitive and worth booking through, just wished I booked more trips, maybe next time

title: Very interesting - Worthwhile
text: We visited the Gambia over Christmas, and found it to be one of the most interesting countries we have been to, while there we went on 2 trips with Arch Tours, the 4 in one tour and the north Senegal safari tour. The 4 in one tour compressed a lot into the day, but gave us a good idea of life in Gambia, from the markets to the schools and homes, the Safari tour allowed us to get up close with the animals and mingle with locals as they went about their everyday business on the ferry. Ali our main tour guide and Fatou his assistant were excellent company, full of local knowledge and insights. I highly recommend Arch Tours. Paschal D'Arcy

title: Fantastic
text:
We booked 2 trips with this tour operator and both were amazing. We went to Senegal to the Fathala Reserve in Senegal. The group was small and the guides were very knowledgeable about the local culture and the border procedures.

The staff made the trip very enjoyable and I would like to personally thank Djemba Baleh, Rhino and our driver G Boy! 

We also went to the Kunta Kinte Island where we were educated about the slave trade and met local villagers. We were provided with a light breakfast and a fantastic buffet lunch on the boat and we were lucky enough to see Dolphins too!!

A special thanks to Bob for making our day !!

title: Booked 3 trips with this company.
text:
We paid £320 pounds for 3 full day trips. Roots, 4 in 1 tour and Senegal game reserve.we were  given drinks all day , beer, coke, water, Fanta, all ice cold. Bob was our guide for the roots tour. He spoke excellent English and he was very relaxed and enjoyable to be with. The tour guides were extremely keen to ensure our safety. The only suggestion I would have is on the Senegal trip were we catch the ferry early morning in the dark. With the confusion of everyone boarding we nearly lost our guide, as it was so dark, and there was urgency to board the ferry. Suggest you get a paddle or flag with tour name and torch to guide everyone as we nearly lost you.! And that was a bit scary. 
We loved experiencing the culture, and opted to travel out every other day with arch tours as well as touring under our own steam. The highlights were the boat trip on roots were we got welcomed with food and drink. Malcolm from bushwhackers was most charming. We visited a village with lots of children. I suggest you buy sweets, pens, paper to take to the children. They welcome visitors regularly on this trip and form a chain of welcome points with children dressed in wedding dressings, and singing to you. This was the location where the story of roots began and the relatives still reside there. I made the mistake of giving all of my lollipops to the first children who sang. Turned around the corner and found about another 20 groups singing , so ended up giving money.doh! Another tour was the crocodile reserve, which was amazing. We stroked a crocodile under careful supervision. The trip to the markets with Fatou and Mohammed, followed by an eco lodge, monkeys Take food from your hands, we saw a local village and how they lived. Very humbling. We learned now to take sweets. They want plastic bottles, as plastic bags and bottles are no longer available. After a meal on the beach, which was scrumptious, we went to see the fish smoking factories and the hub of action in the fishing village with ladies processing fish on the beach, and the constant chatter. The people are genuinely lovely, and whilst you can get a little hassled, they are trying to make a living, so I did give 50 D out to those who came across a trying to earn a living, if I did not want their produce as there is a limit to how many oranges you can eat!

We found the monkey park ourselves in Kotu, excellent fun, and we went to mankeeta with a taxi driver. This place was amazing especially the crabs in the mangroves. 

When we arrived we used the green taxis, and realise these are safe, but. Apparently the yellow and green are much cheaper but not as regulated. The green taxis eat  your money and they seem difficult to negotiate with. A particular taxi driver did agree to take us to a drum factory, but we felt very pressurised to buy, and they made a mess of the drum appearance and rushed the job and we felt the taxi driver was not fair with us, and he also pressurised us. He insisted we pay him 500 d more which is about 10 pounds. We felt awkward, and he was very dismissive of us. This put me off the taxis after this. I felt hassled and rushed. I didn't buy the drum after all. It was not worth the stress. 

Another place to go is the vulture feeding. It is near Kongo beach down the road. 10.30.am. Amazing experience. Lovely helpful people.

title: 4 in 1 tour
text: An excellent tour if you want to see the rural side of gambia with the domestic, market.the fish market.country side villages.My wife and me have done this tour twice and this year was better than last .Most enjoyable with the whole excellent staff.

title: 10 stars
text:
What a experience I did three trips with them was only going to do one ,meet great people and have some good fun and games .
Would like to say a big thank you to all the staff and all the great people which was on the trips with me. If I could give 10 stars I would 
All yours lamin law

title: The reviews are true
text: We went on the Senegal Safari and the trip was awesome. The staff are great and made the excursion even better. Unfortunately we didnt see the giraffes or many antelope but we went in hope rather than expectation. We really enjoyed the trip and Mymuna, Sheriffo, Bob and the team were great. Very knowledgeble, friendly and helpful. Tour operators the world over could learn a lot from Arch Tours the reviews and awards are all worthy. The trip is all about the people. We could have seen all of the animals and not enjoyed it. But the staff truly made for a great excursion, Just wish we did more with Arch Tours. We did go on the walking with Lions trip and it was a truly memorable experience. Thankyou all again

title: Arch Tours ... Amazing
text: We did the Senegal Safari & Roots trips with Arch Tours and the experience was amazing. From the minute we walked into Abdul's office to the end of the excursions we were made to feel welcome and looked after. Mohammed, Maimuna & Demba are excellent guides (Mohammed will keep you laughing all day with his tall stories). On both trips which are all day experiences the guides keep you well informed and there is no need to take any food or drink as it is provided all day in plenty. It was my birthday on the Senegal trip and Arch tours made it extra special by singing Happy Birthday during lunch, with all the guests and safari staff in both English & Gambian x Thank you Arch Tours

title: Safari and sunset cruise walking with lions
text: Had Demba and Fatou on both occasions absolutely awesome lovely people plenty of drinks on both well looked after thought-out lions cost us £30 per head but amazing really well done and professional they are real and not drugged unlike some in Asia appently can't recommend them highly enough they even sang us a farewell song in the cruise as it was our last day

title: trips
text: did 4in one day andthe north senegal safari trip. the 4 in one trip was really good and showed wat gambian life is all about our tour guides fatou and rhino (ali) were brilliat and gr8 fun . the senegal safari was also excellent made even more special by our brilliantly friendly and funny  tour guides which consisted of mohamed.l and maimona and rhino too. my new best friend mohamed an maimona were absolutely brill keeping us entertained from start to finish and even bursting into song when i asked them jokingly to sing to us .so if your reading this mohamed an maimona and rhino THANK YOU for all the gr8 trips. YOU ARE VERY SPECIAL PEOPLE,AND I HOPE TO GET THE CHANCE TO SEE YOU ANOTHER TIME .

title: Trips
text: Another great trip with Arch Tours, this time fishing and Roots. Highly recommend and have used for the past 4 years. See you again in January 2017

title: Senegal Trip
text:
well organised trip
went to Senegal and to the Fathala Wildlfe reserve
Bob/ Bob/ Sheraff - our tour guides were great
Breakfast by the roadside - with tea served in a cup and saucer
Lunch was Pizza - and as I don't eat Pizza they made me a special one - pizza base with chicken onion and mushroom
Banjul Ferry - what an experience ! 
safari drive - there aren't many animals left but saw the one Rhino still there, giraffe, zebra, warthogs, crocodile
it is an experience and you have to be strong to hold on!
you see the real Gambia and Senegal 
Walking with lions is a must - what a once in a lifetime experience -

title: Fantastic Company
text: We had a brilliant holiday thanks to this company, we experienced the real Gambia, walked with lions, stroked a crocodile and more.  They could not have looked after us better, food and drink was lovely and plentiful and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable - nothing was too much trouble. We travelled in small groups from 4 - 12 people with two guides and a driver .  I would highly recommend using Abdul and his staff to anyone travelling to Gambia.

title: Excellent as always
text:
I have been to Gambia 4 times now and the standard of Arch tours are consistently excellent.
The customer service is second to none, Abdul could teach many people how to treat customers.
Free drink in the office when booking, full explanation of each trip, advice on what to take with you and very enjoyable excursions - we did the 4in 1 trip and the roots trip, both excellent. We were well looked after by our guides and given lots of useful information.
Good value for money, safe driving and regular free drinks. Small groups which makes the trip more personal and informative, much better than coach loads of people.
This company deserves its excellent reputation!

title: Kunta Kinte Island
text:
Voor de 2e keer een bezoek aan het eiland maar nu met de boot. Op tijd opgehaald door Arch Tours, het blijft Gambia, en toen richting Banjul om daar op de boot te gaan. Een tocht van ruim 2 uur over het water wat in het begin leuk is maar op een gegeven moment gaat vervelen.
Wel netjes water gekregen voor op het eiland, een lunch op de boot en afsluiten met een kop (slappe) koffie. 
Het bezoek zelf aan het dorp is nu pure verkoop geworden ... continue kinderen die muziek spelen en oudere mensen die zakken snoep verkopen om uit te delen😬.

Maar Arch Tours komt zijn afspraken na en dat is ook wat waard in The Gambia.

title: Great day out!
text: I did the fathala wildlife park tour with Arch tours. Included in the tour was breakfast, lunch and drinks all day. We managed to see Zebra, Rhino, Warthog, Antelope, Giraffes and to finish the tour we had a walk with two lions. Sheriff & Demba were our guides. They provided us with lots of interesting information specific to the tour as well as lots about Gambia & Senegal's history & culture. From start to finish the tour was extremely professionally run. I felt in safe hands at all points and had a great experience. I couldn't recommend more highly!

title: Brilliant trips at a good price!
text:
The best point about going with Arch Tours, is that there are a number of people and this brings down the price.  We spoke to a number of locals and our tour operator at the hotel, who offered prices but these would often only be 4-6 people instead of 12 and so the prices offered were the best around, although we did feel as though this did not particularly help other local businesses, as essentially you are all on the same trip! 

That being said we did two trips this last week with Arch Tours and both were excellent.  We did the Fathala Senegal Trip and paid £95 each, this included everything, breakfast, lunch and snacks and as many cold drinks as they could get to us!  I really have to give it to the bus and tour guides for this, they really look after you! 
Fathala was amazing, and we saw Rhino, Zebra, Warthog, Antelope, Monkeys, and after a long long while, we finally saw a family of giraffe! This really did feel like a safari and some off roading was required! We also did the lion walk, it was scary to be so close to them, but they seem fairly docile and familiar with the trainers - just don't run around.

The second tour we did, was the tour up the river gambia to Georgetown. This is a really long long trip, and you will spend many hours cooped up in the bus on the way there.  Nontheless it was the highlight of my trip to the Gambia, and just seeing the way of life of the local people in their country was amazing.  The lodge in JanJanbureh was fantastic, basic, and we woke up to play with monkeys at breakfast!  The stone circles were interesting, but honestly not worth the trip in itself.  The slavehouse and Georgetown were also interesting, although I was a little overwhelmed with the poverty there and the children who were begging for our empty bottles and pens.  

We visited a local family, and it is a good idea to take things.  We took sweets, and balloons, but another man bought a bag of rice and I think this was probably more useful, but anything helps.

The second of the trip was a long day - with almost no rest stops and no lunch provided - but you did get dinner.  The drinks were also not as free flowing as on the Senegal trip, but I would still encourage people to make this trip if they have the time!

title: 4 tours in 1
text: There were 4 of us is one jeep, 8 people in total on this tour. Our guide Bob was very knowledgeable about all aspects of life in Gambia. Both Tom, our driver and Bob our guide were helpfull and cheerfull. It was an extremely pleasant day. Good luck to Bob in his future. Would really recommend this company.

title: Excursions géniales !
text:
Nous avons fait l'excursion en bâteau ( sur la "Gambia River" jusque l'île des petits villages   Juffeirah et Albreda. + l'île aux esclaves (Pour cette excursion nous avons trouvé que le temps en bateau est un peu long, +/- 2h aller, cependant vous pouvez profiter du soleil sur le bateau ce n'est pas si dérangent). Repas à midi sur le bateau.

Nous avons fait aussi l'excursion en Jeep d'une journée (cette excursion est vraiment géniale, on voit plein de choses, visite du marché de Serekunda, visite de la piscine au crocodiles, visite d'une famille, repos sur la "Paradise Beach" et visite de Tanger (marché au  poisson) Vous êtes dans une jeep ouverte (4-6 personnes) ce qui est vraiment très agréable, avec 2 guides et un chauffeur, des boissons vous sont offertes toute la journées et un repas est prévu le midi sur la plage. 
Nos guides étaient Alagie et Sheriff et notre chauffeur était Bouba. Ils étaient super sympas et ils expliquent très bien. 

Dans chaque excursions, on vient vous chercher à l'hôtel et on vous ramène.

Agence très sérieuse, le représentant se déplace dans votre hôtel pour vous présenter ses excursions.

Agence à recommander et Alagie, Sheriff et Bouba sont a recommander comme guides.

title: Best tour operators in Gambia
text:
We have just returned from our holiday, we had 4 trips booked with abdul and his amazing team. The 4 in 1, roots,sunset cruise and safari in Senegal. Well what can I say apart from they were amazing days out the organisation and hospitality when you get to the office through to the trips was outstanding. His staff are a credit to him, everyone one of the staff are friendly and helpful the food and drinks on the trips flow freely. Words can not describe the time we had. 
A big thank you to you all xx

title: Phenomenal Trips
text:
After speaking to Abdul (the owner) my partner and I decided to do 2 tours with Arch; 4 in 1 tour and the Senegal safari. I couldn't honestly not find one fault with this company, our guide for both tours was Rhino, he was so knowledgeable about everywhere we was visiting and was happy to field any questions about Gambia. You could tell he was a very proud Gambian and it made the experience so much more. 

The 4 in 1 tour is such a mind blowing day, visiting so many things and seeing so much of Gambia, for only £45 is incredible value. All drink and food for the day is provided, the only Dalasi's you will need to take are if you want to buy some sweets for the children before you visit a neighbourhood, and to tip the guides at the end of the day.

Senegal safari is much of the same, breakfast and lunch catered for, as well as drinks all day. Having a beer while being surrounded by some of the most amazing animals on earth is a bit of a 'pinch yourself' moment.

Big thank you to Abdul, Rhino, Fatou, Sheriff, Demba, Maimuna, Tom and everyone else at Arch for making our holiday.

title: A definite must!!!!
text: Excellent!!!! Went on 2 tours the 4 in 1 and day trip to Senegal the the game reserve, was looked after from start to finish by Abdul and the amazing staff, they really are a credit to the company, knowledgable and friendly. Food and drink was supplied all day, great value for money and would recommend highly if visiting The Gambia �

title: Excellent Tour, Excellent Guides, Excellent Service
text:
this was our first visit to The Gambia, and were planning on doing the 4 tours in 1, we had such a fantastic experience, that we then booked onto the Safari Tour in Senegal, again this was excellent.

Arch Tour helped make our visit to The Gambia one to remember, and we will be returning.

A special thanks to our guides Sheriff, Fatou & Rhino, and our driver Tom. And also a thanks to Abdul, who made booking extremely easy.

I would recommend Arch Tours to any and every one who want a fantastic experience.

title: Experience Gambia with Arch Tours
text:
We used Arch tours on recommendation as it was our first time visiting  and because of these guys we will never forget the Gambia. The first trip was the Roots tour great experience to understand the slave trade, Demba and Alhagi (hopefully spelt right) our guides were brilliant we even saw wild dolphins which was also amazing. 
The second trip was the 4 in 1 tour. If you book any you must book this one to really apreciate The Gambia...it was amazing from start to finish a big thanks to Rhino, Dawda for their extensive knowledge on their country and cultures ...completely kept us engaged and answered my many questions not forgetting Tom for the tricky driving and for keeping the truck going!
We booked with Arch tours originally for 3 excursions but only did 2...cancelled the 3rd as we were only there a week no questions asked immediate refund couldn't ask for any more than that! Plus they were more competitive than the tour operators. So take the short walk and book with Arch tours - Thanks guys for an amazing holiday 😊

title: Great 2nd trip with Arch
text: This is our 2nd visit to the Gambia. Last year we did an excellent trip with Arch tours to Senegal and this year we did the 4 in 1 and also the sunset cruise. Overall I would highly recommend Arch tours. Their professionalism, and great enthusiasm really make any trip. A special shout out to Demba who is an excellent and knowledgeable guide.

title: Our experience of Black and White Tours
text:
Firstly I have to say that my partner booked all the tours and I know he found Armstrong very helpful explained what each trip involved. This was my first African trip and I have to say I loved it and the trips we did which were , 4x4 , Roots , Senegal walking with lions, George Town. 

Each trip we had Lamin which allowed us to build up a bond with him and his knowledge of the history of Gambia was second to none. Not only did he talk about the effects of the past but also the hopes and dreams for the future of the country. 

Each trip we were supplied with drinks and meals and they even provided me with a step to get on the jeep which helps when you are 5ft !! 

We visited schools and traditional villages which was a very humbling experience for me as I have never witnessed this before. 

Walking with lions and stroking crocodiles is something I thought I would never do but so amazing. We took boat trips and both times my nerves gave out getting on but Lamin was brillant reassuring me and not laughing when I’m sure he really wanted too. It was amazing to see a Hippo and to see the chimps along the river Gambia and brought tears to my eyes. 

Thank you for making my trip so wonderful with memories that will last a lifetime. 

It was clear to see that customer service and satisfaction is very high in your company. The passion you show really comes across and you made it so easy to ask questions and want to explore further, thankyou to Armstrong , Lamin and the team for everything.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari til Senegal
text:
Super dejlig dag. Der var styr på tingene og vi havde to søde guider med. Der var meget ventetid ved færge, men det var en oplevelse og meget autentisk. 
Vælg lionwalk fra, det er synd for dyrene og giv i stedet guiderne og chaufføren lidt gode drikkepenge. 
5 stjerner

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala safari & Lion walk
text:
I found Black and White after researching. I really wanted to do this trip, not wanting to miss out, I noticed Black and White website enables to book in advance online so I booked and paid in full in advance for this trip and airport transfers to save time.  A receipt was emailed.
Armstrong who runs it emailed me and even contacted by other means to assist, well in advance to reconfirm all was booked in his diary.
On arriving at airport after a late flight, my driver was waiting. He gave me a good welcome. He took me to hotel. I asked if he would take me to Black and White office to meet Armstrong, he obliged. Armstrong was friendly and asked if there was anything else I wanted, he answered all questions.
Following day Armstrong advised me another customer had to cancel their Fathala trip which was same day as mine. I sensed disappointment but Armstrong offered a private trip. I accepted, it cost slightly extra but good value and worth it.
I got to see more and was given VIP service, experiencing real Gambia, meeting friendly locals. The guide was informative and helpful, especially at ferry crossings Banjul/Barra and at Gambia/Senegal border which made border formalities quicker. Much better than being in a group. Everything arranged with Fathala, no waiting, straight on a good safari then an amazing lion walk.
I wanted to revisit crocodile pool in way back to airport after checking out of hotel. Armstrong arranged it... a perfect tailor made airport transfer
I highly recommend Black and White Tours. All reasonable prices. I am so happy with my experience with them. Would definitely use them again.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic
text: We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and so decided to book some trips with Black and White. Armstrong (the owner), met us in our hotel, Ocean Bay, the morning after our arrival and described all the tours. We decided on the Senegal Safari, Matasutu and the Four Wheel Drive, was a result we were given a complimentary half day tour of Banjul learning about The Gambia’s history. We went on three of the tours with Alex who can only be described as the most pleasant, likeable and knowledgeable guide we have encountered to date. The Four Wheel Drive tour was taken by Ya Ya, who is also an excellent guide. Our favourite trip was the Eco Park at Matasutu where you were taken on a boat and then for a walk through the park looking at various birds, monkeys and baboons. The safari was good but can be a very long day as the ferry does not appear to have a timetable and so you can be stuck at the port for a substantial amount of time both ways, also, we did have a problem with the lion walk and after entering the area felt they were more like circus animals just for photo opportunities with the public, so we declined the photo and the walk and left the enclosure. The Four Wheel Drive tour gives you a real insight into life in The Gambia visiting a nursery school, family compound, crocodile pool, market and fishing village. Our thanks go to all at Black and White, Armstrong, Ya Ya, numerous drivers and especially Alex. You made our visit very memorable 🙂

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: A very enlightening trip
text:
We went on the 4x4 Gambia experience visiting the crocodile park, a local community school, the markets and a local compound. Our guide, Alex was amazing. He and his counterparts sherif and lamin the driver took us to see the real Gambia. It’s a true experience and the school and village compound show what real life in Gambia is like. It’s an eye opener and hits you hard with the reality and poverty that is often portrayed on charity adverts back in the UK. 

Make sure you take or buy plenty of sweets for the kids and keep any empty plastic bottles for the kids who will use them to fill with water to take to school. 

The crocodile pool is just that you can get right up to and touch the live crocodiles. There is also a small museum there where Alex also explained some of the old and current rituals, including the circumcision ceremonies which will make you weep with pain. 

Thank you to Armstrong, the owner of black and white who helped us book online before going.

userLocation.shortName: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield
userLocation.name: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great trips provided with the best staff!!
text:
We took 2 trips with these guys and were very happy withy them both.
The guides were so friendly and were happy to answer any questions we had, as it was my first time in Gambia I had sent Armstrong a few emails in regards to my stay, again very helpful in answering all my questions.

On both trips I felt very safe with my family they take very good care of you and make sure your safety is priority.

Would recommend 100% book your trips with these guys, if you don't already know they give a percentage of their money into the local community to help out local schools.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent
text: My husband and I went on 3 tours, the safari, 4 wheel drive and nature adventure tours. We had booked in advance and paid by PayPal before leaving. Armstrong met us at the hotel to introduce himself and explain what we needed to take for the tours and hotel pick up times. At the safari,  our guide was amazing and would take really good photos for us, walking with the lions is an experience not to be missed and the ferry crossing alone was a completely different experience.  Our favourite excursion was the 4 wheel drive with our wonderful guide Yaya. If you choose this tour,  please try to take something with you to the school for the children,  books, pencils, sweets.  The children were adorable and sang us songs they'd learnt in English.  I would also suggest taking sweets for other parts of this excurdion and others,  but ask the guides when they should be handed out. The nature adventure we also went on with Yaya where we fed nuts to the monkeys and had a lovely boat trip. We discovered while we were there that Gambia were playing Benin in a qualifying football match and contacted Armstrong to see if he could arrange transport and an escort for us which he did do very promptly  and called throughout to check we were ok. Gambia is a very poor country and donations are often requested throughout these tours. They are not compulsory but what may not seem a lot to us makes all the difference.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari and Lion walk
text: This had to be one of the best excursions I have ever done. Booking was a breeze. Lamin was very attentive and knowledgeable. I enjoyed the Safari and lion walk. Lunch was great!!!!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Trip to Senegal for 2
text:
We can highly recommend Armstrong and his company “Black&White safari” Everything was comfortable and well organized. Crossing the border was quick. No delays, no extra payment. He is providing VIP trip for two persons only, so you can enjoy wildlife of Senegal or River of Gambia without any rush.

Очень рекомендуем эту компанию и Армстронга. Он может организовать тур в Сенегал и другие для двоих. Это того стоит, поверьте. Можно все посмотреть без спешки.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: C'est l'agence qu'il faut contacter si vous voulez visiter la Gambie
text: Excursion en 4 * 4 et en petit groupe, dans les environs de 50 à 60€ tout compris (repas, entrées, boissons dans le véhicule,...) un service personnalisé, une gentillesse et une disponibilité. Lancez leur un mail, ils répondent très rapidement et viennent à votre hôtel pour la réalisation de votre souhait. Les excursions débutent et se terminent à votre hôtel. Du 5 étoiles !!!  Pour le guide, je vous recommande Alex !

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Roots
text: We did the Roots daytrip with Lamin as our private guide. We went with the ferry from Banjul to Barra which is an experience at its own to do. Afterwards with an open jeep via sandy roads, beautiful nature and little villages to Juffereh, Albreda and St. James island. We visited the museum about Slavery, El Domingo ruines and the island to learn about Kunta Kinteh and  the slavery. Our guide Lamin (with his roots in Juffureh) knows a lot about the region  and the history so he made it very interesting for us. James island made a great impression to us if you consider what happened at it.  After the island visit we had a very good meal (fresh fish) in a local restaurant and went back to Barra to take the ferry. Overall a very good daytrip and Lamin as an excellent guide!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Geweldig bedrijf om The Gambia te ontdekken.
text:
Als jong stel (21 jaar) besloten we om in Augustus naar Gambia te gaan. Wouden een safari en misschien meer doen, dus ruim van te voren besloten een excursiebedrijf te contacteren. Verschillende bedrijven ge-e-maild en bij BWS kreeg ik diezelfde nacht nog een uitgebreide en duidelijke reactie. Uiteindelijk besloten om het contact via whatsapp voort te zetten omdat dit wat makkelijker was. Contact verliep ook over whatsapp erg soepel met vlotte en duidelijke antwoorden. Voor veel vragen kon ik BWS bellen en ook aan de telefoon was de communicatie erg duidelijk en was de man erg vriendelijk. 
Wij wouden een gepersonaliseerde excursie en dit was zeker mogelijk. Hebben uiteindelijk besloten om van The Gambia naar Dakar (hoofdstad van Senegal) te gaan. Onderweg nog stoppen in Bandia Safari Park, is kleiner dan Fathala maar er leven meer dieren, dus de kans is groter om dieren te spotten. Besloten zelf van te voren een hotel te regelen in Dakar, om de prijs omlaag te krijgen. BWS biedt overigens de kans om te onderhandelen over de uiteindelijke prijs. 

Excursie was geweldig, 's Ochtends vroeg opgehaald in een comfortabele privé bus, waarin we zelfs konden liggen! De veerboot overtocht is een gave ervaring en het landschap van zowel Gambia als Senegal is dynamisch en een bizar gave ervaring. Wegen zijn beter geasfalteerd dan in België, dus een excursie is prima te doen voor mensen die last hebben van wagenziekte. Safari was erg leuk en ook Dakar zelf was een super toffe ervaring. Volgende dag vroeg opgehaald en naar het slaveneiland Ile de Goree gegaan, wat zeker een aanrader is! Geen moment onveilig gevoeld, doordat we telkens met twee gidsen waren die op elk moment bij ons bleven voor onze veiligheid. Door de extreem goede ervaring met BWS hadden we gelijk nog een excursie geboekt, voor wederom een erg goede prijs. Dit was de excursie door zuid Gambia, die ook mega tof is om te doen. 

Kortom, BWS is een bizar goed geregeld bedrijf, waar je veel meer terug krijgt dan waarvoor je uiteindelijk betaald. Denk dat er in TG geen betere touroperator zit. Het bedrijf is een voorbeeld voor veel Europese touroperators.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Brilliant all the way
text: Did 3 tours with them last year and top notch all the way. Arranged an airport pick up and was pleasantly surprised to have a driver and a guide who filled us in on a few Gambia facts on the easy to the hotel. Did the 4x4, fathala and a half day freebie bro Banjul. Armstrong the owner was more than helpful and went out of his way including arranging for us to visit a pharmacy when we needed one and a free ride home after visiting, all I did was call in one day at his office for directions and he sorted us out brilliantly.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fantastic Day
text:
Day trip to Senegal for the Safari and walk with lions. Tour guide was Lamin who was brilliant throughout. Don't think that the safari is the only thing you're going for, the journey there through the country and across The Gambia is really interesting, especially the Ferry and the crossing into Senegal.

The safari itself was brilliant, got to travel throughout the reserve and fortunately for us managed to see all of the animals, including giraffes, zebras, the rhino, monkeys, boars, various species of Gazelle and alligators. The lion walk was great, you could tell the trainer really cared for the animals and there seemed to be a mutual respect between them

5 star, will definitely go again with Black and White

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Deb & steve pointon
text: I we did 3 trips while in gambia one was Senegal walking with lions and seeing all the animals amazing 2nd one was roots and Lamin our guide told u so much very educational and we then did lazy day fishing fantastic we av known Armstrong about 15 years and would highly recommend this company very trust worthy and really look after you and show u the real gambia amazing experience keep up the good work Armstrong and ure team ure doing a fantastic job Deb and Steve

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Can't thank you enough!
text: We booked 5 tours with black and white prior to our holiday as we didn't want to take any additional money, this was made simple with Armstrong giving us all the information and keeping in contact with us each week leading up to our holiday. We had limited expectations when we arrived as this was our first time to The Gambia and as you can imagine were a little anxious. There was no need to be, Armstrong meet us at the hotel the day after we arrived and talked through all the tours giving us dates and times to meet. Each tour we were picked up punctually and with a warm welcome. ALL the tours were excellent with fantastic tour guides, our experiences during each tour differed and will be a lasting memory. While you are there you get approached by many different tour operators as well as the travel company you book with, however after talking to various people it became apparent that we had def made the right decision as our tours really gave us the true experience of The Gambia. The safari and lion walk was amazing, we had a fabulous day with our guide lamin who knew so much about the area we were in and the animals we saw, the journey itself going through the border was an experience and my partner even got to have a go at welding true gambia style. walking with the lions      will hold a lasting memory and is one off our bucket list. At each tour we were looked after exceptionally, with excellent company and excellent food, we were catered for all day with water and soft drinks. All our tours were like this and we both differ which one is our favourite but I would strongly reccomend the safari, 4x4 and Lazy day fishing. Not only has this been a holiday to remember but has also made us want to go back and next time do George Town and others. We have meet the most wonderful local people as well as made some new friends (Deb and Steve) together you made our holiday and can't wait to see you again in 2020. Throughout the whole holiday there was laughter as well as tears, please remeber this is a third world country who rely on tourism and people like Armstraong and his team at black and white who truly try to make a difference to their community.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Two amazing tours
text: I cannot rate Armstrong and his team highly enough. We saw the real Gambia with them and will never forget it. Armstrong replied promptly to emails before we left, he picked us up from the airport and the next morning we confirmed the tours we were going to do. The title of the 4x4 trip doesn't do it justice, it gave a real insight into Gambian life. The safari with lion walk was a once in a lifetime experience. It wasn't just the content of the tours, it was how well we were looked after, the attention to detail, the vast knowledge of the guides and the charitable work they do too that made them so special. Thank you for everything

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing Tours & Service From Start to Finish
text:
We contact Black & White in advance of our holiday as we were looking to see as much of Gambia as we could. Armstrong replied to all our questions quickly and soon gave the confidence we were looking for in a local tour operator. We booked 4 tours with them 4x4, Kuntat Kinta, 2 Days in North Senegal (With Fathala & Lion Walk) & 2 Day trip to George Town.

Very glad we did as on arrival we discovered that had we of booked with our own tour company who we flew out with,it would have cost an additional £300, without the personal service given to us by Armstrong and his team. Before, during & after each tour Armstrong would message us to check that everything was ok and ensure we had enjoyed out tours. 

Yaya, Lamin & Alex were so knolegable and entertaining. Along with our drivers, nothing was to much trouble, making sure we had pleanty of stops to take pictures or just chating to us to tell us all about The Gambia.  

The best way to see this country is from the back of a Landrover, with some genuinely knowledgeable and enthusiastic guides. Not as part of a big tour, on a bus, looking at your watch every 10 mins.   

Really carnt thank Black & White enough for making our holiday in The Gambia such an enjoyable experience.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: An amazing day with a visit to Senegal
text: Our journey took us to Bakau where we had to cross the river Gambia on the ferry. Seeing is believing the number of people and vehicles as well as animals that are put on this boat (which looks like a very old Isle of Wight ferry). Once we had reached the other side there was a short journey to our refreshment stop at the Helping Charity Lodge and then onto the border with Senegal. Here we were pestered by children wanting us to buy fruit. Once our passports and been stamped it was onto Fathala wild life reserve. Our guide was Sally a cute 22 yr old who was excellent. The safari took us through the bush where we saw many animals including the elusive rhino. One part was on foot chasing after the giraffe with its young. Afterwards we went to walk with the lions. As the weather was so hot these two majestic creatures refused to move so we were allowed to go and stroke them. All too soon it was time for the return journey stopping for an excellent meal at the school. Our guide and driver were fantastic throughout and I would certainly recommend Black and White Safari.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Superb Tours for visitors to the Gambia!
text:
Me and my Girlfriend visited Gambia for the first time last week and through recommendation from a friend decided to book 2 tours with Black and White and we we're not disappointed. 
We booked 2 trips, full days Safari including Lion walk and the 4x4 tour.
Armstrong came and picked us up from our hotel the first morning of our stay after we'd planned to meet over email before our flight. He was bang on time and took us to his office. He was fantastic in letting us know our options and accommodating us to our needs. He made us feel very comfortable when booking our tours then dropped us back to our hotel afterwards. 
For both our tours we had tour guide YAYA who was fantastic and an amazing guy, he knew everything and made both our tours very special. 
I could go on forever about how amazing our holiday was but you have to do the 4x4 tour where you can see the real Gambia. The highlight being visiting a local school and having the kids sing to you really was an amazing moment and a memory that will last forever.
Thank you to Black and White for making our holiday, I cant recommend them enough! We will be back and will definitely book with Black and White again as there were so many more tours we could have done!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 1 daagse trip naar Senegal
text: We hadden een fantastische reis met twee top !! gidsen Demba en Sjarief ! en een chauffeur naar Banjul. En een chauffeur aan de andere kant. De overtocht met de veerboot is het meest spectaculaire van de dag en we kregen werkelijk een fantastisch ontbijt en er was heel veel drinken mee. Een heel goed verzorgde reis een aanrader om dit via arch tours te boeken ! Bij de grens goede begeleiding en altijd een bij ons in de auto. Er wordt namelijk bij de grensovergang  nogal gebedeld! Zoals gezegd stelt het park niet zo heel veel voor maar er wordt van alles gedaan om de dieren te spotten. Een open jeep ! Een gids van het park die nog mee op de jeep gaat.

title: Best company
text: Highly recommended it .good service and good price , the owner very generous, so kind , and is very hard in his business.. all the best

title: Trip naar Senegal
text:
Twee super goeie leuke gidsen mee, Djambe en Sharif. De reis naar Senagal is zeer spectaculair. Van de 3 veerboten was er maar 1 in bedrijf omdat de andere 2 in reparatie zijn. Het is werkelijk een belevenis om met de veerboot mee te gaan. Enorm veel mensen auto's,  brommers en beesten. Jammer dat de wachttijden erg lang zijn om op de boot te komen. 
Het park Fatala valt tegen. Vooral als je al eens echt op safari geweest bent in Kenia. Maar het is wel leuk om in de open jeep te staan en door de bush naar dieren te zoeken. 
Super leuke dag gehad.

title: Sehr gut und professionell!
text:
Wir wollten gerne eine Tour zum Fathala Nationalpark im Senegal machen. Waren bei Arch-Torus, Bushwaker und wurden natürlich auch auf der Straße mehrfach angequatscht. Wir haben ohne die Löwen 95€ bezahlt, Bushwaker wollte das Gleiche, auf der Straße wurde uns das auch für 80€ angeboten.
Dafür bekommt man bei Arch-Tours für diesen Trip ein Frühstück (wir wurden um 6 Uhr morgens abgeholt), dauerhaft kalte Getränke (Bier, Cola, Wasser etc.) und Mittagessen (Pizza). Das Frühstück haben wir ganz gemütlich am Hafen von Banjul gehabt, das hatte seinen Charme.
Wir waren also den ganzen Tag über versorgt, hatten VIP boarding an der Fähre, keine Probleme an der Grenze oder am Park. Dafür war der Preis absolut gerechtfertigt! Viel bleibt da sicher nicht über, wenn man also günstigere Angebote hat, wird da immer etwas fehlen.
Wir waren 6 Leute auf der Tour, hatten 2 Guides und 1 Fahrer. 
Unsere Guides Sherrif und Demba waren extrem gut! Wir haben uns die ganze Zeit über sicher gefühlt, sie haben eine angenehme Atmosphäre rübergebracht und zu lachen gab es mit den beiden auch genug. Das war genau die richtige Kombination aus Ruhe und Action, sie haben uns auf alle Fragen geantwortet und diese Tour zu einem einmaligen Erlebnis gemacht!
Sehr zu empfehlen!

title: Perfect for first time visitors
text:
We came to The Gambia in April 2016, one friend having being a few times and having a relationship with a local myself and my other friend came as a spur of the moment holiday for her 30th.

We used Arch Tours for the 4 in tour to see more of The Gambia and I'm glad we did.

Booking the tour was really easy and it was nice not having to worry about being in large groups (maximum of 6) or having to find a meeting point as they came to the hotel to pick you up and drop you off.

For the four in one tour she we had Tom the driver, Bob and Fatouh as the tour guides and they made it a very enjoyable experience and are obviously very knowledgeable.

We visited Serrekunda Market, Kachikally Crocodile Pool,  Lamin Lodge where you saw the ladies with the oysters and the piles of used oyster shells, Paradise Beach and Tanji fishing village.

Drinks were provided throughout the trip with regular stops as well as snacks at Lamin lodge which the monkeys stole a couple of cheeky doughnuts and lunch at Paradise beach.

During the tour we also had a school visit and a local village visit where we got to see how The Gambians live in the mud huts.

It is a full day tour but it is worth it.  Just be careful taking photos as some the locals prefer you didn't as we quickly found out.

We will be coming back to The Gambia and more than likely use Arch tours for another trip as there is so much to see we just didn't have enough time to do everything.

Thanks for making our first visit very enjoyable.

title: Wel duur, maar heel goed
text: Vaak denk je goedkoper uit te zijn met een lokale taxi, maar arch-tours doet precies wat hij beloofd en heeft veel koud drinken bij zich. Er word ook veel gestopt omdat je dan eerst moet drinken. Alle tochten waren goed verzorgd en heel goed geregeld!

title: Great tour company!
text:
We did the 4-in-1 tour with Arch Tours in February 2016. I've never been on such a comprehensive tour or done so much in one day; we loved it! We visited Serrekunda market (an experience in itself!), a compound, a school, a crocodile sanctuary, a lodge on the river where we had tea and pastries, lunch on Paradise beach (delectable) and the beach where fishermen bring in their catch every day.
Bob & Fatou were great, they were so friendly and very funny; the car stopped right in the middle of the road and all had to get out to jumpstart it again :)

It was a really good experience, thank you very much!

title: Just as good second time around
text:
This was our second trip to Gambia and having had such a brilliant experience with Arch Tours before we were in contact with them before we flew out. We arranged with Abdul to pick us from our hotel on our first morning and he arrived right on time and took us back to his office. We booked two trips that we hadn't done before - Roots (the slavery tour) and Makasutu Forest Park. Abdul then had us dropped back to the hotel. 
Just as with our first holiday our trips were brilliant. We just love being in the open back land rovers travelling through town and country being able to smell and almost touch Gambian life close up. It is a great way to get some special photos. Once again we were well looked after with plenty of cold drinks and great food. There was always plenty of information and the guides readily engage with you and answer any questions. The Roots tour was very humbling and enlightening and really made you stop and think. We didn't see any dolphins on the boat trip but we had great fun with everyone on board. We were very lucky with Makasutu tour as we were the only ones so my wife and I had the guide all to ourselves. The baboons are great fun and you must go up the viewing towere as the views are amazing. The canoe trip was one of the most quiet and peaceful trips I can remember going on.
Yes on both trips you end up being taken to the locals trying to sell their goods - some people find it hard to deal with but we were just firm but polite and smiley unless we actually wanted to buy something. You should not let this put you off going as the overall experiences are fantastic. We will be back for more

title: Best tour company ever!
text:
We travelled to Gambia for the first time in May and, after a little research, decided that Arch Tours could take us to places other than the beach.
What we didn't realize before travelling was that this was off-season and the tourist areas - and hence the number of tourists looking to go on tours - were very quiet.
This did not deter Arch. We went to their offices and booked two tours - The 4-in-1 Gambia Experience and the Falhala Wildlife Park in Senegal.
On the morning of the 4-in-1 tour the landrover picked up and headed off. I was expecting that we were heading to pick up other people for the tour but no - it was just the two of us. We had a great day going around the country and seeing the 'real' Gambia with our personal guide happy to give us any information we requested.

On the day of the trip to Senegal the exact same thing happened - We had a private guided tour to the wildlife resort where we saw rhinos, giraffes, deer, warthogs... and, of course, the lions. Standing two yards away from the lions while everyone takes photos is a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Overall, we couldn't fault this company for anything.
Whereas others would have cancelled the tours due to small numbers they just went ahead - catering for ANY sized party.

Would definitely use them again for other tours the next time we are in Gambia.

title: Senegal Safari
text:
Long day, but well looked after. The journey in Senegal to and from park was so fascinating, very little tourism in the country.
The truck we travelled in from Senegal throughout was most certainly not for the elderly, Difficult to get on and off also very uncomfortable throughout the day.
The park reception area was beautiful. Trip through park was interesting, took age's trying to find Giraffes unsuccessfully sadly. Very disappointed with that. But! The meeting of the two  lions was worth it. Never forgot it. Have fabulous photo with them.

ownerResponse.text:
we thank you for your excellent review and sincerely regret the fact that the vehicle used on that day was not the least comfortable for the elderly as you rightly mentioned.this is due the fact that our vehicles were not allowed into senegal because of the border closure .just like everyone else we relied on the game reserve to provide us a vehicle to pick us up from the border town and conduct the safari.we do not have any control over this as we entirely  depend on the park to provide us with transport.thank god the borders are reopened now and we can now cross over with our own transport from the gambia.we are deeply sorry for the inconvenience you have been through and hope to make up for it when you visit again.this border closure has being a big setback for our operations in senegal  over the past 3 months  and we are so grateful that the  borders are open now and there is free movement of vehicles from both countries.once more we thank you for reviewing our attraction,
profound regards
The arch-tours team.

title: Een goed georganiseerde trip naar Senegal
text:
Alleen al de overtocht per boot is een onvergetelijke gebeurtenis. Dit moet je meegemaakt hebben. Alles gaat op de boot. Ook vee.
Het natuurreservaat was ook super met loslopende giraffen en allerlei andere dieren. Nog even met de leeuwen op de foto. Leuk.

title: Senegal and Safari Magnificent
text: Chose Arch Tours for our trip to Senegal and Safari because we always try to contribute to the local economy by using Gambian companies wherever possible. Had read a lot about the great reputation of this company and was not disappointed. The attention to detail of the staff where second to none. The trip was a wonderful experience for myself and adult son. Walking with lions is a highlight never to be forgotten. Very highly recommended.

title: Top!!
text: Zijn met gids Demba een dag naar het wildlife park in Senegal geweest. Het was super geregeld, Demba kon over alles heel interessant vertellen, beantwoordde al onze vragen en we hebben alle dieren gezien. Al met al een topdag met een topgids. Aanrader!!!

title: Gambia - spendida!
text: siamo stati a kotu, abbiamo gia prenotato da casa le nostre gite , ed andata tutto alla perfettzione. dal nostro incontro con Abdul, alle excursioni stessi, tutto punuiale, discritto bene cosa dovevamo portare con noi, le presentazioni delle guide e tutto i loro spiegazioni durante il viaggio. per farla breve: abbiamo fatto 4 in 1, il North Senegal ed il Roots, tutto alla grande, in una parole Fantastico e possiamo raccomandare a tutti quanti i tour offerti da Arch Tours. Un saluto grande a Kid, Bob e Fatima tutti gentilissimi e pure l'autista che mi sfuggi il nome adesso, perdono!! Le foto che si vedono sul sito sono tutti veri, li ho guardato adesso e sono più o meno le stesse che abbiamo fatto noi, che spettacolo!!!

title: Excellent
text:
As a party of 7, 5 adults and a 12 yr old and a 5 yr old, we did the 4 in 1 tour. We had Bob and Fatou as guides and Tom for a driver. A brilliant day, as always. All of us except the 5 yr old have done this trip before and I have to say your staff are the best Abdul. "The best in the West". 
We have been coming to Gambia since 1994 and did our first trip with you then. We have never been disappointed. 
Keep doing what you are doing, as you do it so well.
We will drop in to see you in November when we return.
Many many thanks from Rosemary, Andy and family. X

title: 2 Days Georgetown & Stone Circles + 4 Tours in 1 Day
text:
Because of the many good reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to do book our tours with Arch Tours. 

We contacted the company for the first time approximately one month before our holiday. The communication went by email and everything went really smooth. We got into contact with the manager, Mr. Abdul Raman. He suggested to come and pick us up from our hotel they day after our arrival.  The manager is a very kind, professional and well organized man. He gave us a presentation of the tours they organize. 
We decided to join the 2 day excursion to Georgetown and the Stone Circles. 

The price of the 2 day excursion to Georgetown and the Stone Circles was EUR 125 per person. The tour was organized with a mini bus with a group of approximately 12 persons. The tour starts with a short drive from the hotel area to the port of Banjul. 
In Banjul we took the ferry to cross the Gambia River to Barra, on the Northern bank. From here we drove towards the Stone Circles in the village of Wassu. On our way to Wassu we visited a local market and enjoyed a snack break. Drinks are provided throughout the whole day and the guides frequently ask you if you feel thirsty. The guides are extremely friendly and helpfull. 
We arrived to the Stone Circles of Wassu in the afternoon. It's an interesting archeological site. After our visit we continued our drive towards the Janjanbureh Camp Lodge, the place where we were going to spent the night. The Janjanbureh Camp Lodge is located at the river bank. The location is really beautiful. But keep in mind the accommodation is very basic. Make sure you take plenty of insect repellent, a torch (no electricity) and soap with you. 
After unpacking and a short rest, we went to visit the city of Georgetown to see the Slave House. Unfortunately there are not many historical buildings left in Georgetown, but because of its importance in the slave trade, the place is still worth a visit. 
The second day of the tour starts with a 4-hour boat trip on the Gambia River. We enjoyed breakfast on the boat. 
We considered the 4-hour boat trip to be the best part of the 2 days excursion. The Gambia River is a very good place to spot plenty of birds and nature is really beautiful. We got lucky as we got to see hippos. At Baboon Island we have seen some chimpanzees and Colobus monkeys. 
After the boat trip we made a stop in a small village upcountry to visit a local family. The family showed us their compound. This was a great experience, as we got to see how Gambians live. Take plenty of candies with you, the children love them! 
On the drive back towards the hotel we had one more stop for lunch at the Bintang Bolong. 
We highly recommend this tour to anyone that likes to see how people live far away from the tourist area. It's a long drive of almost 300km each day, but according to us it was all worth it. 

As we were very satisfied with the professional service of the guides and tour company we decided to book another tour with Arch Tours a few days later. 

We booked the 4 Tours in 1 Day. The price is EUR 60 per person. I was a bit hesitating to book this tour in the beginning, as we were affraid it was going to be too commercial. 
This tour is organized in a 4x4 with a capacity of max 6 persons. The tour proved very soon to be a very authentic and interesting tour. The tour starts with a visit to the Serrekunda Market. Here you get to see where locals sell and buy their food and products.After strolling on the market, the tour continues to the Kachikally Crocodile Pool. At the pool you get to see crocodilles from close by and if you want you can even touch them. 
At the Lamin Lodge, located at a creek, we got to see the importance of oyster fishing for the locals and had a small snack. 
The tours includes plenty of stops. The driving distance between all the stops are no more than 30 minutes. Driving towards the south we drove on dirt roads through small villages. We visited a traditional compound. In the villages you get to see life on the countryside. 
In the afternoon we arrived at Paradise Beach, considered one of the nicest beaches in the Gambia. Here you can enjoy lunch (included) on the beach. After lunch you can relax on the sunbed or go for a swim. 
On the way back to the hotel one more stop was made at the Tanji fishing village. 

Both tours we did with Arch Tours were really fabulous. The guides and drivers are very helpfull and knowledgeable. They make you feel very comfortable during the trip and do their outmost best to provide a great service. 

Thank you Arch Tours for the great experience!
