title: Amazing - Not to be missed!
text:
This was our first trip to The Gambia & we used Black & White for three tours - Lazy Day Fishing, Fathala Safari and Lion Walk and the 4x4 Tour.  I'd been in contact via email with Armstrong before our visit to The Gambia.  He was always very quick to reply and was very informative.  We were collected from our  hotel the morning after we arrived and taken to the office to book our tours.  Nothing was too much trouble & Armstrong was very patient whilst we were trying to decide which to book, but didn't once try to give us the 'hard sell'.  

Lazy Day Fishing was our first trip, we booked this one as both my husband & I love fishing!  The day was very relaxing, we were picked up from our hotel around 9, and there was just one other couple with us, which was nice as meant it wasn't really crowded on the boat.  Lunch was cooked for us on the boat & was very tasty. There were lots of drinks available all day from water to cold fizzy drinks or tea & coffee.  Nyima was our guide for the day, she's the youngest guide at black and white and she was a lovely girl and made our day really enjoyable.  She couldn't do enough for us. It doesn't matter if you've never fished before, Joe the captain was very helpful and was always on hand with fresh bait and to help if you were lucky enough to catch anything (which we were!)

Our next trip was the Safari at Fathala Wildlife reserve in Senegal.  Our guide for the day was Lamin.  For me personally, this is a day not to be missed!  We were picked up from our hotel at 7am and there were 5 of us on the trip.  We had to get the ferry, which luckily for us, was reasonably quiet as it was a Sunday. The border crossing at Senegal can be a bit daunting too, but Lamin was amazing and really looked after us all, especially as there was a nervous lady in our group.  The safari was amazing, we were joined by a guide from Fathala who along with Lamin kept us informed of everything we were seeing, and were both extremely knowledgeable.  We were lucky to see all of the animals in the reserve.  The icing on the cake for this trip was the walking with Lions - What a fantastic experience!  Certainly something we'll never forget!  It was incredibly hot that day but we were supplied with plenty of cold, refreshing drinks throughout the day and were incredibly well looked after.  Lunch was served at The Lodge, just after the border on the way back, which was a lovely place to visit and lunch was lovely.  This was a very long day, but well worth it!

Our last trip was the 4x4 tour, with Lamin & Nyima as our guides.  we visited Bakau for the Crocodile pool first - again, well worth the visit!  So many crocodiles and we had a lovely guide there, named Moses, who was entertaining as well as informative.  The museum there is interesting and it was a great start to the day.  From there we visited a local school where we were invited into all of the classes and met the teachers and children, who all sang for us, this was a really lovely visit.  we then gave the children sweets, pens and pencils.  After the school, we moved onto Serrekunda market, which was an experience!  So many colours everywhere and a real insight into Gambian life, although I'm really pleased we had Lamin and Nyima with us, as it was quite daunting & intimidating at times.  We then drove to a woodwork factory which was a welcome stop in the heat, a chance to have a look at the products that are made (by hand) and a chance to buy souvenirs to take home.  From here we went to Paradise beach for lunch, and had an hour after to relax on the beach (take your swim stuff and a towel!), have a swim, or just relax on the sunbeds!  We spent the time chatting to Nyima, laying on the sunbeds and watching  a cow run away with a basket of fruit from one of the juice bars!  After lunch, we then headed to visit a local family - this was an incredibly humbling experience, but another chance to get a real insight into Gambian life, meet the family and of course, give the children sweets and gifts!  Our last stop of the day was Tanji fishing beach and market where you get to see the fish being smoked, (and have a taste if you fancy!), watch the boats come in and wander through the market seeing all the different fish.  Nyima and Lamin were fantastic guides for all of our trips and we can't recommend highly enough!  We loved our trip so much that we came straight home and have booked again for next year, so Armstrong - we will definitely be back for more trips next year!  Well done to a fantastic company!

title: Amazing experience
text:
We came to The Gambia with my parents who had been last year and used black and white. We were greeted by Armstrong and Bax  at the airport and they looked after us for our whole stay. 

We booked 3 trips.

4 wheel drive which was a great day, so much packed into one day, a yet so relaxing. Our lovely guide Lamin looked after us and gave us so much information about the culture and history of this amazing country. We visited a school, a village, a crocodile pool, a market, a fishing village and the lovely paradise beach for lunch a fabulous day and my head was spinning with it all when I got back but it was so relaxed. We loved it ! 

Fathala was just the best experience for me I have always loved lions and to experience them this close was a dream come true ! Our lovely guide Lamin picked us up at 7 and took us over on the ferry which is another amazing experience and again we were looked after so well, my daughter is disabled which presents a challenge in itself with her wheelchair and mobility but this did not phase Lamin  or Bax at all, throughout our entire trip especially on the ferry she was looked after and always made comfortable. I can’t thank the team enough for making sure she got to enjoy the amazing experience that we all had, she loved the animals. We saw zebras, rhino, antelope, giraffe, warthog, buffalo and then she got to stroke the lion cubs it was truly amazing and so emotional! My husband and I had a walk with the older lions which was fantastic such an awesome experience to be that close to them!

Georgetown a 2 day trip again an early pick up and on to the ferry,  I love the hustle and bustle of that and lamin has so much knowledge of the lovely country, as you drive through the different villages stopping off at one to meet the children, we stopped for an amazing lunch on top of a hill overlooking the River Gambia, then onto a lovely boat trip to see the hippos and chimpanzees.

We would recommend the team highly and will definitely be using them again! 

Thank you so much for making our holiday such an amazing experience, we had such a wonderful time with your help!

text: My Mum, my brother and I went to Georgetown with Lamin at Black & White Safari Tours. title: Cannot recommend this company enough
text:
We booked 3 tours with black and white and had a fantastic time on each one.
Armstrong and his team looked after us like royalty. They could not do enough for us. The guides are very informative meal and drinks provided along the way as much as you can drink and eat.
We did the Safari in Senegal with the ferry crossing... what a colourful sensory experience that was such fun.
The Safari was very good giraffes rhino warthogs zebras antelope monkeys and lots of birds.
Followed by the lion walk a once in a lifetime experience so magical.
The roots tour is full of history about the slave trade so interesting and sad.
We also did the day gambia tour visiting markets fishing village a school and a local village couple who invited us into their home.
Helped fetch water from the well.
I cannot explain how amazing this day was we felt so humbled and thankful for what we have.
We took loads of things for the family’s children inc a mosquito net and they were so unbelievably thankful.

I would absolutely recommend black and white we felt safe and very well looked after.
And the price was very good. Armstrong who runs it is a fun guy with his best guide Lamin we actually had Armstrong himself take us out much to the surprise of his staff and local people. 
This is a fantastic little company that deserves as much help as possible so please use them. If you have any questions I’m only to pleased to help.
Armstrong will also tailor make a day for you if you want something different also.

I will absolutely use this company again.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Black and White is more than alright!
text:
We decided to book all our tours and hotel transfers through Armstrong as he has great reviews, he was good at communicating and he donates a portion of their proceeds to charity (a local primary school) Armstrong was also able to tweak some of the tours to suit our needs! Our guide (usually Lamin C) always arrived on time and was so helpful, friendly and knowledgable. We always felt safe with Lamin.

Safari tour
The ferry was a great experience for people watching. There are ladies who sell frozen bags of Baobab juice for about 5D which are nice and refreshing.

Lazy day
Great for people who like sunbathing and fishing. Buffet food was very tasty and there are beers available to buy. Our tour did go a bit wrong when the young lad steered to boat into a sandbank and we got stuck for a few hours in shallow water. I found it all quite fun (part of the experience) but some of the older ladies in the tour were a bit worried. Being in shallow water meant that I got to see a wild seahorse! I was glad when we got rescued by another boat as a swarm of bees were starting to take a bit too much interest in the boat. I've never been fishing before, but I found it great even though I only caught 1 small bongo fish, however my partner had more luck and caught a barracuda amongst others. 

4x4
This tour was a mixture of tourist attractions and the real gambia. It was so eye opening to go inside a local house and see how the local people live, how they collect water, grow crops and cook. It was also interesting to go to the local primary school (black and white donate money) the children were singing educational counting songs. It was sad to see they needed money to fix the leaking roof.
Buffet food at the rainbow bar was too, and the highlight of this trip was the wrestling! (Wrestling was not normally part of the tour, but Armstrong and lamin were nice enough to add this in) the fishing village was very smelly but it was great to see the smoke houses. The locals were happy to show us what they were doing and let us try the fish (smoked bongo and sardine)

Sunset cruise
Perfect for couples and birdwatchers (don't forget to take binoculars) 
Feeding The monkeys was fun - my tip is not to stand underneath the monkeys in the trees unless you want to get showered in piss!
The boat trip was very romantic and Solomon was very knowledgable 
We ate at Lamin Lodge - food was perfect

Roots
Historical tour showing the history of slavery. Eye opening, a bit sad, a bit horrifying but definitely worth the visit. The island is suffering from erosion, I hope UNESCO is able to sort something out to save the places

Makasutu
A walk through the forest talking about the different species of plants and animals, the opportunity to get your palm read. Baboons with babies ❤️ buffet food brilliant. Highlight was the palm tree climbing (palm wine tapping demonstration)

So thank you Armstrong, Lamin and Alex for making this holiday so memorable.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Expensive cruise, but quite worth the momentary peace
text:
I booked the river cruise to spend a leisurely day relaxing with the family. It seemed somewhat overproportional to have an own guide and a driver onboard, when the whole guiding consisted of a short one-off explanation about mangroves and no further initiative to engage with us. The boys weren't knowledgeble or proactive, but friendly when being talked to - perhaps the perfect match for a lazy daytrip. The highlights onboard were swimming and fishing, although the fish wasn't prepared for us to eat, like on some other cruises on offer. 

The biggest minus on this trip was the high price (50 euro /head), and that the owner even tried to increase it upon pickup, arguing over the course of local currency. This debate, worth only a couple of hundred of local money, cost a lot more in customer satisfaction, although as a result the owner agreed to accept the original sum. 

On a very positive note, he was replying all my messages without delay, organized an unproblematic trip on schedule, understood and respected my wishes and wasn't persistantly trying to upsell further trips to me, like most other providers, and he even did me some favours I'm grateful of. It felt more ethical to hire this Gambian company instead of the foreign-lead ones, of which income flows abroad.

ownerResponse.text:
Well was kind of taking this as an issue that worths not mentioning .The price in particular was mentioned to you in euro 50 and the exchange rate was 55 dalasis to a euro not 50. I did not argue .It is a big concern for us not to entertain arguing with out customers. . However when the guide told me to speak to you I did said ok to what you want .So what is the point.....
The tour is called lazy day river and it needs not to be talking too much by the guide .We always say one of a peaceful and quiet day out on the river.... So the guide not speaking too much is simply not to distract your day relaxing.Infact this guide Alex is mentioned on trip advisor many times very positively.
