title: Fathala Wildlife Park
text: We went to the Fathala Wildlife Park in Senegal with Arch Tours. The service they provided was first class, we have breakfast served in a clearing in the bush as we headed to the Senegal border, the wildlife park was fabulous, we sited Rhino, buffalo, giraffes, zebras and many more, we even had our photos taken with the Lions. The day was fantastic from start to finish. Well done Arch tours, we will be using you again in the future.

title: Two day trip to Georgetown
text: This trip was amazing value for money and such a good experience to see the real Gambia. The guides were fantastic we saw everything promised including hippos (from a big distance) and chimps (again only just). We stayed in an authentic round house, saw the stones and visited Georgetown to see some of the history, also had a family visit, this all included food and most drinks. The only reason we are scoring a four is the return journey was not great as we didn't actually stop for 'lunch' until about five pm, so we were all hungry and tired and the restaurant was not good so we barely ate anything. Otherwise an excellent trip and I would recommend arch yours to anyone visiting Gambia.

title: Fantastic
text:
It was our first trip to The Gambia, we did a lot of research etc into who to book tours with. After a few emails to Abdul at Arch tours we went ahead with them and so glad we did. Everything was excellent with them. Pick up is very prompt, food and ice cold drinks provided all day inclusive of the price. We did 2 trips: the 4 in 1 and the trip to Fathala in Senegal. We were fortunate enough to get the same guide each trip (Kit) he is a great guy. Very knowledgeable about everything that was asked and nothing is to much trouble for him. We will return to The Gambia and Arch tours will be our first contact when booking trips.................. Thanks a lot guys

Alan & Karen

title: 4 in 1.... SUPERB!
text:
We used the wonderful Arch Tours for our 4 in 1 trip which we would highly reccomend.
We first met Abdul the lovely manager who helped us choose the right tour - even though they didn't have a tour going out on that particular day he made it possible for us. We were then taken on a "magical tour" with Bob & Tom. Bob made the tour so personal for us, with his enthusiasm & knowledge - amazing! He made it an unforgettable trip from start to finish. Tom assured we arrived to all destinations with safety. Such great guys to share our amazing, unforgettable experience - we look forward to our next adventure on our next trip to the wonderful Gambia!

ownerResponse.text: thanks for taking the trouble in reviewing our attraction.we are pleased to note that you left the gambia a satisfied client and we are looking forward to showing you more of beautiful gambia.

title: Wonderful tour company - and great with children!
text:
We feared Gambia might be a risky destination for us with our peanut-allergic 7 year old daughter.   However, with the help of the wonderful guides at Arch Tours, it was a memorable holiday for all the right reasons.

4-in-one (10/10)
If you only have time for one tour do this one.  All the sites were interesting and fun, and the distances between them were relatively short.  See all the other reviews for full details.

Fathala (7/10)
Be warned this is a long 12 hour day with a lot of travelling time and a lot of hanging about.  If you don't set off on the dot of 6am you'll probably miss the first ferry and find yourself waiting for an hour at the ferry terminal.  The ferry itself wasn't as bad as we were expecting, and the 2 hour game drive was great.  However, you may decide it's not worth 10 hours of travelling time for this.  The Arch Tours trip includes a Lion View, but not the famous Lion Walk.  This means you get to take a quick selfie with the lions, but after that you get sent back while others get to walk with the lions.  So if you want to do the Lion Walk, don't go with Arch Tours.  Kids and adults below 150cm aren't allowed to do either the Lion Walk or the Lion View (and our daughter still hasn't forgiven us for this!)

Roots tour (7/10)
This is a very interesting tour of historical sites connected with the slave trade.  However, you will spend a lot of the day on a slow boat.  Apparently the boat's engine broke down a few weeks ago and its new engine is much slower, so expect to spend 2 - 2.5 hours getting there and 3 - 3.5 hours coming back.  It's quite a bumpy ride at times, so be warned if you get seasick.  Some people rave about the lunch, but we thought it was disappointing - basically salad with more salad.

Banjul half day (8/10)
There isn't that much to see in Banjul, but we enjoyed the view from the top of Arch 22, various markets, and an interesting little museum.  In truth, you could probably do this cheaper and just as well by tourist taxi.  Thankfully the distances are short.

Makasutu (8/10)
This is an enjoyable and easy day out to a national park, where you get to ride by longboat through the mangroves, and do a guided walk through a pleasant forest.  You also get to share a rather disappointing lunch with a large troop (or is it a flange?) of baboons.  We also visited the luxury jungle lodge whilst we were there, which is not normally part of the tour, but lovely to see.  On the way back we asked to visit the cattle market, which was interesting but our daughter found it a bit upsetting.

One tour we wanted to do but couldn't was the trip to South Senegal.  Apparently you now need visas and there are restrictions on taking vehicles over the border, so this tour hasn't been running all season.

Despite all the hard travelling (which can be tough with a child in tow), looking back we were glad we did all these tours.  Marie and Bob were amazing as they kept our daughter entertained throughout.  Bob even gave our daughter a piggy back through the Makasutu forest when her little legs got tired!  It felt like we'd hired a nanny and a porter as well as a tour guide!

The itineraries and prices are similar to the big bus tours that you can book through the likes of Thomas Cook.  The difference is you'll be in a much smaller group (max 6 in a jeep), so you get much more personal service and attention from the brilliant guides.

title: 4 in 1 trip
text: It was brilliant.  We went the market crocodile pool, oyster farm, school, a family's house, fish farm, and a lovely beech. It coast us £40 each. Got picked up at 8 o'clock till 6.30.  Food and drink included.

title: Professional, fun and good value tours
text: We booked the 4 in 1 and makasuto trips both were excellent & made all the better by the friendly cheerful tour guides. The guides were punctual, provided plenty of drinks - nothing was too much trouble. The best bit of our holiday was the trip arranged to the batik factory where my daughter was able to spend time making her own batik for her GCSE art. Thank you for arranging that for us and thank you to MSK for keeping smiling even though she accompanied us as an 'extra' and must have got bored sitting watching batik painting for hours! 5 stars doesn't do the company justice

title: Goed geregeld! Aanrader!
text: Wij hebben een Early Bird trip gedaan met Arch tours. We zijn keurig op tijd opgehaald bij het hotel. Vervolgens naar Lamin Lodge gegaan. Hier kregen we thee met een schaal koekjes. Daarna met een houten boot varen door de Mangroves om de vogels wakker te zien/horen worden.. schitterend! Na een wandeling weer terug met het bootje naar Laminaat Lodge waar een heerlijk ontbijt op ons stond te wachten. Hierna zijn we weer netjes teruggebracht naar het hotel. Alles was goed geregeld en de gidsen/ begeleiders waren zeer vriendelijk. Een Early bird trip is zeker aan te raden!

title: Helpful and informative guides
text: We booked for two tours - the four in one day, and also a 3 hour trip on the river...  Both tours were good value for money, and led by well informed and interesting guides.  The four in one was great for a taste of Gambia beyond the tourist strip, - I particularly enjoyed the fishing port.  It was quite a long day, so we asked to re- arrange the three hour river trip for another day - which the manager ( lovely guy ) did without a quibble.  That trip was much more relaxed, and as it was just the two of us, plus guide/driver/boatman, we could relax and enjoy the scenery - the guide there was great.  Absolutely reccomend this company.

title: highly recommended tour company
text:
we have used arch tours many times in the past and done many tours with them .the guides are professional with good knowledge and look after you all day long .
all the tours are good value and you get to see the real gambia ,highly recommended.

title: if you want value and a honest company look no further use arch tours
text: We booked 2 tours with arch, after looking around and reading reviews as well as personal recommendations, we decided to go straight to Arch tours. Abdul is a great man, no hard sell, relaxed environment, cold water, good advice and that was just going into the office. His team are a credit to him as well, Bob, Marie, Tom. We went on the 4 in 1 tour and the safari tour. I would recommend both, its amazing to see the real Gambia in the 4 in 1 and seeing the animals on the safari trip to Senegal.  We had endless supply of drinks they really look after you!! and they supply lunch and donuts in the 4 in 1 and breakfast and lunch on the safari. could not recommend them enough, please if you are looking for a good honest friendly reliable company with no hassle go straight to there office and see Abdul.

title: Could not recommend highly enough
text:
We did two tours the safari and the four in one which was actually a five on one!
Got to see the "real" Gambia, and meet real people. Was lovely to see how people could be so happy with so little. And what we take for granted in the west. 
Tour guides were lovely, tours included all your drinks and food all day.
My only comment would be they are very long days so do nt book them on consecutive days. Both nights after we were in bed for 9!! 
Would defiantly use them again .

title: Easy to see why this company is so highly rated.
text: From the minute you walk into the office, you are treat like royalty. Personal introduction to the owner Abdul who dealt with us. He takes time to talk and listen with you. Nothing is rushed. Complimentary iced water. No pressure on any sales. Extremely relaxed, informative and helpful. Highly HIGHLY recommended for service. The day trip was extremely well organised also with punctual pick up and drop off at your hotel. Friendly.

title: 4 in 1 Tour
text: If you want a great insight into Gambian life with good memories I would recommend the 4 in 1 tour provided by Arch Tours. Open Land Rovers used on trip accompanied by enthusiastic and informative staff many thanks to Bob, Marie and Fatou for excellent service.

title: Safari in Senegal
text: Wij werden 's morgens om 6 uur opgehaald met een busje en om 06:45 stonden we bij de veerboot van Banjul naar Barak. De veerboot was een hele beleving. Aan de overkant gingen we verder met een jeep waar we onderweg even een stop hielden om te ontbijten. Dit was goed verzorgd. Verder naar het safaripark. Daar aangekomen gingen we weer met een andere jeep op safari. We hebben apen, zebra's, elands, makunamatata en een neushoorn gezien. Het was zeker de moeite waard en ze deden goed de best om zoveel ogelijk dieren te spotten. Vervolgens kregen we wat te eten en gingen we naar de leeuwen. Dit was ook een ervaring. Hierna gingen we weer terug om vervolgens weer met de veerboot terug naar ons hotel te gaan. De gidsen waren zeer bekwaam en vriendelijk. Wij hebben erg genoten en de hele dag was verzorgd inclusief eten en drinken. Bedankt Arch Tours Abdul en gidsen. Top!

title: Fantastic Small Group Tours from a Fantastic local Tour Company
text:
On arriving in The Gambia, we already knew that we were going to use Arch Tours after reading so many rave reviews on-line. We wanted to use a local company rather than the big tour giants such as Thomas Cook because the country really needs input on a local level.

We were not disappointed! 

We had contacted Abdul by email a couple of months before arrival and he was very quick to respond, giving us details and prices of the tours on offer. 

We asked our hotel reception to contact Arch Tours on our behalf and within 10 minutes we were being collected to visit the local office. We had already decided which tours we wanted to book and Abdul arranged these for us giving us all the details of what we would need on each day (such as insect repellent, towel, swimming stuff, passport etc). 

All transactions are in cash and receipts are given. 

Drinks and refreshments are plentiful and usually included in the price of the tour. 
The tours groups are very small and intimate with just 4-6 people in each  Jeep with a couple of tour guides and a driver.  It’s easy to hear, see and ask questions and the tour guides are knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and extremely attentive – without exception! 

4 Tours in One Day – Two-Bob!!!
A brilliant and interesting tour – definitely our favourite! 
We went to Serekunda Market with all the colourful sights, smells, hustle and bustle. I loved our time here and the opportunity to take photographs of the Gambian people buying and selling their wares.  It was also, surprisingly, a very hassle-free environment. 

At Kachically Crocodile Pool we learnt about the history of the area and the croc’s themselves and had the opportunity to stroke a full-grown croc. Note:  Each guest is given a croc tooth necklace (charged at 150 dalasi) – you don’t have to buy this. 

Lamin Lodge was where you learn about the women’s oyster collection but is also great for a coffee and donut break – a fantastic wooden-built structure over the water and mangroves where the green vervet monkeys help themselves to your donuts if you’re not quick enough – and sometimes even when you are!  

We all loved the village safari – the kids hear the Jeeps from miles away and come racing out of the villages and compounds shouting “Two-Bob” to see if you have any sweets, pens, pencils etc to give them.  It is well worth asking the guides to help you buy sweets locally as they will make sure you get an excellent price! We took some sweets and pens from home as well as buying some lollies out there. 

As our tour was on a Saturday, we were not able to visit schools so instead we went on a home compound visit and met the extended family who lived there. It felt quite intrusive but was so interesting and informative.  We left a packet of pain-killers with the compound landlord as his father was unwell. Again, there were loads of kids and as a tour group, I think we managed to make sure that every child had a sweet or lolly. 

Paradise Beach was gorgeous and gave everyone a couple of hours to relax and enjoy the scenery after a fantastic lunch (which included chicken domoda)! 
The fish market was another colourful and interesting place to visit with plenty of photographic opportunity. Some people don’t like having their photo taken so being discreet is the name of the game!

Roots River Tour 
My husband was keen to go on this tour as he remembered the TV series. 
A very long journey by boat to Jufureh for the Roots Tour.  The boat is great, serving very well-priced drinks. You will need sun cream and its worth covering up a bit as it’s so easy to burn without realising on the boat and the temperature increases considerably on the tour due to the location. 

The tour is interesting and informative. The Gambian people are very keen to tell you that there is no bad feeling regarding slavery as it is so far in the past and has nothing to do with our present generations.  There are lots more children on the island who respectfully restrain themselves whilst dancing, singing and leaping around excitedly awaiting tour groups to donate pens, sweets and money – again well worth taking some with you! 

Lovely lunch on-board on return, cooked in the tiniest and hottest of kitchens before heading off to Fort James Island to conclude the tour. 

Sun cream / hat / cover up / water / sweets are the most important things to take on this tour and look out for dolphins!

Fathala Game Reserve, Senegal 
An early start at 6am to being our trip to Senegal (passport required).  An interesting trip across to Barre on the ferry with the early morning commuters (including cattle and chickens etc) before a Jeep trip to cross the border into Senegal.

Breakfast is served on the back of the Jeeps before entering the reserve and was a lovely opportunity  to chat to the guides and tour-mates.

While waiting for your passport to be stamped, you are bombard in the Jeep by kids and market sellers so it’s a good idea to carry sweets and pens again! 

The safari itself is about 2.5 hours. We saw most of the animals fairly early on but the giraffes evaded us! We enjoyed being in very close proximity to a Rhino, warthogs and zebra. The highlight of the trip was the lion walk.  Seriously worth the 15 minutes that it takes and quite awe-inspiring! 

Lunch is a freshly cooked pizza before heading back. 

Note: If you have promised to buy something from the market sellers at the border – they will remember! 
A very long but rewarding day!

title: 4 in 1 tour
text: We had the best day ever the guides were all brilliant so much fun and certainly knew their stuff thank you all so much. It is a great trip and value for money.

title: Roots trip
text:
Went on the Roots trip with friends. Got picked up from hotel at 8am got back at 8pm. A brilliant day very hot. Food on boat was excellent. Had to pay for drinks. We also received a free bottle of water. 
The staff was excellent plenty of information from Kit, Demba and Bob they knew their history. Say hi from Julie and Terry. We be back next year for another trip.

ownerResponse.text: thanks for your beautiful review and wee are looking forward to having you on our other tours next year.as usual we do not take drinks on the roots cruise as the boat has a bar and sell their own drinks.this is one of our tours where you pay for your drinks.we always inform you about payingfor your drinks when you book this particular tour. all we provide is free 1.5 litre of ice cold  bottled water before you board the boat.

title: Arch Tours - Wonderful Experience
text: First time to Gambia.   Arch Tours were recommended by other tourists.  I booked an all day excursion with them and had a really great experience.  Throughout the day the staff ensured that we were supplied with drinks.  They took us to see a number  of sights (crocodiles, monkeys (whilst having tea/coffee/doughnuts), Paradise Beach, walk round market, visiting a school etc etc.  The staff were wonderfully helpful and knowledgeable and sooo nice.  It was a fantastic day where even lunch was included in the price.  Definitely recommend this company - value for money and great customer care.

title: Trips
text: Very friendly staff great food drinks are included as much as you want all very knowledgable on their subject been to Gambia twice and used arch tours twice brilliant

title: Amazing excursions
text:
This is our second year using arch tours and they are amazing. Informative friendly enjoy having a good laugh.
Also plenty to eat and drink and food is first class. 
We will be using them again next Year.

title: Fantastic tour company
text: I cannot recommend Arch Tours enough. Abdul and his team are excellent. Having used them for 3 trips last year we returned again this year to book again. So good is the 4 tours in 1 day we did it again this year. We also did the trip to Fathala game reserve in Senegal - just wonderful. I truly can't praise these guys enough. Kit, Demba, MSK, Buba you are all so knowledgeable and a joy to spend the day with. Abdul a true gent. See you all again next year. Helen & Chris x

title: Highly Recommended
text: We can not praise this company enough for the service they give. This was our first trip to The Gambia and we were a little apprehensive about getting out and about. We came across Arch Tours on trip adviser and were very impressed by the reviews so emailed them to get more information and prices. We promptly received a reply and the offer of meeting us at our hotel to give us more detail if we wanted but there was no pressure. Having seen what was on offer we decided on two of the trips that we really wanted to do (4 in 1 and Fathala Wildlife Reserve, Senegal) and booked them before we left. Unfortunately we weren't able to pay in advance but we were met in our hotel lobby at an agreed time to complete the transaction. The tours themselves were more than we expected and this was largely due to the Arch Tours staff who can not do enough for you. They don't just cover the tour itinerary but will happily pass on all sorts of interesting information about local customs, communities, history, nature etc.-while answering all your questions and should you need to purchase anything while you out and about they will help you find it. I will not go into detail about the trips as you can find out more on their web site but they more than exceeded expectations. I have to say that at the end of both trips it felt like we have spent a very enjoyable day with friends.

title: Immer wieder gerne
text:
Abholung usw hat alles super funktioniert!!!!!!
Die Tourguides haben ihre Sache gut gemacht.....
Es wurde immer danach gefragt ob wir etwas trinken wollen.
Die Tour 4tours in 1 day war suuper gut geplant....
Die Roots Tour war etwas überlaufen, da wir mit anderen Tourcompanys unterwegs waren.
Auf dem Boot hätten es etwas weniger Leute auch getan....
Aber es ging.

title: Fabulous 4 in 1 day trip!
text:
I decided to book this after reading the recommendations on Trip Advisor ...and was certainly not disappointed!
I emailed Ash Tours to enquire and book from England...Abdul (the boss) replied straight away and arranged to meet us in the hotel reception on our first day when he explained the tours, we paid (good value) and got a receipt.
On the arranged day, we were met on time by a guide at the entrance of our hotel and then picked up by an open landrover...2 of these (each with 6 tourists,2 guides and a driver) went in a rough convoy; meeting up to walk through the colourful Senegambian market, crocodile pool, quirky Lamin Lodge in the mangroves, a remote village, beautiful (but slightly touristy) Paradise beach for lunch and swim, and then the bustling fishing village....a day full of amazing sights, sounds and smells, and lovely people.....friendly and informative guides helping us to understand the people, customs and country. They were young,animated, interesting and fun and we learned so much...They greeted us like old friends when we bumped into them on the Senegambia strip a few days later! It was a lovely way to travel in the open air...and with smiling noisy, local children running after and alongside the jeeps! We took exercise books, pens and pencils to give them...but what they were really after were 'minty' or sweets!
A brilliant day; well organised, less expensive than the hotel based tours, thoroughly enjoyable and would definitely recommend....

title: Fabulous Tour Operator
text:
We cannot speak too highly of our day trip to Senegal with Arch Tours. 
Our contact had started via email in advance of our trip to the Gambia. Messages were answered promptly and arrangements made to meet up with us at out hotel in the Gambia the day before our planned trip. Abdul, the CEO of the company met us and offered to take us to see his offices in Senegambia from where one of his team took us to the Senegambia Hotel to watch the vulture feeding before taking us back to our hotel– all at no cost!
As there were four of us Abdul gave us a small discount on the cost which made it cheaper than our tour company’s cost AND breakfast, lunch and unlimited drinks were included. 
Being our first visit to Senegal we were a little apprehensive of security issues but we were looked after superbly on the day. In total there were 12 us in two soft topped Landrovers with three Arch Tour staff members with us at all times. 
The tour itself was brilliant. An early start just after 06:00 to catch the 07:00 ferry to the north and home around 18:00 but what a day!
There is lots of information on-line about the trip so we've not included that here (and yes we did meet the lions!).
We have no hesitation in recommending Arch Tours to anyone and we will certainly use them on our next trip to the Gambia.

title: Lazy Day Tour
text: Trip Advisor came up trumps with these reviews. This tour was lovely. A relaxing trip with good food and great hospitality from our hosts. Warm swim in the Gambian river and a spot of fishing.

title: Roots - tour
text: We went with Arch tour (Abdul is the nice friendly head of that company) by boat (big ship) to Jufureh on the Roots trip. Bob, a good guide has given us lots of information. After that we went to Kinta Kunta's Island. Impressive day.  We had a very nice time. Thanks Abdul  and Bob!! From Wil and Ineke

title: Fantastic days
text: Booked 2 tours with Arch Tours. 1st tour, was The Roots tour, what a day,  will not spoil your visit, the boat to and from the islands included the most amazing lunch, with plenty of good quality food inc Gambas, salads, tuna, rice dish, on board bar paid for by you, at crazy low prices, also honoured to watch dolphins playing.   Tour 2 was the 4 in 1 day, incredible day each location exceeded expectations, the guides were amazing and we had the best time, if you nothing else, do this tour.  Thank you Arch Tours, you made our holiday....

title: walking with lions
text: we sooo recomend arch tours this is the 4th time we had trips with them and well done to you all again. We had a full day on the ferry to Barra then by four by four to see the animals all food in and drinks soft and beers guides fun to be with made our day fab thanks to you all for the hard work and all the smilles.

title: Professional, friendly, punctual  and knowledgeable
text:
I cannot recommend Arch Tours highly enough - they are a thoroughly professional and friendly group of people .....from the owner, Mr Conteh  through the guides and drivers our experience on the 3 tours we booked was one of exceptional and highly organised service.
Mr Conteh is really well organised and is polite and charming and will always do a deal if he can -- we did the Roots tour (with Kit) the 4 in 1 tour (with Bob) and the Sunset Cruise (with Bob and Marianna) -- all 3 excursions were enjoyable and informative -- we also had some real laughs (particularly on The Sunset Tour).
Highly recommended and we enjoyed the Arch experience more than the 1 excursion (to Senegal) that we booked through our tour operator Thomas Cook.
Thank you to all at Arch Tours --- well done.

title: Best tour guide in The Gambia.
text: Came back last week and during our last week we had 2 trips with Arch tours. Roots and the 4 in 1. We thoroughly enjoyed our days out and the staff are lovely. Thank you to Bob, Solomon, Tom, Sheriff and MSK for the 4in1 and the very knowledgeable Kit for the Roots tour. When we come back next year we will definitely book with Arch again.

title: Uitstekend reisbureau.
text: Inderdaad een uitstekend reisbureau in de omgeving van de Strip. Veel miogeklijkheden en een betriouwbaar reisbureau. Wij deden de tweedaagse trip naar GeorgeTong en alles was goed geregeld. €40 per persoon goedkoper dan bij Tui en Gambia tourist bureau scheelde €90. We deden dezelfde bezienswaardigheden aan en aten en sliepen in dezelfde accommodatie.

title: Best tour operators ever
text: So glad we went with these guys they made our trips brilliant and perfect from booking them to the end of the tours they are so professional but really friendly and always happy to help and answer questions, kit and dembo and the others made us all feel special and were really knowledgeable drinks and food were in with the tours and they weren't stingy with them they were constantly giving us drinks  we so enjoyed our trips we booked 3, well done guys it was amazing made our trips memorable I would not dream of using anyone else but arch tours they are fun loving and make sure everyone enjoys themselves. Thanks

title: Superb
text:
I did not book any tours from the UK as I thought Arch tours had an office in Kotu but I was told that it closed about 12 months ago, so I called the office and the manager Abdul agreed to come to our hotel to arrange trips. In all we booked three trips with them as you get a discount if you book more than one. On all three trips they were punctual, very informative and extremely helpful and always willing to stay longer at one place if it was very interesting. Free Drinks are provided throughout the day at the numerous rest stops we had and i was delighted to see that the local beer Julbrew was one of the options you could choose. Our reps Sherriff, MSK, Bob and driver Soloman were just fantastic, and well worth their tips at the end of the day. 
My only critisism about any of the tours was on the 4 in 1 tour we had a 2 hour stop at Paradise beach, having just come from  Kotu beach ( which is better than paradise beach in my opinion ) I did not want to waste time  sitting on another beach and would have been much happier if a different activity replaced this, but maybe I am in the minority here. Overall a top class efficient firm and I will certainly be using them again when I return to Gambia next year.

title: North Senegal Tour - Excellence all round
text:
In short Arch tours are highly recommended - excellent and professional service from the very beginning... Having read such positive reviews online  my expectations were high - but every level of the tour and service went above and beyond my expectations! Well done guys! 

I don't often write long reviews - but I think these guys really deserve it - so here's a more detailed description of the day.

We met Abdul the owner who was helpful and charming - and decided to go on he north Senegal safari. Unfortunately no other people had signed up for the same tour, which I presume made the trip unprofitable for arch tours - but Abdul was a man of his word and went to all lengths not to let us down - and arranged essentially a private trip for my friend and I, for which we are both very grateful - and was such good value for money.

We were picked up on time with a professional, knowledgable and extremely freindly guide - Denba - and to our delight an ice box full of soft drinks, beers and snacks was in tow! 

Getting the infamous Banjul to barra ferry was made a breeze - the ice box was the loaded onto another vehicle, again driven by a lovely freindly warm hearted guy, patti - we were whisked off in the jeep and stopped in a beautiful secluded spot for a lovely breakfast in a stunning location, before heading to the border.

The border crossing was made very very easy by Denba - he popped off to do all the paperwork etc - and after a few minutes was back and off we trot into senegal.

After a short drive we arrived at the game reserve - there were a few tourists there from other companies - who were being loaded into a big safari bus - to our delight a few minutes later Denba arrived with patti in a private Land Rover - and a wonderful expert gamekeeper - we really felt special and couldn't believe our luck (or wisdom in choosing to book with arch tours!) to have such a great level of service for the price we paid! 

We drive round the park and couldn't believe out luck - we got very close to a rhino, 4 giraffes, zebras, waterhogs, antelope...And amazing birds! It was genuinely one of the  the best days I can remember. A real adventure made easy and fun.

In sure this may all sound too good to be true but it really was! Thank guys! Will definitely use again.

title: Bij Archtours de early bird tour geboekt en echt fantastich geregeld.
text:
Deze trip is aan het begin van de ochtend voor zonsopgang, wij werden stipt op tijd opgehaald bij het hotel.
De 2 gidsen, voor 2 personen, zeer behulpzaam en super vriendelijk nemen echt de tijd voor je en je bepaald zelf het tempo.
Wij waren daardoor langer weg dan gepland.
De gidsen hebben gekoelde dranken bij zich voor iedereen ( water, limonade, bier ).
Ze hebben zeer veel kennis van de omgeving en de dieren die je tegenkomt.
Zeer zeker een aanrader, als wij meer sterren zouden kunnen geven zouden wij dat zeker doen.
Volgende keer gaan wij weer bij deze mensen een excursie boeken.

Monique en Werner
Onze excursie was op 24 februari 2016.

title: Great company, great tours
text:
We arranged 3 tours with Arch Tours, 
4 tours in 1 day
North Senegal and Fathala Reserve
3 hour river cruise & Abuko Reserve
Abdul sent a Land Rover to pick us up from Luigi's complex although the office is easy to find on the Senegambia strip next to Scala restaurant. 
We paid for the trips in Sterling and were able get a discount for booking three together. 
The tours were all excellent and we especially enjoyed the 4 tours in 1 day and the Senegal trip staff are all very knowledgeable, speak excellent English and very enthusiastic.

title: Awesome Awesome Awesome
text:
We went on the 4 in 1 trip with Arch Tours. Wow, what an awesome day and awesome guides. Bob (Bubba) and Marie were amazing. They really know their stuff and are superb at what they do. It was a fun filled, informative, exciting and sometimes emotional day, made better by these two. They bounce off each other like an old married couple.
When we return to this glorious country, we will definitely be booking all our trips with Arch tours.
Love these guys 💜

title: Our Trip with Arch Tours
text: My husband and I visited the Gambia for the 2nd time this year, we used arch tours this year as we did before, last year we did the Roots Experience and we can only give our guide Zack the recognition he deserves, I have walking difficulties and found that Zack although a very knowledgable person, he really couldn't of  done more for me, it was also the same for this years trip to Senegal Safari and Lion Walk (which by the way was totally amazing) I really can't praise him enough.  Thankyou Zack.

title: Nous avons fait 4 excursions
text:
4 wheel drive; Banjul; Fathala safari + lion walk et Gambia forest and mangrove.
Pour Un prix équivalent du tour operator officiel, nous avons eu des services personnalisés, des trajets en 4x4 décapotable avec un minimum d'autres voyageurs dans la voiture (2;2;2;1). Tj deux accompagnants pour la sécurité. A Fathala un guide en FR. EN le reste du temps. On vous le conseille si vous aimez l'authentique et n'avez pas envie de vous retrouver avec 30 autres personnes en autocar.
Le paiement se fait en cash, d'avance. La totalité à l'arrivé. Demandez un devis par mail avant. 
Nous ne pension pas que vous trouverez mieux ailleurs, sinon plus cher... 

Nath et Jose

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Sunset cruise and Georgetown
text: Just got back from an amazing holiday to Gambia.  The trip was made all the better because of the wonderful staff at Black and White Tours.  In particular, Lamin and Omar were outstanding. We did two separate trips.  Firstly the sunset cruise, this was a lovely trip through the mangroves and stopping for dinner at Lamin Lodge.  Marks out of ten - ten!  Our second trip was even better, culminating in seeing four hippos in the river gambia, as well as chimpanzees, baboons and loads of birds.  We stopped overnight in Georgetown and the hotel was as described by the Tour Guides - basic. Nevertheless, itvall added to the experience.  We really feel that we saw the real Gambia.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Holiday Day trips
text: These guys are excellent and the best at what they do. They ensure your safety and enjoyment are their priority and that you don't miss seeing anything. We went on three trips with them: Fathala National Park, Roots & Four By Four. They were all informative and there was lots to see and do with food and drink as part of the deal. They were very reasonably priced and I wouldn't hesitate in recommending them.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: An incredible experience - can’t recommend enough
text: Words can’t describe how amazing our adventure was. We were picked up from our hotel and taken right through the Senegal border to the safari. We saw so many animals it was absolutely breathtaking. Part of the price included lunch at a fantastic local charity which was above and beyond, and all proceeds went straight to the local children. I highly recommend to anyone visiting - it’s well worth the money and you’ll be looked after the entire way.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: LAZY-Lazy-Lazzzzzzzzzzzz!
text:
The trip we did was a a LAZYday by the river. There are plenty of places to book trips including the hotel but we have  used Black and White Safari , out of hotel 100 metres turn right 30 metres on left just past the old ali babas. We booked a lazy day on the river. it is a fantastic day of relaxation. collected on time from hotel. onto a beautiful local boat, "the Dolphin", coffee, tea and water available free, beer and softies  at a good price. we took champagne for friends birthday. we caught some nice fish one of which we ate. The crew are great and as laid back as you can get which helps us poor gadget based overloaded brits to relax. 
Now i must say that on this boat there was a young lady who cooked and prepared the food, chicken, 4 salads, rice and cous cous and cooked one of the fish fresh from the river. The food was the best. it was as good in its own way as Scala and the Winery. The fish was probably the best i have tasted or very close to it. Thank you for that and I am sat here drumming my brain trying to think of her name. Perhaps some one from black and white safari can add it ?

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent tour company
text: Excellent tour guides, very knowledgeable and good to see some of the projects they support through our custom. I emailed them in U.K. and met them on first day, very accommodating. We booked 2 trips, both very good, highlight walking with lions in Senegal. Did not like the trip to fish market and a little uncomfortable in the Gambian home, but part of an experience. Would totally recommend and good value(same price as booking through hotel, and 5% goes to local school). Thank you for 2 memorable days.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathall Game Reserve and Lion Walk
text: This was at the end of the game drive through Fathalla Game Reserve and allowed us to actually walk with a lion and lioness. It was an amazing experience we where just feet away with excellent photo opportunties. The guides were superb.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Don't hesitate to book! We even brought our 10 month old and toddler on 2x1day tours
text: We spent a week in Kololi with our baby and toddler. On days 3 and 4 we did the Safari trip and Four Wheel Drive trip with Black and White Safari Tours. Both were amasing experiences made totally doable and extra enjoyable with the Black and White drivers and tour guides. They were so helpful, professional, knowledgable and great company - pre-empting needs with the kids, happily entertaining them while we had our lunch/ some relaxation on Paradise Beach, or looking after them when we wanted to focus on conversations with the school teachers/ or the market offerings for instance. The four wheel drive tour visits a different school for kids aged 3-7, rotating back every few weeks. We did both trip as a private tour due to having the kids. Both tours were totally tailorable to our wishes - spending as long or as short as we needed. The B&W staff are totally flexible. And we loved that its a local The Gambian tour company, hiring from the tourism college. The Safari trip started with a 7am pick up - 5pm and the Four Wheel Drive from 9 until 5:30ish. Both trips gave us a great insight in The Gambia with a taster of Senegal crossing the border and going into the Fathala Nature Reserve. With the other days spent mainly by the pool and dining locally, these tours gave us a fuller experience of The Gambia. We thoroughly recommend Black and White Tour company and these trips.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent
text:
We booked with Black and white tours on the strength of the reviews on TA. We were not disappointed, we had a couple of questions about their web site and the owner Armstrong sent us his whats app number and we conversed a few times before booking. 
When we arrived in Gambia,  we arranged for Armstrong to come to the hotel the following day and he told us exactly what would happen on the trip, and we booked and paid. The day ran like clockwork, pick up was prompt, the journey to Senegal interesting and Fathala park was amazing. We saw all the animals we hoped to see and the climax was the walk with Lions which was awesome, it was more of a walk around the lions whilst they relaxed after a meal, so they were pretty docile but I was amazed how close  we were allowed to get as after all these are still wild animals.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: FANTASTIC/OUT OF THIS WORLD
text:
WOWWWWWW what a trip safari and walking with lions then kunta kinte island,
our guides were very good informative and nothing was to much for them will never forget our trip have already recommended black and white tours to everyone we talked to will be definatelybe booking again with them when we return
billy,and cheryl from bradford

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Simply great!
text: Wir haben 4 Touren gemacht und sind begeistert. Ohne Lamin (Tourguide) hätten wir nicht im Ansatz so viel von Land, Leuten und Kultur erfahren. Auf unsere individuellen Wünsche wurde Rücksicht genommen (z.B.: keine Touristenverkäufe anfahren). Wir waren mit unserer 8-jährigen Tochter in Gambia und Black & White hat es für unsere ganze Familie zu einem unvergesslichen Erlebnis gemacht!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Ontdek The Gambia
text:
We hebben 3 tours met Black and White Safari geboekt. Het eerste contact verliep via What'sapp en bij onze eerste ontmoeting kwam Armstrong zelf naar ons hotel toe. We hebben gekozen voor de 4x4-tour, de Roots-tour en een bezoek aan de mangroves en Lamin-lodge.  
De begeleiding van onze gids Lamin was uitstekend. Hij is heel ervaren en geeft veel nuttige informatie. Black and white safari werkt samen met lokale ondernemers. Dit biedt meer mensen de mogelijkheid in het toerisme iets te verdienen.
Een groot voordeel is dat ze werken met kleine groepen. Hierdoor krijg je alle aandacht die nodig is. Bij bijvoorbeeld een bezoek aan een school of een markt (4x4-tour) is het prettig om in een kleine groep op pad te gaan. 
Wij zijn zeer tevreden over de service en kunnen iedereen aanbevelen een tour bij Black and White safari te boeken.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Good organised tour and amazing experience
text:
We have found Black and White on internet. We sent a few questions about the tours and got immediately response from Armstrong, the owner and a very friendly person.
From the great tours offers of Black and White we have chosen the safari and lion walk in Senegal. The tour lasts all day. We and one other couple were picked up from our hotel early in the morning by 4x4 and our guide Lamil.  We drove to Banjul where we took ferry to Bara. The ferry was a great experience itself. From Bara we took another 4x4 to the safari park in Senegal. Thanks to Lamil and his experience was crossing the border with Senegal very easy. But don’t forget your yellow fever vaccination book!  The safari was very nice, we could see all animals. The lion walk was also amazing. I thought it would be scary but it was not at all. It was very hot in Senegal that day! Fortunately took Black and White care for cold drinks for us.   
Thanks Black and White, we will come back next year!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: excursies Black and White
text:
We hadden op voorhand een mail naar Black and White safari gestuurd en een afspraak gemaakt aan het hotel. Daar werden we op het afgesproken tijdstip opgehaald door de vriendelijke Alex. Die bracht ons naar het kantoortje zodat we alle excursies nog eens konden overlopen. Daar hebben we 3 excursies geboekt.
We hebben deze excursies privé gedaan in een groep van zes personen. Black and White safari steunt de lokale bevolking, schooltjes voor arme kindjes en de minder bedeelde.Ook geven ze jongeren de mogelijkheid om te studeren en een centjes te verdienen om hun studie's te betalen.

De eerste uitstap die we gedaan hebben was het dierenpark in Senegal samen met de leeuwenwandeling. Dit was één hele dag. De ferry was zeer indrukwekkend om te zien, maar ook de dolfijnen die voorbij zwommen waren leuk om te zien. In het park hadden we alle dieren gezien. De leeuwen waren ook super leuk om te doen.

De tweede uitstap was naar het slaveneiland met de boot. De kinderen op het eiland stonden ons al zingend op te wachten. Als dank voor de kinderen kon je voor hen een zak snoep/schoolgerief kopen aan de inkom. Het snoep kan je dan uitdelen aan de verschillende groepen kinderen die stonden te dansen en te zingen. Het slaveneiland was om stil van te worden, maar ze zeiden ook heel vaak dat het niet onze schuld was.

De laatste uitstap was de 4x4 tour. De krokodillen waren zeer leuk voor foto's. Het lokale schooltje doe je best wel in de week voor het uniform. De markt is zeer kleerrijk en druk. Dit kan je best niet in je eentje doen. Het houtfabriek zijn lokale houtbewerkers die hun eigen spullen verkopen. De gids helpt mee voor een correcte prijs. Het arm gezin was zeer erg om te zien, maar doet je ogen open. Wel de moeite om de realiteit te kunnen zien. Het Paradise Beach was mooi er stonden zelf koeien op het strand. Het vissersdorp was zeer indrukwekkend om de begankenis te kunnen waarnemen en de hopen vissen worden met de kruiwagens weggebracht.

De lunch tijdens de excursies zijn inbegrepen in de prijs en het eten was altijd zeer lekker. Ook was er een koelbox aanwezig met verschillende dranken voor tijdens de excursies, er was ook voldoende drank voorzien voor het hele gezelschap. We zijn blij dat we deze excursies samen met Black and White gedaan hebben en zouden het zeker opnieuw doen.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: AMAZING !!
text:
After reading reviews we chose black and white Safari tours for our trips in the Gambia. I emailed Armstrong before we went and he arranged to meet us at our hotel the day after we arrived and took us to his office to arrange our trips. We did three trips the Four wheel drive , Senegal Safari with the lion walk, and the sunset cruise. Bass was our driver on all trips, Lamin was our guide for two trips and Yaya for the other one. All trips were amazing and we were so well looked after, Lamin and Yaya were very informative, we had refreshments throughout and delicious meals, nothing was too much trouble.
Thank you Armstrong  and your fabulous team for making our Gambia experience unforgettable,we have booked to return next year and bringing the family along. We will definitely be doing more trips, there is so much more to see, so looking forward to seeing you all again and going on more adventures with you

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Best Tour Company
text: Blown away by the customer service and experiences we had with Black and White safari.  We had 3 trips with Black and White and all of them were incredible.  Armstrong and all his team are very friendly and truly created a magical experience for us.  Thank you so much for everything, memories will last forever!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing Gambia
text:
Planning to travel to west coast of Gambia ? Looking to discover the land ? Then Black and White safari is what you need.
Armstrong and team dedicated to deliver an exceptional customer experience 🇬🇲
An almost tailor made program 👍
The 🍒 on the cake ? Part of revenues goes to local nursery school, indirectly you're supporting local education project 😀

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Robert & Denise
text: Had four trips with black-and-white Safari I was amazed with them all Yaya was excellent it seems like you knew him or your life he was so helpful could not do enough for you so if you going to the Gambia book with black and white they've made out on the day fantastic and Armstrong plan the trip is perfectly okay then 10 out of 10 and will be back again soon once again thank you Armstrong

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala Game Reserve and Roots River with Black and White Safari Tours
text:
We had a brilliant time with our guide Lamin from Black and White Safari Tours on both trips with them. 

Fathala Game Reserve - we were picked up early from our hotel, crossed over the River Gambia, and then headed to the safari park for a fantastic few hours of watching animals including: antelope, zebras, giraffe, buffalo and we even saw a bird catch a snake and eat it! We had the safari jeep to ourselves and also had a ranger with us. We then walked with lions! And had lunch in a local school/charity, which was excellent. 

River Roots - this was a very moving day. Lamin is a history expert, and guided us around all the islands where the slaves were held. On the river ride we saw dolphins which was magical. 

Lamin was so attentive throughout the tours, offering us refreshments, and giving us answers to all our questions. Being in a private group with him made all the difference to the visits - would highly recommend Black and White Safaris. 5% of their profits also go to a local education charity.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 4x4 school visit crocodile pool
text:
Iv just returned from Gambia an booked two excursions with black an white safari Armstrong who runs this and his co workers are fabulous great guides amazing tours I had the time of my life,
Thank you Armstrong an the gang

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing
text:
Naenae was our guide she was lovely from the minute we was picked up everything was explained to us. She looked after us but let us get on with things at our own pace. 
Everything went really smoothly only issue was the 2 hour wait for the ferry on the return which after a very early start puts a downer on the day but apart from that an amazing experience would definitely use black and white tours again.

Take water with you as you only get it once you have crossed the ferry into barra.
The lunch provided was delicious.
We met one of the staff at the hotel the day before to pay for the trip and arranged a pick up for the next day.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Lazy day fishing.
text:
Yet another well organised trip. 

Picked up at the hotel by Armstrong the boss of black and white safari on time. Transfer to Denton Bridge where we boarded the boat for the day. 

Rods and bait supplied for fishing along with drinks and a lovely lunch cooked on board the boat. How the cook can manage such a feast in such a small kitchen I will never know!!  

Great day fishing we hold a competition and this year there was even a trophy (bought at Albert Market) My dad caught a massive captain fish, my mum caught a number of different fish and Armstrong caught a barracuda. I caught nothing but had a great day. Two other guests joined us on board and also participated in the competition. 

After a full day we returned back to the hotel tired but very happy. 
Can't wait for next years black and white day trip. Keep up the good work.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The most unforgettable trips
text:
After our initial flight was cancelled in end of January, we booked a new flight to Banjul and emailed about our schedule changes for some companies. Only one, Armstrong from B&W answered us, even in a same day.
The afternoon we arrived, the Senegambia Strip was empty, almost no tourist. We visited B&W office and said hi, then our first Gambia holiday started.

I should say, I’m rather a back-packer type of tourist, not always using tours, and we also went upriver regions ourselves during this trip, but during the first B&W tour, “Four Wheel Drive”, we noticed how much we could learn about Gambia from them and how interesting. We also felt all tours (not only B&W, B&W is rather cheaper one) are expensive, but soon noticed how expensive the actual entrance fees, petrol, Lunch for tourists etc. So, we ended up trying most of the day tours with B&W and they even organised some more from our interests. 
One is “Visiting JulBrew Brewery”. The brewery is making JulBrew, Gambian Guinness and all Gambian soft drinks but they are not open to the tourist/visitors at the moment. B&W negotiated and we could visit and see the Brewery 1 week later (and now the Brewery has started planning open brewery visit again, probably “Brewery visit tour” would set up soon !?).

The B&W teams are all contacting with mobile all day, “how’s going the tour”, “everything’s fine”, “we arrived xxx so the driver should come and wait there now” etc. so all the tourist could be very happy end of the day and they are working very hard for that.

What the B&W special about:
-Only private or small group (2, 4-6) tours.
-Contributing schools and local society.
-They are really trying to take care all about the tour and tourists.

Watching animals and walking with lions in “Fathala park with lion” is once in a lifetime for everyone, and someone who want to see real Gambia a little bit more, “Four Wheel Drive” is perfect. For foodies, “Gambian Home Cooking” with Nenneh and her family will be very interesting eye-opening experience. “Kunta Kinteh Roots” tour with B&W, our most trustful guide and friend Lamin, who was always with us, (and who made us cry a lot, and already started planning our next overnight trip to upriver and Senegal!) was the most important and special one for us (we actually did lot more with B&W).

Lots of things we saw in the Gambia with B&W, lots of new things happened from mid-January, during the holiday, and still continuing. I recommend, with B&W, many tourists could share the happiness experiences  of new happy Gambia.

Thank you again, Armstrong, teams and Lamin, for all your helps, kindness and everything! We will definitely come back soon.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: 3 day Gambia tour - fantastic!
text:
We had an amazing time on our 3 day Gambia tour. Alex was a fantastic guide and Bass a great driver. Their knowledge, professionalism and good personalities made the trip and our holiday.

The river trip to see hippos was a highlight, along with being able to see the country through their eyes. Would highly recommend to travellers.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Wonderful
text:
We visited The Gambia last year and had a fantastic time. 
We booked our trips in advance and this truly wonderful team picked us up from the Airport. I can honestly say, we were bowled over by there generosity of spirit, kindness and ability to put us at our ease instantly. I have never felt like this before within minutes of landing in an unfamiliar country!
We did the wonderful Safari, the lazy days fishing trip which was relaxing , fun and the food was beyond delicious!
We also stroked crocodiles on another trip and the crew are by your side the whole time, attentive and informative. 
We are returning early April and adding a couple more tours to our list and two that we have already done because the experience was so amazing!
Armstrong and his crew are our Gambian family now and we really can't wait to see them again very soon .. counting the days !
Lots of love you lovely lot!!! 😍😍❤️

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari, lazy day river, local community 4x4. Amazing
text:
Amazing.
We heard about black and white safari through trip advisor and contacted them from the UK. Armstrong could not be more helpful via email and we arranged 2 trips and airport transfers. (The trips had been so good we booked a third while in Gambia).

The first trip we went on was the safari. We got picked up from our hotel in a 4x4 and taken to the ferry crossing. Alex was our helpful tour guide explaining everything as we went and giving information on the local area. The boat crossing is a cultural experience of the locals commute not to be missed.
 Once across we were back in a 4x4 heading to the boarder into Senegal to the safari. What luck we had seeing all the key animals including the only rhino in the reserve. The driver was on point spotting giraffe all the other tours missed through bushes and tree lines. Amazing experience as he got us in for a closer look. 
The next experience was a walk with the lions. Amazing experience with the exception of one family that turned it into their family's photo shoot. 
We were provided a meal once returning to Gambia at a charity restaurant. Good food and amazing to see what the charity do for the local community. There is no pressure to give a donation they are just happy your eat there.

All in all amazing experience i would recommend to anyone travelling to Gambia.

Our second trip was a day out on the river relaxing in the unspoilt scenery of the river Gambia. We were taken by the greatest tour guide Alagie. We could not of asked for a more friendly, bright and interesting tour guide. His aim all day was to make sure we had the most out of the experience and that he did. The crew on the boat (captain, 2 crew and the lovely lady chef). The team are full of experience and most helpful. The food on the boat was second to none. Better than some of the finest establishments in London. So good we got the receipt. We had a great day fishing my girlfriend managed to catch two fish at once and one of the guys managed to catch a captain fish big enough that we had to chase it in the boat to bring it in.  What a day relaxing and having fun.

We enjoyed our trip with black and white so much, we booked a third trip seeing 7 sites of the local community. (Called 4x4 tour). 
Calling the trip 4x4 tour might be an oversight by black and white as it does not explain the amazing experience of what the tour entails and suggests a trip around some off road and muddy day out. 
We were lucky enough to read the description and notice it was a trip to see how local people lived and iconic places.

We were lucky enough to  have Alagie for this tour. (Giving more evidence of why he is the best tour guide in Gambia).

The day was full of information and culture which needs to be experienced. How the local community come together, why Gambia is known as the smiling coast of africa, as well as meeting/touching sacred crocodiles and a stop with more amazing food at paradise beach.

Can't recommend black and white enough.
Amazing people and experiences. A must for travellers in Gambia.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Haha leuke trip maar safari. Beekse bergen lijkt er meer op
text: Leuke trip omdat je met de ferry oversteekt.met fourwheel drive door minder gebazndlandschap is leuk. Het is echter een dierenparken waar vijf giraffen zeven zebra's en twee neushoorns zijn neergezet. Vrouwtje neushoorn heeft de liefde van haar man niet overleefd dus nu is hij alleen. Vooraan het park stonden neushoorn en zebra's en wat zwijntjes lekker van voer te eten. Er zijn wel echte wilde termieten en een paar soorten antilopen. Gids meldde dat ze ook al lang vragen om meer dieren. De leeuwen zitten appartement anders eten ze het wild op.😀dierentuindieren dus

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Four Wheel Drive, Roots by Boat and Banjul City Tours. Excellent!
text: Armstrong and the team looked after us well on the tours. Lamin was our guide for two of the tours, very knowledgeable and  passionate about his country and the people. The maximum number of people on our trips would be 4, which was perfect. The tours in the four wheel drive were great but as we would be driving through alot of dust on the Roots by Boat tour, a taxi was used which was ideal. The team, Lamin the driver, Nene and the others not mentioned really helped to make these trips an experience and a half. To be able give clothes, balloons, footballs to the different families Black and White took us too and go see the happiness on their faces is something we will not forget.  If you want that personal touch, go with Black and White tours!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Slightly disappointed...
text:
We decided to do an overnight trip to the Fathala game reserve in Senegal and required transport from and to our Gambian hotel. After contacting several tour operators, I found Armstrong not only to be the cheapest (£100 for the two of us) but also the most responsive to our emails.
As arranged, Armstrong came to our hotel the day after we arrived to discuss the details and receive payment. I think he was slightly disappointed that we did not wish to arrange further excursions (our hotel had its own taxi-driver on call so we were sorted for all the local trips we wanted to take).
The following morning we were picked up at 7 am as arranged. We had not expected an open-top vehicle (knowing how dusty the roads would be) but that was ok. Nene was a very nice guide who accompanied us on to the Barra ferry and safely handed us over to the driver waiting on the other side (another open-top vehicle). Border formalities seemed to take ages on both sides (on the Senegalese side, we were actually asked for our yellow-fever certificates although nobody seemed that interested when I actually produced them). Our driver dropped us off at Fathala and explained that he would be back for us at 1 pm the following day when he was visiting Fathala with a tour group anyway. We should just wait for him by the gate lodge/restaurant and he would pick us up when leaving with his group.
We followed his instructions but when nobody had arrived to pick us up by 1.45 pm, we got one of the Fathala staff to ring Armstrong. It turned out that the group tour had been cancelled so the driver never made it back to Fathala. Armstrong promised that somebody would be with us some time after 2 pm. He then spoke to the Fathala staff member again who informed him that another tour group from Discovery Tours was just about to leave the Reserve. Armstrong spoke to their guide who agreed to take us back to the ferry with him. The journey in the fully covered vehicle was much more pleasant and border formalities were dealt with in less than 10 minutes. The Discovery guide (sorry, I can’t remember his name but he was lovely) even paid for our ferry tickets back (which were included in the money we had paid Armstrong) and was about to load us onto his truck back to our hotel when Nene arrived with a driver to take us back from the ferry.
I know that mix-ups can happen and believe that Armstrong did his best to remedy the situation once he became aware of it. However, it would have been a nice touch if he had called us or even called into our hotel afterwards to make sure we got back safely and were not too upset about the mishap. As it was, we never heard from him again – not exactly a sign of caring customer service. Full marks, though, to Discovery Tours and their lovely guide who went out of his way to get us back safely – thank you!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala safari and lion walk
text:
The Fathala safari is a glorified zoo / similar to the safari park you get in the UK. However, The lion walk is awesome and well arranged on par to our recent Whale watching tour. The trip is a good experience crossing river Gambia on the ferry and the open 4 wheel jeep drive.
Black and White operate from a small office in the Senegambia strip and whilst we did not meet the owner Mr Armstrong but spoke to him on the phone several times are reliable, efficient with a very good team of drivers and guides. There were punctual in pick up, provided what was offered ( drinks/ lunch etc) and quite informative.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala Safari Park - fantastic day
text: We  made an initial contact with Armstrong over email before coming here. We then rang him on the day we arrived and he came to see us at our hotel to organise the trips. We booked two trips the Game drive in Senegal  (without the lion walk) and a cooking experience. We have just come back from the first trip and had a truly fantastic day. We were a party of 5 aged 9 to 73 and it was suitable for all of us. I never thought  we'd  see the animals so close the fighting giraffes were a sight to behold. Our guide Yahya was excellent very knowledgeable and attentive and always happy to answer our questions with interesting facts and stories about the country and family life in the Gambia. More of those please!!!! We are really  looking forward to meeting the rest of Yahya's family when we go for the cooking trip. Final thing to mention for this trip was lunch at the HELPING. This is a charity that supports local projects it seemed to be a really worthwhile place to visit that brings one closer to the real Gambia away from the tourist bubble. The food there was good and freshly prepared.  The only minus point was that the transportation was quite old and not quite to European safety standards, but then we are not in Europe and the drivers drove well and safely.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great tours and good guides
text:
We were on 3 tours with Black and White Safaris. A 3-day tour to Georgetown and Tendaba, and day tours to Fathala (Senegal) and Makasutu. Most guides were very experienced and gave good service and information. Our driver was great too and drove so that we felt safe at all times, also at the many police and army control posts. Only are the vehicles a bit old.
We made a fair number of interesting stops, especially when in the remote areas, so we really got to see the Gambian "outback".
The tours are a bit pricy, but you do get good service and hence value for the money.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Four Wheel Drive and Safari/Lion Walk
text:
Both trips were great, lunch and cold drinks throughout the trips were included.
One trip was booked from the U.K. 
Finding the office in Kololi was easy, here we booked the second trip with smiling, friendly Armstrong - the Boss.
The Four Wheel Drive tour gave us a look at the life and the lives of the Gambian people - a real eye opener which makes you appreciate what you have.
We had two young guides - Alex and Nuyma - both knowledgable, friendly and so helpful and lovely a pleasure to be with - that is why we asked for them to be our guides on the second trip.
Lamin (who we called Lewis) was our driver, he was friendly, helpful and a great driver. All three are friends we will remember.
The Safari/Lion Walk was an experience never to be forgotten. A drive to Banjul, then over The Gambia river by ferry to Barra, on over the border into Senegal on to Fathala. Here we saw animals in natural surroundings, rhino, zebra, giraffe and more - amazing.
We were introduced to two lionesses, 4yrs of age and the keepers who had helped rear them - what an experience to be so close to these wonderful big cats. Watching them climb trees with ease and grace, these powerful hunters so calm and beautiful. 
Being able to photograph them and be photographed with them, then walk with them (under the guidance of the keepers who spoke so gently to the lionesses) the bond between them was unreal.
After lunch back over the border to Barra, another ferry ride to Banjul - Alex gave us lots of information about the Capitol then through the villages seeing smiling, happy children back to our hotel - with a beautiful sunset to end a perfect day.
I use crutches and was a little worried about going on these trips - but need not have been - I was so well looked after by Alex, Nuyma and Lewis - a big THANK YOU my friends.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Safari and lion walk
text: If visiting The Gambia you must simply go on the day safari and if your nerves hold then walk with the lions (All part of the £90 pounds cost). Included with this trip is dinner at a lodge and drinks while on the jeep. Armstrong from black and white travel picked me up from my hotel to talk business as I had contacted him prior to arriving to The Gambia. You get picked up from your hotel on your safari day and travel to the port where you travel by boat to Senegal so don't forget your passport. This is the second time I have been on this safari but first with black and white tours and this was by far the best version. You have two people who accompany you on your trip , a driver and your host Soloman who were both fantastic and very knowledgable. I have pictures with myself and zebras , giraffe , rhino and of course lions. The staff at the safari park in Senegal were fantastic and will take pictures of you with the lions though you have a stick to protect yourself (sounds worst than it actually is). On the way back from the safari I asked Soloman are there any football matches on and he said yes there is the Gambian super cup which is the league winners v the cup winners and I wanted to go. I arranged for me to be picked up with my friend and I hired the driver, Soloman , armstrongs car, paid petrol , got VIP tickets for the game and sat behind the Gambian football president (12th November 2016) which until the final whistle was where the trophy and medals were being handed out (I have uploaded a video on YouTube Gambian super cup). You get a newspaper and drink at the game and the best seats in the house. So for me, my friend, the driver and Soloman plus car hire, petrol, tickets vip the total of £21 I paid and remember the pound is poor at the moment. I have to tell you BLACK and WHITE SAFARIS made my holiday and I can't thank the team enough for what they did for me. They are so humble , they had a girl with us who was learning to be a jeep safari host on our journey but I can't remember the girls name but the people who were in the jeep with us made the trip so funny. Do the trip guys and get a Senegal stamp on your passport and get dramatic pictures for your albums.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: See the real Gambia and make it a trip of a lifetime with Black and White
text:
It was important to us that we booked with a Gambian company so the money was going back into the country. Some other tour companies never got back to me when i emailed them but everything was very easy to organise beforehand, Armstrong responds to emails very quickly and will go out his way to find the right tour or options for you. 

We normally do our own thing and not use tour companies as we are independent travellers but the small extra price you pay, you get to see so much more and get so much more out of the overall experience. 
Armstrong and his team were fantastic and professional throughout, picking up always on time. We booked three tours with them in advance (Senegal Lion Walk, Makasutu Forest and the free Banjul tour) and as they impressed us so much we booked the 4x4 trip which goes to 7 places in one day. I would recommend them all, but if you only had time for one, the 4x4 tour really encapsulates everything: nature, local history and culture, chill-out beach time, shopping and getting to see how beautiful Gambia and the people are. 

If booking the Makasutu forest, please make sure you have some change for tipping or to take part in extra things, like the palm reading etc. throughout the trip. 

The Lion Walk is definitely a once-in-a-lifetime and the whole day was fantastic, the trip to Banjul and ferry crossing was something completely different and the overall logistics were well organised and considering what we did in one day, i was very impressed. The nature reserve is an open space, not a zoo, so it really is the luck of the draw as to what you will see. We were lucky to see a giraffe, zebras, rhino and warthogs. If you want a full-on safari Senegal may be not the best place and you are best to visit the East Coast of Africa to guarantee animal sightings or have a typical 'safari', but you should definitely go if would like to do the lion walk and with the view that to see anything else is a bonus! Some people complained they didn't see enough animals but that is a beauty of seeing them in a nature reserve and not an enclosed zoo! The lions themselves are treated very well and you can tell they are cared for and looked after like family. Whilst it is a 'tourist attraction', if one of the lions got tired during the walk they didn't force them to do anything they didn't want to do, which is very ethical. 

The tours were reasonably priced, super easy to book (you can pay by card in advance via paypal) and to top it off 5% of what you pay goes to three local schools - which is quite exceptional. We visited one of them on the 4x4 tours and was so rewarding to see how the school has grown and helped the local community, from teaching under a mango tree to teaching three year groups! If you go to a school, I'd recommend taking some pens and, if possible, books - that is what the kids really want. Sweets are nice, but if you really want to help, then buying pens is better and much more appreciated. I would advise taking some money if you want to donate or one of the guides can arrange for this afterwards. 

All of the guides are fantastic, so knowledgeable and personable and want to tell you everything! You can tell they are all experienced, especially Lamin - the chief guide. Another thing i liked is that no one forced you or 'guilt-tripped' you into giving any donations for things or tips, and really made sure no one hassled you or tried to sell you things if you didn't like it, such as at markets etc. I think if anyone is disappointed with a tour then this is down to some unreal expectations they had as the company is always honest, realistic and truthful. 

They are also really flexible.  One day my partner had a case of the 'Banjul belly' and the night before we told Armstrong we couldn't make the tour the following morning (i.e. less than 6 hours notice in the night). We re-arranged several times until we knew he was better and it was not a hassle at all for Armstrong (most companies who not allow this). This is because Armstrong keeps small tour numbers and keeps his service very personalised. Not many tour companies would offer this level of customer service. 

I think it's really important to support local Gambian businesses and you can tell Armstrong puts his customers first and will do anything to make sure they have the best time. They really made our holiday a trip of a lifetime and so much more than a beach holiday, with experiences we will always remember :)

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Unsafe Roots tour was black and white tours!
text:
Let me start by saying i live in sierra leone so i did not expect a posh ride but for 45 pounds, i expected at least semi-safe and i did not expect to be lied to.

I paid for the Root by Boat tour but the owner didn't bother telling me the boat was broken so we ended up on Roots by Land.  the guide told us the boat had been broken for months but the owner lied and said we could have done the boat tour had we requested another day.  no mention of any of this until I asked after the tour.  I'm assuming the owner didn't think I would realize the roots by boat was another tour.

First, men had to push start our vehicle to get it started---the vehicle we took the day before also had maintenance issues and wouldn't go over 35-40km/hour.  This is not uncommon in West africa.

What concerned me most was the driver. He was Extremely dangerous--literally almost ran over a woman and her 2 babies and then an old woman, and got into 2 fights along the way.

Then, he ran off the road and smashed into a clump of trees.  im not talking about a few tiny branches coming into the vehicle.  Im also assuming it was because the driver had been checking his cell phone again because we saw the same vehicle and driver at another tour site 2 days later.  We had nodded off and only avoided being seriously hurt bc the guide started screaming for us to get down. We had to walk 1km to catch a ride with another tour group. 

During the tour, we heard nothing about kunta kinteh.  They just moved us from different groups of people wanting money.  The island was interesting but the guide added nothing the signs didn't tell us and then the boat Captain asked for more money.  

As we were leaving, more people gathered around our vehicle and were actually upset and yelling at us when we told them "no, thank you".  they said they only came out to sell for us people so we needed to buy something.  we had to tell the driver a few times to drive away bc he was just letting them harass us.  

i would definitely recommend going with another company, esp for 45pounds per person!

  I spoke to my guide,she said it was not an accident is a vehicle breakdown and this obviously even in Europe can happen.The 1km walk you mentioned was over spoken as you waited next to car and you get pick up by another car.The nearly crashed by a woman with her 2 kids you stated is another thing.I can fully agreed with you as you booked for the Roots by boat  not roots by land you been on caused you hate everything single thing about the tour.I fully understood but this is one of a tour there was never such a complain.Infact what you see on that tour is more interesting than just cruising on the river for 2 and half hours.
 I did acknowledged and felt sorry because you where not brief by my guide about the Roots by land when the pick up is taking place and i deeply regret that.
Your booking and paid for Roots by boat and we failed you by taking you on Roots by land ,we strongly apologize but should not mean unsafe like you mentioned....
Since we start my operation with such a strong bad impression about our this tour ,you becomes number one to against such a lovely tour that is appreciated and loved by every one who has been on it.This is Africa and as you are also residing in Africa so we expect to realize that kind of break down is normal even in Europe ,but when it happen that does not mean that is all been bad like what you stated.
You paid 45 pounds and if i am to make the break down of how we spent it  on the trip you will not mention a word.Imagine we manage with that to take only 2 of you 
I do never want to push and pull with my customers so is just to let you know that you over  speak about the break down,the 1 km walk you mentioned,The driver being dangerous and the guide not giving information.
Our main objectives are customers satisfaction,security and by keeping you well inform and if this is not what you experience with us we apologize and as the saying goes no man is perfect ,we are also learning from mistake .
