placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Saved our honeymoon!!
text:
We're so pleased that we had booked all of our tours with Black and White and not with our tour operator (TC).  They were waiting for us at the airport to take us to our hotel, and had arranged for us to go into their office the next day to sort out an itinerary for our 10 days trip.  
Unfortunately we both ended up with a stomach bug on the third day, but Armstrong worked around us to make sure we didn't miss out on anything.  
Our tour guide was YaYa for 90% of the time, and he was great.  Such a lovely warm person, who was happy to answer any of our questions, and made a special effort to include our requests to see Djembes being made. We also were invited to his home to do the Gambian Home Cooking tour, which was an incredible experience.
PomPom our driver was a legend. We always felt safe, and they were both so professional.
Our favourite place was Makasutu.  If you're going to Gambia, go there!  It's the most tranquil, peaceful place I have ever visited, and YaYa made sure we got there before any others arrived.
Ya Ya and PomPom went that extra mile on every trip to make sure we were happy.  Black and White saved our honeymoon from being a disaster, so thank you!
Armstong was excellent at correspondence before we flew out, and Stuart handled all the deposit over in the UK.  
Black and White is a superb company to go with, so if you are thinking about booking a few tours, choose them, as they are a local firm, with all local knowledge,but extremely professional.

title: A once in a lifetime experience!!!
text: We booked the Safari and Lion Walk tour with Black & White Tour company from UK after reading so many wonderful reviews and we were so glad we did! Everything was buzzing: the journey across land in a jeep watching the real Gambia go by, the ferry crossing so colourful and crazy,  the border crossing to Senegal and finally the actual amazing Safari! placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great day out
text:
We have just returned from another great visit to The Gambia where we used Black and White for the trip to Fathala and the lion walk.
   I contacted Armstrong prior to our holiday, he responded very promptly to my email and we booked the trip before we went.
   I contacted Armstrong on arrival and he arranged to come to our hotel to collect payment. He is very knowledgeable and very professional.
   Our trip.
  We were picked up very early in the morning to start our day, everything was extremely well organised and the pick up was prompt. We especially liked the fact that there were only 6 of us on the trip which meant the trip was more personal. Our guide Lamin Ceesay was again very knowledgeable and good fun.
  On arrival at the Senegal border we had our own Fathala vehicle waiting for us which again was great. (I don't think that this happens with all tour operators)
   The drive around the park was great and we did manage to see the white rhino and giraffe.
   The walk with the lions was absolutely amazing with the opportunity to take lots of photo's.
   To sum the day up :-   Very well organised trip, great service, amazing experience.  Good value trip.
 Would definitely recommend Black and White.  Definitely an experience on the ferry

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Fathala Lion Walk
text: The day itself is really interesting, in particular mingling with the locals on the ferry from Banjul to Barra and vice versa.  The lion walk is also really good with plenty of photo opportunities. The guys from black and white do look after you well on the journey too. We had Lamin 1 with us all day. The one downside for us was the vehicle used for the safari drive.  Whilst all other vehicles were covered to keep the sun off, ours was open and we baked for over 2 hours in 39 degree heat with no shade in the middle of the day, stuck to a dusty plastic seat.  Apart from this, we would have been giving a four star review.  That is until we were asked to complete feedback reviews in the restaurant on our return journey. Having put pretty much as above and given a "very good" review which is the second best out of the four available categories, our guide started discussing the safari vehicle feedback on the return ferry journey along with the rest of the group. We found this really unprofessional almost making us out to be unreasonable in front of the others.  This is personal and objective feedback and if any discussion is to be had, then have it directly with us. For this reason, the review is only 3 stars.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Overnight stay in Georgetown
text:
We went on the overnight stay to Georgetown with Lamin 1 & Lamin 2. 
we had an early pick up at 6.30am, but it is a long drive so was needed. Stopped for breakfast in Soma before heading onto the ferry over the River Gambie. A visit to Wassu Stone Circle before heading on a boat trip up the river. We saw loads of wildlife; various birds, baboons, monkeys a crocodile and were lucky enough to see numerous chimps. Amazing. Unfortunately for me, we saw no hippos, but it just means a return visit is in order. We then took the ferry over to Georgetown. We had a buffet dinner in the hotel before Lamin 1 took us on a stroll round Georgetown at night. The stars were amazing and so beautiful. After breakfast we had a wander round Georgetown and visited the Governor's office. While we were there the deputy Governor visited. He must have heard we were in town!!! ;-) 
We stopped for lunch in Soma then visited a village where we were shown round the houses. A real eye opener!! Lamin 1 & Lamin 2 looked after us at all times and couldn't do enough (apart from find hippos, and that wasn't from lack of trying) I will definitely be taking a return trip with them next year when we return. Thank you Armstrong and all your staff.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Just superb
text:
We did 3 fantastic trips with Armstrong and his wonderful crew during our stay in Kololi.
It was all arranged before we left and we were collected from the Airport by Armstrong and Alex. Never have we been made to feel more welcome! We did the 4 in 1 day out to the market, school, fish market, paradise beach and stroking the crocodiles, quite the experience! We were really well looked after and given unlimited cold drinks all day. We also did the big Safari to Senegal . Again fantastic! Walking with Lions etc. Then we did the Lazy day cruise, just bliss! Every trip we were provided with a truly delicious lunch. These people are fantastic and really friendly and professional in what they do .
We have booked to go back next year already and will be doing more trips with this fabulous company. They even took us back to the Airport! Armstrong couldn't make it As he was on a trip but even rang us in the car to say goodbye.. The friendliest people you will ever meet. Thank Armstrong Lamin, yaya , nima , pompom and Alex and whoever else we may have not mentioned . Princess can't wait to come back again and hopes you loved her drawing.  Don't hesitate to book with them!! 👍🏼

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Georgetown and senegal
text: We emailed black and white to pick us up from the airport this was great and they were waiting for us as soon as we got the luggage.we then went on 2 trips first to Senegal where we had an amazing time from the start of the day seeing zebra, rhino, warthogs antelope and giraffe.then we went on the lion walk it was amazing being so close to them.the second trip was to Georgetown where Lamin 1 and 2 went out of there way to make our trip a wonderful experience seeing 5 hippos was so amazing.we stopped at a village where we were made really welcome.there is a long drive on the overnight trip but if you get chance it's a great cultural trip.thanks again black and white

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Great Experience
text: We researched this company before we went to Gambia and made contact with Armstrong before we went. He was very helpful,informative and polite. text: what a once in a lifetime experience i cant stop telling everyone what a amazing time we had! first set off to the ferry, then got on 4 by 4 to fathal safari. nehneh (sorry if its spelt wrong) really took us on board and really looked after us thank you! placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Delivered exactly what they said
text:
Collected us from our hotel at 6.30am aargh! Not the best time of day but it has to be done to catch the ferry in Banjul, this is an experience in its self all the hub bub of people animals etc.
We stopped for a comfort stop and tea/coffee etc also ordered our lunch we then continued into Senegal to visit Fatala reserve saw rhino,Zebra, Giraffe etc the highlight of the trip is walking with Lions what an experience fantastic! Many thanks to Lamin who was our guide for the day and to Armstrong who explained everything to us in the office keep up the good work!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Amazing day out
text:
We went on the senigambia Safari and had a great day. Set off early in morning by taxi to the local ferry that we went on by foot this was an experience in its self, 
We then got on to the jeep and traveled for an hour to the border then a little further once we had passports were stamped. 
Then on to the safari we seen antelope, warthogs, zebra and a rhino no giraffe as it was mating season and apparently very elusive at this time. Lots of exotic birds here too. 
We then went on the lion walk after we were a bit nervous at 1st but it's defiantly the hi light of the day thought this part isn't suitable for children, 
Plenty of drinks included during the trip and a nice lunch on our way back,

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Excellent
text: On my recent and first trip to Gambia we had organised afew of our trips with B&W Safari and I can't recommend them highly enough. placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Wonderful local company of good people
text:
This was our first trip to Africa for our honeymoon. We were recommended B&W from he Fathala Reserve and we ended up spending 3 of our days on their tours: the Senegal trip, the 4WD tour, and the free Banjul city trip. Lamin was our guide the whole time, with Niyma training, and both of them were incredible guides. We learned so much and you can tell they really love what they do. Armstrong was great at organizing and accommodating us. They are good people.

Some things to note, though: if they tell you there will be 8 people on the trip to Fathala, do not go on it. That trip should have maximum 6 people. Two people of our 8 had to leave because they forgot their passports in the morning, which was unlucky for them but lucky for us because that trip would have been miserable. Only eight people can fit in that truck, so 8 guests + 2 guides is WAY too many. Don't do it.

Another thing is that our driver on that trip was not good. I forget his name. The drivers on the other trips were great, though.

Thanks for taking great care of us, Lamin and friends!

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

text:
Friendly, service oriented, pro staff ***** We booked 3 trips with B&W and we had great time. Every penny worth. 
Armstrong is true human with big hard & man of his words.
I witness that he pledged basketball equipment to Banyaka Lower Basic School (Holland school) and made 830 student happy. More power to you and your staff.
keep up the good work.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Lion walk
text: What an experience to walk along side two lions.  I emailed Armstrong at Black and White  about the trip and he got back to me very quickly to explain what the trip entailed and sent me recent photos of the trip.  When we got to Kololi we went round to Black and White to meet Armstrong and pay for our trip.   We were met out side our hotel on the given day were Lamin introduced himself and the driver.  we were well looked after by them both, nothing was to much trouble and they answered all the questions asked of them by the group.  oohh are we glad we booked it.  It was the best experience ever to walk along side two beautiful lions,  if you are thinking of going on this trip do not hesitate it is well worth it.  Armstrong and his team are such lovely people you'd be mad not to.  Well done Black and White Safari.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: Outstanding!
text: A huge THANK YOU for the ''Black & White Safari'' and for the great time we had in the Gambia. Don't hesitate to book your trips with B&W, you will never be disappointed - all the guides are very well trained, very informative and helpful, caring and looking after you, making everything for you to have a memorable, safe, fantastic and unforgettable holiday! Special thanks for Armstrong and Lamil who were with us all the time, waiting for us at the Airport on arrival, picking us up at the hotel for every trip - we had 3 - and taking us back to the Airport for depart. Brilliant service, very friendly and always with a smile, they make you feel safe and part of the big happy family of Gambian people on the smiling coast of Africa! I can say we have new friends there and we can't wait to see them again.

placeInfo.name: Black and White Safari - Day Tours

title: The highlights of our holiday,to "The Gambia"
text: What can I say? This was me and my wife Annes first trip to Africa.We popped into Black& white offices,and there the adventure began.Armstrong and his very efficient team talked us through all the amazing trips on offer.We chose for trip 1 to go and see the crocodiles,then onto the local market(the hussle and bustle was amazing),we then visited a local village which was very humbling(our kids don,t know how lucky they are).We then went to paradise beach for a rest,and a wonderful buffet meal(the best),we visited a local fish market on the way back home.For trip 2 we decided to go to Senegal on a wildlife safari(passports required).We went from Banjul to Barra on the ferry,across the Gambia river,from there to the border,and then onto the forest,where we walked with lions(no cages).We also saw giraffes,zebras,rhino,warthogs,waterbok and a variety of exotic birds.On all the trips you are transported in open top jeeps,and soft drinks are supplied unlimited and free!!.We can,t thank Armstrong and his team enough,these adventures really made our holiday extra special.We have some friends going to the Gambia over Chrismas and we,ve told them to call into theBlack&White offices and book the trip of a lifetime.We,ll definitely be coming back to see you guys,until then be lucky.Mick&Anne God Bless you all xxxxxxxxx
